story:
Short Summary

We are Third Eye Productions, a team of students based in Toronto that are producing a short film. Our team study at Ryerson University and are in our final year of studies, obtaining our Bachelor of Arts. Olly, Aviva, Will, and Alex have spent the spring and summer months developing and crafting a concept that we are very excited to bring to life.

We are producing a short film with a twist. High school student, Monroe, enters an alternate universe, and must learn to adapt to her new surroundings and discover the secrets that this world holds. You, the audience get to make Monroe's decisions for her, in this 'choose your own path' story. 

This story is important to us, as we want to create a production that is both interactive and outside the norm, in regards to television/film production. We want to put the power in our audiences hands and create an experience that allows users to experience different endings and paths, every time they guide Monroe through the Visionary. 

Any contribution is appreciated by our team, no matter the size of magnitude. With your help, you can help us students create our largest production yet, as we graduate University. 

What We Need 

Our team needs to raise funds to assist in obtaining shoot locations and purchasing props/wardrobe. Due to being out of work for a lengthy period of time, while paying full price for tuition, we're in great need of financial assistance so that we can supply our cast with the wardrobe that we envision, decorate our set with the desired props and rent our locations to shoot our scenes.

The Impact

By donating to our campaign, you will be assisting young students looking to create Canadian content. Our team has high ambitions to create film/television productions that are experimental, out of the box and encourage production in Canada. We aspire to create productions so that young Canadians like ourselves can be given the opportunity to find experience here, rather than have to move to the United States. We want the film/television industry to continue in Canada as it helps create more jobs, especially in more remote areas of the country. We're proud to have a diverse cast and crew of Canadians in our production and hope to continue creating opportunities for young media professionals like ourselves

Risks & Challenges

The COVID-19 pandemic has proven to be a massive challenge in peoples day to day lives. Our team has had to attend classes from home and plan our production remotely. This has proven to be a massive hurdle and has slowed the production process down.

Despite this, we have learned to adapt to the many changes that this pandemic has brought, with our production being one of them. We have learned how to collaborate electronically, whether it be writing the script or brainstorming ideas for concept art, we have found a way. We don't plan on stopping now and have accepted that life has changed, and though challenging, we will create a production that we can look on and be proud of. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that you may not be able to donate to our production and that's ok! There are other ways that you can help us create our final production.

You can follow us on Instagram: @thevisi0nary_ and share our posts and stories. You can also help get our name heard by sharing our campaign through the Indiegogo share tools

We thank you for your help.

 

-The Visionary Team

story:
Why Donate?

We are looking to create TWO new projects for our TikTok @shadowtheshow. We are so appreciative of all of our followers and want to create videos just for them! We have been in the production industry for over 10 years and want to bring our experience to create an all-new made for TikTok drama series. 

The way people watch content is constantly changing we believe the next place for scripted shows is TikTok. We want to give our fans that exclusive experience with these two projects!

The first project we would like to create is a Shadow The Show Reunion/Reboot episode. Where are Calli, Carver, and Shadow now 10 years later? Find out and with a special twist!

Our second project is a made for TikTok original drama series. What happens when the new kid in town is framed for a crime? Will he find who actually did it? What if it will hurt the ones he loves the most? Find out in our new drama series!

As far as we know this has never been done before and we want to do it especially for you, our followers!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • All of our funding will be going 100% to the production budgets for both projects. We are not looking to profit just make more content!
  • We want to do it right this time, with the right gear, sets, and costumes. We want high-quality entertainment for our Tik Tok followers.
  • Most importantly we can bring back the show that everyone has loved so much with some higher quality production values.
  • We want our audience to be involved! We will have Behind The Scenes content along the way and will be incorporating YOUR feedback!

 

Challenges

  • Unfortunately, Tik Tok doesn't pay as much as people think it does, and definitely not enough to make high-quality content. So, we must rely on our followers for funding for our next project.  
  • However, if all of our followers donated just $1 we would have enough funding to create BOTH projects!

 

We are giving back!

We first made Shadow when we were in High School and it completely shaped our careers today. We want to give back to current students interested in the production industry.

How are we doing this? We have added a perk for students in the New England area that can come to set on one of our projects and shadow (no pun intended) a professional in the position they are interested in. This is a great way to get hands-on experience in the field and learn from real professionals!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please share this campaign anywhere you can!
  • Like, share, subscribe to our Youtube Page: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3ABz0ynx1IeIj...
  • Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/shadowtheshow/
  • Follow us on TikTok: https://www.tiktok.com/@shadowtheshow

 

THANK YOU!

Thank you to everyone who has watched our show on Tik Tok. It has meant the world to us that a project we made so long ago has finally been seen. We worked extremely hard on it and we love seeing everyone's reactions to our videos! So, thank you, from the bottom of our hearts!

story:
JULIE IS BACK!

The new season of 21st Century Demon Hunter is almost upon us! Juliette Johannes (played by Chelsea LeSage) is a demon hunter from a long line of demons hunters, tasked with fighting the forces of darkness, but her goals in life revolve more around getting high, drunk, and laid. Unfortunately for Julie, there are some very ancient and powerful forces that are about to enter this world and her life in a very big way.

Written and directed by Charles D. Lincoln, with Season 1.5, which we have dubbed #TheLincolnCut, Julie is back with new misadventures, new enemies, and a few familiar faces! From vampires to a magical serial killer to ancient evils beyond the stars, there's so much awaiting her.  But since we wanted to do things extra special, this time, after the guerrilla filmmaking style of the first season, we went the extra mile and went full crew and a cast full of amazing actors. Returning from Season 1 are Rebecca Lauren (Stephanie), Casey Marie Ecker (Persephone), Madison Humes (Desiree), Matthew Carter (Mr. Allen), Kevin Ralston (Frederick Matherson), Anna Lynn Holmes (Enid Gardner), and Charles D. Lincoln as his Theresa & Allison character, Tony. New additions to cast include NYC punk icon Tibbie X (of The X-Possible, GASH, and Reagan Youth), Marine Assaiante, Kerrys Virgo, Ian Schulz, Kasia Walczak,  Ilaria Malvezzi, Caitlin Ross-Poteet, Robert Abrams, Nikki Delmonico,, Jonathan Hartman, Alyssa Jo Mills, and many many more! 

 

AND ALL OF THAT IS DONE! SHOT! IN THE CAN! So, what do we need from you? Well...

  • We are Charles D. Lincoln and Chelsea LeSage of C. L. Squared Productions, an NYC-based independent production company dedicated to making undiluted, unbridled, unhinged work, working together with the best independent cast and crew we can, to show that just because something is from a small company doesn't mean the quality has to be lacking.
  • On the heels of the release of the 21st Century Demon Hunter novel (available from Burning Bulb Publishing), our first season, which is available now on Amazon Prime Video, was done with a point and shoot, guerrilla-style to emulate some of the lower budget films that influenced us, as well as capture the gritty NYC punk rock style of our anti-heroine. However, with bigger narrative stakes, we felt production should reflect that, so we went bigger. We worked with amazing D.P. Christopher Bye and makeup artist extraordinaire, Shannon Rae Mulligan, to make the new season of 21st Century Demon Hunter darker, funnier, more disturbing than the first one. We dubbed this season 1.5, instead of 2, because first, it's only five episodes, whereas the first one was comprised of thirteen, and two, because it's a bit of a new beginning for us. 
  • Production is done. All scenes are shot and edited. All score is composed. But a personal tragedy put a damper into our Post Production plans and now we turn to you, for help with finishing it up!

WE NEED YOUR HELP TO COMPLETE IT!!

So, what do we need from you?

  • We need a total of $4,000 to complete post production. We need $2,000 for sound design from the very capable Evan Joseph, who worked with us, previously on our first feature, Theresa & Allison. We need an additional $1,000 for VFX to spice up some scenes or fix things in the background we didn't realize were problems. And we need $500 to complete color correction. We've already begun it. As you can see, with these before and after pictures. Really, our goal is to get this looking and sounding as good as possible so that you, the viewer, can get the best five episodes possible! And on that note, we also need another $500 for subtitles in multiple languages, so that we can reach as big an audience as possible. 
  • In exchange for your help, we're looking to give you some awesome perks! We are offering personalized shout outs, personalized memes, signed scripts, DVD's and Blu-Rays of the entire season, signed copies of the 21st Century Demon Hunter novel, the chance to have a private zoom Q&A, lunch, and/or even play videogames with writer/director/producer Charles D. Lincoln and star/producer Chelsea LeSage, and for two lucky people, props from Season 1.5! If you give to us, we will give to you! 
  • And if we don't get everything, well, we'll definitely miss our deadline and won't be able to release on Halloween with our new distributor, but we will still soldier on and pay out of pocket when the money comes to us. We'll still give you this season, but it will be way later than Halloween 2021.

 

Risks & Challenges

The only real challenge at this point is funding. We have the people, we have the footage, we have a new distributor who only needs our finished copies. 

  • As we've said, everything else is done. The scenes have been shot, the score has been composed, the episodes have been edited. We just need to fix the quality of the visuals and the sound, as well as provide subtitles for various nations. With your generous contribution, we can achieve that. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Of course, if you can't  make a contribution right now, spread the word. Watch the first season on Amazon Prime and think of the potential behind it being shot professionally and realize that is what we achieved here.  Tell your friends. Tell your enemies. Tell everyone. Spread the word! The second coming of 21st Century Demon Hunter is upon us and with their help, we can give birth to something very very messed up! 
  • You can also go to Amazon or Barnes & Noble and pick up a copy of the 21st Century Demon Hunter novel, written by Charles D. Lincoln, today!

story:
3...2...1...FIGHT'S ON!

"I'm good at this simulator, so I could easily fly a real fighter jet!"

We've all heard it before, right? Especially when a gamer beats a real pilot in virtual reality.

Instead of just rolling our eyes, what if we could actually put them to the test?

Mover Media and Etched Motion Productions have partnered with Victory Flight Training to do just that. We'll start by taking gamers and putting them in real jets (after a little bit of instruction from our hosts, of course) and find out who America's Next Top Dogfighter really is. 

We're creating a pitch/pilot of what will hopefully become a series taking people from various backgrounds and letting them (safely) fight it out over the skies of Texas in our Marchetti S-211 aircraft.

 

Meet the Hosts

C.W. LEMOINE 

"Mover"

Mover started his military flying career in the Air Force Reserve flying F-16s. After one thousand hours and a combat tour in Iraq, he transferred to the Navy Reserve flying F/A-18s. He later transferred back to the Air Force Reserve and is currently flying the T-38A as an adversary pilot.  He also flies for a legacy U.S. Airline.

When he's not flying, Mover is the host of the YouTube Channel "C.W. Lemoine" with over 300,000 subscribers. His show "Mondays with Mover" includes aviation breakdowns, interviews, and flight training videos. He is also the author of the SPECTRE SERIES and THE ALEX SHEPHERD SERIES

TREVOR HARTSOCK

"Gonky"

 

Gonky is a former Navy F/A-18 International Instructor Pilot. After leaving the Navy, he flew with the Malaysian Air Force as a Boeing Instructor Pilot. He later returned to the Navy Reserve where he met Mover flying Adversary F/A-18s in New Orleans. He has since transferred to the Air Force Reserve where he currently flies T-38As with Mover. He is also an Airbus A320 pilot.

When he's not flying, Gonky runs a real estate business and is the host of "The Ready Room" on YouTube. His channel has over 16,000 subscribers and features military aviation videos and interviews.

What We Need & What You Get

 

Flying jets isn't cheap, but we're doing our best to be as cost effective as possible. Our initial ask is $100,000 USD to create a pitch for the show. This includes the cost of aircraft rental and getting Gonky and Mover checked out to fly with passengers.  Our STRETCH GOALS will expand this concept from a simple pitch to full episodes! 

In return, you'll get to watch the final product free of charge on C.W. Lemoine's YouTube Channel  and those that sign up for Perks will get early access, plus behind the scenes footage and if you REALLY want to go all in, we'll have perks with flights in T-6 Texans (Coming soon). 

Stretch Goals

 

  • If we raise our initial goal of $100,000 USD, we will create a pitch/proof of concept of the show.
  • If we raise $150,000 USD, we will create a short pilot episode (20-30 min) with high production quality.
  • If we raise $175,000 USD, we will be able to add dedicated aerial cinematography chase aircraft, filming the dogfights in 8K!
  • If we raise $200,000 USD, we will create a full-length pilot episode (approximately 42 min) with high production quality. 
  • If we raise $250,000 USD, we will create a second episode featuring non-gamers.
  • If we raise $300,000 USD, we will create a third episode in which the winner of EPISODE 1  faces off against the winner of  EPISODE 2  and include a special tribute for FOLDS OF HONOR.

 

Giving Back

Five percent (5%) of the proceeds raised from this campaign will be donated to Folds of Honor, and we plan to fly a Folds of Honor scholarship recipient to tell the story of their family member who made the ultimate sacrifice for our country. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

First off, if you can't support our project, please consider donating directly to Folds of Honor.  Anything helps, and it is a worthy cause we truly believe in.

Otherwise, you can help by sharing and getting the word out!  The more attention our project gets, the more likely it is to succeed and the more likely it is to be picked up by a major network or streaming service in the future. 

You can also visit our MERCH STORE and buy t-shirts, stickers, and more to support our cause.

story:
www.shadybishestheseries.com

We were encouraged with the success of Episode 1/Pilot - "Lucas" to shoot a complete season. We can't wait to continue sharing the lives of these Shady Bishes with six more episodes! 

Episode 2 - "Daniel": Daniel and Lucas meet for drunk brunch. Daniel's sister, Ayanna stops by for a surprise visit. A ghost from Daniel's past suddenly reappears. 

Episode 3 - "Flowers": Lucas and Daniel receive flowers from present and past loves.

Episode 4 - "Group Therapy": Daniel comes to a realization. Lucas and Ayanna discover they have a common interest. 

Episode 5 - "Brian": A day in the life of an Uber driver. 

Episode 6 - " Queer Speed Dating": Lucas participates in a Queer Speed Dating event. Daniel has a face off with his ghost. 

Episode 7/Season Finale - "Get Mine": The Shady Bishes attend an art show.

We are raising funds to cover the cost of Production and Post Production for the six additional episodes: 

  • Paying our creatives - Cast and Crew! 
  • Cost of Film Permits, Insurance and Locations
  • Equipment Rentals
  • Post Production costs such as Editing, Color Correction, Sound Mixing 
  • Catering on set

Your donations will help all future episodes reflect the creative professionalism of the pilot! 

Arthur James Solomon (Creator)

Arthur is an award-winning actor, writer and an alumni of Rutgers University and The New York Film Academy. As an actor, Arthur has performed in numerous productions, both regionally and Off-Broadway, and was nominated for Best Featured Actor (2017) by Broadway World for his performance as Ethan in "That Long Damn Dark". Arthur belongs to the award-winning improv group, "The Captains of Industry". In 2018, Arthur was honored to be selected for the NBC/UNIVERSAL Outfest Infusion Symposium for emerging LGBTQIA+ writers, furthering his passion to create content that reflects the diversity of the LGBTQIA+ community. Most recently, Arthur created and produced the pilot of the web series "Shady Bishes" which was licensed by Yup Network and premiered on their Youtube channel in February 2019. 

"Several summers ago, I joined a gay kickball league and was assigned to a team of other solo players; a bunch of diverse misfits. We named ourselves the "Shady Bishes" and became a chosen family and the worst team in the league. I am inspired to create "Shady Bishes; The Series" to reflect the diversity, camaraderie, joy and shade of my beloved team." 

Natalie Combs (Director)

A graduate of the Peter Stark Producing Program at USC and a native Hoosier, Natalie comes from an agricultural background, but has a love for film that brought her to Los Angeles over seven years ago where she has since worked live event production for TV shows such as "The Voice" and "American Idol" and for musical acts Paul McCartney, Beyonce, Fleetwood Mac and several others. While being a part of these large productions is exciting, ultimately she knows it is only a step in the direction of creating feature films. 

"Arthur and I have known each other for years. We always had whisperings of working on a project together but nothing came to fruition until he came to me with "Shady Bishes". 

Arthur is hysterical and the script takes advantage of that, plus comedy is my wheelhouse. I am incredibly honored that he would let me handle a project that I know is so special to him."

story:
Mission Statement

In 2021, it is ever more important to elevate female voices and the voices of women of color. This project not only does this, it also highlights Bronx culture, which often is overlooked in deference to Manhattan or Brooklyn stories. Diversity and inclusion will be valued both in front of and behind the camera. Our crew is an all female crew and our star and creator is actress Danielle Alonzo, a Bronx-native and woman of color.
 

About The Project

Bronx ‘ish is a comedic webseries about the adventures of a young woman of color in the Bronx chasing her dreams. The hilarious first season, eight 5-minute episodes, written entirely by Danielle, and produced by an all-black crew, was released in 2018 to a delighted audience on YouTube.

So it's time for Season 2!! Danielle has now written 8 more hysterical episodes sharing the amusement she’s found within the challenges and daily life of a woman of color chasing her dreams in NYC’s most cross-cultural borough.

Danielle, through her humor, reminds us to look deeper, think longer, and laugh harder at ourselves. No one is their best self all of the time, but we can try to be.

See what happens when you’re an adult woman stuck with your mom in an apartment in NYC during the pandemic, when you finally move out and have to “adult” on your own, and when you need therapy from your therapy.

Episodes we can look forward to:

1.     Pandemic

2.     New Digs

3.     Grandma

4.     Privilege

5.     Therapy

6.     Girls Night

7.     The Boo

8.     One of the Boys
 

About The Team

Danielle Alonzo (Creator/Writer/Director) is a writer, actor, and content creator. If you’ve been within 100 feet of Danielle, you’d know she’s Bronx raised and proud! This Afro Latina is the quintessential New Yorker with sass! If she’s clapping her hands in your direction.. RUN. 

With all the people living in her head, Danielle found her outlet with creating her One Woman Show, “In Your Face” at The Pit in 2014, which she wrote and performed. In 2015, it returned to a sold out audience. She also created her webseries “Bronx ‘ish”, following her random adventures.

She is known for being cast in ABC’s Diversity Showcase; making the top 12 out of 11,000 applicants. She is known for her roles on CBS’s FBI as Salina, as well as  HBO’s “ High Maintenance” as “Mirania.”

Gillian Fritzsche (Producer/Co-Director) has produced a range of narrative and documentary projects, including: the award-winning feature comedy, “The Rock ’n’ Roll Dreams of Duncan Christopher,” which she also costume designed; a docuseries for the non-profit Hearing First called “LSL Life,” which she also directed and which features children with unique hearing devices; as well as the upcoming narrative short film “Carrol Lynn,” staring Annie Golden. She was also a producer of award-winning theatre during her tenure in Management at a professional theatre company in Vancouver, Canada called Pacific Theatre.

Gillian’s credits as a director include the short drama “Sonny,” which she also wrote. “Sonny” premiered at the LA Woman’s Film Festival in 2013, was nominated for a screenwriting award, and will be available soon on a Christian VOD platform. Gillian’s credits also include the short comedy “Jerry & Diane,” which she also wrote and which premiered at the Big Apple Film Festival in 2014, and the aforementioned 12-episode docuseries, “LSL Life.” Gillian is currently attached as a director to an action feature film, produced by D.A.M.E. Media, based in Florida, and is working on two documentary projects, a feature documentary about the postpartum season for new mothers, and a short documentary about small business changes during the coronavirus lockdowns of 2020. Gillian has worked as a screenwriter and corporate writer for many years. In addition to previously serving as an Adjunct Professor at Azusa Pacific University, Gillian has also served as a panelist for film classes all over North America and she has been featured on Celtx’s Industry Series sharing her knowledge of story structure and documentary filmmaking. Gillian lived in Brooklyn for 10 years and has been based in the NYC area since 2010.
 

Why Fund This Project?

Support black voices! Support female voices! Support more women behind the camera! And get hilarious content for it! Our award-winning, all-female crew deserves to be paid a fair rate for their professional work. And we can do it with your help!

We are passionate about paying people for their work. To create more of the hilarious content enjoyed in season 1 and to elevate the production value, we need your help. You funding this project will enable us to pay our actors, crew, rentals, and location expenses.
 

How Will We Use The Money?

Season 1 was self-funded and filmed with a volunteer crew. This time around, we need to pay our professional crew their worth! We will also be adding a few crew positions to elevate our production value.

We will be producing another 8 episodes of approximately 6-7 minutes each of hilarious comedy and Bronx-centered content on location in the Bronx and Manhattan in New York City! Funding will go toward production expenses.

"BRONX 'ISH" SEASON 2 PRODUCTION EXPENSES

$3000 -- Production Staff

$2000 -- Cast

$6500 -- Camera Crew & Rentals

$1500 -- Make-up Crew

$ 500 -- Props

$1500 -- Sound Crew

$2500 -- Locations Expenses         

$17,500 -- TOTAL

 

The Impact

Funding this project will provide an economic impact in both Bronx specifically and with the independent film community in New York City in general, which has been hit hard during the covid-19 pandemic.

You will contribute to elevating the voices of creative black women and female filmmakers. You will support independent filmmakers and help marginalized voices find their platform.
 

What if…?

We would prefer to be able to pay everyone a reasonable day rate, but if we do not raise our entire goal, we will do our best to divvy the resources among the entire crew fairly. Our producer, Gillian Fritzsche, has experience producing and directing short projects and feature projects with budgets from $500 to $500,000. She is able to allocate funds properly and fairly to ensure a quality project is made.
 

COVID-19 Production Standards

We will be utilizing new industry standard covid-19 production protocols that have been developed by industry leaders over the past year. From smaller crews to safety standards, we will work to ensure that each person on our set remains healthy. As we continue to prepare for our production, we will continue to monitor covid-19 related safety standards and maintain our set at the highest standards of safety.  
 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you’re not able to contribute right now, but you want to help, please follow this page, follow us on Instagram, Twitter, and subscribe on YouTube. Share this campaign with your friends and followers and let them know about us!

This new season is going to be hilarious. You can help make it happen!
 

From the Creator:

Hiiii!  I’m almost not even emotionally or mentally prepared that my little web series is growing up. I started Bronx ish 5 years ago. Before I had representation, and before I was in the union. When I had to get all the auditions myself, and the ones I self submitted to frankly... some were cool, and some made me nauseous. I was tired of it.I remember watching GIRLS on HBO, and at the end of every episode .. it always said “Written & Created by Lena Dunham.” I always got the chills, 1: because Adam Driver is handsome... (Danielle, focus), and 2: I said to myself - THAT’S what I want for ME.

I can write, and I can act in it… and here we are. 

I’m a Soundview girl, forever and ever. I love being from the Bronx. My Grandma moved here when she was 14, alone. First Generation... and she is still living here to this day. My Pisces twin.

Ahh. NYC... when you can’t tell if that was a shootout or fireworks...but you know damn well it wasn’t fireworks. I love being from NY... our culture, and our energy. If you know... You know. There literally isn’t a cooler place to be from.

Sorry, not sorry.

Bronx ‘ish... is me. What makes it special, what gives you a headache... and all in between. As an Afro-Latina, living at home, and chasing a dream.. To say that doesn’t come with its share of ‘ish.. Is an understatement. The naysayers, the doubters, the “realistic” ones... They all have an opinion. 16 years later... I still listen to my voice. This Soundview girl will share her journey of coming up in the Bronx... To infinite possibilities and all the ‘ish… that comes with it! 

See you at the top! 

<3 

 danny.

story:
FINALLY, the Game Chaser's BEST season is coming to Blu-Ray with tons of extra content!

Relive some of the best moments of the show in high definition and no youtube compression!

What is on the Season 5 Blu-Ray set?

Here is what we have so far:

  • Each episode of season 5 remastered and uncensored, many extended just for this set, including added scenes and new footage
  • a BLU-RAY EXCLUSIVE NEW EPISODE! 
  • Commentary on each episode
  • A documentary on the making of season 5
  • Over 1 hour of Outtakes and deleted scenes
  • Interactive menus 
  • A never before seen episode featuring unused footage from season 5 
  • "The Dodongo Den" Part 3
  • more to be added and announced 

Fan-favorite episodes include:

Episode 50 With Chris and Jay fighting over the Sega CD case!

Episode 46 Where they guys exchange games for beer

Episode 52 Where Eric is scared *hitless in a game store basement

Episode 43 Where the guys get robbed

Episode 45 With the Atari ST song...

Episode 49 With there turn of Dodongo from hiatus 

And many more fan-favorite moments! 

 

SEASONS 1, 2, and 3 on Blu-Ray for the First time!

These Blu-Rays will be upgraded versions of the DVD's. Some things will be different, some minor stuff taken out, but some things added as well. One thing that is for sure is that every episode will now be in glorious 1080p, It's not even 1080 on youtube. These will be the clearest and best versions of the show you will ever see. Oh, and YES they are region FREE. Here is a breakdown of just SOME of the things in each set.

Season 1

  • Every episode of season 1 RE-Edited with additional NEVER before seen footage! Some episodes being 2-3 minutes longer!
  • Audio commentary for every episode.
  • The PAX episodes re-edited into one big Pax special with new footage!
  • An exclusive interview with the "Alright Guy"
  • A HUGE outtake reel with never before seen interview footage and tons of nonsense
  • A documentary - "We Should Do This With Video Games" The Story of Season 1
  • a BONUS just for DVD/Blu-Ray episode
  • making of featurettes!

Season 2 

  • Each episode of season 2 remastered and uncensored, some including added scenes and new footage
  • commentary on each episode
  • A 45 minute documentary on the making of season 2
  • Over 40 minutes of Outtakes and deleted scenes
  • Interactive menus 
  • Mini-episodes featuring never before used footage
  • "The Dodongo Den" Dodongo interview and ramblings
  • Dodongo's game room tour
  • Easter eggs galore, secret menus

Season 3

  • Each episode of season 3 remastered and uncensored, some including added scenes and new footage
  • commentary on each episode
  • A 45 minute documentary on the making of season 3
  • AN HOUR LONG reel of Outtakes and deleted scenes
  • Interactive menus with a story arch over the 3 discs, concluding with a "final battle" on disc 3
  • Never before seen footage
  • the Second Christmas Cartoon
  • A TIMED EXCLUSIVE EPISODE featuring MELVOR AND DODONGO looking for games with Jay and Billy as the cameramen. This might not ever be uploaded to YOutube.
  • Easter eggs galore, secret menus

Awesome HD menus....with SECRETS....

Read Carefully!!

If you want to bundle multiple Blu-Ray sets together instead of coming back later and buying another separately, It's easy! Just pick the Season 5 Blu-Ray perk, then at check out, you can choose to add season 1, 2, or 3 to your order for a discounted bundle deal that also saves on shipping! 

Now, if you live overseas the bundle deal doesn' work out as well due to the way it adds the already crazy high shipping charges so we decided to offer you a special over-seas perk that has the proper discounted shipping total so you don't go broke! This is ONLY available over-seas fans. And remember, if you are only buying 1 or 2 Blu-rays you can still do it normally, this perk is ONLY if you are buying ALL the Blu-Rays.

Risks & Challenges

We've talked about this before, but because we are not a big studio we can't afford to make thousands of these at once which keeps the material costs per unit lower. The reason the seasons 1-3 Blu-Rays are a little more is that we have no idea how many of you will want these. We have to think worst-case scenario and assume only printing out a few hundred of each. Otherwise, we may shoot ourselves in the foot and not have enough money to make them if we put the price we charge too low. It was the same issue with the Digi-books, but luckily not THAT expensive. And making 4 Blu-Ray sets will be a TON of work. I will have to hire help, so that cost has to be factored in. And I can't imagine us ever re-printing these again, more than likely these Blu-Ray runs will be the only run there is.  Plus, because we are producing 4 separate sets, each time you make a blu-ray you have to pay for licenses and expensive masters for each disc. And we will have 8-10 discs here with all these sets combined. So that cost has to be considered since, again,  we are not Disney and can't produce a million copies to make it cheap. 

Why is the goal only $1000?

Well, this is a pre-order not a traditional crowdfunding campaign. I have to put some number. Obviously we want to sell as many sets as humanly possible. We gotta eat. And also pay off our movie debt..

Awesome HD menus....with SECRETS....



Read Carefully!!
If you want to bundle multiple Blu-Ray sets together instead of coming back later and buying another separately, It's easy! Just pick the Season 5 Blu-Ray perk, then at check out, you can choose to add season 1, 2, or 3 to your order for a discounted bundle deal that also saves on shipping! 
Now, if you live overseas the bundle deal doesn' work out as well due to the way it adds the already crazy high shipping charges so we decided to offer you a special over-seas perk that has the proper discounted shipping total so you don't go broke! This is ONLY available over-seas fans. And remember, if you are only buying 1 or 2 Blu-rays you can still do it normally, this perk is ONLY if you are buying ALL the Blu-Rays.

Risks & Challenges
We've talked about this before, but because we are not a big studio we can't afford to make thousands of these at once which keeps the material costs per unit lower. The reason the seasons 1-3 Blu-Rays are a little more is that we have no idea how many of you will want these. We have to think worst-case scenario and assume only printing out a few hundred of each. Otherwise, we may shoot ourselves in the foot and not have enough money to make them if we put the price we charge too low. It was the same issue with the Digi-books, but luckily not THAT expensive. And making 4 Blu-Ray sets will be a TON of work. I will have to hire help, so that cost has to be factored in. And I can't imagine us ever re-printing these again, more than likely these Blu-Ray runs will be the only run there is.  Plus, because we are producing 4 separate sets, each time you make a blu-ray you have to pay for licenses and expensive masters for each disc. And we will have 8-10 discs here with all these sets combined. So that cost has to be considered since, again,  we are not Disney and can't produce a million copies to make it cheap. 
Why is the goal only $1000?
Well, this is a pre-order not a traditional crowdfunding campaign. I have to put some number. Obviously we want to sell as many sets as humanly possible. We gotta eat. And also pay off our movie debt..

story:
Short Summary

We are Katy Schutte and Edmund Fargher, two improviser/writer/comedians living in London in the UK.

I'm Katy, an award-winning improviser who teaches and performs all over the world. I'm also a writer, actor and director with several solo shows, plays and a book to my name. This is Edmund, a TV and stage actor who in a previous life worked as an Assistant Director in film.

We found one another on the wonderful London improv circuit, creating hip-hop versions of fairy tales, maintaining 'serious' scenes while getting custard-pied and turning non-romantic movies (like Alien, Home Alone and Terminator 2) into rom coms.

Sideliners is a brand new series written by us. It consists of ten, ten-minute episodes. ​The story is set against a romantic comedy, but instead of following the leads, we follow the oft-forgotten best friends; the Sideliners. We are super proud of our written work and we want to get it made to a professional standard. We want to make it our way, without having to compromise the work as we imagine it. This is the big one. The one we really care about.

You can find out more about the series itself at www.sidelinersseries.co.uk

If we hit our target, we will film a top quality pilot as a launch pad to help us make the rest of the series. If contributions are larger than our dreams, then we can make even more episodes independently.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need £9,900 to make our first high quality episode with cast and crew, filming over two, ten-hour days. We'll be using HD SLR cameras, pro audio recording and a crew (meaning me and Ed get to focus on performing).

  • £2,000 Equipment hire for 2 days (lighting and grip kit borrowed where possible)
  • £6,400 Pro crew for 2 days (including scale-down crew and in-kind Producer and Director)
  • £0 Cast (in-kind support)
  • £400 Transport for 2 days
  • £200 Food for 2 days
  • £900 10% contingency (for anything that goes wrong or costs more than we budgeted)
  • TOTAL £9,900

Concessions to keep costs down:

  • We will source lighting from friends and family.
  • Friends who work in the industry have offered to work for free because they have faith in us and in the scripts.
  • We have removed the Camera Assistant, Script Supervisor and Grip from the crew as these are super helpful people to have, but not essential for our shoot.

Our perks:

All backers will be named on a shout-out video.

  • We know that for some people the joy of supporting friends and/or a cool-sounding project is enough, so we made a perk for that (and we'll shout you out on film). (£10)
  • We're improvisers at heart and we know you like mementos, so we'll send you a postcard with a unique three-line scene improvised onto it by both of us. (£15)
  • Nothing's more fun than FOMO, so you get an exclusive invite to our very first screening in London, plus a secret special treat. (£20)
  • One of our first improv shows together was Pie-day Night, where one of us got pied in the face. Paying homage to our roots, we will make a video of one of us thanking you or a friend while getting pied in the face. Choose between me and Ed or pay twice to get us both. You also get a first screening invite. (£30)
  • Merch, merch, merch. Get a lovely tee with our show branding on it, plus an exclusive London screening invite. (£45)
  • Double-up and get two tees and two screening invites. (£65)
  • Come and be a background artist in our pilot and hang out on set. You also get a tee and a first screening invite. (£75)
  • We'll have a one hour video chat online for up to ten people at a time. Ask me and Ed whatever you want; about us, about improv, about writing, or anything really. You also get a tee and a first screening invite. (£100)
  • Get a secret 45-minute improv show at your house, venue or improv night. We'll throw in a couple of tees and first screening invites too. (£500)
  • You like us and/or the project so much, you want to give us more. We will credit you in the show and you'll be invited to the first official screening as a VIP with up to nine friends. Plus up to ten branded tees. (£1,000)
  • You're a legend because you've made a whole episode possible. You can have any or all of the perks above. Pie Ed as much as you want. (£10,000)

If we raise less than our goal, we'll still make the pilot, but every penny drives up the quality and a cheap pilot will look like a cheap pilot. Without a high standard pilot, we're unlikely to be able to make more than one episode in the long run.

If we make more than £10,000 we will drive up the quality of our pilot and see if the money will stretch to make more episodes. 

 

The Impact

We want you to be involved in our making process. It's exciting seeing something getting made, whether that's videos about how it's going, or filming on set with us. As improvisers, we love to see projects raw, in their infancy and we hope that's why you're here too. We believe that the polished, finished product will be a great contribution to the rom com oeuvre. We're picking the genre apart and adding a lot more down-to-earth humanity to it; where perhaps even us best friend types can be the stars.

We have tried and tested the scripts by bringing a team of writers and creatives together for our first table read, doing rewrites, then performing a 'live table read' with guest performers at Hoopla, our London improv home. We were thrilled to get such useful and positive feedback and inspired enough to make another draft that is even better. Right now we're really happy with the scripts.

We are both actors on stage and screen, with credits including Keith Lemon: Coming in America, BAFTA-winning series History Bombs, cult sensation Knightmare Live plus commercials, immersive theatre and such .

I was nominated for Best Comedy Show, writing and performing Schutte the Unromantic at Brighton Fringe in 2018. I collected a bunch of four and five star reviews for my touring folk-horror play Let's Summon Demons over the last year. I'm also a contributing writer for Cards Against Humanity.

Edmund is a TV and stage actor whose secret weapon is his previous life working as an Assistant Director in film. Between us, we have enough smarts, talent and experience to make this work.

 

Risks & Challenges

There is always the chance that something will fall through, especially when we are counting on favours. In this case, we will rally to find help elsewhere and/or divert some of our funds to solve a problem.

As improvisers, we are both used to rolling with the punches. We have such a great support network of experienced creatives in our artistic community, we are sure we can pull the project together no matter what surprises and challenges we have to face.

Ed and I have a great working relationship through improvisation and performing together in scripted work for the stage, but we are new to film making as a duo. To allow us to do our best work on screen, we have enlisted an excellent production team so we can focus on performance without being distracted on set by the bigger project. 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will film anyway, reducing our budget by using less high-end kit and finding more crew and performers who are willing to work with us in kind. We really hope we can get to £10,000 and we think the project is more than worth it, but we will use whatever we raise to get a pilot made.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you're unable to contribute financially, we'd still love your help. If you can get the word out and make some noise about our campaign, that would help us no end.

If you have any expertise in film making or producing and think you could help us out, do get in touch and let us know.

We'd love you to use the IndieGoGo share tools and tag us with #sidelinersseries Here are some suggestions:

  •  Link: https://igg.me/at/sidelinersseries

  • Twitter: Support this new #romcom by my talented friends @katyschutte and @edmundfargher https://igg.me/at/sidelinersseries #sidelinersseries

  • Facebook: Oh my gosh, you should absolutely get on board with #sidelinersseries a rom-com from the point of view of the best friends! https://igg.me/at/sidelinersseries

  • Instagram: Hello, my chums are raising funds to make the pilot of #sidelinersseries It's funny and awesome. https://igg.me/at/sidelinersseries

  • Katy's friends (anywhere): Shit, did you hear Katy is 40 this year? I didn't get her a present. Um, is she okay with being an actress past her last fuck-able day? Mate, I don't know. We should absolutely fund her IndieGoGo so she has something to hold on to. https://igg.me/at/sidelinersseries

  • Ed's friends (anywhere): Man, Ed is such a lovely human. I wonder what he needs in his life today? He's so kind to other people the whole time. Wait. He needs some support for his amazing comedy pilot. I'm IN.  https://igg.me/at/sidelinersseries

  • Or - you know - write your own...

story:
Have you ever seen a character with autism portrayed authentically? What about ADHD?

Growing up I never truly saw my life on the screen. I never saw someone with ADHD going to Resource Room. I never saw someone having to get extended time to finish a test. Instead, what I saw was that I was stupid. That it’s my fault I have trouble focusing. Episodes of shows like The Simpsons would show Bart taking meds and becoming a more bearable person. I became embarrassed of the fact that I took ADHD meds even though I was getting help. Shows like Unbreakable Kimmy Schmidt show ADHD medication as an answer to bad parenting showing that medication puts kids in a zombie-like state, making them more easily controlled. Perpetuating the stereotype that ADHD is caused by bad parenting. Making parents less likely to get their kids diagnosed.

In addition, Autistic characters are rarely ever shown as people in media. Rather opting to portray autistics as empty shells. Cold emotionless robots, requiring much care. Seldom portrayed by Autistic actors. Rather, they are played by neurotypical actors, who are wearing autism as if it's a costume. Exaggerating the disorder, dramatizing its symptoms, and humiliating the us who have to live with it every day.

The world needs a series that shows what growing up being neurodiverse truly means told by those who actually went through it.

 

Meet the Team:

Justin Janoson - Writer/Director/Creator

Raised on Long Island, Justin has always had a passion for storytelling. From the moment his mother gave him a light green Flip Video Camera, he knew that filmmaking was his destiny. However, Justin didn't grow up in a neurotypical household. Justin has ADHD and an Autistic twin sister named Lara. It is that relationship that inspired him to write What's the Rule. 

Growing up, Justin heard it all that he had so much "potential" but wasn't using it. That he is "lazy," despite working twice as hard as anyone else, he grew up with his "friends," saying that his "ADHD isn't real" or that "everyone has ADHD," and he shouldn't need to take medication for it. People would tell him that his success in school was attributed to his ADHD medication and that they "would do well if [they] had a magic focusing drug." 

For Justin, he never truly saw anyone on screen who was quite like him. He never saw a family quite like his. He wants to tell this story because he knows that neurodiversity is important and wants to show people going through these experiences that they are not invisible. 

Justin is a student at Quinnipiac University studying Film, Television, and Media Arts. He has worked as a camera operator for ESPN, as well as an intern for NSTV. Justin directed the short film A Typical First I Love You, which was screened at many festivals, including The Long Island International Film Expo, and won the Audience Choice Award the Quinnies. Justin also created and hosted a talk/sketch show which featured guests from all across the film industry called The Janoshow.

 

Emily Kordovich - Director of Photography

Emily Kordovich is a Director and Director of Photography based in Brooklyn, NY. She graduated from the Rochester Institute of Technology in 2018, double majoring in Film (focus on Cinematography) and Advertising Photography. She is a first-generation Macedonian immigrant, originally from a small town outside of Rochester, NY. You’ll find her capturing the beautiful, authentic little moments in life, one frame at a time (on both film stock and pixels.)

 

Jessica Hoechstetter - Lead Cast/Samantha “Sam” Schneider

Her name is Jessica Hoechstetter, and she was born to play Sam. Jessica is a 19-year-old actress from Houston, Texas. When she was in 5th grade, she was diagnosed with ADHD. Throughout her whole life, she’s had to learn how to manage it on her own. When Jessica went to high school, she was eligible for a 501, which allows students with disabilities to receive more time on assignments and tests. 

Jessica would feel embarrassed staying behind in class after tests and being moved to other rooms for standardized exams. On top of this, Jessica also learned that being a Jewish American in the Bible Belt of the country would come with its own set of problems. She’s had to deal with antisemitism for her whole life. Despite all of these challenges, she remains strong and continues to pursue her dreams of being an actress.

 

Claire Murphy - Supporting Cast/Ashley

Claire Murphy is an eighteen-year-old actress from Connecticut.  This is Claire’s second production with IndEP Media.  She first met Justin Janoson while playing Liv Blanchard in “Snap Maps”.  Claire is so excited to work with IndEP Media again, and she is thrilled to play the antithesis of her real-life personality in “What’s the Rule?”. 

When Claire is not acting, she spends time volunteering with disabled children at her local Ronald McDonald House.  She loves organizing activities and making all children feel accepted and welcome, which is why a series about neurodiverse teenagers struggling to feel accepted in their high school speaks deeply to her.  In the fall, Claire will be a freshman in college, and she hopes to major in neurobiology while continuing to act in film and theatre.  Claire aspires to become a physician and continues to advocate for people with disabilities. 

 

Tianna Alley - Katie/Supporting Cast

Tianna Alley, based in New York City, is a classical and contemporary actor. Tianna grew up in the rural of Washington State and found her way to The American Musical and Dramatic Academy, where she graduated from the Studio Acting Conservatory Program. Tianna is interested in telling new and untold stories that impact societal standards and outlooks, even if just by small margins.

 

William Gavin - Blog Writer/Associate Producer

Will Gavin is an experienced writer, interviewer, and reporter. Driven by an urge to give a voice to the unrepresented, he takes pride in providing the best stories possible. As a reporter, his goals include accurately informing and educating the public. When not working on the next big story, Will enjoys catching up on the news, watching the political circus, and scrolling through Twitter.

 

The Schneiders aren’t your neurotypical family. Taking place, a year after the death of their mother, Samantha "Sam" Schneider, a teenage girl with ADHD, and Jackson "Jack" Schneider her autistic twin brother who are forced to coexist at the same school. 

Throughout the show, What's the Rule explores what two very different sides of special education look like. 

Characters:

Samantha "Sam" Schneider (Jessica Hoechstetter) - Sam is a 14-year-old high school female who has ADHD and takes daily medication for it. Following her mother's death, she finds herself trying to take on her mother’s role while at the same time, trying to fit in and be a kid. People tell her all the time that she “can’t have ADHD because she is gifted.” She often spends her time trying to do too much in a single day, get herself into trouble by over-explaining herself. Going through her day, she feels parallel to everyone else.

Jackson "Jack" Schneider (TBA) - Jack is a 14-year-old Autistic male who is in his sophomore year of high school. He takes everything literally. For example, if he were to work at a supermarket and the boss were to tell him to turn on the sign for 12 items or less, he would only help people with that number leading to people being pissed off. He also has trouble with sarcasm. In addition, he is always confused about why people feel sorry for him when he is just living his life day to day. Jack loves trying to make people laugh. He has a VHS collection with a passion for physical media. Throughout the show, we see Jack join the school choir and follow his passion for theatre.

Paul Schneider (TBD) - The father of Samantha and Jackson, mourning his late wife, unsure about how he will continue to raise his kids on his own. He spends his time trying to figure out how to connect, while at the same time slowly becoming overwhelmed with everything. Dad often has trouble understanding that it isn’t that Sam doesn’t want to focus but often she really just can’t. Paul also struggles to find ways to pay the bills after losing his wife's income and has to work multiple jobs in order to keep his family leading him to consistently be late or missing important moments in his kids lives.

Ashley Watts (Claire Murphy) - Ashley is the teacher's pet who sees Jack as the unknown. She spews hurtful claims she's picked up from her parents about how "special education is a waste of our tax dollars" and that Jack shouldn't be in public school. However, as she gets to know Jack in the school choir, she slowly learns that she must start to form her own opinions and develops a close friendship with Jack.

Katie Powell (Tianna Alley) - She is an openly bisexual, female who develops a friendship with Sam. As she gets to know Sam throughout season 1, Katie starts to wonder if what she thought was her being weird was actually ADHD leading her to try and get diagnosed. Though she meets all the criteria, the school refuses to give her any services as she "isn't a problem" and she discovers the stigma that comes with being a female with ADHD. 

Kevin Conroy (TBA) - Jack's one-to-one, he follows Jack throughout his day and sits with him throughout the classes where he is mainstreamed.  

Colleen (TBD) - She is a Non-verbal Autistic female who is Jack's classmate. Colleen communicates through an aac tablet.

Our goal is to produce the pilot episode utilizing a neurodiverse cast and crew that are often kept from entering the industry.

The campaign will give us the funds to create the pilot episode. Our goal is to have a festival run followed by the pilot episode being released online after the run has completed.

Our number one priority is the safety of our cast and crew. To ensure everyone stays healthy, we may need to provide testing for the cast and crew on our own. The longer we shoot, the more it costs. We need extra precautionary room in our budget to cover costs should COVID cause us to shut down. Every dollar pledged will go towards our production, and any extra money unused for COVID precautions will be allocated right back into any of the other production essentials previously mentioned.


What's the Rule? takes influences in its story from films such as The Edge of Seventeen (2016), Booksmart (2019), and Keep the Change (2018), as well as television shows like Speechless (2016), Never Have I Ever (2020), and more.

 

We are all so excited to work with you to bring this story of neurodiversity and acceptance to life.

Rather, they are played by neurotypical actors, who are wearing autism as if it's a costume. Exaggerating the disorder, dramatizing its symptoms, and humiliating the us who have to live with it every day.The world needs a series that shows what growing up being neurodiverse truly means told by those who actually went through it. Meet the Team:Justin Janoson - Writer/Director/CreatorRaised on Long Island, Justin has always had a passion for storytelling. From the moment his mother gave him a light green Flip Video Camera, he knew that filmmaking was his destiny. However, Justin didn't grow up in a neurotypical household. Justin has ADHD and an Autistic twin sister named Lara. It is that relationship that inspired him to write What's the Rule. Growing up, Justin heard it all that he had so much "potential" but wasn't using it. That he is "lazy," despite working twice as hard as anyone else, he grew up with his "friends," saying that his "ADHD isn't real" or that "everyone has ADHD," and he shouldn't need to take medication for it. People would tell him that his success in school was attributed to his ADHD medication and that they "would do well if [they] had a magic focusing drug." For Justin, he never truly saw anyone on screen who was quite like him. He never saw a family quite like his. He wants to tell this story because he knows that neurodiversity is important and wants to show people going through these experiences that they are not invisible. Justin is a student at Quinnipiac University studying Film, Television, and Media Arts. He has worked as a camera operator for ESPN, as well as an intern for NSTV. Justin directed the short film A Typical First I Love You, which was screened at many festivals, including The Long Island International Film Expo, and won the Audience Choice Award the Quinnies. Justin also created and hosted a talk/sketch show which featured guests from all across the film industry called The Janoshow. Emily Kordovich - Director of PhotographyEmily Kordovich is a Director and Director of Photography based in Brooklyn, NY. She graduated from the Rochester Institute of Technology in 2018, double majoring in Film (focus on Cinematography) and Advertising Photography. She is a first-generation Macedonian immigrant, originally from a small town outside of Rochester, NY. You’ll find her capturing the beautiful, authentic little moments in life, one frame at a time (on both film stock and pixels.) Jessica Hoechstetter - Lead Cast/Samantha “Sam” SchneiderHer name is Jessica Hoechstetter, and she was born to play Sam. Jessica is a 19-year-old actress from Houston, Texas. When she was in 5th grade, she was diagnosed with ADHD. Throughout her whole life, she’s had to learn how to manage it on her own. When Jessica went to high school, she was eligible for a 501, which allows students with disabilities to receive more time on assignments and tests. Jessica would feel embarrassed staying behind in class after tests and being moved to other rooms for standardized exams. On top of this, Jessica also learned that being a Jewish American in the Bible Belt of the country would come with its own set of problems. She’s had to deal with antisemitism for her whole life. Despite all of these challenges, she remains strong and continues to pursue her dreams of being an actress. Claire Murphy - Supporting Cast/AshleyClaire Murphy is an eighteen-year-old actress from Connecticut.  This is Claire’s second production with IndEP Media.  She first met Justin Janoson while playing Liv Blanchard in “Snap Maps”.  Claire is so excited to work with IndEP Media again, and she is thrilled to play the antithesis of her real-life personality in “What’s the Rule?”. When Claire is not acting, she spends time volunteering with disabled children at her local Ronald McDonald House.  She loves organizing activities and making all children feel accepted and welcome, which is why a series about neurodiverse teenagers struggling to feel accepted in their high school speaks deeply to her.  In the fall, Claire will be a freshman in college, and she hopes to major in neurobiology while continuing to act in film and theatre.  Claire aspires to become a physician and continues to advocate for people with disabilities.  Tianna Alley - Katie/Supporting CastTianna Alley, based in New York City, is a classical and contemporary actor. Tianna grew up in the rural of Washington State and found her way to The American Musical and Dramatic Academy, where she graduated from the Studio Acting Conservatory Program. Tianna is interested in telling new and untold stories that impact societal standards and outlooks, even if just by small margins. William Gavin - Blog Writer/Associate ProducerWill Gavin is an experienced writer, interviewer, and reporter. Driven by an urge to give a voice to the unrepresented, he takes pride in providing the best stories possible. As a reporter, his goals include accurately informing and educating the public. When not working on the next big story, Will enjoys catching up on the news, watching the political circus, and scrolling through Twitter. The Schneiders aren’t your neurotypical family. Taking place, a year after the death of their mother, Samantha "Sam" Schneider, a teenage girl with ADHD, and Jackson "Jack" Schneider her autistic twin brother who are forced to coexist at the same school. Throughout the show, What's the Rule explores what two very different sides of special education look like. Characters:Samantha "Sam" Schneider (Jessica Hoechstetter) - Sam is a 14-year-old high school female who has ADHD and takes daily medication for it. Following her mother's death, she finds herself trying to take on her mother’s role while at the same time, trying to fit in and be a kid. People tell her all the time that she “can’t have ADHD because she is gifted.” She often spends her time trying to do too much in a single day, get herself into trouble by over-explaining herself. Going through her day, she feels parallel to everyone else.Jackson "Jack" Schneider (TBA) - Jack is a 14-year-old Autistic male who is in his sophomore year of high school. He takes everything literally. For example, if he were to work at a supermarket and the boss were to tell him to turn on the sign for 12 items or less, he would only help people with that number leading to people being pissed off. He also has trouble with sarcasm. In addition, he is always confused about why people feel sorry for him when he is just living his life day to day. Jack loves trying to make people laugh. He has a VHS collection with a passion for physical media. Throughout the show, we see Jack join the school choir and follow his passion for theatre.Paul Schneider (TBD) - The father of Samantha and Jackson, mourning his late wife, unsure about how he will continue to raise his kids on his own. He spends his time trying to figure out how to connect, while at the same time slowly becoming overwhelmed with everything. Dad often has trouble understanding that it isn’t that Sam doesn’t want to focus but often she really just can’t. Paul also struggles to find ways to pay the bills after losing his wife's income and has to work multiple jobs in order to keep his family leading him to consistently be late or missing important moments in his kids lives.Ashley Watts (Claire Murphy) - Ashley is the teacher's pet who sees Jack as the unknown. She spews hurtful claims she's picked up from her parents about how "special education is a waste of our tax dollars" and that Jack shouldn't be in public school. However, as she gets to know Jack in the school choir, she slowly learns that she must start to form her own opinions and develops a close friendship with Jack.Katie Powell (Tianna Alley) - She is an openly bisexual, female who develops a friendship with Sam. As she gets to know Sam throughout season 1, Katie starts to wonder if what she thought was her being weird was actually ADHD leading her to try and get diagnosed. Though she meets all the criteria, the school refuses to give her any services as she "isn't a problem" and she discovers the stigma that comes with being a female with ADHD. Kevin Conroy (TBA) - Jack's one-to-one, he follows Jack throughout his day and sits with him throughout the classes where he is mainstreamed.  Colleen (TBD) - She is a Non-verbal Autistic female who is Jack's classmate. Colleen communicates through an aac tablet.Our goal is to produce the pilot episode utilizing a neurodiverse cast and crew that are often kept from entering the industry.The campaign will give us the funds to create the pilot episode. Our goal is to have a festival run followed by the pilot episode being released online after the run has completed.Our number one priority is the safety of our cast and crew. To ensure everyone stays healthy, we may need to provide testing for the cast and crew on our own. The longer we shoot, the more it costs. We need extra precautionary room in our budget to cover costs should COVID cause us to shut down. Every dollar pledged will go towards our production, and any extra money unused for COVID precautions will be allocated right back into any of the other production essentials previously mentioned.What's the Rule? takes influences in its story from films such as The Edge of Seventeen (2016), Booksmart (2019), and Keep the Change (2018), as well as television shows like Speechless (2016), Never Have I Ever (2020), and more. We are all so excited to work with you to bring this story of neurodiversity and acceptance to life.

story:
We, Thee Delinquents is a Canadian teen drama series that follows French immersion students of Lady of Mercy Catholic High School. It’s a darker, grittier and lively look into life as these Gen Zer’s battle with issues of racism, sexuality, drugs and mental health. Watch as these Canadian teenagers navigate the hardships of growing up.

 

THE STORY

The story is set in Etobicoke, one of the many boroughs of Toronto. The city is quieting down, leaves are changing colour and the students of Our Lady of Mercy Secondary are getting ready for a new school year. And with this change in weather, comes a change in attitude for the people of the city. And with changes, come new beginnings. Especially for Kiyanna Fuller. A reformed juvenile who will have to repeat grade 11. Integrating into a new high school definitely won’t be easy and finding a sense of normalcy is all Kiyanna wants. Enlisted to help her settle in is Student Council President, Ana Pacheco. A well-rounded student and an academic god, who’s own pressures of school success in getting the better of her. Coupled with her own fractured friendships, especially with ex BFF, Samantha Russo, an ‘IT’ girl battling her own insecurities while maintaining her perfect image. With a mountain of secrets, raging hormones and finding their own footing, more connect these young ladies than ever before and the cliques that they run in.

 

WHY THIS PROJECT

Everyone knows that Degrassi: The Next Generation is our national treasure. Degrassi gave Canadian teens a sense of identity, that I never really appreciated until now. And I believe that's something we desperately need for the next generation. In the last two years, there have been open dialogues all around the world about the various social injustices taking place. There’s always been these perceptions that Canada is this nice, quiet country with no problems. Unfortunately, that isn’t that case. I along with many others, have experienced police brutality, racism, sexism, homophobia, colourism etc. For me, this series is not just about reflecting or identifying life as a Canadian teen, but I believe it is my duty as a filmmaker to reflect on the times. When writing We, Thee Delinquents, it was very important for me to represent characters from different races, cultures, and with different sexualities and socio-economic backgrounds. There are so many truths from people I grew up with that haven’t been told on a media platform and they deserve to be. Having it be set in a catholic French immersion high school is as Canadian as it gets. As we also haven’t had the opportunity to explore the dynamics of a school with a French immersion program, one that is a very common element in the Canadian Education system. 

In a way, this is my love letter to the yute of the past, present and future because you’re not alone. You are important, and your stories matter.

 

MEET THE TEAM

Creator, Director & Writer: Gabriel Miller (she/her/her)

IG: @gabbantoinette

Gabriel Miller is an emerging director and writer, based in Toronto. Miller began her filmmaking journey with acting – her training as an actor helped her to first understand filmmaking from a performers point of view, later challenging herself to learn the world behind the camera. A significant personal and professional goal for Miller is cultivating a more diverse space for the Black community and POC, both in front of and behind the camera.

 

Showrunner & Producer: Nikita Adoni (she/her/hers)

IG: @_nadoni

Nikita Adoni is a writer and producer born in South India, who moved to Toronto, Canada at the age of 15. She grew up with a passion for both Bollywood and Hollywood film and television. Through her producing work, she aims to help tell stories that are both insightful and engaging and often collaborates with emerging female directors. 

 

WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

We, Thee Delinquents is a passion project supported by a dedicated, passionate and talented crew and cast. Many team members are investing time and personal resources into this project, which we couldn’t be more grateful for but we are hoping to raise enough funds for a high-quality production.

Come be a part of this amazing journey! We have a short week and a half to raise some funds, and we appreciate any and all support you have to offer. 

Your support will go towards:

  • CRAFT
  • INSURANCE 
  • EQUIPMENT RENTAL
  • TRANSPORTATION/GAS
  • PROPS/SET DRESSING

story:
Eighteen and free! For a naïve country boy leaving home for the first time, nothing compares to the thought of sun, fun, beach, women, and adventures waiting for him on the Sunshine Coast.

This is Jonathan. He’s just moved to the Sunshine Coast from the country, ready to start the next phase of his life.  Until he meets his housemates…

ADAM : When a man enters new territory, he either comes in peace or is declaring war.

JONATHAN : Ummm I'm not?!? ...What are you doing?

ADAM: Glistening.

JONATHAN: Like in Twilight? ­­­­­­­

Adam's expression sours quickly.

ADAM: Like a crocodile.

Just like leftovers on a plate, the SCRAP online drama series tells a story of a quirky group of people brought together through different circumstances. Living in a share-house, the characters embark on a journey to overcome obstacles in life and the audience controls the characters’ destinies  by voting online. 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET 

The SCRAP's team's mission is to invigorate the film & television industry on the Sunshine Coast. We have an outstanding team of creatives, of different disciplines and from all areas of the Coast who have joined forces to bring this project to life. Through SCRAP we will create innovative ways for businesses and the arts to work together.  We've got the scripts, the concept and team ready to go, now we need the funds to produce it!

This campaign is to fund the creation of six episodes for the first series. The more we raise, the more we can complete! You decide Take Control 

Here's a list of what's involved in shooting a drama series: 

  • Equipment and camera, sound, lighting, design
  • Marketing & Promotion 
  • Wardrobe
  • Make-up 
  • Props
  • Food
  • Accommodation
  • Locations
  • Insurance
  • Cast and Crew.

To raise the funds we've created some seriously cool perks for you and we hope you'll start interacting with SCRAP here and on our website too!

Jump onboard with SCRAP and let's see how far we can go!

THE IMPACT

It's new, it's interactive and it's fun!

Concept owner , Rachel Forsyth says...
"I always loved the "choose your own adventure books" as a kid, and later when I was studying Drama at University,  I fell in love with Augusto Boal's Forum Theatre and how he used "art as a weapon" to challenge people, to make them think. I  believe that Art can make people think, feel and move in their seats. This drama will be about current topics that people need to talk about, to stimulate conversation and to make a difference". 

In our first series, the topic centres around "FAMILY"; what is a family and how are the traditional views of family are changing?  In the first six episodes, you will get to meet and get to know our quirky housemates. You will go on an interactive journey with them.  

Our main character Jonathan, has just moved from the country to the big smoke on the beautiful and lively Sunshine Coast.  He is a bit of a nerd & will need your help to navigate his journey.  


In this drama series, You Decide &  Take Control, and vote for story choices that our characters need to make.

#CREATE #DESIGN #CONTRIBUTE with scrapdramaseries.com

RISKS INVOLVED

Artists are risk-takers. Creating a drama series is taking a huge risk. However our team has been carefully selected to minimise risk and make this happen with professionalism and quality. We have engaged heads of business, website, marketing and promotion to build our concept even before we started writing our scripts. This project has solid foundations and the expertise to make it happen. 

And we have a great deal of faith in YOU, our audience, to guide and navigate the plot outcomes  of our story so SCRAP is bound to be a success.  Shooting begins in August 2017 and before then we have loads of decisions to make. So start interacting with SCRAP because what you decide now, how much money we raise, will affect production in August 2017.

$50000  will allow us to produce episodes one and two for series one. We have a fantastic business plan in place to secure other funding to produce the entire series which we aim for  release in December 2017.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We know not everyone can contribute funds, but we hope you'll still be part of making the SCRAP story.

You can assist us greatly:

  • Become a Friend of SCRAP by liking and sharing us on our Facebook and Instagram pages. 
  • Email a friend and invite them to contribute because you like the innovative concept of SCRAP and think it should be made. 
  • Take part in our interactive elements of the show. You can find this on our website - where you can #DESIGN  #CREATE  #CONTROL... The elements you choose now will set the course for production Filming in August 2017. You decide. Take Control!
  • Get in touch and interact with us and talk about this new drama series with your friends. Let us know how you feel about it. We want SCRAP  to grow and build with our audience.  
  • Thank you for your interest in our show.
