OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We know not everyone can contribute funds, but we hope you'll still be part of making the SCRAP story.
You can assist us greatly:

Become a Friend of SCRAP by liking and sharing us on our Facebook and Instagram pages. 
Email a friend and invite them to contribute because you like the innovative concept of SCRAP and think it should be made. 
Take part in our interactive elements of the show. You can find this on our website - where you can #DESIGN  #CREATE  #CONTROL... The elements you choose now will set the course for production Filming in August 2017. You decide. Take Control!
Get in touch and interact with us and talk about this new drama series with your friends. Let us know how you feel about it. We want SCRAP  to grow and build with our audience.  
Thank you for your interest in our show.

story:
What is The Golden Apple animated series?

The Golden Apple is a fantasy animated series based on Balkan legends and folklore. Every season consists of twelve 24-minute episodes. The series is developed simultaneously in both English and Bulgarian, with the option for more languages.

We are telling a modern original story, set in the mystical world of Balkan legends. Our story bears the same heart, morals and lessons as these legends – we just use animation to show them, and contemporary, relatable conflicts to make them accessible to a wider audience.

UPDATE: NEW GOAL FOR A 12-MINUTE PILOT AND EXTENDED DEADLINE

20.06.2017 – We have decided to split our pilot episode in half and focus our efforts on a fully animated, complete, 12-minute episode. This would require half the amount we're crowdfunding – around $70 000, and we are very close to reaching it. With the $30 000 already raised, and with the co-production of the Bulgarian National Television, we’re just $15 000 short. So please, help us get to $45 000!

Cutting costs, however, does not mean we will cut on quality. We still aim to produce a complete, fully animated pilot episode with a developed plot and soundtrack, the only difference being the length of it. Thanks to your help we are closer than ever to the pilot episode of the Golden Apple!

Also, to give the campaign some more time, we're extending our deadline with 15 days. We can only extend the campaign once, so this is it: We have until 6 July to make this happen!

Of course, our dream and big goal remains to create a full, 24-minute episode, so we will continue looking for funding for the second half of the pilot. However, we want to finally be able to show you a complete, fully animated episode of the series, even if it has to be shorter. With your incredible help and support, we have a real chance to make a complete, 12-minute episode.

Why are we doing this?

We are an international team of professionals in the fields of animation, storytelling, design and folklore and we have been working on this project for more than five years. We want to show the most compelling elements of Balkan culture in a modern, engaging way and help preserve these exotic and unknown legends before they die out.

Balkan folklore is passed down through songs and spoken stories – the tales are rarely written down or illustrated, apart from some academic texts. These legends promote lessons and morals that are widely applicable to the modern world. Sadly, these stories are slowly perishing, along with the old people who carry them in their traditional songs and tales.

The first 3 years of the project were mostly devoted to research – designing the visual style of the series, traveling around small villages and immersing ourselves in the culture of the Balkans, talking to old people and identifying the core elements of the story.

We found out that Balkan legends are based on several defining cultural aspects that became the foundation of The Golden Apple series:

  • Nothing is black or white
    The fantastical creatures in Balkan folklore represent nature, and as such can be both helpful or harmful, depending on how people threat them.
  • Respect for nature
    Our folklore is based on the deep understanding of the elements and the interconnection between humans and their environment. 
  • A sense of belonging
    Balkan folklore is focused on bringing people together, and creating a collective in which people rely on each other to overcome the obstacles that come their way.
    This idea became central to the plot of The Golden Apple series – each of our main characters is motivated not only by their personal desires, but by the wish to help their community. The characters are forced to work through their differences and discover that the only way to achieve their goal is by sticking together.

Our team was amazed at the treasures these stories hide, and at how easily their morals can be applied to the modern world. We realised it would be a terrible loss to let these tales die out along with the old people who kept them. And besides preserving and presenting this centuries old culture in a contemporary way, we aim to tell a modern, yet relatable story, set in an exotic and mystical setting, which has not been shown before

Why crowdfunding?

The Bulgarian National Television has become a co-producer of the project, providing 20% of the funding for the pilot episode. They are showing interest in airing the entire series, but only after they see a finished pilot.

This is where we hit a wall. There has been great interest in The Golden Apple, but since there has never been a similar project created in Bulgaria, everyone wants to see that we can pull off a good pilot before they invest in the entire production.

We tried finding the rest of the 80% funding for the pilot through various ways, but were faced with a tough decision. We had to either surrender creative control on the project, which would defeat its purpose; continue working in our spare time and take ages to complete an episode… or try something else.

Then we realized that YOU, the fans and supporters of the project, have been the only constant that has allowed us to continue working. Both Studio Zmei and The Golden Apple exist ONLY and ENTIRELY thanks to the amazing support of the people who believe in the project! 

This is why, once again, we turn to you, our fans and supporters. By backing us in this campaign, you will become a co-producer on the series, and will directly help preserve and present the best elements of Balkan culture and folklore trough modern animation!

Besides the perks and awards, you will also get access to exclusive, monthly video log updates. These will be our way of showing you, our co-producers, how we are using your investment and what progress we are making.

We found out that the only way for us to continue forward, and make The Golden Apple the way we believe it is supposed to be, is with your support. Only with your help, we can take this step forward and create a complete pilot episode and use it to secure funding for the entire series. If we reach our target goal, we will be able to produce a fully animated pilot episode.

How can I help?

If you have been with us thus far, THANK YOU! It would mean the world for us if you back this project and help make the Pilot episode a reality.

Even if you can't support us financially, it would be just as beneficial if you spread the word: Share the campaign on social media or on your blog, or just tell people about the project. We are honoured that because of your amazing support so far, we've been able to continue our work. We will not give up and with your help, we can make this series a reality. This is your project. Thank you! :)

 

If you are new to the project, below you can read a bit more about the team behind it, the story of The Golden Apple, find out about our progress so far, and discover the amazing world of Balkan folklore, the way we imagine it

 

Trailer for The Golden Apple animated series

 

The Team

Dimitar Petrov is the creator/show-runner of The Golden Apple series, and a producer for the pilot episode. Before founding Studio Zmei, Dimitar got an Animation degree from The University of Westminster, UK, and worked for Cartoon Network Studios Europe as a layout artist. He also did freelance work, producing animated advertisements for several agencies, graphics and 3D animation for video games and teaching. Dimitar has been a guest lecturer in Bulgaria and France, and has also been a speaker at several TEDx events. He received an award for outstanding achievements in the field of culture form JCI Bulgaria in 2016, and has authored the award-winning "Legend of the First Kuker Warrior" illustrated story book.

 

Teodora Filipova is the technical director of the series. She has studied Illustration and animation at the European institute of design in Milan (IED Milano), where she’s currently working as a motion graphics teacher and a thesis assistant. She’s also a freelance illustrator/animator/VJ, and has worked for several animation studios and series.

 

Stanislav Tsvetkov is the lead animator in The Golden Apple, and a tutor for the animation courses at our Zmei Academy. He has studied art, sculpture and wood carving at the National School of Applied Arts in Sofia. Stanislav has more than 12 years of experience in animation, working for companies such as Adult Swim, Warner Bros and Comedy Central.

 

Marta Andreeva is the lead designer on the project. She has a a degree in Media Studies from the University of Potsdam, Germany, where she won a prize for her graduation film in 2016. Marta has worked for one of the biggest animation studios in Germany, where she was part of the development of the successful and internationally distributed TV-animated series "Mia and Me". She has also worked as a freelance character designer and an illustrator on various projects, and has been featured for her illustrations on Behance and The Character Design Reference Blog.

 

Boris Stoyanov is one of the background artists on The Golden Apple team. He is a graduate from the University of Worcester, UK. Apart from being an artist on the team he is also a part time freelancer working on a variety of projects from all around the world. Boris has participated in more than 30 different projects ranging from PC and mobile games development to board games and animations. In early 2017 he was featured in the Illustration section on Behance for his speed paintings.

 

Magdalina Dianova is our samodiva expert and a character designer in the team. She has been featured twice in 2D Artist Magazine and the Wacom artist gallery. Magdalina has done a lot of freelance work, with clients including the Singapore Symphony Orchestra, Simon & Schuster and CLUSE watches.

 

The visual style of the show was developed with the help of our lead designer Svetla Radivoeva – another Bulgarian born artist. She is responsible for Vihra’s character design and created the guides for the female costumes. Svetla currently works as a CG animator at Walt Disney Animation studios.

 

Momchil Stepanov is our Business development manager and voice talent consultant, as well as the voice of the kuker Vlad. Momchil has a degree in acting for drama theater from the National Academy for Theater and Film Arts, Bulgaria, and experience in Arts management. He has been working as a freelance actor and singer, specialising in voice acting. Some of his roles are in the Bulgarian versions of films such as "Frozen" (Kristoff), "Moana" (Maui), "Beauty and the Beast" (Lumire), "Tangled: The Series" (Flynn Rider), "Trolls" (Branch), etc. From 2016, Momchil is the president of the Bulgarian Voice Actors Guild.

 

Irena Parvanova is working on the story bible of the series and is developing screenplays for the first episodes of the project. She studied Balkan folklore and mythology in middle school and developed a personal interest in the subject. Irena has been captivated by the stories and legends about samodiva nymphs and spirits, and is basing a lot of the narrative of The Golden Apple on these tales. Currently, she is studying English Philology at Sofia University, focusing on creative writing.

 

Our lead consultant is Vihra Baeva, PhD., a member of the Bulgarian Institute of Ethnology and Folklore Studies. She has published several books on Zmei spirits and is an expert on Bulgarian written and spoken folklore.

 

The producer of the show is Elena Rapondzhieva. Having graduated in Communication and Media in the UK, she has worked as a producer and project manager for multiple companies such as Ubisoft, Worldwide FX and RCR Films.

 

 

We would like to say a special THANK YOU here to our partners from MOVE.BG, who have been actively supporting us on our journey in creating The Golden Apple. MOVE.BG is a platform for value creators working for good society in Bulgaria. They are looking for innovative solutions for social transformation, working for sustainable development and affirming a culture of constructive dialog, participating leadership and shared values.

 

The story of The Golden Apple project

The project was launched about 5 years ago. In the first 3 years, we worked entirely in our spare time. In 2015, after a successful crowdfunding campaign, we founded Studio Zmei and for the first time ever we had the opportunity to work full-time on the project. The direct result was the short film Legend of the First Kuker Warrior, which serves as a prequel to the main story in the series. We have also done tons of more research and visual development, background and character design work. The first (pilot) episode is completely scripted and we have even started work on parts of the storyboard.

This has allowed us to start negotiating with potential investors and distributors about the entire series. Our idea was to use the momentum and viewer interest from the first crowdfunding campaign as proof of the viewer interest in the project, and to secure funding for the entire first season. This partly worked – we now have a distribution deal with a French company and interest from the USA, plus the co-production commitment from the Bulgarian National Television... but we still need to secure the remaining 80% of the required funding for the pilot – hence the crowdfunding campaign! And only after a complete pilot, the interested investors and distributors will help us fund the entire series. You can find out more details on the Frequently Asked Questions page on our website.

The world of The Golden Apple animated series

This fantasy world is inhabited by humans and spirits. Most spirits are related to a specific force of nature or natural element; for example, the zmei spirits control the storms and fogs, and the samodiva spirits control the rivers. 

Humans and spirits have lived in peace and cooperation for hundreds of years in the city of Khan and the surrounding rose valley, which has led to unprecedented development and growth – making Khan the most developed city in the known world.

However, this is not the case everywhere. Far away from Khan, in the Kuker Mountains, people and spirits have been in open conflict for generations. The cities there are built like fortresses, and have huge, magical bells at their gates, to protect them from the evils, lurking in the shadows of the mountains.

Тhe only way people can even survive in the Kuker Mountains is because of the Kuker warriors – specially trained fighters who use their magic bells and intricate costumes to fight off the evil spirits and protect the humans. People who want to be Kuker warriors have to attend special Kuker schools and spend years learning how to wield the magical bells.

On the other hand, in the vast, wild Kuber Mountain, people and spirits tend to stay away from each other and don’t really have an established dynamic. The people of Kuber Mountain are known as Balkandjees.

The Balkandjees are shepherds – they ride on huge rams (and like to organise races with them), and have huge herds of colourful sheep. No one knows why, but only in Kuber Mountain each sheep has a unique pattern and color. 

 

Our main characters begin their adventure in the city of Khan, quickly pass through the lands of the Kuker and then end up in the mystical Kuber Mountain. 

Music in The Golden Apple project

The music for the series will be composed by the amazing George Strezov. We have already worked with George on the trailer for the series and our short prequel. He composed an amazing soundtrack, which combines a classic movie orchestra, a Bulgarian folk choir, traditional folk instruments and a Japanese tayko drum. Check out the making of the "Legend of the First Kuker Warrior" soundtrack here:

Visual style of the project

 

 

The style of the series is inspired by the iconic style of the American illustrator Eyvind Earle. We decided to combine this familiar style with traditional Balkan graphic elements, architecture and costumes. The more we dive deeper into this wild world, the more these elements will become apparent. With this approach, we aim to walk a thin line between the familiar and exotic.

The main story in The Golden Apple animated series

Once every hundred years a comet crosses the sky, and wherever it falls, a magical tree appears. The tree bears a single golden apple, which has the power to fulfill wishes. Once the comet appears, creatures and spirits from all over the world set forth to look for the mystical artifact, hoping it will solve all their troubles and problems.  

Meanwhile, a conflict between humans and spirits in the city of Khan quickly escalates, and the peace is lost.

Vihra, the daughter of the two leaders – Vulkan Zmei, leader of the spirits, and Iskra – mayor of Khan, sees no other way to help her parents, and decides to go and find the golden apple. She plans to wish for peace, and thus save her home town and her family.

She is joined by her best friend – the Samodiva spirit Tina.

Tina-Pakostina is Vihra’s best friend – a mischievous, very talkative samodiva spirit who likes playing jokes. As a samodiva nymph, she can influence nature around herself through her song and dance. Tina belongs to a conservative Samodiva tribe from the forest near the town of Khan, but she is curious about the world outside her forest so every chance she gets, she sneaks out in search of adventures with Vihra.

Meanwhile, our other two main characters – the brothers Bran and Vlad – accidentally become responsible for the destruction of the Kuker guide. The Kuker guide is an ancient book, which is said to contain all the secrets of the Kuker magic, which the Kuker warriors use to fight evil spirits. Bran and Vlad decide that there is no other way to save their people, but to find the golden apple and wish for a new Kuker guide.


But to succeed, the events lead the two brothers to only one option. The two kuker brothers, who have been taught from an early age that all spirits are evil, have to join Vihra – an obvious half-spirit, and Tina – a samodiva water spirit, on a huge adventure. At first, there is conflict in the group – Bran and Vlad don't want to trust the half-spirit girl and the samodiva water spirit, and there is only one golden apple. During the course of the series however, this conflict turns into a legendary friendship.

The beginning of the story: The Pilot episode

The Pilot episode of the series will tell the beginning of the story of Vihra, Tina, Bran and Vlad, and will show us the starting point of their journey. It will lay out the foundations for all the conflicts in the show, introduce us to some of the main locations of the series, as well as to the main antagonists. Needless to say, neither the conflict in Khan, nor the destruction of the Kuker Guide were mere accidents. Our main characters will have to uncover a much bigger story if they are to succeed and save their homes.
story_txt:
What is The Golden Apple animated series?The Golden Apple is a fantasy animated series based on Balkan legends and folklore. Every season consists of twelve 24-minute episodes. The series is developed simultaneously in both English and Bulgarian, with the option for more languages.We are telling a modern original story, set in the mystical world of Balkan legends. Our story bears the same heart, morals and lessons as these legends – we just use animation to show them, and contemporary, relatable conflicts to make them accessible to a wider audience.UPDATE: NEW GOAL FOR A 12-MINUTE PILOT AND EXTENDED DEADLINE20.06.2017 – We have decided to split our pilot episode in half and focus our efforts on a fully animated, complete, 12-minute episode. This would require half the amount we're crowdfunding – around $70 000, and we are very close to reaching it. With the $30 000 already raised, and with the co-production of the Bulgarian National Television, we’re just $15 000 short. So please, help us get to $45 000!Cutting costs, however, does not mean we will cut on quality. We still aim to produce a complete, fully animated pilot episode with a developed plot and soundtrack, the only difference being the length of it. Thanks to your help we are closer than ever to the pilot episode of the Golden Apple!Also, to give the campaign some more time, we're extending our deadline with 15 days. We can only extend the campaign once, so this is it: We have until 6 July to make this happen!Of course, our dream and big goal remains to create a full, 24-minute episode, so we will continue looking for funding for the second half of the pilot. However, we want to finally be able to show you a complete, fully animated episode of the series, even if it has to be shorter. With your incredible help and support, we have a real chance to make a complete, 12-minute episode.Why are we doing this?We are an international team of professionals in the fields of animation, storytelling, design and folklore and we have been working on this project for more than five years. We want to show the most compelling elements of Balkan culture in a modern, engaging way and help preserve these exotic and unknown legends before they die out.Balkan folklore is passed down through songs and spoken stories – the tales are rarely written down or illustrated, apart from some academic texts. These legends promote lessons and morals that are widely applicable to the modern world. Sadly, these stories are slowly perishing, along with the old people who carry them in their traditional songs and tales.The first 3 years of the project were mostly devoted to research – designing the visual style of the series, traveling around small villages and immersing ourselves in the culture of the Balkans, talking to old people and identifying the core elements of the story.We found out that Balkan legends are based on several defining cultural aspects that became the foundation of The Golden Apple series:

Nothing is black or whiteThe fantastical creatures in Balkan folklore represent nature, and as such can be both helpful or harmful, depending on how people threat them.

Respect for natureOur folklore is based on the deep understanding of the elements and the interconnection between humans and their environment. 

A sense of belongingBalkan folklore is focused on bringing people together, and creating a collective in which people rely on each other to overcome the obstacles that come their way.This idea became central to the plot of The Golden Apple series – each of our main characters is motivated not only by their personal desires, but by the wish to help their community. The characters are forced to work through their differences and discover that the only way to achieve their goal is by sticking together.
Our team was amazed at the treasures these stories hide, and at how easily their morals can be applied to the modern world. We realised it would be a terrible loss to let these tales die out along with the old people who kept them. And besides preserving and presenting this centuries old culture in a contemporary way, we aim to tell a modern, yet relatable story, set in an exotic and mystical setting, which has not been shown beforeWhy crowdfunding?The Bulgarian National Television has become a co-producer of the project, providing 20% of the funding for the pilot episode. They are showing interest in airing the entire series, but only after they see a finished pilot.This is where we hit a wall. There has been great interest in The Golden Apple, but since there has never been a similar project created in Bulgaria, everyone wants to see that we can pull off a good pilot before they invest in the entire production.We tried finding the rest of the 80% funding for the pilot through various ways, but were faced with a tough decision. We had to either surrender creative control on the project, which would defeat its purpose; continue working in our spare time and take ages to complete an episode… or try something else.Then we realized that YOU, the fans and supporters of the project, have been the only constant that has allowed us to continue working. Both Studio Zmei and The Golden Apple exist ONLY and ENTIRELY thanks to the amazing support of the people who believe in the project! This is why, once again, we turn to you, our fans and supporters. By backing us in this campaign, you will become a co-producer on the series, and will directly help preserve and present the best elements of Balkan culture and folklore trough modern animation!Besides the perks and awards, you will also get access to exclusive, monthly video log updates. These will be our way of showing you, our co-producers, how we are using your investment and what progress we are making.We found out that the only way for us to continue forward, and make The Golden Apple the way we believe it is supposed to be, is with your support. Only with your help, we can take this step forward and create a complete pilot episode and use it to secure funding for the entire series. If we reach our target goal, we will be able to produce a fully animated pilot episode.How can I help?If you have been with us thus far, THANK YOU! It would mean the world for us if you back this project and help make the Pilot episode a reality.Even if you can't support us financially, it would be just as beneficial if you spread the word: Share the campaign on social media or on your blog, or just tell people about the project. We are honoured that because of your amazing support so far, we've been able to continue our work. We will not give up and with your help, we can make this series a reality. This is your project. story:
What is "The Department" ?

It is about a Rookie Cop, that just graduated from Police Academy;  who dies, turning out to be a Criminal seeking justice on the department; The man who killed The Rookie keeps taunting his Girlfriend and the rest of the department, until some one cracks and The Department's Secrets are released.

 

Short Summary of myself

My name is Jasmine Sean, I am 20 years old, living in Toronto, Canada. I was Born in Vancouver British Columbia!  I attended Toronto Film School For Acting. I have been doing Theater/Acting since I was 5 years old. This past year I have been very interested in Production/Behind The Scenes of Films and Television Shows. Branching out and exploring more than Acting.

The idea of The Department is a mix of all my favorite shows mixed into one. Ex. Rookie Blue, Gossip Girl, Chicago P.D, ETC. 

What We Need:

To make this production happen we would need $1,500 to help assemble food and transportation for Cast and Crew!

The money we raise will be used to pay for Meals during our shoot days, 3 meals, snacks and drinks for everyone on set, As well as paying and providing transportation for Actors and Crew to get from set to set.

Even if we do not reach our full goal, the funds that are donated to us will still go towards the project and will still be used to get what is needed. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't donate that's totally fine! We ask if you can kindly share our link and page around and help build Social Media Exposure. 

Media pages!
If you would like to keep up with us, they are:
Twitter: The_Dprtment
Instagram: The_department_official
Snapchat: the.department
story_txt: What is "The Department" ?It is about a Rookie Cop, that just graduated from Police Academy;  who dies, turning out to be a Criminal seeking justice on the department; The man who killed The Rookie keeps taunting his Girlfriend and the rest of the department, until some one cracks and The Department's Secrets are released. Short Summary of myselfMy name is Jasmine Sean, I am 20 years old, living in Toronto, Canada. I was Born in Vancouver British Columbia!  I attended Toronto Film School For Acting. I have been doing Theater/Acting since I was 5 years old. This past year I have been very interested in Production/Behind The Scenes of Films and Television Shows. Branching out and exploring more than Acting.The idea of The Department is a mix of all my favorite shows mixed into one. Ex. Rookie Blue, Gossip Girl, Chicago P.D, ETC. What We Need:To make this production happen we would need $1,500 to help assemble food and transportation for Cast and Crew!The money we raise will be used to pay for Meals during our shoot days, 3 meals, snacks and drinks for everyone on set, As well as paying and providing transportation for Actors and Crew to get from set to set.Even if we do not reach our full goal, the funds that are donated to us will still go towards the project and will still be used to get what is needed. Other Ways You Can Help:If you can't donate that's totally fine! We ask if you can kindly share our link and page around and help build Social Media Exposure. Media pages!If you would like to keep up with us, they are:Twitter: The_DprtmentInstagram: The_department_officialSnapchat: the.department

story:
A Monster Series... Without the Monsters...

As fans of the classic monster movie genre, we wanted to make a series about what it would be like hunting those monsters today, with all the misinformation circulating the internet. But we've all seen a toughened hero fighting a stuntman in a rubber costume (or more recently, a stuntman in a green zentai suit). What we wanted to deliver was the hero fighting themself, and ask the question, "when does the hero become the real monster?".

So we're doing this by having Mike vlog about his experiences instead. You get to see the hero's personal perspective, while he processes his new lifestyle choice. You can see a teaser of what that will look like here:

 

Silver Bullets are Expensive!

We have a lot of fantastic ideas for the first season, and we just need some helping bringing those ideas to life. 

That's why we're raising a some money to pay for graphics, sound composition, makeup and  props.

Makeup: Mike is going to get pretty beat up on his hunts. So the fx costs for his bruises, gashes and wounds are going to add up. 

Props: We're keen on creating a set that grows with the character. Each hunt will bring new trophies or gadgets, which will be added to the backdrop throughout the season. Also, who doesn't want a crossbow?

Sound: What's a horror movie without a great soundtrack? We want to hire artists to make original music for the show, giving it that extra kick of energy that Mike needs to fight an ancient evil.

Graphics: A few artists have donated their time to the project already, but time is valuable. We wish to compensate everyone who has helped out for their time. As well as pay for future art that we need created for the show. It's important to us to pay artists for their work whenever possible, and we are grateful to those who choose to donate their time to our project. 

If you contribute we have various perks to offer, but most importantly, anyone who contributes $10 or more gains access to bonus content we will make throughout the series. Such As:

  • Mike reviewing old monster movies
  • More detailed descriptions of Mike's hunts, play by plays of his fights, etc. (Also if we reach our stretch goal we will create a MHM Comic to go with each episode) 
  • Live Q/A's with Mike and Zac

For only $50 you can get either the MHM Poster

 

or a deck of Psychobilly Tarot Cards!

Help us hunt!

Our initial goal is what we need to enhance a great series. However, if we can raise more, it means we can deliver a higher calibur show. We appreciate anything you can give, and please share the project with your friends!

We want to bring together a community of Monster Movie Enthusiasts, and when Mike has enough viewers, we'll reach out to you to help Mike figure out how to hunt these beasts of darkness.  

Other Ways You Can Help

Whether you can afford to contribute or not, if you could share this campaign with your friends, it would be immensely helpful! If you tell two friends and they tell two friends, soon we will conquer the known world!

We are immensely appreciative that you've taken the time to take a gander at our project.
Thank you.

https://www.facebook.com/monsterhuntermike/

http://www.indiegogo.com/campaigns/monster-hunter-mike-chosen-one-without-a-choice-horror

story:
Our Story

We love making this series. It's a lot of work, but we consider it an honor to get to keep making more episodes.

We've already got six screenplays ready to go for next season, but we need your help. Though we try to keep costs down, making a web series isn't free. That's where you come in! If everyone pitches in a little bit, we get to keep making more episodes.

Perks

We've got some great perks this season. Whether you're an introvert or not, there's sure to be something for you. We're especially excited about the Introverts Valentines. Order by February 9th to ensure they arrive on Valentine's Day. All other items will be shipped shortly after the campaign ends.

Introverts Valentines: One of Many Perks

Risks & Challenges

We've heard a lot of people complain that they've contributed to a campaign but never received their perks. Frankly we're shocked to hear of such a thing! We've done this before, and we have a proven track record of seeing our projects through to completion. If we raise less than our $6,000 goal, then we might consider a reduced season. If for some reason we aren't able to deliver your perks, you'll receive a full refund and our sincerest apologies.

Introverts Coffee Mug, Also Available with Introverts Logo

Other Ways You Can Help

Even the smallest amount helps and is greatly appreciated. However, we understand if you're not able to give at this time. If you'd still like to help, feel free to share our campaign with people you know, through social media, email, or even word of mouth. We love our fans, and we're glad to have your support!

International Viewers

It's tricky to ship overseas, but we don't want our international viewers to feel left out. Contact us if you'd like to splurge on international shipping, and we're happy to work something out.

story:
R.O.M.E Production Group provides a full in-house film service which includes script development, casting, marketing, and production of films. Much like the fictional company from our inaugural series, SHOWCASE, we are also a start up and we need your help to get this comedy off the ground so we can get you laughing flat on your backs.

R.O.M.E believes in 100% transparency with invested funds. Your tangible support will go to the following expenses:

  • Actor's & Crew stipends
  • Costume & Wardrobe
  • Craft Services
  • Locations Securement
  • Post-Production (i.e. editing, sound, and color correction)

The world needs laughter and you can help us create it. Please Donate.

Peace, Love & Comedy

story:
Episode 1 - "The Prologue"

We can show you better than we can tell you. Check out the 1st episode of "Generation Z" below!

 

 

 

Why It's Important to Support

We're a group of young artists going out and creating opportunities instead of waiting for them to fall into our laps! If for nothing else I hope you'll support our creativity and initiative; and help us continue to grow as artists. Not to mention it will be an awesome series!

We've got a super talented and diverse cast & crew; who are all ready to give 101% to make the best quality series possible. We've got the cast, we've got the crew, we've got the scripts, now we just need the funding. Anything that you can offer is much appreciated, even if it's $1!

I believe in this project, and our team, so much that I decided to back us with my own money to get started and to show that we're ready to take on a project of this magnitude. I'm very proud of what we've been able to do so far and I hope you'll help us get to the next level. 

- Zachary Michaels

 

Meet the Team 

 

Meet the Cast

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to raise 10,000 so we can produce the rest of the episodes in Season 1 of "Generation Z"! You can watch the video below to find out exactly how we'll be using that money and find out all the cool perks you can get if you donate!

 

How else can you help?

Every single contribution is much appreciated! 

If you can't donate or would just like to help us out as much as possible, here are some other ways you can contribute to our campaign.

  • Like, follow, and share our social media pages. 

                    

  •  Let your friends & family know all about "Generation Z" and our IndieGogo campaign.
  • Leave a positive comment on our IndieGogo to help boost our campaign in searches.
  • AND last but certainly not least, watch & share our first episode of "Generation Z"!

THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH!!!!!!!!!!!!!

story:
The Show & Why We're Making It

Library Freaks is web series that follows Bea Nixon & Thaddeus Peterson, two high school students trying to cope with mental illness on top of everything else life throws at them. It's smart, quirky, sensitive, and even a bit romantic. 

This show is near and dear to our hearts as we have both been teenagers, and have both had personal experience with mental illness. 

The Creative Team

We are Tyler Meacham and Grace Day, two crazy gals with the wild notion of puttin' on a show!

Tyler is a graduate of Elon University, where she studied Cinema and Television Arts and was an all-around boss, from singing with an a cappella group AND an indie-folk duo to producing original content on YouTube (which she's been doing since 2007, nbd). After graduation, she interned with Walt Disney Imagineering. She can pretty much do it all: video production, editing, photography, graphic design, content development, singing, acting, dancing, unicorn-wrangling, you name it.

Grace is Tyler's number one fan, and the author of the above paragraph, basking in her glory since the early days of their friendship in 9th grade Honors English. Grace has a degree in acting from the American Academy of Dramatic Arts and a B.S. in psychology from Virginia Commonwealth University, because she just couldn't get enough of school! She has performed professionally on various stages across Virginia and New York City, and her face was recently on advertisements in subway cars, so she's just checking off one bucket list item at a time. 

What We Need 

We need emotional and financial support to make this happen! Specifically, we are raising funds for camera and equipment rentals, location fees, props, costumes, set dressing, and hopefully, the ability to pay our cast and crew with more than just free food.

We want Library Freaks to look beautiful, and generally speaking, the more we can invest in our equipment and production design, the better looking the final product will be. So, here’s a more detailed breakdown of how we plan to use our campaign funds:

  • Equipment
    • We could easily spend between $1000 and $2000 on renting a camera, lenses, stabilizer, and other support rigs alone.
    • Because most of our shooting locations are interiors, we’ll need to rent a full lighting package to make sure our scenes can be seen! This is another large & important expense.
    • We can’t tell a story if you can’t hear the actors, so we also would like to invest in high quality audio gear to use on set.
  • Production Design
    • Although we will primarily gather props, costumes, and set pieces by borrowing (and not spending money), there are some special pieces we simply can’t get without buying or making them. 
      • PS: One of these very special pieces also happens to be a perk for our backers!
  • Locations
    • A portion of our budget will go towards location fees and acquiring any necessary permits for filming on location.
  • Post-Production Needs
    • Although most of our budget will support the production of our show, it’s not complete until it’s been edited. Some of our post production needs include digital storage (SD cards & external drives), music acquisition, and rights clearance for any assets (images, sounds, etc.) that might appear in our production.
  • Everything else!
    • We need to be able to support our cast and crew on shoot days with ample craft services (that’s the free food part), but we really want to be able to provide our team with a stipend for their hard work. It’s a big goal, but your contribution will help us reach it.

Why This Matters

Mental health awareness is an important cause to us, and the stats on how mental illness impacts children, teens, and young adults are staggering. Take a look at this infographic from the National Alliance on Mental Illness:

Mental illness has made an impact on our personal lives, as well. We know how difficult it can be to deal with and how hard it can be to understand. That's why we want Library Freaks educate our audience on self-care, de-stigmatize the conversation surrounding mental health in young adults, and tell a story about realistic characters who are more than their illnesses.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, we totally understand. (Trust us--we're only recently out of college, so we get that budgets are tight!) The best thing you can do to support Library Freaks is to share our campaign with your friends on social media and get the word out! Also, follow all of our social accounts for the latest updates on our production.

Click here to SHARE Library Freaks on Facebook: http://bit.ly/2vu6b4I

Follow us on Twitter: http://twitter.com/libfreaks

Like us on Facebook: http://facebook.com/libraryfreaks

Follow us on Instagram: @libraryfreaks

story:
So What Is "For Nothing" All About

For Nothing is the first novel in An Upstate New York Mafia Tale, an Amazon bestselling series. Having sold more than 250,000 copies to date, this project is a mafia-genre story that primarily takes place in Buffalo, NY and spans Western New York all the way to Upstate New York. By supporting this project you will allow us to film the story in Buffalo, NY and showcase the city, putting a spotlight on a place that is often overlooked or forgotten. You will also allow us to take the pilot to investors to get the tremendous amount of funding for a full season of mafia-style intrigue and hard-boiled detective intensity we believe you want to see.

Who Are We? 

Aeri Productions has teamed up with author Nicholas Denmon in an attempt to turn the cult series, An Upstate New York Mafia Tale (of which For Nothing is book one) into a television series. The series has sold more than 250,000 copies to date and has been an Amazon bestseller several times over.

Aeri Productions is helmed by visionary Steven Quach who has filmed for large brands such as H&M, Culvers, World of Beer, Marriott among others. He has also directed numerous short films such as  Beyond the Dark, Ashes in Trinity, and the For Nothing Concept Short.

Nicholas Denmon is an international bestselling author. Dubbed the "Savior of Mob Fiction," by Men's Mag Daily, his series An Upstate New York Mafia Tale has topped the Organized Crime genre more than nine times. He is also from the great city of Buffalo, NY and wants to highlight his home as well as stay true to the setting of his novels. Buffalo, he feels, is often a forgotten city but is a great city rich with history and culture that would be perfect for the screen. He wants to share this with the world - all while telling a mafia story that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

The Story

An origin story, the pilot takes place three years before the initial story of For Nothing. For Nothing brings us on a journey as undercover cop Alex Vaughn goes deeper than ever into the organized crime family of Buffalo, NY. Motivated by justice and revenge, he seeks out the assassin that laid his friend low. Professional killer Rafael Rontego traverses the deadly politics of Buffalo’s mafia underbelly. In a city whose winter can be just as deadly as those wielding power, Rontego tries to stay ahead of the game.

 Their two worlds collide in this epic thriller that takes the reader on a search for self, justice, and truth. The pilot explores all the chess pieces: mafia wars, federal indictments, and the quest for justice which set up the events that unfold at the beginning of the written series.

See What We Did Already

We have already filmed a seven-minute concept short film. We did this in one day, for free. Give it a watch and imagine what we can do with time and money. Click the picture below and see what more than 100,000 folks have already seen in just over two weeks.

CLICK ME ---v

The Cast

Tom Sizemore as Salvatore Pieri, Boss of Bosses

Tom Sizemore

Sizemore is probably most widely recalled for his role as "Sergeant Horvath" in Saving Private Ryan. The role and film received wide acclaim and introduced Sizemore's talents to a much broader audience in a more human and well-rounded role than he had previously been given. 

Sizemore then portrayed a psychotic paramedic in Bringing Out the Dead directed by Martin Scorsese followed by performances in Play It to the Bone, Red Planet, and Pearl Harbor. Sizemore then received another leading role in the high-profile military drama Black Hawk Down directed by legendary director, Ridley Scott.

Specializing in the sort of ultimate tough-guy/manly man roles that hearken back to a different era in film, Sizemore continues to be a favorite of Hollywood's greatest directors. A commanding voice and presence on film, Sizemore will now lead a talented cast on the pilot episode of gangster drama For Nothing.

Daniel Baldwin as Old Joe Falzone, Underboss

Daniel Baldwin

Baldwin is an American actor, director and producer. He is the second eldest of the four Baldwin brothers, all of whom are actors. Baldwin played the role of Detective Beau Felton in the NBC TV series Homicide: Life on the Street, and has starred in Ned Blessing: The True Story of My Life (1992), Mulholland Falls (1996), Vampires (1998), The Pandora Project (1998), Stealing Candy (2002), Paparazzi (2004) and Grey Gardens (2009). He hosted "The Daniel Baldwin Show" on radio station WTLA in Syracuse from 2017 to 2019.[2][3] He has also been an emcee for the television series truTV Presents: World's Dumbest.

James Duval as Jack Benton, Undercover Detective Liason

James Duval

 Duval has starred in numerous independent films, including the 2009 psychological thriller The Black Waters of Echo's Pond and the mystery crime-thriller film Noirland directed by Ramzi Abed. He is also known for his roles in the Gregg Araki trilogy—Totally Fucked Up, The Doom Generation, and Nowhere—in addition to Frank in Donnie Darko, Blank in May, Miguel in Independence Day and Singh in Go.

Eve Mauro as Charlotte Vaughn

 

Eve Mauro

Most recently, Eve was cast in Crackle's upcoming drama series The Oath, executive produced by Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson's (Power) G-Unit Film & Television. She will be acting alongside fellow actors Sean Bean, Katrina Law, Ryan Kwanten, Cory Hardrict, Arlen Escarpeta and Micheal Malarkey. She has accumulated a vast array of credits including The Oath (2018), Age of the Living Dead (2018-2020), Land of the Lost (2009), The Steam Experiment (2009).

Doug Hutchison as Christain Biela 

Doug Hutchison

Doug grew up in Detroit and Minneapolis, eventually moved to N.Y.C., and attended the Juilliard School for a brief stint. Since that time he has appeared in over 82 TV shows and films. Most memorable roles in The Green Mile, Punisher: War Zone, 24, and iZombie.

Brian Krause as Phil Rawlings

Brian Krause

A native of Orange County, California, Brian Krause is best known for his portrayal of Whitelighter Leo Wyatt on Aaron Spelling's popular program Charmed [1998-2006/The WB] opposite Alyssa Milano, Rose McGowan, Holly Marie Combs and Shannen Doherty. He starred on the popular program for eight seasons and appeared in 154 episodes.

Known for Charmed (1998-2006), Return to the Blue Lagoon (1991), Sleepwalkers (1992), Camel Spiders (2011)

Sean Gloria as Muro Lucano, Hitman

Sean Gloria

Sean won his first award for a dramatic short film, "If You Want It", that was screened at the University of Tampa's Campus Movie Fest (2010). That same year, a short film Sean led, titled "Scoops", won "Best Picture" at the University of South Florida Campus Movie Fest (2010). He is also known for The Bag Man (2018), The Cuddlers, LLC (2019), Rogue Island (2016), Mr. McCuddles (2019)

Nicholas Denmon as Rafael Rontego, Hitman 

Nicholas Denmon

 Nicholas Denmon is a novelist, poet, and actor. He was most recently cast as Tony Diamond in the television series Rivals (2019), as well as in the sadistic role of Nazi guard Oskar in the WWII film Wolfhound starring James Maslow. He is known for Wolf Hound (2020), Jabberwanky (2020), Death Trap (2019), Rivals (2019), and Real Premonition (2007)

Chalet Brannan as Kira Nivsky

Chalet Brannan

She has been nominated for several awards for Best Supporting and Lead roles. She has presented an ICON Award at the Pre-Oscars to Kevin Sorbo who has been in her films. Her lead role in Crepitus has helped her to surpass Actress Linda Blair as a lead in an R Rated horror feature at 12 years of age. Chalet Brannan continues to impress all she meets and has been likened to Dakota Fanning and Jodie Foster in her abilities. She is known for Tinker' (2018), Vengeance (I) (2019), The Sparrows: Nesting (2015), Peter Pan, Land of Forever

Michael Humphreys as Alex Vaughn, Undercover Detective

Michael Humphreys

Michael trained at Central School of Speech and Drama, specializing in Collaborative and Devised Theatre. He toured for two years in London's National Theater production of  War Horse. To date, mostly a theatrical actor, his stage credits include The Good Earth (Flea Theatre, New York), Fear of Drowning (Chapter Arts), Little Shop of Horrors (Theatre Clwyd), War Horse (U.K., Ireland and South Africa Tour), One Million (Greenwich Festival), Llwyth (Sherman Theatre), The Beach (National Theatre of Wales. For Nothing will be his small screen debut.

Quid Pro Quo

This round of funding is to help us secure $35,000. Contributors would be allowing us to bring the film crew to Buffalo, NY for the duration of the pilot. The contributions would be used to pay, house, and feed the crew of fourteen for 8 days. We will also use funds to rent equipment and pay for other pre-production costs. This is phase 1 of the production. We will use any extra funds to push towards phase 2, filming.

If we miss the goal...

We will still put this money only towards paying our crew first.  Then decide where we can start to make cuts. We will just have to try and make do with less, which is not ideal! 

But regardless of if we meet our goal or not - you still get stuff for helping us.  We truly believe that our supporters deserve something for all that they do to help us get this project off the ground. The more you help, the more you get!

  • Get copies of the series
  • Get signed copies of the series
  • Swag! Tshirts, pins, and sunglasses, oh my!
  • Earn a special "thank you" in the credits
  • Earn a Producer credit
  • Earn an Executive Producer credit
  • Secure a spot on screen as an extra
  • Or earn a day or week on set with the team

Why $35,000?

In the creative world, people are often asked to work for free on projects like these. But we refuse to operate that way. Hard work (film sets are often 14 hour days) deserves to be compensated. For our younger team members especially, a nominal paycheck makes a big difference in their lives and helps to allow them to continue to create inspiring work. 

This young team of filmmakers made Beyond the Dark for free on the weekend. 

Imagine what they can do with a little more time and a little more money.

If We Don't Raise Money

We will have to dramatically cut our staff. Doing this is not ideal because the staff members we have chosen are all needed for a variety of expertise such as lighting, set design, props, costumes, audio, music, camera work, editing, directing, etc.

To cut down on the basics means others will have to double up in areas where they may not be experts and the overall quality of the production starts to suffer.

We only know one way to operate and that is to do our best to put the most polished product forward. With your help, we can overcome this challenge!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can share this page with your friends, send them the link, post on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, etc!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.
story_txt:
So What Is "For Nothing" All About
For Nothing is the first novel in An Upstate New York Mafia Tale, an Amazon bestselling series. Having sold more than 250,000 copies to date, this project is a mafia-genre story that primarily takes place in Buffalo, NY and spans Western New York all the way to Upstate New York. By supporting this project you will allow us to film the story in Buffalo, NY and showcase the city, putting a spotlight on a place that is often overlooked or forgotten. You will also allow us to take the pilot to investors to get the tremendous amount of funding for a full season of mafia-style intrigue and hard-boiled detective intensity we believe you want to see.

Who Are We? 
Aeri Productions has teamed up with author Nicholas Denmon in an attempt to turn the cult series, An Upstate New York Mafia Tale (of which For Nothing is book one) into a television series. The series has sold more than 250,000 copies to date and has been an Amazon bestseller several times over.
Aeri Productions is helmed by visionary Steven Quach who has filmed for large brands such as H&M, Culvers, World of Beer, Marriott among others. He has also directed numerous short films such as  Beyond the Dark, Ashes in Trinity, and the For Nothing Concept Short.

Nicholas Denmon is an international bestselling author. Dubbed the "Savior of Mob Fiction," by Men's Mag Daily, his series An Upstate New York Mafia Tale has topped the Organized Crime genre more than nine times. He is also from the great city of Buffalo, NY and wants to highlight his home as well as stay true to the setting of his novels. Buffalo, he feels, is often a forgotten city but is a great city rich with history and culture that would be perfect for the screen. He wants to share this with the world - all while telling a mafia story that will keep you on the edge of your seat.

The Story
An origin story, the pilot takes place three years before the initial story of For Nothing. For Nothing brings us on a journey as undercover cop Alex Vaughn goes deeper than ever into the organized crime family of Buffalo, NY. Motivated by justice and revenge, he seeks out the assassin that laid his friend low. Professional killer Rafael Rontego traverses the deadly politics of Buffalo’s mafia underbelly. In a city whose winter can be just as deadly as those wielding power, Rontego tries to stay ahead of the game.

 Their two worlds collide in this epic thriller that takes the reader on a search for self, justice, and truth. The pilot explores all the chess pieces: mafia wars, federal indictments, and the quest for justice which set up the events that unfold at the beginning of the written series.
See What We Did Already
We have already filmed a seven-minute concept short film. We did this in one day, for free. Give it a watch and imagine what we can do with time and money. Click the picture below and see what more than 100,000 folks have already seen in just over two weeks.
CLICK ME ---v

The Cast
Tom Sizemore as Salvatore Pieri, Boss of Bosses

Tom Sizemore
Sizemore is probably most widely recalled for his role as "Sergeant Horvath" in Saving Private Ryan. The role and film received wide acclaim and introduced Sizemore's talents to a much broader audience in a more human and well-rounded role than he had previously been given. 
Sizemore then portrayed a psychotic paramedic in Bringing Out the Dead directed by Martin Scorsese followed by performances in Play It to the Bone, Red Planet, and Pearl Harbor. Sizemore then received another leading role in the high-profile military drama Black Hawk Down directed by legendary director, Ridley Scott.Specializing in the sort of ultimate tough-guy/manly man roles that hearken back to a different era in film, Sizemore continues to be a favorite of Hollywood's greatest directors. A commanding voice and presence on film, Sizemore will now lead a talented cast on the pilot episode of gangster drama For Nothing.
Daniel Baldwin as Old Joe Falzone, Underboss

Daniel Baldwin
Baldwin is an American actor, director and producer. He is the second eldest of the four Baldwin brothers, all of whom are actors. Baldwin played the role of Detective Beau Felton in the NBC TV series Homicide: Life on the Street, and has starred in Ned Blessing: The True Story of My Life (1992), Mulholland Falls (1996), Vampires (1998), The Pandora Project (1998), Stealing Candy (2002), Paparazzi (2004) and Grey Gardens (2009). He hosted "The Daniel Baldwin Show" on radio station WTLA in Syracuse from 2017 to 2019.[2][3] He has also been an emcee for the television series truTV Presents: World's Dumbest.
James Duval as Jack Benton, Undercover Detective Liason

James Duval
 Duval has starred in numerous independent films, including the 2009 psychological thriller The Black Waters of Echo's Pond and the mystery crime-thriller film Noirland directed by Ramzi Abed. He is also known for his roles in the Gregg Araki trilogy—Totally Fucked Up, The Doom Generation, and Nowhere—in addition to Frank in Donnie Darko, Blank in May, Miguel in Independence Day and Singh in Go.
Eve Mauro as Charlotte Vaughn
 
Eve Mauro
Most recently, Eve was cast in Crackle's upcoming drama series The Oath, executive produced by Curtis "50 Cent" Jackson's (Power) G-Unit Film & Television. She will be acting alongside fellow actors Sean Bean, Katrina Law, Ryan Kwanten, Cory Hardrict, Arlen Escarpeta and Micheal Malarkey. She has accumulated a vast array of credits including The Oath (2018), Age of the Living Dead (2018-2020), Land of the Lost (2009), The Steam Experiment (2009).
Doug Hutchison as Christain Biela 

Doug Hutchison
Doug grew up in Detroit and Minneapolis, eventually moved to N.Y.C., and attended the Juilliard School for a brief stint. Since that time he has appeared in over 82 TV shows and films. Most memorable roles in The Green Mile, Punisher: War Zone, 24, and iZombie.

A native of Orange County, California, Brian Krause is best known for his portrayal of Whitelighter Leo Wyatt on Aaron Spelling's popular program Charmed [1998-2006/The WB] opposite Alyssa Milano, Rose McGowan, Holly Marie Combs and Shannen Doherty. He starred on the popular program for eight seasons and appeared in 154 episodes.
Known for Charmed (1998-2006), Return to the Blue Lagoon (1991), Sleepwalkers (1992), Camel Spiders (2011)

Sean Gloria
Sean won his first award for a dramatic short film, "If You Want It", that was screened at the University of Tampa's Campus Movie Fest (2010). That same year, a short film Sean led, titled "Scoops", won "Best Picture" at the University of South Florida Campus Movie Fest (2010). He is also known for The Bag Man (2018), The Cuddlers, LLC (2019), Rogue Island (2016), Mr. McCuddles (2019)

Nicholas Denmon
 Nicholas Denmon is a novelist, poet, and actor. story:
THE DERDS SITE http://forthegreatergoodfilms.com/derds/

YOUTUBE CHANNEL https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC35t1IlwVEgll2...

FACEBOOK https://www.facebook.com/thederdsseries/

 

My name is David Acampora. I have been working as a Motion Graphic Artist for 20 years doing projects for commercials, feature films and television shows. I have always been a fan of animation and its many forms. As a kid I enjoyed watching all the classic cartoons: Road Runner, Popeye, Super Friends, Bugs Bunny, Scooby Doo, Dastardly Dog, and the Flintstones to name a few. Creating an animated series has always been a dream of mine. I am a big fan of the Adult Swim line up and the shows that studios like Titmouse and Williams Street are producing.

The idea began when I was standing on the subway platform in NYC one day and overheard a conversation between a few guys, dudes, nerds…Derds. They spoke about a new band they really liked and then video games and eventually a little political conspiracy theory. As I listened in I felt I really related to these guys, myself being a bit of a cool nerd. The rest of the afternoon I was going over the conversation and later I jotted down some notes. The rest is history and I present to you The Derds.

Your contribution will enable us to pay additional Voice Over talent, Animators and Illustrators so we can really take this show to the next level. Phase one is getting the pilot made and ready to pitch. Phase two is working on the next few episodes.

Get on board and join the Derds adventure. Be a Producer or even an Executive Producer. Oh and maybe even get your likeness as a Derds character. We have some great perks!

I realize it is a difficult task to get a show made these days, especially with so many great animated shows being put out there. I believe the Derds has the right formula to be a success in today's animated world. The competition is tough but at the same time there are so many outlets for good content and more becoming available everyday.

The Derds characters and stories need to be shared with the world. We thank you for your support. Please spread the word and share the links. If you are illustration, writing or animation savvy and want to do some work on The Derds that would be great too.

Thank You,

David and The Derds

story:
Short Summary

 

  • We here at Cellar 13 Films have a combined 60 years in the media and film industry. We are passionate about making compelling movies and TV shows that will keep you talking about them over and over again. Our last film has been accepted and played in 5 different film festivals all over the world. We are also currently a semi finalist for a Los Angeles Film Festival. We have an award winning director on the show, and editor that has worked with Francis Ford Coppola, and an Elly Award winning DP. 

     

  • This campaign is important to us, because we are tired of "reality" shows out there, that aren't true reality. They are nothing but scripted shows full of fake drama, just to boost ratings. We want to do a true reality show, that not only will give you tantalizing drama, but will also dive into the real live of these bounty hunters. We will show and tell you who Tony The Tiger was as a boxer, and who he is as a bounty hunter, philanthropist, and loving family man. We will show you the life and times from all 4 bounty hunters, and explore what they do on their down time. Of course there will be plenty of action from the chases that are bound to ensue. We will explain the bail bonds process from the first phone call from jail, to the first office visit, to the first pound on the door to catch a runner. We will also show you what Tony does out in the community as he helps train up and coming boxers, and how he teaches at risk youth within a classroom setting. 
  • As a contributor, you will help bring TRUE REALITY to reality TV. You will also be helping to keep at risk youth off of the streets, because part of the proceeds from this show will go towards Tony's charities for youth. You will help bring a show to the airways that people can actually connect to.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • We will be using the funds to make sure that we have everything put into place for the show. It also pays for the crew who follows Tony and his boys around, and also all of the post production. 
  • Some of the perks include, signed memorabilia from Tony, and also from the show. Some people may get the chance to be on set to see how the whole show process goes. Also, dinner with Tony, the crew of the show, and the film crew. A few lucky people will also get a private screening of the pilot once it is finished.

The Impact

  • Our show is valuable, because we show the true nature and compassion of these guys, as well as the flip side when they need to get their job done. There will be no "acting" in the show, this will be 100% true to life.
  • Every project that we have funded off of Indiegogo has gone on to see success within the film festival world.
  • There are no hidden agendas here, we are just wanting to create great content for TV and VOD. We want people to engage in the show, and to understand that Bounty Hunters aren't all juiced up freaks with narcissism tendencies. 

Risks & Challenges

 

  • We have been in the movie business for a while now, and we know and understand all of the pitfalls and obstacles that can come our way. We have a contingency plan for ANYTHING that may try and hinder production. We have a very professional crew that knows how to handle adversity, and we never fall behind, nor do we ever quit. Even when our sound guy once lost a complete day of sound, we took care of it and still made our tight deadline. 

    So, in short, there isn't anything that we can't handle, because we have already lived it and know how to handle it.

     

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

We also ask for your help in sharing our campaign and letting others know about it so that we may get all the help possible. We certainly appreciate your contributions, and for taking time out to view our campaign.

story:
We created this Indiegogo campaign to raise the money needed to film the entire first Season of Killer Crew.  We are a passionate and committed group of filmmakers looking to bring the characters in this story come to life.

Help us and join us throughout our journey!

 

STORY

For most peers, college means papers, finals, and the occasional all-nighters, but for these four young adults it means shovels, body bags, and the not so occasional dead professor. In an attempt to change their final grade gone wrong; three sophomores Will, Chuck, and Mothy accidentally kill their cruel Biology professor. Enlisting the help of their nosey room advisor Liv, this jump starts a comical adventure as they go step by step in attempting to conceal their heinous crime and get off scot-free. Some people say college is tough, for these guys it’s literally murder.

 

SERIES LOGLINE

Four college students get their world turned upside down when a bad grade leads to the death of the their professor.

 

INSPIRATION

Dark comedy has always had a special place in the roots of the Killer Crew team, with majority of our projects having a macabre nuance to them. It was always fun to take conventionally dark things like death or crime and subvert the people’s expectations with a lighter tone. We pulled inspirations from various classic media that we grew up on to help shape what the show is now. These range from classics such as Beetle Juice and Heathers to more recent additions like Shawn of the Dead and Horrible Bosses. It was Mark Twain who said “Humour is tragedy plus time”. So in a time where the state of our world is arguably at it’s bleakest; it’s not hard to find humour in things, you just need to no where to look.

 

THE TEAM

Part Time Productions is a partnership of skilled postgraduate filmmakers originating from New Jersey. We are an independent production company focused on creating high quality digital content. We are dedicated to telling rich, unique and diverse stories.

 

Romario Achille -  Co-Creator/Writer: Romario Achille is an independent writer/director from Irvington, New Jersey. Romario has been interested in all forms of media since he was in high school and spent time writing numerous screenplays, one of which was accepted by the annual Teen Arts Festival. With a BFA in Television Production at Montclair State University, he has written, produced, and directed multiple short films such as Girl on Fire, 101 Ways to Kill Yourself, and What’s The Worst That Could Happen. As of now he is currently an Assistant Editor at NBC Universal and is head writer of Killer Crew, a passion project 5 years in making.

 

Matthew Borrello - Co-Creator/Director: Matt is a film buff, turned film student, turned filmmaker.  Like all the greats, he started watching movies as a little kid and developing a love for the cinema.  However, it wasn’t until college when he decided to focus his career on making the very art that he loved.  Matt graduated Seton Hall University with a degree in Visual Media. He is an award winning film director, and he has worked on many popular television shows such Law and Order: SVU and Marvel’s The Punisher.  As a filmmaker, horror is his favorite genre and greatest inspiration. In fact, every story that he tells, involves death in one way or another. Obviously Killer Crew is no exception.  As the co-creator and director on the series, he's excited to bring this darkly humorous story to life.

 

Jose Cortez - Producer: Jose is a Producer/Editor/Videographer based in Clifton, New Jersey.  He graduated from Montclair State University where he received a BA in Television Production. Throughout college Jose maintained a busy schedule serving first as the Assistant Programming Director then Station Manager for MSU’s college radio station 90.3 WMSC-FM, interning at The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon & LXTV’s George to the Rescue and Open House, and working on several student films, including his last film Sticks & Bones where he served as a producer.  He is currently an Assistant Editor at NBCUniversal.  

 

THE CAST:

We are nearing the end of our casting. We feel confident we have found the best and talented ensemble cast. We will soon introduce you to our wonderful group of actors.

 

WHAT WE NEED

The biggest thing we need is financial support to make this happen!!!

Our goal is to raise $10,500 to film 7 episodes for Season 1 of Killer Crew.

Majority of the money we raise will go into our production costs. This includes camera and equipment rentals fees, location fees, food, props, costumes, food, set dressing, travel expenses, hotels, and yes more food.  We would really like the ability to pay our cast and crew with more than just “free” food.

 

WHAT YOU GET

With your help, we would like to do our part in giving back!

Depending on the contribution amount, we will provide all rewards that come with it. Your contribution will play a great impact in the success of our production.

If we don't reach our goal, all the funds will continue to go towards making Killer Crew possible.

 

RISK/CHALLENGES

Our biggest challenge we may face is travel.  We are attempting to shoot 7 episodes in a span of 24 days.  We have been fortunate that we have locked down some great locations to shoot in, but getting our cast and crew there may be a challenge.  Most of our locations are located throughout northern New Jersey.

However, no matter how well we plan things out, there will always be something that will undoubtedly go wrong. It’s the nature of filmmaking! For this reason, we are setting aside a portion of our funds to use for contingency.  This will help us deal with any problems that may or will arise. We are fully confident that no matter what problems we encounter, we will be ready to take it head on!

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you are unable to donate, that’s OK!

Here are some other ways you can help us make Killer Crew a success!

SHARE! Help us spread the word about our campaign by sharing this campaign with all your friends and family.  You can send them this campaign using the Indiegogo share option.

LIKE our Facebook page and FOLLOW our Instagram account!! We will constantly be posting updates and information on all our socials to keep you updated on our progress.  

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/killercrewWebseries/

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/killer__crew/

HASHTAG: Use #KillerCrew when posting on Facebook and Instagram.

 

We want to thank you for taking the time to look over our project!
story_txt:
We created this Indiegogo campaign to raise the money needed to film the entire first Season of Killer Crew.  We are a passionate and committed group of filmmakers looking to bring the characters in this story come to life.
Help us and join us throughout our journey! STORY
For most peers, college means papers, finals, and the occasional all-nighters, but for these four young adults it means shovels, body bags, and the not so occasional dead professor. In an attempt to change their final grade gone wrong; three sophomores Will, Chuck, and Mothy accidentally kill their cruel Biology professor. Enlisting the help of their nosey room advisor Liv, this jump starts a comical adventure as they go step by step in attempting to conceal their heinous crime and get off scot-free. Some people say college is tough, for these guys it’s literally murder. SERIES LOGLINE
Four college students get their world turned upside down when a bad grade leads to the death of the their professor. INSPIRATION
Dark comedy has always had a special place in the roots of the Killer Crew team, with majority of our projects having a macabre nuance to them. It was always fun to take conventionally dark things like death or crime and subvert the people’s expectations with a lighter tone. We pulled inspirations from various classic media that we grew up on to help shape what the show is now. These range from classics such as Beetle Juice and Heathers to more recent additions like Shawn of the Dead and Horrible Bosses. It was Mark Twain who said “Humour is tragedy plus time”. So in a time where the state of our world is arguably at it’s bleakest; it’s not hard to find humour in things, you just need to no where to look. THE TEAM
Part Time Productions is a partnership of skilled postgraduate filmmakers originating from New Jersey. We are an independent production company focused on creating high quality digital content. We are dedicated to telling rich, unique and diverse stories. Romario Achille -  Co-Creator/Writer: Romario Achille is an independent writer/director from Irvington, New Jersey. story:
Are you a new vegetarian, part time vegetarian, or dedicated vegan who wants to discover new recipes that taste great, are healthy, and no meat?

Help us to create a new type of vegetarian cooking TV show that is a mix of entertaining television shows with discoverable and interactive online content.

About the VegiPlus.TV Show

Our vegetarian cooking program is a mix of the most tasty and popular cooking videos that come from chefs, restaurants, and popular online cooking videos with interactive online information that helps you to discover restaurants, groups, events, and other stuff that makes vegetarian life better and more exciting.

We Need Your Help - and Rewards

While some of our production team are unpaid volunteers who are passionate about helping others to eat less meat, we do need some money for experienced professionals, for graphics services, and to pay for broadcasting and streaming costs.

Rewards are Good For You - please contribute and help us and choose a reward that helps you.

Why We Started the Project

The founders Timothy Bell and Lawrence Harte are part-time vegetarians (full time wannabes) who were constantly looking for better tasting vegetarian food and easier ways to get and prepare it. They did the normal stuff - got cookbooks, searched for videos, and talk to other vegetarians.

We realized that we could make an MTV like vegetarian cooking TV show with great videos which could be linked and combined with additional information to make finding and getting tasty vegetarian food easier.

If you want to relax and watch a 30 minute show on vegetarian BBQ, lean back and watch it on TV. Want to find quick preparation vegetarian breakfast recipes that are high protein and low calorie, enter a few options and recipes with preparation videos are available. Watch on TV, your smartphone, or on the VegiPlus.TV website.

Amazing New Vegetarian Taste Experiences

Eating vegetarian food can be an amazing taste experience if you have the right recipes. We find the best recipes, add options and preparation tips, and get or produce the cooking video.

Why This Program is Important

Helping people to enjoy being a vegetarian with less fuss and lower cost helps the reduction of meat consumption. Vegetarians typically live 4 years longer, feel better, and vegetarian recipes can provide amazing new taste experiences.

Where You can Watch VegiPlus.TV

Initially VegiPlus.TV will be available on Roku and on the VegiPlus.TV website. We will quickly expand to provide VegiPlus.TV on Amazon Video and other Internet TV platforms. In early 2018, we will start to provide VegiPlus TV on Local TV stations throughout the USA.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides contributing financially, sharing VegiPlus.TV with as many people as possible. By sharing this campaign on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, and other social media platforms you can let your friends and the world learn how to enjoy more tasty food, feel better, and live longer.
