story:
I am Thomas Allen Harris and I’ve been using film, photography, and performance to explore family and identity for the past 25 years! My goal with my new TV show project Family Pictures USA is to create a healing movement, using family photographs to better understand ourselves and others across differences of race, religion, class, gender, orientation, and ability.

Each episode will illuminate connections among and between family narratives to create an inclusive new American Family Album! The series will expose threads of history that enrich and enlarge our understanding of our nation and its diverse people while expanding our ideas of WHO WE ARE. It continues my work to bridge inter-generational and cross-cultural differences and bring communities closer together by transforming strangers into family.

 

Our pilot series kicks off in Detroit where we filmed over a hundred families this past summer and got an insider look on the Motor City through the lens of family photos! We are redefining the family photo album in the digital age and creating a new purpose for our old pictures!

Family Pictures USA emerged out of Digital Diaspora Family Reunion (DDFR), a transmedia engagement project which has built and refined a community photo sharing model that employs photography, film, live storytelling events and social media to illuminate the importance of a "people's history." This socially engaged art project has held live events in more than 50 cities across the United States and across the globe. To date, my team and I have interviewed over 3,000 people and gathered in excess of 30,000 images across the globe. DDFR was born in 2009 during the making of my award-winning documentary film Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People, which premiered at the 2014 Sundance Film Festival and was broadcasted nationally on Independent Lens.

 

How YOU Can Help!

We have an urgent need for $35,000 to get us in the edit room to complete the 1 hour pilot for national broadcast in 2018! We completed our full production over the summer in Detroit, transcribed hundreds of interviews, archived thousands of photographs and have completed editing the first half of the 1 hour pilot. Now we need your help to complete the second half of the episode. Your funds will help support:

- Post-Production Team

- Archival & Research

- Editing

- Music

We have received funding from various foundations but our biggest support is from the public, people who believe in what we are doing! In return for your contributions we put together a fun list of perks so that we can give back to YOU!

If you are a donor and are interested in making a tax-deductible contribution, please contact us directly: info(at)familypicturesusa(dot)com.

 

"Detroit is the Future... and it's OK!"

Our pilot series features the city of Detroit on the 50th anniversary of the rebellion that forever changed the Motor City. Working in partnership with Detroit Public TV along with cultural and educational institutions (including the Detroit Historical Society’s Detroit 67 Project and the Detroit Institute of Arts), we reached hundreds of thousands of Detroiters. We selected over 100 families to come in and share photo albums that spanned generations, and numerous global origins, to reveal the story of a frontier town that became one of the greatest cities in the nation and captured the imagination of the world and still has much to teach us about perseverance, hustle and triumph over challenges. 

Detroit stories were shared by a diverse cast of characters coming from all corners of the city - East Side, West Side, from downtown to 8 Mile. Some of our on-location character interviews included, among many others, industrial artist Tim Burke, Marsha Music - daughter of legendary pre-Motown record producer Joe Von-Battle, Paul Wasserman - owner of Henry the Hatter the oldest hat retailer in the US, and local historian, Baba Jamon Jordan.

 

Could Your Family Photos Help Tell Detroit's Stories? (Detroit Free Press)

We need your help to finish the full hour Detroit special and bring their stories to light!

Public TV Show Breaks Out Family Photos for

     ‘People’s History’ of Detroit (Current)

 

Meet the Team Behind Family Pictures USA!

 

Thomas Allen Harris - Host, Director, Executive Producer

Thomas Allen Harris is a filmmaker and artist whose work across  film, video, photography, and performance illuminates the human condition and the search for identity, family, and spirituality. Graduate of Harvard College and the Whitney Independent Study Program, member of the Academy of Motion Pictures Arts and Sciences, and published writer/curator, Harris lectures widely on the use of media as a tool for social change. He lectures and teaches on media arts, visual literacy, and personal archiving at such institutions as Yale, Dartmouth, University of California, and many others.

His deeply personal films - VINTAGE- Families of Value (1995), É Minha Cara/That’s My Face (2001), and The Twelve Disciples of Nelson Mandela (2005), have received critical acclaim at international film festivals such as Sundance, Berlin, Toronto, FESPACO, Outfest, Flaherty, and Cape Town. His most recent feature film, Through a Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People (2014), which looks at the ways photographic representations serve as tools of representation and self-representation through history, was nominated for both an Emmy and Peabody, and won over 7 international awards including the 2015 NAACP Image Award for Outstanding Documentary Film. His latest short film, About Face: The Evolution of a Black Producer (2017) had its premiere on World AIDS Day at the Whitney Museum of American Art and over 100 institutions worldwide as part of Visual AIDS’ 28th annual Day With(out) Art.

In 2009, Harris founded Digital Diaspora Family Reunion, LLC (DDFR) a social engaged transmedia project that has incorporated community organizing, performance, virtual gathering spaces, and storytelling into over 45 unique audio-visual events in over 30 cities. With this project, Harris has toured nationally and internationally, most recently as a Montgomery Fellow at Dartmouth College and at the Yale University Afro American Cultural Center, to invite individuals to explore and share the rich and revealing narratives found within their family photo albums. To date, DDFR has brought over 3000 people together in live events and gathered in excess of 30,000 images, sharing content through social media, television, articles, newspapers, and radio to receive over 70 million impressions worldwide. Harris is bringing DDFR to national TV with Family Pictures USA.

His work has been supported by the Ford Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Sundance Institute, Tribeca Film Institute, The Fledgling Fund, Rockefeller Foundation, Corporation for Public Broadcasting, Nathan Cummings Foundation, New York State Council on the Arts, Creative Time Inc., and the Banff Centre. Born in the Bronx and raised partly in Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania, Harris currently lives in Warwick, New York with his life and producing partner Don Perry.


Don Perry - Producer, Writer, Executive Producer

Don Perry is an accomplished producer & director of unique visual features that communicate organizational strategies in compelling ways to both internal and external constituencies, for a wide range of use, including recruiting, retention, marketing and fund-raising. He is an accomplished writer, having written or co-written scripts for award-winning feature documentaries and short subjects, including the 2015 NAACP Image Award Winning Outstanding Documentary Film, Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People.

Recognizing the power of “Story” in defining an organization, Mr. Perry utilizes multimedia and social engagement tools to foster organizational diversity and inclusiveness across genders, generations and cultures. Mr. Perry is CEO and a lead architect of a new digital media venture DIGITAL DIASPORA FAMILY REUNION LLC which uses the intersection of history and visual literacy to bring people together inter-generationally and cross-culturally around shared values and experiences. DDFR is a unique and powerful experiential platform for leadership and team building; organizational diversity and inclusion programs; diversity and culture education programs; as well as community engagement and brand development programs.

Mr. Perry is an experienced multidisciplinary strategist focused on out-of-the-box solutions for complex organizational problems. His interests, talents and skills are quite diverse, and encompass a wide range of competencies, reflecting a deep background in multimedia development, marketing, finance, strategy, restructuring and entrepreneurship.

In his spare time, he is a writer/publisher of fiction, fantasy, and paranormal stories featuring strong multicultural characters, in recognizable settings, dealing with matters of life, death, spirituality, faith, salvation and the redemptive power of love.

 

Joanne Butcher - Development Consultant

Joanne Butcher worked as a global marketing consultant for YouTube, eventually running their UK movie rental unit and collaborating with engineers and curatorial teams around the world.

Joanne has worked extensively with hundreds of filmmakers from the US, UK, Brazil, Cuba, the Caribbean and Latin America. She has been mentored by James Schamus (producer/screenwriter Ang Lee’s The Ice Storm, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon); Ted Hope (producer, In the Bedroom, 21 Grams); Laura Bickford, (producer, Traffic), and Lucy and Luis Carlos Barreto who have made over 200 films in Brazil and produced 2 filmmaker sons who have both been nominated for Oscars.

Joanne was the former Director of the Alliance Cinema on Lincoln Road, Miami Beach, IFP/Miami and a founder of IFP/National. She created and spearheaded the Florida Statewide Film Competition that provided $200,000 cash and services to a feature film. She has taught film financing and screenwriting.

 

Natalie Shmuel - Associate Producer

Natalie Shmuel is a NYC based filmmaker and photographer. She picked up the art and industry of documentary storytelling while working on projects with influential award-winning filmmakers including Stanley Nelson, Laurens Grant, and June Cross. Natalie has worked closely with Thomas Allen Harris on multiple projects, including his award-winning feature documentary Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People as well as his upcoming national TV show series Family Pictures USA. She currently produces and conducts research for social justice documentaries including Third World Newsreel’s latest documentary feature by Konrad Aderer, Resistance at Tule Lake.

Natalie has a keen eye for film aesthetics and loves to work with fictional narratives having studied film theory and cinema history for 15+ years. Natalie works closely with various indie directors and producers as a trusted advisor and consultant for all things logistical and creative from development through post. Her passion is working on set as a Stills Photographer.

Natalie also organizes multiple grassroots activism coalitions and direct actions for several policy reforms. She holds an M.A. in Cinema Studies from NYU Tisch, and received a B.A. cum laude in Film Studies and Psychology from Queens College.

 

Lindsey Seïde - Assistant Editor

Lindsey Seïde is a Haitian American filmmaker and photographer based in New York. With her huge love of the arts, she graduated cum laude with a B.A. degree in Film and Broadcasting at the College of Mt. St. Vincent. She began her career as an intern with Academy member and mentor, Thomas Allen Harris, working on the NAACP Image Award recipient, Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People (2014), which premiered on PBS.

She has worn many hats in the industry working with companies like Firelight Media and NBPC. She is currently the assistant editor at Chimpanzee Productions, Inc., creating digital content for the transmedia roadshow, Digital Diaspora Family Reunion and new public television series, Family Pictures USA. She edits video content for OutBytes Media Group, which produces multi-platform video highlighting diverse and unsung voices & causes within the LGBT community. She is the associate producer for two short films, Roommates (2015) and About Face: The Evolution of a Black Producer (2017). She curated the photography exhibit, Digital Diaspora Family Reunion: Turning Strangers into Family (2016) for the Whitney Humanities Center at Yale University.

When she’s not snapping shots on the streets in NYC, she’s the official house photographer for Film Society at Lincoln Center, where she has photographed many red carpet events, film premieres, and VIP talent.

 

Sarah Rodzevik - Intern

Sarah is a graduate student at Sacred Heart University pursuing a Masters Degree in Multi-Media Digital Productions. She earned a B.A. in Media Arts with a concentration in Television and Film Production this past May 2017. During her time as an undergrad at Sacred Heart University, Sarah dedicated her time to working with The Jerry Springer Show, playing NCAA D1 Rugby and participating as a member of Lambda Pi Eta, National Communication Association Honor Society. Through interning for new public television series, Family Pictures USA, she has developed a passion and appreciation for the field of post production.

 

Jinyoung Kim - Intern

Jinyoung works with a variety of social media platforms at Chimpanzee Productions. Jinyoung majored in Advertising and Public Relations at the University of Hongik in Korea with a big interest in art & culture. She is from South Korea and a participant of Korea WEST, a cultural exchange program that gives internship opportunities abroad. Jinyoung began her work at an IT start up company and has strong skills in social media marketing, such as Facebook advertising and Digital contents marketing.  She came to America to experience American culture and various arts. She is enjoying New York life and learning culture diversity. She is also experiencing diverse culture and history through Family Pictures USA!

His latest short film, About Face: The Evolution of a Black Producer (2017) had its premiere on World AIDS Day at the Whitney Museum of American Art and over 100 institutions worldwide as part of Visual AIDS’ 28th annual Day With(out) Art.In 2009, Harris founded Digital Diaspora Family Reunion, LLC (DDFR) a social engaged transmedia project that has incorporated community organizing, performance, virtual gathering spaces, and storytelling into over 45 unique audio-visual events in over 30 cities. With this project, Harris has toured nationally and internationally, most recently as a Montgomery Fellow at Dartmouth College and at the Yale University Afro American Cultural Center, to invite individuals to explore and share the rich and revealing narratives found within their family photo albums. To date, DDFR has brought over 3000 people together in live events and gathered in excess of 30,000 images, sharing content through social media, television, articles, newspapers, and radio to receive over 70 million impressions worldwide. Harris is bringing DDFR to national TV with Family Pictures USA.His work has been supported by the Ford Foundation, National Endowment for the Arts, Andy Warhol Foundation for the Visual Arts, Sundance Institute, Tribeca Film Institute, The Fledgling Fund, Rockefeller Foundation, Corporation for Public Broadcasting, Nathan Cummings Foundation, New York State Council on the Arts, Creative Time Inc., and the Banff Centre. Born in the Bronx and raised partly in Dar Es Salaam, Tanzania, Harris currently lives in Warwick, New York with his life and producing partner Don Perry.Don Perry - Producer, Writer, Executive ProducerDon Perry is an accomplished producer & director of unique visual features that communicate organizational strategies in compelling ways to both internal and external constituencies, for a wide range of use, including recruiting, retention, marketing and fund-raising. He is an accomplished writer, having written or co-written scripts for award-winning feature documentaries and short subjects, including the 2015 NAACP Image Award Winning Outstanding Documentary Film, Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People.Recognizing the power of “Story” in defining an organization, Mr. Perry utilizes multimedia and social engagement tools to foster organizational diversity and inclusiveness across genders, generations and cultures. Mr. Perry is CEO and a lead architect of a new digital media venture DIGITAL DIASPORA FAMILY REUNION LLC which uses the intersection of history and visual literacy to bring people together inter-generationally and cross-culturally around shared values and experiences. DDFR is a unique and powerful experiential platform for leadership and team building; organizational diversity and inclusion programs; diversity and culture education programs; as well as community engagement and brand development programs.Mr. Perry is an experienced multidisciplinary strategist focused on out-of-the-box solutions for complex organizational problems. His interests, talents and skills are quite diverse, and encompass a wide range of competencies, reflecting a deep background in multimedia development, marketing, finance, strategy, restructuring and entrepreneurship.In his spare time, he is a writer/publisher of fiction, fantasy, and paranormal stories featuring strong multicultural characters, in recognizable settings, dealing with matters of life, death, spirituality, faith, salvation and the redemptive power of love. Joanne Butcher - Development ConsultantJoanne Butcher worked as a global marketing consultant for YouTube, eventually running their UK movie rental unit and collaborating with engineers and curatorial teams around the world.Joanne has worked extensively with hundreds of filmmakers from the US, UK, Brazil, Cuba, the Caribbean and Latin America. She has been mentored by James Schamus (producer/screenwriter Ang Lee’s The Ice Storm, Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon); Ted Hope (producer, In the Bedroom, 21 Grams); Laura Bickford, (producer, Traffic), and Lucy and Luis Carlos Barreto who have made over 200 films in Brazil and produced 2 filmmaker sons who have both been nominated for Oscars.Joanne was the former Director of the Alliance Cinema on Lincoln Road, Miami Beach, IFP/Miami and a founder of IFP/National. She created and spearheaded the Florida Statewide Film Competition that provided $200,000 cash and services to a feature film. She has taught film financing and screenwriting. Natalie Shmuel - Associate ProducerNatalie Shmuel is a NYC based filmmaker and photographer. She picked up the art and industry of documentary storytelling while working on projects with influential award-winning filmmakers including Stanley Nelson, Laurens Grant, and June Cross. Natalie has worked closely with Thomas Allen Harris on multiple projects, including his award-winning feature documentary Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People as well as his upcoming national TV show series Family Pictures USA. She currently produces and conducts research for social justice documentaries including Third World Newsreel’s latest documentary feature by Konrad Aderer, Resistance at Tule Lake.Natalie has a keen eye for film aesthetics and loves to work with fictional narratives having studied film theory and cinema history for 15+ years. Natalie works closely with various indie directors and producers as a trusted advisor and consultant for all things logistical and creative from development through post. Her passion is working on set as a Stills Photographer.Natalie also organizes multiple grassroots activism coalitions and direct actions for several policy reforms. She holds an M.A. in Cinema Studies from NYU Tisch, and received a B.A. cum laude in Film Studies and Psychology from Queens College. Lindsey Seïde - Assistant EditorLindsey Seïde is a Haitian American filmmaker and photographer based in New York. With her huge love of the arts, she graduated cum laude with a B.A. degree in Film and Broadcasting at the College of Mt. St. Vincent. She began her career as an intern with Academy member and mentor, Thomas Allen Harris, working on the NAACP Image Award recipient, Through A Lens Darkly: Black Photographers and the Emergence of a People (2014), which premiered on PBS.She has worn many hats in the industry working with companies like Firelight Media and NBPC. She is currently the assistant editor at Chimpanzee Productions, Inc., creating digital content for the transmedia roadshow, Digital Diaspora Family Reunion and new public television series, Family Pictures USA. She edits video content for OutBytes Media Group, which produces multi-platform video highlighting diverse and unsung voices & causes within the LGBT community. She is the associate producer for two short films, Roommates (2015) and About Face: The Evolution of a Black Producer (2017). She curated the photography exhibit, Digital Diaspora Family Reunion: Turning Strangers into Family (2016) for the Whitney Humanities Center at Yale University.When she’s not snapping shots on the streets in NYC, she’s the official house photographer for Film Society at Lincoln Center, where she has photographed many red carpet events, film premieres, and VIP talent. Sarah Rodzevik - InternSarah is a graduate student at Sacred Heart University pursuing a Masters Degree in Multi-Media Digital Productions. She earned a B.A. in Media Arts with a concentration in Television and Film Production this past May 2017. During her time as an undergrad at Sacred Heart University, Sarah dedicated her time to working with The Jerry Springer Show, playing NCAA D1 Rugby and participating as a member of Lambda Pi Eta, National Communication Association Honor Society. Through interning for new public television series, Family Pictures USA, she has developed a passion and appreciation for the field of post production. Jinyoung Kim - InternJinyoung works with a variety of social media platforms at Chimpanzee Productions. Jinyoung majored in Advertising and Public Relations at the University of Hongik in Korea with a big interest in art & culture. She is from South Korea and a participant of Korea WEST, a cultural exchange program that gives internship opportunities abroad. Jinyoung began her work at an IT start up company and has strong skills in social media marketing, such as Facebook advertising and Digital contents marketing.  She came to America to experience American culture and various arts. She is enjoying New York life and learning culture diversity. She is also experiencing diverse culture and history through Family Pictures USA!

story:
Ah, the 90's...a time long before cyber bullying and social media apps, where the race of teenage girls had to find other means of torture and good old humiliation.


One way to climb the proverbial ladder of teenage hierarchy and secure yourself a spot at the top where you'd be free from shame and inevitable mortification was this:

Throw yourself a party that would out do all of the parties that came before it.

So when Rachel asks her girlfriends to help her throw the Sweet 16 of a life time, lets just say they are more than happy to oblige.


 With a sprinkle of cruelty, a dash of mischief and a video camera to capture it all, we begin to unravel the true meaning of the female friendship.

(You mean, aside from the fact that it is directed by a female with an entirely female cast?!)

Picture your favorite found footage horror film like The Blair Witch Project, Cloverfield, Paranormal Activity or Cannibal Holocaust (shout out to the 80's). 

Rachel's Birthday is a found footage dark comedy shot entirely on a VHS camcorder, bringing you into the homes, lives and sometimes minds of four manipulative teenage girls.

Rachel's Birthday takes place in an unmarked year in the 1990's. The characters live in a "90's world" breaking a traditional linear timeline, which allows for any and all 90's events in pop culture, fashion, music and movies.

Now, you might be sitting at your computer desk wondering why I referenced found footage horror flicks. Well, I'll let you in on a little secret:

Each camcorder is operated entirely by one of the character's in the series. We see ONLY what the camera sees and fortunately for us, a camera has no filter and we come to realize...

Evil reigns in the form of teenage girl.

 

The year is 1995. Instagram is still 15+ years away and social media apps have yet to create a vast window into each others lives. We must find other ways to entertain ourselves, suppress our hardened insecurities and build up our hungry egos because, well...we're still human, right? 

But how will we do so without poking, liking, DMing or commenting. How will we show someone we like or dislike, approve or disapprove of their every move?

We build followers.

And NO I'm not talking about the ones who like the #foodporn you post every morning before you dig into your Egg McMuffin.

I'm talking about the OG followers. 

The ones who "suppress our hardened insecurities and feed our hungry egos"

...in REAL life. 

And we call that

THE GROUP PHENOMENON

According to StopBullying.gov :

 Bullying is not usually a simple interaction between a student who bullies and a student who is bullied. Instead, it often involves groups of students who support each other in bullying other students.

Even today, 49% of children in grades 4-12 reported being bullied by other students at school at least once during the past month, whereas 30.8% reported bullying others during that time.

 

  • PAYING MY CAST & CREW. I cannot tell you how important it is to me, to give back to the people who have made this all possible.
  • Securing locations.
  • 90's props (anyone got a bop-it?!)
  • Wardrobe and Accessories (this sh!t ain't cheap).
  • Feeding my cast & crew - We gotta eat, yo!
  • Promotional & Marketing 

The creation of Rachel's Birthday, Season One will indefinitely help us get the word out and continue on in the hopes of a second season. 

We are shooting for the moon and we would not have such faith in ourselves if it wasn't for your love and support.

 

We are so thankful for you.

 

So with that being said, HAPPY HUNTING & we look forward to crawling into a 90's coma with you.

 

xoxo.

 

P.S. PLEASE don't forget to R.S.V.P. - Rachel's Mom needs a head count, okay?!

story:
1025 Productions is proud to present Lovers and Friends L.A, a show will feature the LGBTQ as a whole, with an array of different nationalities reflected in the melting pot that is the L.A culture.  Lovers and Friends L.A is a spinoff of the LGBTQ shows, The Lovers and Friends Show, a web drama primarily featuring lesbians of color first premiered on the web January 1st 2008. At a time when webseries and Youtube were just getting it's footing, it was the first of it's kind. The L Word paved the way and created a hunger for lesbians of color to see themselves represented somewhere in media, making The Lovers and Friends Show into an underground success.  

The Lovers and Friends Show acquired international distribution with Wolfe Video.  Wolfe Video is now in its 30th year being the oldest and largest exclusive distributor of gay and lesbian films and Wolfe has been a long-standing leader in the video industry and enjoys significant sales with Target, Blockbuster, Hollywood Video, Amazon.com, Netflix, Wal-Mart and Best Buy to name a few.  However the producers have found that there is still a void in representation of lesbians color and by popular demand we have take the show to the West Coast.  

“These days, more color is hitting the Web Screen and the most wonderful thing is that lesbians are feeling it. Case in point: the next big webisode series, The Lovers and Friends Show” – Curve Magazine 

Lovers and Friends L.A is salacious, steamy, and filled with out of control drama and fun!  The Show stars Nicole Pina, Micalea Ramey, Erica Nicole, Jamaica Summer Rose, Anastassia Taktejeva, Spring Terry, Diana Cabuto, Chavia Knight, Amanda Poynter, Adina Palmer, Laketa Awls, and Emma Maddock and is produced by 1025 Productions.   

 

 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are in need of 20,000 to go towards:
    • Equipment
    • Post Production video and audio
    • Cast and Crew payments
    • Location costs
    • Craft services
    • Misc. production costs
  • Perks
    • Cast merchandise
    • A visit to the set
    • Exclusive links to see the show before anyones else
    • Invitations for two to the premiere/wrap party
    • Producer Credit
  • If we don't reach our goal the funds you donate will still go toward the production

The Impact

What the fans on Youtube have to say...

"Worth the Wait! Profound, well put together, nicely edited, and Excellent actors SERIES!!!!!!! I am a woman who loves women and love series that depict lesbians in a intelligent, having ethics and morals, and a good narrative."﻿

"Thanks to Lovers And Friends LA TV for giving LGBTQ community a classy, elegant, and well written script web series with AWESOME actors!"

"Addicting ,,,,I Love the Whole Crew,,,,,Bring it!!!!﻿"

"I feel a strong unique tie to Dani and I am excited to see what becomes of her in the coming episodes.﻿"

"I absolutely LOVE this show! Great quality, beautiful woman WITH talent, music on point...I could go on & on!!! Please tell me there will be another season?!!!"

"Always satisfied with this series. I love it more than before so guys keep up the good work!?????❤ I'm in luv with all characters and I can't wait for another episode!﻿"

"Been a fan since the first Lovers and Friends. Keep it up. Thank you to the cast crew and director for all you do. Arlene Arthur I'm Maryland﻿"

"Good music and good scenes even the storyline is more than ok hope you will be able to continue the good job, I see your work"

Help be a part of the movement!!! Help us premiere another season!!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Follow us on Social Media and help spread the word!

https://www.facebook.com/LNFL.A/

https://www.instagram.com/loversandfriendsla/

https://twitter.com/lnflosangeles

story:
What is it?

Legacy is the story of genderqueer college student Carson, as they are invited to join an exclusive social club on campus, called a Legacy League. Oh- and also they find out they're going to be inheriting the powers of a god. 

Among other things this series includes:

  • A genderqueer main character!
  • Lesbians!
  • Gay dudes!
  • Mythology!
  • Nobody dies!

Our team is committed to diversity and honest, quality representation through good story-telling. What more could you want?

 

What We Need 

So right now we have what we need to create a basic quality show, but we want to go above and beyond the basics. In the interest of complete transparency, here's what your money will be going towards.

  • $500 - Equipment. Lights, a camera, an external hard-drive, and Adobe subscription.
  • $250 - Art/Music. We've reached out to three amazingly talented artists who are each designing a logo for one of the three Legacy Leagues, and one wonderful graphic designer who is designing the show and university logos. We are still searching for our perfect fit musician, but we'd like to be able to pay them too. 
  • $300 - Actors. We appreciate the hard work our actors are putting in to this project but we recognize that love of acting does not pay bills, money does.
  • $150 - Set Dressing. We want to turn a basic room into Carson's dream dorm.
  • $200 - Incidentals. We're no stranger to this business. We recognize that something is going to go wrong five minutes in to filming, and this is how we combat that.
  • $100 - Craft Services. Well fed and watered actors and crew are the keys to a successful production. 
  • $500 - Perk Fulfillment. If you pay for something you should get that something. 

We wanted to put the "FUN" in FUNdraiser, by choosing perks that were affordable for us to produce, yet enjoyable for you. If we do not meet our goal, paying our artists, actors and musicians is our number one priority, because we value their efforts. From there we move down the essentials list: better lighting, better camera, set design, etc. 

 

Why This Story?

Sorin (Queer|they/them) - Writer/Producer/Actor 

I started writing this story for one major reason. Representation. It seemed like, from where I was sitting, that there were only a handful of LGBT+ characters, and even fewer non-binary or gender non-conforming characters. And when they did show up, especially in YA literature, they only showed up in the context of discovering who they were or falling in love. Stories were never about a genderqueer character going off on an adventure through a magical forest to save the day, or piloting a ship through a dystopian wasteland. As an older sibling, I didn't like the idea that my siblings wouldn't have access to good quality representation if they ever went through the same processes I did, so I decided to change that. Once my mind was made up, I just had to add in my real-life love for mythology and a story was born!

Eli (Gay|he/him) - Director/Actor

This project is rad because it tells stories that we know in one way but tells it fresh and new. It puts LGBTQIA+ voices and perspectives front and center. It's the first time I've gotten to be a part of a big artistic project from the very beginning though all the stages in a long time, and that's just really cool.

Faith (Lesbian|she/her) - Production Manager

Many LBGT+ people, myself included, relied on the internet to help us through our self discovery. Most have that moment where they first recognize themselves in a character. That moment where a character says something that speaks to you on a deeper level than anything any character has ever said before. That moment where you start to realize why you feel so different. I love the idea on working on a show that could be that moment for some other young person. That is why I am so pumped to be working on this show!

 

What Else Can I Do?

GREAT QUESTION! 

  • Follow us on Twitter @legacyserieshq
  • Share this with your friends. Share this with your neighbors. Share this with your mail carrier. Spread the news faster than glitter and help us get the word out!
  • Join us! We're still actively searching for a composer for the theme, so if you are a musician or you know a musician, pass them in our direction!

And above all else, Thank you so much for your support!

story:
WHAT IS BROWN?

We live in a world where marginalized groups are finally getting their time in the sun. Society is changing, and with it our standards. Television is beginning to reflect real life.

BROWN is the latest installment of the coming-of-age ensemble comedy, the newest generation of Friends, if they were all sassy, emotionally damaged people of color who are more codependent on their iPhones than they are with each other.

The show follows Omar and Olive, two black siblings in constant competition with one another, and their friends:

  • Jack, a painfully shy Latinx nerd.
  • Beau, a Polynesian surfer/stoner and resident Adonis, and,
  • Daisy: no nonsense, ambiguously Asian, and killing everyone with kindness.

Together they tackle issues of race, identity and sexuality, all while trying to support each other and redefine what it means to really be a family.

WHY BROWN?

It seems like everywhere you look now, there’s a show about plucky minorities rearing its head. To some this is overkill. To us? It’s what we deserve. Reparations, if you will, for years of constant exposure to the nuclear family.

For many of the members of the crew, we yearned to see faces that looked like ours when we were growing up. The lack thereof can be supremely damaging to a young mind. BROWN has a way of celebrating the beauty and differences of disparate cultures without making it a huge deal. It’s just life. A little crazy, a little offbeat, and yeah: more than just black and white.

WHO'S ON DECK?

OLYVIA SCOTT is the creator of BROWN, as well as the director and writer of the pilot. She has been working on BROWN since her freshman year of college and is now entering her senior year (whew!).  Olyvia’s favorite character is Beau, but for inexplicable reasons is probably most like Olive.

DANIELLA FERNANDEZ is the director of photography. A talented, writer, photographer and painter (double whew), Daniella is a proud Gemini and identifies the most with Jack. Since graduating from SCAD in 2017 with a degree in Film & Television, Daniella has been instrumental in the development of BROWN and is eager to bring the characters to life onscreen!

DEONNA GIBBS, assistant director, Leo. DeOnna studies Dramatic Writing, Photography and Music Composition (triple whew) and is in her senior year as well. She identifies as the female version of Omar and, should the moment arise, is prepared to play him at the drop of a hat. She intends to pursue playwriting after all is said and done, but for now is content in the BROWN writer’s room.

CASSIDY HAYNES is producer and head gyal in charge. Her boundless energy and optimism is rivaled only by anime heroines, and we are forever grateful to be harnessing a human Energizer bunny on this project. Haynes is studying Dramatic Writing like DeOnna, is a proud Libra (as is Olyvia), and loves every character to death. (Olive is her favorite despite the fact that she refuses to choose.)

HOW YOU CAN HELP

BROWN is being funded independently. Like our charming band of characters, the creators of the show are broke twentysomethings that just need a little help from their friends.

The ultimate goal is $5,000. And that’s quite a bit on paper. But as this is a passion project years in the making, we want it done right. However, this is a flexible goal.

$1,000 will get our foot in the door.
This will get us enough to film a quick proof of concept, one that we can feel good about showing. With $1K, all backers will receive their perks and we’ll be able to give you all a taste of the characters and the show as a whole.

$2,5000 will get us halfway there!
$2.5K can help us shoot and edit approximately half of the pilot.

$5,000? Say no more.
With our full budget, the creators of BROWN can produce a fully fleshed out pilot, one that we can send to festivals and present to production companies. Production will start in the fall and the final cut will be released in 2019.

WHERE IS MY MONEY GOING?

The money we raise will go 100% towards the execution of BROWN. But since we’re perfectionists, here’s a breakdown of costs:

  • Locations: It all starts somewhere!
  • Production Design: Costumes, make-up, props, and set dress are important elements in their own right. We want to make sure our cast and the locations look their best.
  • Equipment: Cameras, lighting, and sound are going to be imperative to making this pilot the best it can be.
  • Food, food, food: We’ve all got mouths to feed. And for our full days on set, we want to make sure that our cast and crew are happy and healthy.
  • Post and Promo: Even after the cameras stop rolling, we’ve got footage to edit and a film to promote! This will help us polish the final cut and send it on its way when we’re finished. (This also includes the perks we’ll be sending out *gasp* TO YOU!)
  • Accidentals, artistic promotion and miscellaneous needs.
  • Those Indiegogo fees!

HOW ELSE CAN I HELP?

Help spread the word about BROWN!

Follow our journey on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.

Share the link to our crowdfunding page! Every penny counts.

story:
HOMECOMING takes a look at the lives of three Hispanic siblings who are in different spots with their relationship with their ethnicity who are brought back to their suburban town when their father passes away. When they are reunited, they are forced to confront their abandoned culture, broken dreams, and hidden secrets.

We wish to challenge representation of Hispanics in media with characters that bring humanity to the story lines surrounding Hispanics that are constantly seen in the media (immigration, discrimination, etc.) while exploring what it means to be raised in one culture but to live in another.

Written by Hispanics and featuring the work of Hispanic actors and artists, this series hopes to shed a true and accurate light on the Hispanic community that escapes most mainstream shows.

Homecoming is a dramedy web series that follows the lives of a trio of Hispanic siblings when they are called back to their hometown following the death of their father and what happens when they confront their culture, their relationship as siblings, and hidden secrets.

 

THE CAST

Lauryn Lugo, “Daniela Castillo” - Lauryn is an experienced performer that has been recognized at the national and international level. In 2009, Lauryn won Gold at the National Phi Ro Pi Forensics Tournament. Most recently, in 2015 Lauryn won an international poetry slam in Carlow, Ireland. While Lauryn has collaborated with the Nuño Twins on video versions of her slam poetry and in the short film Little Things, this will be her first major role in a web series.

Andrew Nuno, “Raphael Castillo” - Andrew is an Illinois-based creative with experience being both in front of and behind the camera. He has directed, produced and written several award-winning films through his production company Diginamic Productions in addition to work he has done on behalf of several mental health organizations. Andrew is dedicated to making content that entertains and sheds a light on marginalized communities. In addition to producing and starring in Homecoming, Andrew will also be filming a role in the upcoming mockumentary There May Be Ghosts later this summer.  

Adrian Nuno, “Gabriel Castillo” - Also an Illinois-based creative, Adrian is an award-winning filmmaker, public speaker and content creator. Through the production company Diginamic Productions that he co-founded with his twin brother Andrew, he has lended his creative abilities to more than one hundred and thirty projects. However, Adrian is thrilled to be making a return to acting with this project. In addition to Homecoming, Adrian just wrapped up editing on Little Things, a short film he co-directed and produced last summer that will have its Chicago premiere very soon followed by an online release sometime in the fall.

Michelle Jasso, "Magdalena" - Mexican-American actor Michelle Jasso is a versatile, active performer and director with credits encompassing opera, cabaret, theatre, television, commercial, and voiceover. Within her repertoire of over 25 leading and supporting roles, favorites include the title role in Puccini's Suor Angelica, “Sally Bowles” (Cabaret), “The Witch” (Into The Woods), “The Beggar Woman” (Sweeney Todd, Bay Area Theatre Critics Circle award), and “Ursula” (The Little Mermaid). Jasso most recently received great press for her portrayal of the fading prima ballerina Elizaveta Grushinskaya in Kokandy Productions’ Jeff-recommended, highly-acclaimed production of Grand Hotel. She has also worked locally with Teatro Vista, Lifeline Theatre, Oil Lamp Theatre, and Porchlight Music Theatre, and appeared on the Investigation Discovery show “I Almost Got Away With It.” Next up Michelle can be seen in her own Kurt Weill/Bertolt Brecht cabaret show at Davenport’s in Chicago on August 22nd (accompanied by the magnificent Aaron Benham), and will reprise the role of The Witch in Music Theater Works’ December 2018 production of Into The Woods. Michelle is a member of the American Guild of Musical Artists (AGMA) and of the Alliance of Latino Theatre Artists (ALTA), and is represented in Chicago by Big Mouth Talent. More at www.michellejasso.com @JassoJustle @cmjasso

Jon Monaga, “Ben” - Growing up in a cornfield in Michigan, John knew that he was a fish out of water. He moved to Chicago in 2004 and has done everything from baking, administrative work and even astrology! He says acting makes him feel like a fish in water. He’s taken classes at Vagabond School and Green Room and can be seen in independent films and short films being produced here in Chicago.

Mateusz Wielomek, “Luke” - Mateusz is very excited to once again be apart of a production that involves Adrian and Andrew Nuño and Lauryn Lugo. He's also quite inspired to work on a project whose subject material hasn't been given the honest exploration it deserves.

Armando Reyes, "Manuel" - Armando Reyes is a Chicago based film, theater and voice over actor. He has performed at several Chicago theaters including Interrobang Theatre Project, Silk Road Rising, Pride Film and Plays, The Agency Theater Collective, Urban Theatre Company, Teatro Vista, and many others. Film and television credits include Chicago Med, Nowhere Mind, The Origins of Wit and Humor and Icarus. Armando is represented by Gray Talent Group.

How will the money be spent?

 

With the creators taking $0 and the cast & crew taking minimal rates, the majority of the funds will be used towards production expenses.

  

This campaign will run for 4 weeks. Once funded, our schedule is:

Pre-Production: January to August 2018

Production: August to September 2018

Post-Production: September to December 2018

Release: January 2019!

Notable Crew

Daniel Gebert, Director - Born and raised in Crystal Lake, Daniel Gebert has been working most recently as a part of the crew at Spirit Juice Studios in the Chicagoland area. His background in visual arts began with a love for photography at a young age. His past film-making efforts have yielded first place victories in the Central Illinois 48 Hour Filmmakers Fest as well as in multiple student film festivals. Daniel is thrilled to be reuniting with Adrian, Andrew, and Lauryn again after serving as cinematographer on the short film Little Things last year. 

Thomas Seffernick, Unit Production Manager- Thomas Z. Seffernick is a born Michigander who moved to Chicago, IL to follow is passion and skills in film. He is experienced in Unit Production Manager, 1st Assistant Director, and Producing. He has been Unit Producer Manager for the successful short web series Easy Abby which was shown at the 54th Chicago International Television Festival in 2018. Thomas has concentrated in advocating work for the LGBT community and believe more content needs to be made for cultures who are underrepresented in television and film. He is excited to be the Unit Production Manager for the short film, “Homecoming”.

Our crew is what keeps this project going from start to finish. With a crew full of people from a variety of different backgrounds, we are all dedicated to making a show that challenges perspectives while providing quality entertainment.

 

There are many ways you can help us in our journey!

1. Donate to our campaign and get some awesome prizes!

2. Share the campaign with your family and friends to help us spread the word!

3. Connect with us, we want to hear from you about what YOU would want out of a project like this!

4. Like our Facebook page to continue following us on our journey! 

Thanks again for your support. It means the world to all of us.

-- The Homecoming Team

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Melinda Hill, a comedian you may have seen on the shows Lady Dynamite, Adventure Time & more. Now I’m making a comedy special & I'd love for you to be involved! According to 2017 statistics: "Overall, women accounted for only 16% of all directors, writers, executive producers, producers, editors, and cinematographers working in entertainment. Broken down per category, women comprised of only 8% percent of directors, 10% of writers, 15% of executive producers, 24% of producers, 14% of editors, and a mere 2% of cinematographers." I want to help change these statistics by writing, producing, and starring in my own stand-up special of material that will be cross-purposed into upcoming projects such as my new series. Invest in my campaign and I vow to make a great comedy special that will inspire, empower, and enlighten the human race through sharing my story. If you’d like to see my work please click this link to watch Romantic Encounters with Melinda Hill (this is the one minute sizzle reel where you can click "watch entire series" to see the whole thing): https://youtu.be/6G1gxbmk5HQ I crowdfunded the series in 2012, and co-produced, wrote and starred in it. It won many awards including “best comedic series” and it was acquired for both domestic and international distribution. Thank you for your support, it means everything to me.

What We Need & What You Get

  • I need $ for things like pre-pro, the shoot, locations, editing, food, guest stars and marketing.
  • I'm offering exciting perks from T-shirts & tickets to my show to learning how to do stand-up with me and an opportunity to produce this project along with me.
  • I guarantee I will make the best special possible to honor your investment.

The Impact

  • This project is really needed in the world because these are dark times. My intention is to provide joy, light and laughter.
  • You can trust me with your investment because the last time people invested in my crowdfunding project, I delivered. I made a nine-episode webseries which we screened, it won awards like "best comedy series" and "best actor," and was acquired for distribution both domestically and internationally. It has now enjoyed millions of views on multiple platforms and you can read all of its press here: http://www.melindahill.com/videos/
  • I will deliver on this, you can trust me.

Risks & Challenges

  • My proof of concept is the webseries I've already created, produced, written and starred on.
  • That series was based on my stand-up. My intention is to develop this special which will be cross-purposed as material for my new series.
  • My plan is to release at least 3 videos a week on my Instagram for the next 2 months and to make this special in 2018.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I would love if you could help get the word out and share this campaign with your email lists & social media, you can do it very easily by using the Indiegogo share tools! Thank you so much for believing and investing in me, I'm eternally grateful for your support.

story:
ABOUT SYCAMORE VALLEY--

Hello! Let me introduce myself. My name is Marisa Luz and I am the writer/director/producer of Sycamore Valley. If you haven't already seen Season 1 you can check it out at sycamorevalleyshow.com. 

What is Sycamore Valley? It's a mockumentary about two rival realtors in an idyllic Southern California suburb. Our first season follows first-time home-buyers, Kayla and Curtis, as they navigate the pitfalls of finding their first home. In our second season the stakes are higher, with fun new characters, and lots more Cece and Simon drama. Everyone is hungry to see more of their rivalry, so we're delivering! 

Before starting season 1, I had no clue what was involved in putting together a production--time or budget wise. Both were a lot more than I bargained for. All I had was blind ambition, and a concept that I was passionate about, to keep pushing me through when times got tough. And in the end, I came out with a product and story I'm really proud of, and something that viewers really enjoyed (and a Best Series and Best Actor festival win to boot!) The enthusiasm from our fans has given me the energy to have another crack at it, and see if I can't make something even bigger and funnier while I continue to grow as a writer and filmmaker. 

WHY WE'RE RAISING FUNDS--

We had such an amazing response from our families, friends, friends of friends...so we want to involve you! All donations to this campaign will go toward including our fans in some form or fashion.

It should go without saying that filmmaking is expensive, so to be able to bring on board the people and locations that will expand our Sycamore Valley universe, we need some help. 

Your donation will go toward:

  • Crew and Equipment - Let me tell you I (naively) tried to shoot this show on my iPhone, and 100% this needs to be left in the hands of the experts. Your eyes and ears will be grateful.
  • Location Rentals - This show is all about houses, and we need to transport our viewers into the Sycamore Valley world with locations that will help tell our story. 
  • Insurance - Zzzzz. Did I lose you? This is the boring side of filmmaking, but our fancy equipment and location rentals all require insurance in case any of the Cece/Simon cat-fights get out of hand. 

WHAT IF YOU EXCEED YOUR GOAL?

Our current goal is set to about 50% of the show's total budget. There's so much more that needs to be paid for. If we go over and above our goal your contribution will help secure the following:

  • Actors Salary - These lines don't learn themselves, people! Our actors take pride in transforming themselves into the characters you see on screen, and while it looks like a lot of fun, it's also incredibly hard-work. 
  • Production Assistant - We need all the hands we can get on set, and having one more person to help us out would make a huge difference in getting everything done our limited time frame. 
  • Food for Cast and Crew - No shrinking violets on this set! A happy cast and crew are a well fed cast and crew, and we need to keep everyone strong to get through our long days.
  • Editing and Color - You don't want to see what I would come up with tinkering in iMovie. This, too, should be left to the professionals. 
  • Animations - We have a talented animator we'd love to hire again to keep our opening credits fresh, unique and exciting. They're one of my favorite parts of our show. 
  • Wardrobe and Props - A major part of our world-building are the small details that you may not notice otherwise, but are critical to the storytelling. 
  • BTS Photographer - Behind the scenes images make a huge difference in promoting and marketing our show. We would love to have an extra person on set to capture our fun filming moments for social media and festival press-kits. 

A SINCERE THANK YOU-- 

Asking for a monetary donation is not something easy to do, nor do I take this ask lightly, so before you hit the donate button, or even if you don't, I want to thank you for supporting this project. Even if that support is just with your eyeballs, watching Season 1 over-and-over again to get our view counts up on youtube. My ego really appreciates it.

UNABLE TO CONTRIBUTE AT THIS TIME? 

If you're unable to donate for whatever reason, but still want to help support Sycamore Valley, here's a few ways how you can help!

  • Send this campaign to your indie film-loving friends and family!  
  • Donate in-kind services or skills:
    • BTS Photographer looking to build their portfolio.
    • Hair and make-up looking for IMDB credit/experience.
    • Etc., etc. You get the idea! =)
story_txt:
ABOUT SYCAMORE VALLEY--
Hello! Let me introduce myself. My name is Marisa Luz and I am the writer/director/producer of Sycamore Valley. If you haven't already seen Season 1 you can check it out at sycamorevalleyshow.com. 
What is Sycamore Valley? It's a mockumentary about two rival realtors in an idyllic Southern California suburb. Our first season follows first-time home-buyers, Kayla and Curtis, as they navigate the pitfalls of finding their first home. In our second season the stakes are higher, with fun new characters, and lots more Cece and Simon drama. Everyone is hungry to see more of their rivalry, so we're delivering! 
Before starting season 1, I had no clue what was involved in putting together a production--time or budget wise. Both were a lot more than I bargained for. All I had was blind ambition, and a concept that I was passionate about, to keep pushing me through when times got tough. And in the end, I came out with a product and story I'm really proud of, and something that viewers really enjoyed (and a Best Series and Best Actor festival win to boot!) The enthusiasm from our fans has given me the energy to have another crack at it, and see if I can't make something even bigger and funnier while I continue to grow as a writer and filmmaker. 

WHY WE'RE RAISING FUNDS--
We had such an amazing response from our families, friends, friends of friends...so we want to involve you! All donations to this campaign will go toward including our fans in some form or fashion.
It should go without saying that filmmaking is expensive, so to be able to bring on board the people and locations that will expand our Sycamore Valley universe, we need some help. 
Your donation will go toward:


Crew and Equipment - Let me tell you I (naively) tried to shoot this show on my iPhone, and 100% this needs to be left in the hands of the experts. Your eyes and ears will be grateful.

Location Rentals - This show is all about houses, and we need to transport our viewers into the Sycamore Valley world with locations that will help tell our story. 

Insurance - Zzzzz. Did I lose you? This is the boring side of filmmaking, but our fancy equipment and location rentals all require insurance in case any of the Cece/Simon cat-fights get out of hand. 

WHAT IF YOU EXCEED YOUR GOAL?
Our current goal is set to about 50% of the show's total budget. There's so much more that needs to be paid for. If we go over and above our goal your contribution will help secure the following:


Actors Salary - These lines don't learn themselves, people! Our actors take pride in transforming themselves into the characters you see on screen, and while it looks like a lot of fun, it's also incredibly hard-work. 

Production Assistant - We need all the hands we can get on set, and having one more person to help us out would make a huge difference in getting everything done our limited time frame. 

Food for Cast and Crew - No shrinking violets on this set! A happy cast and crew are a well fed cast and crew, and we need to keep everyone strong to get through our long days.

Editing and Color - You don't want to see what I would come up with tinkering in iMovie. This, too, should be left to the professionals. 

Animations - We have a talented animator we'd love to hire again to keep our opening credits fresh, unique and exciting. They're one of my favorite parts of our show. 

Wardrobe and Props - A major part of our world-building are the small details that you may not notice otherwise, but are critical to the storytelling. 

BTS Photographer - Behind the scenes images make a huge difference in promoting and marketing our show. We would love to have an extra person on set to capture our fun filming moments for social media and festival press-kits. 


A SINCERE THANK YOU-- 
Asking for a monetary donation is not something easy to do, nor do I take this ask lightly, so before you hit the donate button, or even if you don't, I want to thank you for supporting this project. Even if that support is just with your eyeballs, watching Season 1 over-and-over again to get our view counts up on youtube. My ego really appreciates it.

UNABLE TO CONTRIBUTE AT THIS TIME? 
If you're unable to donate for whatever reason, but still want to help support Sycamore Valley, here's a few ways how you can help!

Send this campaign to your indie film-loving friends and family!  
Donate in-kind services or skills:
BTS Photographer looking to build their portfolio.
Hair and make-up looking for IMDB credit/experience.
Etc., etc. You get the idea! =)

story:
Connie The Conjurer  is the story of Connie Caldwell, a young, violin-playing, shy girl from California.  Her loving parents noticed early signs that Connie possessed the family gift of magic, and they decided that her eccentric grandma, “Mimi”, was the one to teach Connie all about it. So off Connie went to live with Mimi, down south, in the spooky town of Port Murky, Louisiana.  Port Murky is inhabited by so many ghosts that it puts any haunted mansion to shame. Mimi feels that Connie can become a conjurer in time.  Before that, Connie must learn to control her power to conjure spirits, to copy the ability of ghosts and to cast a proper spell.

Gaining supernatural powers isn’t the only thing that Connie faces. Connie has to manage her own “Social Anxiety” that keeps her from connecting to others which she so desperately wants. Moving to a new town is challenging for anybody, but especially so for Connie, whose fear of being judged keeps her from doing what she wants.  

Luckily for her, Connie isn’t alone on this adventure. With Mimi's guidance and a colorful bunch of new paranormal friends, Connie embarks on a mission to help every spirit in Port Murky and help herself become the person she wants to be.

 

Connie The Conjurer is a series that deals with a variety of timely messages. While it may be a fun and spooky show, at its core it exposes how a child with social anxiety navigates the world. The real dilemma in this show doesn’t come from  ghosts or monsters, but instead from Connie's own inhibitions.  How she accepts herself and how others accept her "otherness" is a message that speaks to how diversity of every kind ought to be valued.

Battling social anxiety is personal for series creator, James Fairbanks IV. At Connie’s age, James grew up with social challenges and worked through them to find peer connections. Connie is a character that anybody can relate to, because everyone has entered a room not knowing what to say or do. Connie's vulnerability and honesty resonates deeply within each of our hearts. 

 

James Fairbanks IV is an animator, storyboard artist, screenwriter and children's book author & illustrator. After releasing his first picture book, "Crystal & The Northern Lights" with Amazon in 2018, James founded 4th Scope Productions and began developing Connie The Conjurer with his animation mentor/friend Jeff "Swampy" Marsh. 

James is the Creator, Director, Show Runner and Executive Producer of Connie The Conjurer.

Jeff "Swampy" Marsh" is an animator, writer, director, producer, and voice actor. His most notable achievements are as a co-executive producer for Disney's animated series' Phineas and Ferb , and Milo Murphy's Law. Swampy is currently heading "Pete The Cat" for Amazon Prime.

Swampy is the founder of Surfer Jack Productions and is acting as a Senior Advisor for the development of Connie The Conjurer.

Randy Abrams is a seasoned entertainment executive.  He has played a key role in several successful projects as a creative marketing executive such as the launches of Phineas & Ferb, Wizards of Waverly Place, The Oprah Winfrey Network and UFC on Fox/Fuel TV!

Randy is acting as the Executive Producer and Creative Director of Connie the Conjurer.

 

A shy yet spunky girl with social anxiety who learns she’s next in line to inherit the family gift of becoming a Conjurer. Beneath her shy exterior, Connie is a very exciting and energetic person.  When she's not casting spells and helping spirits, Connie can be found playing her trusty violin "Stephane" and reading her large manga collection which she guards with her life. With her grandmother, new friends and unique abilities, Connie can finally begin the journey to find out who she is and what she's capable of.

Connie will be voiced by actress Francesca Capaldi. Francesca has played in a variety of roles, both live and animated, from Disney Channel's "Dog With a Blog" to 20th Century Fox & Blue Sky Studios' animated film, "The Peanuts Movie" as The Little Red Haired Girl.

 

The art of Voodoo is feared by everyone who encounters it, unless you’re Omi Miller. A young girl versed in Voodoo history, Omi hopes to show everyone that Voodoo is not scary or menacing at all. Positive, electric, and accompanied (at all times) by her white boa named Damba.  Omi is the kind of friend that can provide Connie with more than enough excitement, and Connie loves the wild ride of this friendship. 

Omi will be voiced by actress ​Skai Jackson. Skai has starred in Disney Channel hit shows such as "Jessie" and "Bunk'd"s as well and has experience voice acting in animated shows such as Team Umizoomi, Ultimate Spiderman, and more. 

 

Tricky, unpredictable, and accidentally conjured by Connie, Bodie is the most unique poltergeist you will meet. Much like Connie, Bodie has issues figuring out where he came from or where he belongs. Reluctant to admit it, Bodie is secretly happy to be Connie's friend.  Bodie also isn’t fully aware of how much his friendship means to her. 

Bodie will be voiced by voice actor Justin Cabanting. Justin has voiced a variety of freelance  roles both online and in gaming platforms before being cast in Connie The Conjurer.

 

New to Port Murky just like Connie, Maggie balances life as both a witch and a sixteen-year-old. Her magic comes out through her incredibly talented singing voice.  When she’s not reading about magic, or helping Connie understand magic, she spends time looking after her little brother, Zeke, who is a handful, though surprisingly gifted in magic too.

Maggie is voiced by voice actress, writer, and singer, Olivia Olson. Currently writing and recording new projects, Olivia has found success in animation, voicing Marceline The Vampire Queen in Cartoon Network's Adventure Time & Vanessa Doofenshmirtz in Disney's Phineas & Ferb. Olivia's first album, "Nowhere Land" was just released this year.

 

People in every corner of Louisiana know and fear the name Madam P. Crambay. In our story , however, she is simply known as Connie’s loving Grandma or “Mimi”. She mentors her favorite grandchild in the art of Conjuring, as well as the art of being strong in the face of danger. When she’s not conjuring spirits, running her creepy shop of horrors or telling people’s futures with her crystal ball, Mimi can be found gambling all night long or hunting for the man that got away!

Mimi will be voiced by experienced voice actress Jodi Carlisle. Jodi has played multiple voice roles in animation dating back to 1982. She is best known for her role as Marianne Thornberry from the classic Nickelodeon cartoon, "The Wild Thornberrys" and has played several live action television roles.

Stephane is Connie's trusty violin. Acting as both her comfort and Conjuring companion,  Connie cannot leave home with Stephane. The magic of Stephane is his powerful music that is filled with intense emotion and showcases Connie's potential and strength. 

Stephane will be played by world renowned violinist Sandy Cameron. Discovered at age 12, Sandy has since played shows all around the world included tours with Danny Elfman, Chris Botti, and more!

 

Syd Craven “Paranormal Extraordinaire" came to Port Murky to launch his paranormal television series where he chases Ghosts.  His sidekick is his college roommate who acts as his technical advisor on the show.  The two friends are constantly surprised and ill-equipped to handle the Spirit World they encounter.  They make a million mistakes as they attempt to get the T.V. show going.  Some of the mistakes cost them momentum, but others of those mistakes cost them even more. 

Syd Craven will be voiced by voice and podcast actor Cole Fairbanks. Cole has experience acting in multiple theater productions and will serve as both a voice actor and a writer for Connie The Conjurer. 

 

Port Murky is home to spirits of every kind, including poltergeists, banshees, pirates, ghouls and old opera singers. Ghosts can be found floating around town until their unfinished business is completed. 

Certain important ghosts will be voiced by voice actor, Brock Powell. Brock has voiced multiple character and creature roles ranging from The Kool Aid Man for Kraft, College Humor, Season 1 & 2 of Disney's Milo Murphys Law, God of War, and Hotel Transylvania 3: Overboard.

 

David Errigo, Jr. will voice some of these ghosts too.  David has performed voice work for roles in Final Fantasy XV, Yugioh ARC-V ,and more recently, "Ferb" in Disney's Milo Murphys Law Crossover with Phineas & Ferb.  In Connie The Conjurer, David will play the dark spirit prankster"Siph".

 

The music for Connie The Conjurer  will be created by film composer Bethany Brinton. Bethany has composed short film scores and collaborated on many projects, including Season 2 of Milo Murphy's Law , and several live acts with the creators of Disney's Phineas and Ferb. She has performed with many professional ensembles in a wide variety of genres, both in the U.S. and abroad.

 

 

Our story takes place in the fun, but freaky town of Port Murky, Louisiana. Every nook and cranny is full of activity for both the living as well as the dead! Including its many seaports, historic buildings, and endless places to eat, Port Murky  is a home for just about everyone. 

Port Murky is inspired by the historic and mysterious setting of New Orleans, Louisiana. It is a melting pot of many different cultures and traditions dating back hundreds of years. Think of Port Murky as an expanded version of everything that makes New Orleans unique. People come far and wide to witness not only the history the town provides, but also its endless variety of tasty dishes from every culture imaginable.

Aside from the history, you will find an endless amount of apartments all older than its current inhabitants. Every apartment includes a themed business beneath it, including local shops, ancient markets turned into restaurants, and even voodoo shops both catering to tourists and practicing magic for themselves. 

As mentioned before, Port Murky is a town rich with history, meaning thousands of spirits from all different time periods call Port Murky home. Every kind of ghost from Poltergeists and Banshees to Phantoms and Doppelgängers can be found in Port Murky’s eventful and dark history. This is the backdrop for Connie to explore as she becomes the remedy for every spirit with unfinished business, and there’s a lot of them!
