story:
Short Summary

Hello! We’re Little Doors Media LLC, the creators of Ghosted an internet anthology that explores the social phenomena and impact of one of the dating world’s most pervasive trends: ghosting - the practice of abruptly ending a relationship without any communication or explanation; effectively ‘disappearing’ in the eyes of an unsuspecting partner, or would-be partner.

What’s so unique about Ghosted is that each episode is inspired by and crafted around the deeply personal experience of someone who wanted to share their story. These experiences are compelling because the act of ghosting is not always what it may appear to be on the surface; sometimes it’s a necessary act of self-preservation, or profoundly harrowing and involuntary. Our stories range from from heartwarming, to fateful, and even the downright bizarre; while simultaneously exploring a host social issues such as: LGBTQA acceptance and rights, domestic violence, and even sexual assault.

About Little Doors Media LLC

Little Doors Media is an independent film production company that specializes in new media entertainment. Wholly student-owned and operated by a passionate group of volunteers, the Los Angeles based company is committed to delivering riveting, yet meaningful original content. You can learn more about us at www.littledoorsmedia.com

What We Need & What You Get

In order to deliver a sensational first season of Ghosted, we aim to raise at least $25,000 to meet our estimated production budget. While we may be volunteers, we still  have real costs such as:

  • Insurance – Accidents happen, and we want to make sure that our cast and crew are covered and protected, in the event anyone is hurt on set.
  • Permits – Would you really want us filming in your backyard without permission?
  • Equipment & Rentals – Lighting, sound, cameras – the list goes on. Technology has come a long way, and while it’s possible we could film the series on our smartphones, we think you and the rest of our audience deserve a quality viewing experience.
  • Food – Everyone has to eat, and actors are no different. It’s important to feed our cast and crew on the days that we’re filming; otherwise, they’ll get hangry and their performance will suffer.

What’s in it for you?

For our contributors, we are offering a variety of perks; including but not limited to:

  • Shout-outs on social media and our website!
  • ‘Special Thanks’ in episode credits, series credits, or even on IMDb!
  • Exclusive early access to our pilot episode!
  • An opportunity to walk the red carpet at our Hollywood premier!

And so much more… check out our full list  of perks.

The Impact

In today's political climate, we feel it is imperative for those with a platform to exploit it; using ours, we plan make sure that these stories are told; not for our own gain, but rather to raise awareness to the issues of sexual and domestic abuse, ghosting, and an ever-eroding sense of empathy.  That's why, we are donating any and all net proceeds remaining from production to RAINN (Rape, Abuse, Incest, National Network), the nation’s largest anti-sexual violence non-profit organization.

Through funding our project, not only will Little Doors Media give back by donating our net proceeds, but it enables our audience and contributors the opportunity and incentive to change lives by supporting RAINN - an amazing organization, with a truly noble cause. 

If you or someone you know is a victim of sexual violence, please call the National Sexual Assault Hotline. It's free, open 24/7, and confidential. 1-800-656-HOPE  or visit www.rainn.org

Risks & Challenges

Every project presents its own set of risks and challenges; for us, the biggest challenges are securing quality locations, and raising enough capital to film all 10 episodes. But fear not, we assure your contribution will not go to waste; we are 100% committed to producing Ghosted and delivering as many episodes as our contributions allow. Check out our FAQs for more details. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Here at Little Doors Media, we're all students and volunteers, so we understand you might only be able to donate a couple of dollars; and not everyone has the ability to contribute financially - that’s ok! Still, we’d be forever grateful if you would take a few seconds to help  spread the word about Ghosted by sharing our campaign via Indiegogo share tools, or even just by telling a friend.

We hope you’ll join us in making the Ghosted webs-series a reality, and thank you for being a part of our story.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Hello! We’re Little Doors Media LLC, the creators of Ghosted an internet anthology that explores the social phenomena and impact of one of the dating world’s most pervasive trends: ghosting - the practice of abruptly ending a relationship without any communication or explanation; effectively ‘disappearing’ in the eyes of an unsuspecting partner, or would-be partner.
What’s so unique about Ghosted is that each episode is inspired by and crafted around the deeply personal experience of someone who wanted to share their story. These experiences are compelling because the act of ghosting is not always what it may appear to be on the surface; sometimes it’s a necessary act of self-preservation, or profoundly harrowing and involuntary. Our stories range from from heartwarming, to fateful, and even the downright bizarre; while simultaneously exploring a host social issues such as: LGBTQA acceptance and rights, domestic violence, and even sexual assault.
About Little Doors Media LLC
Little Doors Media is an independent film production company that specializes in new media entertainment. Wholly student-owned and operated by a passionate group of volunteers, the Los Angeles based company is committed to delivering riveting, yet meaningful original content. You can learn more about us at www.littledoorsmedia.com
What We Need & What You Get
In order to deliver a sensational first season of Ghosted, we aim to raise at least $25,000 to meet our estimated production budget. While we may be volunteers, we still  have real costs such as:


Insurance – Accidents happen, and we want to make sure that our cast and crew are covered and protected, in the event anyone is hurt on set.

Permits – Would you really want us filming in your backyard without permission?

Equipment & Rentals – Lighting, sound, cameras – the list goes on. Technology has come a long way, and while it’s possible we could film the series on our smartphones, we think you and the rest of our audience deserve a quality viewing experience.

Food – Everyone has to eat, and actors are no different. It’s important to feed our cast and crew on the days that we’re filming; otherwise, they’ll get hangry and their performance will suffer.

What’s in it for you?
For our contributors, we are offering a variety of perks; including but not limited to:

Shout-outs on social media and our website!
‘Special Thanks’ in episode credits, series credits, or even on IMDb!
Exclusive early access to our pilot episode!
An opportunity to walk the red carpet at our Hollywood premier!

And so much more… check out our full list  of perks.
The Impact
In today's political climate, we feel it is imperative for those with a platform to exploit it; using ours, we plan make sure that these stories are told; not for our own gain, but rather to raise awareness to the issues of sexual and domestic abuse, ghosting, and an ever-eroding sense of empathy.  That's why, we are donating any and all net proceeds remaining from production to RAINN (Rape, Abuse, Incest, National Network), the nation’s largest anti-sexual violence non-profit organization.
Through funding our project, not only will Little Doors Media give back by donating our net proceeds, but it enables our audience and contributors the opportunity and incentive to change lives by supporting RAINN - an amazing organization, with a truly noble cause. 
If you or someone you know is a victim of sexual violence, please call the National Sexual Assault Hotline. It's free, open 24/7, and confidential. 1-800-656-HOPE  or visit www.rainn.org
Risks & Challenges
Every project presents its own set of risks and challenges; for us, the biggest challenges are securing quality locations, and raising enough capital to film all 10 episodes. But fear not, we assure your contribution will not go to waste; we are 100% committed to producing Ghosted and delivering as many episodes as our contributions allow. Check out our FAQs for more details. 
Other Ways You Can Help
Here at Little Doors Media, we're all students and volunteers, so we understand you might only be able to donate a couple of dollars; and not everyone has the ability to contribute financially - that’s ok! Still, we’d be forever grateful if you would take a few seconds to help  spread the word about Ghosted by sharing our campaign via Indiegogo share tools, or even just by telling a friend.
We hope you’ll join us in making the Ghosted webs-series a reality, and thank you for being a part of our story.

story:
Thank you for visiting!

When I set out to write a nerdy web-series, I had no idea how much it would speak to different people. Role-playing games and video games have been a huge part of my life, and I wanted to use my artistic skills to try to tell the stories of the various people I've met along the way. With the series completely written, cast, and ready to go, we're planning to shoot everything in April and May of 2021. I hope that you will support us and join us on this crazy journey!

-Katie Otten, Writer, Producer & Actor

 

What We'd Use the Money For

  • One of our goals is to pay everyone involved! There are many professional filmmakers living and working in the Omaha area (both on-camera and behind), and we want to support them and the amazing work that they do!
  • Costumes! We want them to be super cool and really represent the characters!
  • Locations, props, nerdy paraphernalia for the characters, all that fun stuff.
  • Hosting a website and keeping up-to-date with social media and marketing, so we can expand our audience for the show.

 

Perks

  • Gnome ($5) - We will give you a shout out on social media and a permanent thank you on our website!
  • Human ($10) - We will give you a shout out on social media and a permanent thank you on our website, as well as a vinyl sticker of our logo!
  • Druid ($25) - We will give you a shout out on social media and a permanent thank you on our website, as well as a vinyl sticker of our logo, and a choice between two face mask styles!
  • Elf ($50) - We will give you a shout out on social media and a permanent thank you on our website, as well as a vinyl sticker of our logo, and an 11"x17" poster signed by the cast!
  • Wizard ($100) - We will give you a shout out on social media and a permanent thank you on our website, as well as a vinyl sticker of our logo, and an 11"x17" poster, and a hard copy of the script (both signed by the cast)!
  • Dungeon Master ($500) - We will give you a shout out on social media and a permanent thank you on our website, as well as a vinyl sticker of our logo, an 11"x17" poster signed by the cast, and an Associate Producer credit on IMDB and our website!

 

Stretch Goals

If we're able to make above our goal, we can make the series even cooler!

  • $7,000 - We can add super cool hand-drawn art of the characters (both in-game and real-world!)
  • $10,000 - We can add short animatic sequences to the ending credits!
  • $15,000 - SUPER awesome stuff! We could have really gorgeous costumes, animated sequences, and even more support for a second season!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us spread the word! Even if you can't contribute financially, following us on social media and sharing with your friends is IMMENSELY helpful! We just want people to enjoy our work!

Twitter: InnerWorldsShow

Instagram: innerworlds_webseries

Facebook: InnerWorldsSeries

story:
Alone and wounded former spy J.D, (Julian Gamm) is on the hunt for members of a shady organisation he used to work for - White Crow.

This hunt will take him to the edge of his sanity and abilities, and possibly uncover a darker and more sinister conspiracy that could change the world as we know it.

White Crow follows J.D a rugged and battered Spy who for a mysterious reason has turned against his own. The series is full of twists and turns, ups and downs and a cast to die for with fantastic performances that transform the scripts from words on a page to tense and edgy episodes that keep you on the edge of your seat.

Series 1 of our modern day spy thriller is intended as 9 Episodes in 3 volumes.  So far, we have managed to produce and release the first 3, but we need your help to complete the final six!

Through a very generous private investment we secured £3000 to produce the first 3 Episodes (Lake of Spies, A Stab in the Dark, Special Delivery) as a pilot volume.

Why not view these episodes below?

 
Did you enjoy them? The episodes only get BIGGER and BETTER from here!
 
 
We have put together a fantastic line up of Award-winning actors and actresses who all believe in the series, the story and the potential it has. Their energy, professionalism, talent and chemistry is brilliant to see and work with. With their skills, they transform the words on the page into real characters with depth who are gritty and believable.
 
 
https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6919747/?ref_=nv_sr...
 

Julian Gamm is an Award Winning Actor fast becoming known as the man with a thousand faces for his many versatile roles on the indie film circuit, he has also been fortunate enough to have acted in some high end films and tv series.

Julian has acted on sets like The Legend of Tarzan, The Hatton Garden Job, EastEnders, Wolf Hall, Dangerous Game, Max Payne-Retribution and worked alongside many A-list actors in the process. Julian has gained a lot of experience from starring and working on many short films including 'Yellow' for which he won Best Actor at the Malibu Film Festival. Julian has also starred in many feature films like Eleven, The Lethal Game, Soldiers of Embers and The Reverend and Mrs Simpson to name a few, some of which are due for release soon.

Julian strives to make each character he plays different from the last and always gives 100% when he is on or off set.

www.spotlight.com/profile/7017-8943-6547

With over 35 years of experience behind him in theatre, film and television, Carl recently portrayed Deputy Director Philip Johnson in the award winning film Conspiracy of Dark Falls. Working across various genres, brought him to create and bring to life the comic character of Father Willhiem Mueller in the TV series, Rose Black.
Moving also into voice over, his voice can be heard in the animated, The Homework's Revenge Esther in Wonderland.
As Billy the Butcher, we find him creating havoc in the film Exiled :The Chosen Ones.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm8450570/?ref_=nv_sr...

Jennifer is an actress and writer who has trained at the Royal Central School of speech and Drama and has many years of stage and screen acting experience. She recently appeared in Sky Atlantic's ‘Britannia’ alongside Zoe Wanamaker, and in SyFy channel’s TV series ‘12 Monkeys’ opposite Emily Hampshire. 

She starred in the title role of the feature film ‘Susan’ which has, to date, won 12 awards in international film festivals including two for best actress. She played a lead role in the short film ‘Nora’ which was screened at the BFI IMAX as part of the NHS 70th birthday celebrations, and for which she won a best actress award. She was also recently awarded best supporting actress for the feature film ‘British Made’. Her latest release is the feature film Hosts which premiered at Frightfest this October. It’s due for release in the UK in January 2021’

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm11340958/?ref_=nv_s...

Keith was trained at Drama Centre London Ltd during its Chalk Farm era and his most recent roles have been in corporate films usually playing doctors. His latest theatre role was as Sauerwald in The Freud Play at the Actors’ Centre and his television roles have included three episodes of Gestapo on the History Channel and the Curse of Success on BBC 4.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4601770/?ref_=nv_sr...

Andrew is an experienced stage and screen actor having appeared in many productions across London's fringe theatres including The Usual Suspects, It's a Wonderful Life and Dracula.

Despite the pandemic of 2020, he has kept busy shooting a number of features more recently in the horror and sci-fi genre with 'Prototype' and 'Rats Reborn' coming out on DVD and VoD in 2021; and is currently filming as series regular is season 2 of 'Trending Crimes' on Amazon Prime.

When not shooting, Andrew maintains regular industry training and enjoys hitting the gym to keep his fitness level high for some of the more physically challenging roles he is cast in.

Stott is a British actress staring in Lala Ladiez (sitcom) as one of the leads for Zee TV & Endemol Shine Productions. Stott plays Dawn, mother of 5 & partner to Kulvinder Ghir. Her enthusiasm & drive for life comes across in her performances in TV/Film & theatre.

Leanne Stott was cast for 2 years running in Cleavage Chronicles' Everybody Loves's Boobs which was a phenomenal show raising awareness for breast cancer. Stott also stared alongside the visionary Terry Jones of Monty Python fame in MyHealthTips.com, was recently spotted in Eastenders as the moody shopper & was the face for Miracle Gro.

Natasha has been involved in film and theatre for over 15 years having acted in her first play at the tender age of 9. She was heavily involved in the dramatic arts and her local theatre company throughout her teenage years. Her repetoire includes acting, directing, stage-managing, writing and film projects.

At 18, Natasha was selected to join the National Youth Theatre and spent an intensive period training and performing with the company at the National Theatre.

At university, Natasha pursued her passion further by acting in several film projects in addition to becoming a committee member for the Drama Society. Following this, she worked to achieve her LAMDA grade 8 acting award, gaining greater understanding of practitioners and performance methods.

Joseph Campbell is a actor based in West London. Having graduated from Buckinghamshire New University in 2016, he undertook some acting classes at The Reel Scene & MN Academy in which he reaffirmed his commitment and desire for acting. His credits inculde: Inbetween, Ready, Steady Shoot and others.

Behind the Cast is a keen and aspiring team of independent filmmakers ready to put their all into bringing this story to life and raise it to its full potential.

George Threadgold started out as a self taught filmmaker, teaching himself how to write and format scripts. Following that, he picked up a camera and started shooting to follow his dream of becoming a Director. 

After collaborating on a couple of projects and a fairly successful (zero to no budget) first web series "Shadow Play", George went in pursuit of a better understanding for film and the process behind it.This led to Raindance film school where he Studied on two intensive courses, Scriptwriting and Directing, in 2016/17. Later He followed on with a Producers Course in 2019.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm7363496/?fbclid=IwA...

Graduating from Middlesex University three years ago with a 1st Degree BA Hons in Cinematography, having worked on award winning shorts such as ‘Sabina’ ‘The Art Of My Scars’ and ‘Cigarettes and Alcohol’ and then using the skills and knowledge gained to go on to work at established equipment supplier Production Gear, providing the industry, across all levels, with the right equipment and know-how to help creators with there filmmaking needs.

James is an internationally published photographer with a wealth of knowledge and experience in the industry. Self-taught, James has now been a professional photographer for over 10 years, plying his trade in various genres from sport, weddings, portraits and property photography.

Although having years of experience in stills photography, this is James’s first foray into filmmaking and one that he is excited to embrace with open arms.

Gareth has worked within the industry for over 12 years. Within that time, he has spent over 5 years honing his craft within stunt and combat techniques. Gareth has worked alongside stage pieces for London theatres, Edinburgh Fringe work as well as for independent film.

Gareth is looking forward to the endless possibilities which are open within the world of White Crow, bringing more entertainment and thrills to the audience.

Annmarie Malley/Made up by Malley is a professional special effects and make up artist. Annmarie graduated September 2018 and since then has worked on various films and projects, Damned, Jack In the Box and Silent Night.

Annmarie has worked with Fridays, a youth organisation to help against knife crime Annmarie has spent a lot of time voluntary teaching make up to young people to build up their confidences and too keeps young people off the streets, also domestic abuse charities. 

Many of the films Annmarie has worked on have been awarded winners in various countries. Annmarie's passion is special effects.

Filmmaking has gotten less expenses in recent years from cameras and equipment becoming more affordable to editing and grading software becoming easier for independents to obtain, but there are still costs that cannot be avoided and wages to be paid.

Each episode costs around about £1000 to produce and then there is the cost of sound mixing and editing on top of that. The more money we can raise, the better the series we can produce, making it a more enjoyable experience for the you, the audience!

Your money and support will go towards the cost of producing this thrilling series. Here is a break down on how we will allocate the budget.

 

    As you can see a large percentage of the money will go towards cast and crew wages and hospitality. Then we have equipment such as lenses and gimbals, props such as stunt weapons and permits so we can legally film in certain areas. It all adds up!

    Securing the full £8,000 budget will ensure that we can truly put our all into this and make it a comfortable experience for all those involved in production. 

    We would be so grateful for every single penny in support that comes our way! In return, we have some fantastic perks to show our gratitude. We don't want to just give you the rest of the series in return, we want to give you an experience too!

    • A special thank you shout out from a member of the cast on our social media pages.
    • A special thank you message in the end credits.
    • Signed copy of an Episode script of your choice from the entire cast.
    • A limited edition White Crow T-shirt.
    • An (Associate, Co, Executive) Producer credit along with an IMDB credit.
    • Access to the Episodes earlier than the rest of the world.
    • A very special on-set experience day on one of the remaining shoot days,
    • A VIP seat at our premier night for the super cut of the entire series in feature form!

     Sound awesome? We want to return the love as much as possible!

    Every endeavour is fraught with challenges and hurdles to over come.

    Other than the financial hurdle we have to face, the biggest threat to continued production is the COVID-19 Pandemic that the world is sadly facing at the moment.

    We will do our upmost to protect our cast and crew from infection the best we can by implementing precautions on set. 

    These include:

    • Every member of the team will be asked to take a Covid test before coming on set.
    • Sticking by Social distancing rules while on set.
    • Everyone who comes on set will have their temperature taken at the door.
    • Masks will be worn by every member of the team unless they are in front of the camera and even then we will try and ensure a safe distance where we can.

    Thank you very much for spending the time to read through our page and hopefully for your support in helping us reach our next funding goal!

    Please remember that every penny counts! We truly want to bring you the very best we can for the remaining episodes of this series, and with this series bring a fresh feel to the spy thriller genre.

    Even if you can't support us financially you can still help by sharing this campaign with friends and family and on your social media pages! (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter)

    We really cannot wait to bring you the rest of the series in all of its glory and we are excited to have you along for the ride! Hopefully all going well, we can carry on filming in February/March 2021 with the aim of a May/June release. Lets help JD complete his mission!

It all adds up!Securing the full £8,000 budget will ensure that we can truly put our all into this and make it a comfortable experience for all those involved in production. We would be so grateful for every single penny in support that comes our way! In return, we have some fantastic perks to show our gratitude. We don't want to just give you the rest of the series in return, we want to give you an experience too!
A special thank you shout out from a member of the cast on our social media pages.
A special thank you message in the end credits.
Signed copy of an Episode script of your choice from the entire cast.
A limited edition White Crow T-shirt.
An (Associate, Co, Executive) Producer credit along with an IMDB credit.
Access to the Episodes earlier than the rest of the world.
A very special on-set experience day on one of the remaining shoot days,
A VIP seat at our premier night for the super cut of the entire series in feature form!
 Sound awesome? We want to return the love as much as possible!Every endeavour is fraught with challenges and hurdles to over come.Other than the financial hurdle we have to face, the biggest threat to continued production is the COVID-19 Pandemic that the world is sadly facing at the moment.We will do our upmost to protect our cast and crew from infection the best we can by implementing precautions on set. These include:
Every member of the team will be asked to take a Covid test before coming on set.
Sticking by Social distancing rules while on set.
Everyone who comes on set will have their temperature taken at the door.
Masks will be worn by every member of the team unless they are in front of the camera and even then we will try and ensure a safe distance where we can.
Thank you very much for spending the time to read through our page and hopefully for your support in helping us reach our next funding goal!Please remember that every penny counts! We truly want to bring you the very best we can for the remaining episodes of this series, and with this series bring a fresh feel to the spy thriller genre.Even if you can't support us financially you can still help by sharing this campaign with friends and family and on your social media pages! (Facebook, Instagram, Twitter)We really cannot wait to bring you the rest of the series in all of its glory and we are excited to have you along for the ride! Hopefully all going well, we can carry on filming in February/March 2021 with the aim of a May/June release. Lets help JD complete his mission!

story:
We've done it!!! 

Thank you so much for helping us reach our goal!!! We'd like to thank all of our backers and announce a stretch goal of £5000.

This extra £1500 will be put towards filming the second episode in the series and continue to bring this story to life.

 

Short Summary

Described as Peaky Blinders meets Downtown Abbey meets Oliver Twist, A True Mismatch is an ambitious Scottish TV show written by Kris Scott and Daniel Reynolds during lockdown 2020.  Set in Victorian London, it follows the story of upper class Alice and her blossoming romance with the working class Harry.    Alice struggles with her overbearing father, the obvious class divide and Harry's involvement in an organised crime ring.  When a colleague of her fathers is found murdered, Alice's loyalty is tested as she is left with a choice to make regarding her own happiness and keeping her family safe.

 

 

Meet The Team

  • Kris and Daniel have gathered a talented and experienced team to bring their idea to life and plan to shoot the pilot episode in Renfrewshire and Ayrshire over the month of May 2021 if regulations allow.
  • Daniel found himself homeless in 2011 and has built himself from the ground up to the actor and creator he is now.  Because of his background, he feels it's important to provide creative opportunities for working class actors and filmmakers who may not be given the opportunity otherwise.
  • Kris is the award winning creator of the Amazon Prime show 'Detachment' and the Scottish feature film 'Love, My Way In A Northern Town'.  

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are hoping to raise £3,500 in order to complete the pilot episode of a True Mismatch and pitch it for distribution.  This will be used to secure locations, make unique, era appropriate costumes and of course to pay our hard working cast and crew for their efforts.
  • In return for your contribution, we are offering a range of exciting perks, including executive producer credits, vintage Victorian postcards, exclusive t-shirts and social media shout outs!

The Impact

  •  We believe this project brings something new to Scottish film and TV, while creating jobs in an industry that has been decimated by the impact of the global pandemic.  If we don't reach our goal, the pilot will unfortunately be postponed until we can raise the funds to produce it to the highest standard possible.  If we surpass our goal, the excess will be put towards the budget for episode two.
  • We want to make something that utilises the best of Scottish based talent.  We will be investing in the local economy by using local cast, crew, catering and locations.

https://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/authors/paisley-daily-express/blockbuster-hopes-new-crime-series-23426908

Risks & Challenges

  • Covid-19 is still a threat in 2021,  All cast and crew have completed up-to-date Screenskills Coronavirus training and are aware of the protocols required to keep everyone safe while filming.  There is a chance that further restrictions and lockdowns may impact filming.  No filming will take place unless we are legally allowed to do so, and in order to comply with legislation we have made the decision to shoot in Daniel's local area using outdoor locations where reasonably possible.  Full risk assessments will be undertaken by our producer for each location and all cast and crew will be provided with free hand sanitiser and all meals and snacks will be individually wrapped.  
  • Outdoor shoots involve many challenges in terms of logistics.  There is the chance that the shoot will be affected by inclement weather.  To prepare for this, we will encourage all cast and crew to dress appropriately and we will provide blankets and hot drinks while outdoors.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute but would still like to support this project:

Share our campaign, follow us on social media and tell your friends about 'A True Mismatch'!

story:
My name is Michaela P. Shelton and I am the creator of a digital series called Reckless Behavior: The Series. The show tells the story of a post college black millennial and aspiring writer, who navigates through life attempting to find herself and avoid reckless behavior. It is loosely based on my life and its purpose is to create something millennials can relate to that also showcases the beauty and culture of the Bay Area. I am passionate about black storytelling, because I feel that it is important that our voices are heard and our stories are accurately told.

Although it is very uncomfortable for me to request help, I am aware that I must put my pride aside, because it takes a village. After digging myself into debt, working seven days a week and doing various freelance projects to gain extra income, I now realize that I can no longer solely depend on myself to fully fund my projects. 

Through my web series, I have given opportunities to aspiring actors, up and coming musical artists and promoted a number of black owned businesses. In addition, Reckless Behavior: The Series has been mentioned on popular Bay Area radio station 106.1 KMEL, it has been featured on many blogs and podcasts and it has been selected for viewing at the 2020 Pan African Film and Arts Festival, the largest and most prestigious black film festival in America.

If you want to support a young Black woman who is passionate about creating content for us and by us, please donate anything you can. I want to continue this filmmaking journey, but I need your help.

Here is a link to season 2 episodes:

https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLF3EQvVvh41SAXqEZQurJlrcnvdWe_ld7

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
​Who We Are

You're probably asking yourself, "why would I want to support this project?" Well, let me help you understand a little more about who we are and what we stand for:

Ginamarie and Olivia here, we are a Mother/Daughter Duo (more like best friends, if we're honest).  We began writing this series so that families would come together again in the living room.

Our desire is to bring a wholesome, family-friendly TV series to your home weekly. We want parents and children to feel comfortable watching TV together, without worrying what might be heard or seen.

What is Abbott Falls?

Think of Gilmore Girls for the small town feel, which creates the ability to have close-knit relationships and of course, coffee addictions.

Abbott Falls truly is unlike any show currently on the air today. Abbott Falls is a wholesome, family-friendly, hour-long drama centered on the town of Abbott Falls, but more specifically, the Kennedy Family.

Throughout the series, the Kennedy family will face unexpected events as their world is turned upside down by a troubled foreign exchange student, the reveal of shocking family secrets, and the destruction of various relationships. They will have to learn to trust each other and depend upon their faith. 

What We Need 

I believe in being totally transparent. We need YOU! The father, mother, grandparents, millennials, Generation Xer's, college students, high school and middle school students and even the very young at heart. 

This pilot will cost us nearly $200,000.  I know, that's a lot of money. I feel you. I'm digging deep into my pockets for this tv show as well. Each dollar contributed to Abbott Falls TV series will be spent on the production of the pilot episode.

The Impact

Each episode of Abbott Falls will impact you and your family. It's time for families to enjoy being a family. To be laughing and crying together. Talking about real life and sharing in each other's joy. 

Other Ways You Can Help

How can you help?

  • Pray for us as we continue to strive to bring Abbott Falls to your home.
  • Share our campaign with your social influence. Help us by sharing our vision.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help us.
  • Watch for audition opportunities so you can be a part of our vision.

Meet Some of the Cast

Meet Some of the Cast

story:
Can you imagine what it would be like to go from your life right now to suddenly living underground 24/7 with four strangers in a tiny bunker; and anytime you stick your head outside there are 6 billion zombies trying to eat you? And then try to think of all the ways you might entertain yourself so you don’t go crazy.

That’s the crux of Bunkheads. We wanted to take the characters and situations you find in a sitcom and place them into a world they've never been before. Over the course of a season, we pit these diverse goofballs against each other in ways that resonate in today’s America and ultimately help them forge a new kind of family.

Bunkheads is more than just a web series; it’s an opportunity to join our gang of merry pranksters and watch a show that we can laugh at together, despite all the chaos in the world. Feels appropriate, right?

It's also an opportunity to support the filmmakers + cast, and help us showcase the kind of original work we can create after years and years of honing our crafts.

And it's not just us who think so! The online video news site Tubefilter recommended Bunkheads as their Fund This of the week:

   https://tinyurl.com/y8opz8gs

"All signs point to this project being a polished an enjoyable one, full of relatable characters who have been shoved into an unusual setting. Bunkheads has all the makings of a quality web series..." 

Will Gong is an LA based writer, producer, and award-winning editor hailing from the great state of Virginia. Over the past fifteen years, he has been privileged to work with some of the finest studios around town on projects such as Star Wars, Straight Outta Compton, CNN’s The Sixties, and The Concert for Valor. Will has taken all the advice and experience he’s learned in Hollywood and put it all into this project.

 

Lauren Klixbull is a director, commercial art director, and oil painter. Her work includes several Super Bowl commercials, feature films, and branded content for Smashbox makeup, PopSugar.com, Lowe’s, Macy's, and Target. This Pittsburgh native and Carnegie Mellon University graduate has never once let up from her goal of directing scripted material, and she is in the perfect place to direct the hell out of Bunkheads.

 

Gabriel Reiter has produced countless commercial projects, on budgets ranging from pennies to millions of dollars, for well-known brands including Walmart, Tide, Wendy’s, and Starbucks. He’s well-versed in web content having produced “Raising An Olympian”, a heralded branded documentary series that screened at the Cannes Lions International Film Festival and attracted over 25 million views online. Gabriel is ready to muster all of his producing talent and his Miami Hurricanes pride to bring this project to life.

Khalif Boyd is from Lakewood, CA  aka Sports Illustrated’s “Sportstown of the Year” in 2004 (seriously, look it up). After playing semi-pro basketball in Costa Rica, Khalif began acting through collaborations with notable YouTube influencers. Khalif is currently creating content for YouTube with David So Comedy and writing an autobiographical film called Vinegar, about his unique Vietnamese and Black identity.

 

Currently living in LA, Chris is originally from Rhode Island. With over a decade of experience, Chris's trademark ability to find the humor hidden in drama and the vulnerability behind comedy has helped him land roles in every genre on every media platform. Look for Chris as Mark in the upcoming horror film, Found Footage 3D.

 

Carly Turro is a bicoastal actor, screenwriter, and slightly obsessive pet-parent. Shortly after graduating from Colgate University with a degree in Biology, she decided to put it to excellent use by instead pursuing acting. Most recently appearing on Homeland, she can soon be seen starring in the horror/comedy feature film Blood Puppet! Christmas ’94, and several other festival-bound films.

 

Josh Covitt is from San Diego and is a graduate of the UCLA School of Theatre, Film, and Television. His work spans TV, film, theatre, and live comedy, including performances with Will Farrell, Luke Wilson, Mindy Kaling, Eva Longoria, and Luke Perry. In 2011, Josh was voted the winner of IO West's The Ultimate X-ecution: The Search for LA's Best Improviser. He currently performs every Tuesday night at UCB in L.A.

 

Alexandra Johnston is from Portland, Oregon and is known for her work as Cynthia Maddox in Amazon's American Playboy: The Hugh Hefner Story, Megan in feature film The Big Day, and Hannah in the west coast premier of Sex and Education at The Laguna Playhouse. 

    Episode 1 - "This is the Place” 

On their one-year anniversary of living together, the Bunkheads debate whether or not their situation is sustainable and if it’s better to risk their lives topside with the zombies still ravaging the Earth. As they debate, we learn more about them, how they came together, and discover who created the bunker in the first place.  

    Episode 2 - “Touch of My Hand”

A bit fed up with the boys and seeing an opportunity, Dani persuades the guys to leave the bunker so that she can have some “quality” time to herself. Out in the woods, Matt tries to keep the peace while Kip and Cash argue over who Dani is most attracted to.  

    Episode 3 - “Let Me Clear My Throat!”

Kip's never ending “Cold War” against Cash transforms into a full-blown conflict during the first “Bunkheads Presidential Debate.” It forces Cash into revealing some long-held secrets to the gang and everything comes to a head when a vote is taken to kick out one of the bunkmates! 

    Episode 4 - “Who’s That Girl?” 

Out in the real world, Kip discovers an attractive stranger, Blair, and brings her back to the bunker. The delicate equilibrium of their group dynamic is thrown out of whack and the Bunkheads have to decide whether to permanently invite Blair into their gang.  

    Episode 5 - "Dreams"

Riding the coattails of the Sandman, we step inside each of the Bunkheads' minds for an episode that takes place entirely in sleep. Inside their dreams, we meet new characters, learn new secrets, and finally experience the full, majestic, and uncontainable glory of Kip’s first rap performance.  

    Episode 6 - “All My Friends” 

After two years of holding everyone together, Matt has a nervous breakdown. Kip, Cash, and Dani come together to try bring Matt back through the kind of zany skits that he loves to put on. Despite their best efforts, nothing seems to get through to him - that is, until Kip comes up with one last brilliant idea.

Unlike a novel or a painting where one person can create art with some basic tools (and a whole lot of magic), making a film or a web series requires a whole mess of people. We already have an army of friends donating their time and equipment but, to create something truly special, we are going to need money.

We need cameras, equipment, food, and most importantly we need a bunker! It’s not like we can just borrow one or head over to our local mall and find a “Build-A-Bunker Workshop.” Nope! From the fake walls to furniture, we are going to have to build a bunker from scratch and rent a space to put it in.

Not only that, but we are creating a 6-episode season. Although any one episode can be funny, what makes TV special is the progression of story and characters over time and the way we let them into our lives.

 

Perks! These, plus a whole lot more options to choose from on the panel to the right.

 

If you dig Bunkheads and what we're all about, here's a not-so-secret way you can help out even more!

  • Like, follow, and share our social media pages and encourage your friends to become Bunkheads as well!

                      

 

  • AND leave a positive comment on Indiegogo. It helps boost our campaign in searches, which helps us reach a broader audience.

This one's for you guys and for us. It’s for the fans of slowpoke zombies and absurdist comedies. It’s for the scrappy little guys and the softhearted giants.

This isn't meant to be a big-budget, star-driven kind of show where the back-end profits dictate the front-end decisions. This is meant to be real, to be honest, and to be grassroots.

We are Bunkheads and we invite you all to join and share in the fun!

In 2011, Josh was voted the winner of IO West's The Ultimate X-ecution: The Search for LA's Best Improviser. He currently performs every Tuesday night at UCB in L.A.
 

Alexandra Johnston is from Portland, Oregon and is known for her work as Cynthia Maddox in Amazon's American Playboy: The Hugh Hefner Story, Megan in feature film The Big Day, and Hannah in the west coast premier of Sex and Education at The Laguna Playhouse. 

    Episode 1 - "This is the Place” 
On their one-year anniversary of living together, the Bunkheads debate whether or not their situation is sustainable and if it’s better to risk their lives topside with the zombies still ravaging the Earth. As they debate, we learn more about them, how they came together, and discover who created the bunker in the first place.  
    Episode 2 - “Touch of My Hand”
A bit fed up with the boys and seeing an opportunity, Dani persuades the guys to leave the bunker so that she can have some “quality” time to herself. Out in the woods, Matt tries to keep the peace while Kip and Cash argue over who Dani is most attracted to.  
    Episode 3 - “Let Me Clear My Throat!”
Kip's never ending “Cold War” against Cash transforms into a full-blown conflict during the first “Bunkheads Presidential Debate.” It forces Cash into revealing some long-held secrets to the gang and everything comes to a head when a vote is taken to kick out one of the bunkmates! 
    Episode 4 - “Who’s That Girl?” 
Out in the real world, Kip discovers an attractive stranger, Blair, and brings her back to the bunker. The delicate equilibrium of their group dynamic is thrown out of whack and the Bunkheads have to decide whether to permanently invite Blair into their gang.  
    Episode 5 - "Dreams"
Riding the coattails of the Sandman, we step inside each of the Bunkheads' minds for an episode that takes place entirely in sleep. Inside their dreams, we meet new characters, learn new secrets, and finally experience the full, majestic, and uncontainable glory of Kip’s first rap performance.  
    Episode 6 - “All My Friends” 
After two years of holding everyone together, Matt has a nervous breakdown. Kip, Cash, and Dani come together to try bring Matt back through the kind of zany skits that he loves to put on. Despite their best efforts, nothing seems to get through to him - that is, until Kip comes up with one last brilliant idea.

Unlike a novel or a painting where one person can create art with some basic tools (and a whole lot of magic), making a film or a web series requires a whole mess of people. We already have an army of friends donating their time and equipment but, to create something truly special, we are going to need money.
We need cameras, equipment, food, and most importantly we need a bunker! It’s not like we can just borrow one or head over to our local mall and find a “Build-A-Bunker Workshop.” Nope! From the fake walls to furniture, we are going to have to build a bunker from scratch and rent a space to put it in.
Not only that, but we are creating a 6-episode season. Although any one episode can be funny, what makes TV special is the progression of story and characters over time and the way we let them into our lives.


 
Perks! These, plus a whole lot more options to choose from on the panel to the right.


 
If you dig Bunkheads and what we're all about, here's a not-so-secret way you can help out even more!
Like, follow, and share our social media pages and encourage your friends to become Bunkheads as well!
                        
 
AND leave a positive comment on Indiegogo. It helps boost our campaign in searches, which helps us reach a broader audience.


This one's for you guys and for us. It’s for the fans of slowpoke zombies and absurdist comedies. It’s for the scrappy little guys and the softhearted giants.
This isn't meant to be a big-budget, star-driven kind of show where the back-end profits dictate the front-end decisions. This is meant to be real, to be honest, and to be grassroots.
We are Bunkheads and we invite you all to join and share in the fun!

story:
Sign up for our email update list! http://eepurl.com/c1_hUH

PRODUCTION IS COMPLETED!

Current ​Goals

"The kill scenes are fun, dialogue rich and a surprise ending that I totally enjoyed."

- Chad Armstrong, leglesscorpse.com

We are still raising post production funds ($40,000) to cover editing costs, colorist, composer, sound editor/designer and visual effects.

  • If you would like to contribute to help us finish please go to: http://bit.ly/CBWPaypal
  • If you would like to contribute by buying a hat please go to: http://bit.ly/Ballcap

CRAZY BITCHES

Crazy Bitches is “a fun romp that will make you laugh and cringe, often at the same time, but will definitely keep you guessing until the last minute. It’s a film you don’t want to miss.”

- Marcus Thomas, This Is Infamous

The web-series is based on the comedy/horror film CRAZY BITCHES: Live Vain Die Ugly and picks up not long after the murders at Great Spirit Ranch. 

(The original feature released in February 2015. Watch the trailer below. Find it on ITunes, Vimeo, HORRORinsidetheBOX.com and Amazon among many other place.)

TRAILER FOR CRAZY BITCHES, THE ORIGINAL FEATURE

Season 1 Synopsis

Crazy Bitches “is a fun story, with the perfect mix of Desperate Housewives cattiness and Pretty Little Liars paranoia...."

- Bears Fonte, AM/FM Magazine

After the slaughter at Great Spirits Ranch one or more killers remains on the loose, unbeknownst to a gathering of women at The Wellness Retreat and Healing Spa Ranch in Big Sur. A private and secluded spa in the mountains along the coast of California, TWRHSR, as it is affectionately known, is an exclusive gathering place where a small and select groups of women (and their GBFs) of all ages and ilks gather to reclaim their relationship with mother earth and their own vaginas.​

A new group of arrivals enjoy a beautiful first day in the sun, before things turn dark when one of the guests shows up  dead in the hot tub. Police are called in to investigate and the bodies start piling up.

The Filmmaker

"Clark’s intelligent script and her ability to maintain the funny while amassing the gore is a welcome entry into a genre, heretofore, untapped by women directors."

- Madrid S. Angelo, ROCK CHICAGO

Jane Clark is a multiple hat wearing storyteller - writer/director/producer/editor. Through her company, FilmMcQueen, she has brought numerous shorts and 3 feature films to life, winning 18 awards and another 8 nominations by envisioning strong characters in visceral environments. She has worked in film with actors such as Lukas Haas, David Arquette, Theo Rossi and Necar Zadigan, as well as Emmy-winning sound wizard,  Andy D'Addario ("Mozart in the Jungle") and composer Curt Smith (co-founder of Tears for Fears). Jane focuses on character exploration and tells stories that move audiences to laughter and tears by revealing shades of gray beneath a surface of black or white. This year she is venturing into VR with a narrative horror short and onto the small screen with a web-series incarnation of her CRAZY BITCHES franchise.

MY MEANDERING PATH TO BECOMING A DIRECTOR

Timeline

“Crazy Bitches refreshes a genre that was getting tired and tiresome.”

Chicago Pride – Gregg Shapiro

  • Edit - Dec. 12 - Feb 12
  • Color, Sound, Music - Feb 12 - March 15
  • Release Date - April/May 2018
  • DVD release - September 2018

The Location

 “Jane Clark’s Crazy Bitches gets an A in my book—packed with moments that will make you giggle, cringe, and maybe even jump out of your seat for a second. Make no mistake: Bitches be crazy.”

- AfterEllen – Kim Hoffman

We have a beautiful location. You can see images here: KLENTNERRANCH.COM

 “Filled with laughs, suspense, and well crafted gore Crazy Bitches is a deep slasher that knows it’s roots and excels in the lavish world of horror.”

Horror Movies Uncut – Travis Brown

HONEY ROBERTS

You can hear the mp3s at the links below:

"I'm Done": https://soundcloud.com/user-99795565/im-done

"Over You":  https://soundcloud.com/user-99795565/over-you

The Credits You Can Earn

“Clark gives us a smorgasbord of entertainment through a variety of female leads.”

– Cooper Copeland

The more you contribute the bigger and bolder your credit gets! Because you deserve it!

The following are the various levels of credit that are going to be listed on the website and the end credits of the film. The more you donate the bigger and badder the credit will be. And its cumulative, so you can donate $50 today and earn "Crazy Donor Bitch", come back a week later and donate $25, then a week later and donate $30 and you'll be promoted to "Crazy Crazy Bitch." The more you add to your donation amount, the higher you go on the credits.

$10,000 and above, Insanely Crazy Imperial Bitch

$5000 – $4999,  Crazy Her/His Royal Highness Queen/King Bitch

$2500 – $4999, Crazy Princess/Prince Bitch

$1000 – $2499, Crazy Bitch of Excellence

$500 – $999,  Crazy Premier Bitch

$350 – $499,  Super Crazy Royal Bitch

$200 – $349,  Crazy Royal Bitch

$100 – $199,  Crazy Crazy Bitch

$50 – $99,  Crazy Donor Bitch

Cast

“Crazy Bitches has a smart cast of pretty little prey, each with a reasonably tragic and well conceived backstory.”

– Mark Buckingham, Cinema Sentries

story:
Help Us Bring "Hyper Piper and the Adventures on I.V.I." to a Screen Near You!!

This TV Series is great for kids, tweens, teens and adults, as it shows how working together helps to solve problems and find solutions. It is a creative sci-fi adventure that takes viewers through obstacles at school, home, on the Outer Planets Research Space Station and on I.V.I.!

  • Help kids learn leadership and teamwork skills, while exploring science and space travel!
  • Fund a TV show that has great values and an imaginative location!
  • Help us to promote the show to networks, so there will be more quality TV programs for kids, tweens and teens!

Your donation will help us to complete the editing and show the world our first episode!

We need $2K to complete our funding for Episode 1.

Why $2K?

  • Our minimum entire goal for production was $4500. It's a low-budget film in that we are only paying production at this time, with hopes to be able to pay our actors for future episodes. 
  • We raised $2400 with our first IndieGogo campaign, and need $2K to cover the final amount towards editing.
  • Your donation will go towards the editing, and if there is any amount over $2K, it will go towards the filming of Episode 2, and help to pay for the trailer filming, wardrobe, food, transportation and other misc. expenses during the filming of episode 1.

Thank You.

We are so thankful for your donation - it's more than $, it's an opportunity for these actors to learn on set and grow as a team! Every time we have a yard sale or bake sale fundraiser, the kids give a % to help kids in need. Their hearts are big and the actors have donated so much of their time and energy towards this amazing story! Your donation encourages kids to find their strengths and follow their dreams.

Not able to help this time, no worries!

You can help in the following ways:

  • Share our IndieGogo campaign! (look for the "share" buttons to share on social media)
  • Share our Facebook and Instagram pages, as well as our Website, www.hyperpipertv.com!
  • Let the industry know that you would like to see this TV program on their network! (Hulu, Nickelodeon, Netflix, Disney, Amazon Studios, etc...)

Thank you!

story:
What is Indiegogo and how does crowdfunding work?

Indiegogo is a platform to fund ingenious, work-in-progress products and ideas. Although contributing to a campaign is not the same as purchasing a product, when you support a crowdfunding project, you help bring ideas to life! Learn more.

How do I select a perk that interests me on this page?

On desktop, you’ll see a list with all available perks on the right hand side of the page. Click on the perk you want, then click the "Get This Perk" button to be redirected to the payment page. If you're on a mobile device, scroll up to see all available perks.

How do I ask the project owner a question?

If you’ve already backed this campaign, you can leave a comment on the Comments tab, or send the project owner a direct message. Otherwise, you may be able to contact the project owner through their website or social media accounts. Learn more.

Already contributed to this project?

Can I change the shipping address for my perk?

In most cases, yes. Here’s how to do it. However, if the project has already started to ship perks, or if you need to change your country, you’ll need to contact the project owner in order to request any changes.

Can I change the item, or perk, I selected?

You’ll need to contact the project owner directly to request any change to perks, like color or quantity.

Can I ask Indiegogo for a refund?

Indiegogo does not guarantee that the perks offered by the campaigner will be produced or delivered and is not directly responsible for refunding contributions. Learn moreabout our Refund policy.

story:
danny   is   a   psycho
 

Synopsis

Danny is a nice, normal, optimistic guy...but there's just one problem. Lately, when folks lean on the side of supremely annoying, he tends to black out and murder them with whatever's laying around.  Danny is a psycho. But, we all got problems right?

In a world where no one cares about much of anything unless there's an app for it, who will defend their god-given right to blatant douchery? Probably no one, our protagonist is a serial murderer.

Disaffected, paranormal, horror-comedy.

 

Who We Are and What We're Doing
 

Here we are, smack stab in the middle of producing season one.  We just premiered at Crypticon, our online release is hot on its tail, and we’re about to begin production on the second half of our first season.

That’s where we need your help.  We’ve flipped the last couch cushion and ate the last of our ramen, and as we sit here at the plasma center writing this…okay, not really-really, but close…it’s clear that we need some help.

How’d we get here? Cheap booze and fairy dust. Oh yeah, and an idea or two.  Having worked and collaborated as an actor on many other people’s projects, some of them rehashed stories, the desire to create original content grew stronger.  It had always been there, but filmmaking (content creation) is a long, complex, daunting endeavor and it seemed pretty elusive.

The idea began back in the day that as a group of performers we could pour our collective, pooled talent into something and build a foundation, while supporting each other’s growth and creative expression.  And have fun making something silly together that tickles a funny bone or two. Following that dream for the last year plus has led us here.

It’s all been a great building process, putting this thing together over the months. Everyone has worked very hard, and we're hoping to work much harder to bring more, bring it better, and entertain. 

 

How You Can Help


We, the cast and crew of Danny is a Psycho, are asking for contributions to support all that it takes to keep the production alive!  $10,000 will get us over the hump in providing a decent  day rate for our actors and crew, for all of their dedicated work, and buy us a few essentials to improve production value. We are in need of a monitor, lavaliere mics, more lighting equipment, and other miscellaneous equipment and effects stuff.  Oh, and probably some blood.

What's in it for You?


If you support us you’ll have our undying love, respect, and gratitude. Without you this web-series could wind up deceased before it's time and that would be a bloody shame. And, just maybe, you'll find a little catharsis and think of us the next time you want to bludgeon your co-worker with that stapler on your desk or shoot your TV in the middle of the evening news. Plus, there's some cool schwag we'll send you!

Perks! Perks! Perks!​

  • $1 Vote for a murder weapon!             
  • $5 Sticker!
  • $10 Button!
  • $25 DVD, button, and sticker!
  • $50 T-Shirt, button, and sticker!                                
  • $100 T-Shirt, DVD, button, and a sticker! 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Please donate and SHARE, SHARE, SHARE!

Thank you, from one psycho to another!

-jon a. hall
writer, director, actor

     

Cast                                          
calvin mccarthy
alysse fozmark
sean lamb
tabitha trosen
jon a. hall
brian koch
illya torres  
dana shea

Crew
jon a. hall
mike lindberg
calvin mccarthy   
zach nirich
tim west
amanda healy

story:
About Us

Dan Erez and Inbal Baron- We are both filmmakers in our early thirties. We studied film making together in college in the south of Israel and during this time we directed, produced, wrote and held the boom in many many films. After graduation we moved in together, but only as roommates, and had a three seater couch that accommodate many couchsurfers from all over the world. After we experienced a few funny, weird and even terrifying nights we realized that we had a comedy in our hands and started creating "Foreign Couches". 

The Story

Yael and Yaron are a couple who lives in a small crumbling apartment in Tel Aviv. She is a struggling actress aspires to be recognized and he is a musician with stage fear. When they find themselves In their thirties with no friends, trying to figure out how to be adults when they still feel immature, with debts, taking money from their parents and a career path to nowhere, they decide to start hosting tourists to spark their gray reality. Hosting tourists let them live in escapism for a while and a way to travel abroad without spending money on a plane ticket or leaving the comfort of their couch.

Adding a couchsurfer to the mix creates chaos that force them to grow up...eventually. Every time they feel they are on the right track, reality comes and slap them on the face.   

In every episodes they will host a tourist from a different country, someone that will give them a unique perspective on life and help them understand what the fuck they are doing

It’s going to be surreal, witty, awkward, scary, emotional and heart breaking.

Help us bring the first season of "Foreign Couches" to life.

With your contributions we will be able to fully produce the first season of the series retaining the high quality, professional and stylish feel with the same unique cinematic language as seen in the teaser.

The first season will have a total of 5 episodes with each episode lasting around 5 minutes,

Cast & Crew

Inbal Baron- Creator/               Dan Erez- Creator/ Director

Executive Producer                     Once directed an ass. Literally an ass.                        

        

Inbal Baron Showreel               Dan Erez Showreel  

                     
Elazar Mack- Screenwriter                  Tamar Segal- Actress

Obsessed with Holocaust's                   Rock Paper Scissors                                                        obsession.  

                                                                                                                                                                                                                       

Elazar Mack Showreel                            Tamar Segal Showreel          
   

Yossef Soffer- Actor                        Adi Mozes- Cinematographer

                                                                 The man who wants to film it all.          

  

 Yossef Soffer Showreel               Adi Mozes Showreel

Amos Geva- Narrator                       Original Music- Alon Kaplan  

     

Amos Geva Showreel                       Alon Kaplan Showreel

 

Producer - Gidi Aviv

Editor - Lior Netzer - The Feel Makers http://thefeelmakers.com/

Teaser Cast - Joel Landshut / Rebecca Hessing / Ruben Visscher

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only way you can help us with this campaign! What do we mean?

SHARE SHARE SHARE!

If you don't have money to contribute right now, you can still contribute through word of mouth. Spreading the word about Foreign Couches will help us create a larger fan base and will help make the web series more successful.
story_txt:
About UsDan Erez and Inbal Baron- We are both filmmakers in our early thirties. We studied film making together in college in the south of Israel and during this time we directed, produced, wrote and held the boom in many many films. After graduation we moved in together, but only as roommates, and had a three seater couch that accommodate many couchsurfers from all over the world. After we experienced a few funny, weird and even terrifying nights we realized that we had a comedy in our hands and started creating "Foreign Couches". The StoryYael and Yaron are a couple who lives in a small crumbling apartment in Tel Aviv. She is a struggling actress aspires to be recognized and he is a musician with stage fear. story:
Grettir Ásmundarsonar wants to make a name for himself as a warrior, but his violent temper and the curse of the revenant Glámur leads to a life on the margins of society as he becomes the most notorious outlaw in medieval Iceland.

This story takes place roughly 1,000 years ago. The book upon which this series is based was written about 700 years ago by an unknown author.

My name is Niles Maxwell. I am an American writer/director (and producer by default) living in southwest Germany. I have been making movies since I was 14 or 15 years old. Now I'm 48 and ready to finally produce and direct my first series, starting with this pilot episode.

I find the Grettir character to be a lonely, solitary figure, not unlike my own teenage years growing up. He feels misunderstood, and society has denied him what he truly wants, to make a name for himself as a great viking warrior. During the time this story takes place, the Viking Age was coming to an end, as Nordic peoples became Christianized. Yet Grettir aggressively takes action against injustice anyway, leading to the lonely life of an outlaw.

We know that J.R.R. Tolkien was influenced by the Icelandic sagas, as is apparent in similarities between Tolkien's work and this particular saga... in the names of the characters (Thorir Long-Chin, Bjorn the Hitardal Champion, Onund Tree-Foot, etc.), the types of monsters Grettir must battle (trolls, witches, revenants, etc.), the recurrence of singing or recitation of poetic verse and the adventurous nature of Grettir's long journey.

With your help, we can produce this pilot episode in Iceland and Norway, hopefully starting sometime in the winter of 2022. Because of the costumes, sets and remote locations, it is an enormous undertaking for a 45-minute episode.

We need close to €2 million to produce this pilot. We need Viking vessels, weapons, many costumes, and to pay a large professional cast and crew to shoot. As a contributor, you will remain informed about our progress, receive behind-the-scenes images and footage, have access to special communications with the cast or receive credit for your contribution, depending on your level of support. My team and I (see www.bohemianentertainment.com) are working to finance this project by other means as well, and if we don't raise the €1.5 million on IndieGoGo, we'll continue to work toward getting the project financed by other means.

As a director/screenwriter, I take a collective approach to filmmaking. Making movies is hard work, but it's not all about the director's vision. It's about working together to achieve something special, to create art, to create stories that are powerful and meaningful... as well as entertaining. In our current time of economic and political upheaval, it is glaringly obvious that the myth that we can pull ourselves up by our own bootstraps as individuals is coming to a long-needed end. We have to work cooperatively to solve our very difficult challenges. So too in filmmaking -- I much prefer a cooperative experience as a team to any egocentric expressions of individual players.

My own background is like this... I am originally from Anchorage, Alaska. I started making movies with my neighborhood friends and my younger brother when I was 14 or 15, always remaining behind the camera. I hold a BA in English composition and an MFA in creative writing (with a concentration in screenwriting) and was on stage as an improv comedy actor for 4 years prior to switching into the film industry in 2006. So I have a strong appreciation for what actors bring to the table. I have written and co-produced (with a large team supporting me) one feature-length film thus far (see the trailer here: https://vimeo.com/ondemand/halfbrothers).

Producing a film or pilot episode for a series is like organizing a large wedding every day that you shoot... if something can go wrong, it will go wrong. But I use my experience in improvisational theater to roll with the punches as they come. One can always find creative solutions to last-minute problems. In fact, I welcome such challenges, because sometimes they force me to come up with even better options than were initially planned. But my general approach to reducing the risk of failure is to do a great deal of planning ahead of time. Living in Germany has helped me in this regard, because the Germans are good at planning! That's why I'm giving myself two years to prepare this project -- it will take that long to get ready and make this pilot work at the quality we hope to achieve.

For those of you who can't contribute financially, we welcome your support to help create a following online through social media and other means. Spreading the word about this campaign will help us reach our goal. So please use the IndieGoGo sharing tools.

Thank you so much for reading to the end. We can't wait to actualize this project with your help. Thanks again! 

Best Regards,

Niles Maxwell & Team

story:
Spilled Paint is a  TV Series we are hoping to get on AMAZON, NETFLIX, HULU or any platform that will have us.

STORY: Patrick is a painter who must use his talent to try to save himself from a gangster and set his life straight.  

 Spilled Paint is a  TV Series we are hoping to get on AMAZON, NETFLIX, HULU or any platform that will have us.

STORY: Patrick is a painter who must use his talent to try to save himself from a gangster and set his life straight.  

Top (Brandon Gibson, Bronson Taylor), Bottom (Jaime Cline, Justine Renee)

Spilled paint is an original series based off of the previous work of the writer and Director Enock Dorestan. The short film of the same name has won awards and gained critical acclaim due to its strong cast and its gripping take on a familiar narrative. The series delves into the visceral underworld of a criminal art network ran by Ramirez without betraying the relatable and witty life of a struggling artist and his girlfriend. When the two worlds collide all hell breaks loose. 

The Film inspired the series

Genre: Comedy - Drama  

Running Time: 6 -30 min episodes

Language: English. 

 Country: USA

 

Spilled  Paint is a TV Series specifically at at AMAZON, NETFLIX & HULU, but  we'd like to fund it ourselves in an effort to maintain the integrity  and direction of the show.

STORY:

  Patrick,  a talented painter who is down on his luck, is looking for any way to  bounce back. After taking a $100,000 loan from a notorious mobster,  Patrick makes a colossal lapse in judgement. When he can't make good on  the money or the promises he made in time, the clock is ticking on his entire world, the woman he loves and his own life.

 

  In the pilot episode we are introduced to the key players Patrick, Helena, Ramirez and the  bodyguard. Then sets into motion the events which lead Patrick to accept a deal from Ramirez  that he can’t make good upon. Leading Ramirez to set Patrick the ultimatum of conjuring up  twenty grand a week or suffer the consequences. In the end, Patrick is hours away from the  deadline with nothing to show

Episode 101 (Completed. TBD Release Coming Soon)

Episode 102-106 ( In Development) 

 

MEET THE CREW:

Director: Brandon Gibson (NCIS, Black-ish, The Crazy Ones, Fresh off the Boat)

Top Image (Brandon Gibson in ABC's "Fresh off the Boat", Bottom (Brandon Gibson with Robin Williams in The Crazy Ones)

Producer: Beth Wheatley (Emmy Nominated, Eastsiders Netflix)

 

Writer: Jon Kohan & Brandon Gibson 

Director of Photography: Harry Aaron (Super Size Me 2)

Producer: Beth Wheatley (Emmy Nominated, Eastsiders Netflix)

Executive Producer: Enock Dorestan 

  TV Pilot - CAST:   Brandon Gibson ... Ramirez - Bronsonn Taylor ... Bodyguard - Justine Renee ... Helena -Lee Markham ... Beaten Man - Patrick Lemon ... Creepy Man -Jann Van Dyke  &Buzz Van Dyke ... Older Couple at Gallery  Stacy Gannon  MUA & ... Restaurant Patron 3 - Jamie B. Cline ... Patrick-  Be Edwards ... Kylie- Roger Greco  ... Buyer-  Douglas Neville ... Homeless Guy-  Doreen Stockwell ... Old Lady at Diner - Erik V. Garbus ... Art Gallery Attendee - Sarah Marshall ... Restaurant Patron 2 -  Ken Nesbit ... Art Gallery Attendee - Sara Hornberger  PA &... Restaurant Patron 4 -Giovanni Murro  ... Restaurant Patron 1 - Jenn Gannon MUA & ... Restaurant Patron - Laura Swindoll ... Restaurant Hostess-  Caleb Parkerson ... Kid - Nicolas Acuna ...  PA ,Restaurant Waiter & Valet  

WHAT IT WILL COST TO COMPLETE

EP. 101 (Completed) - Release: TBD Coming Soon 

EP. 102-106 (In Development) - Raising Funds to complete full series.

WHAT YOU WILL GET

Backers will have the opportunity to see the TV Series at the red carpet premiere, have exclusive sneak peaks of backstage photos and footage, IMDB Credits, walk-on roles, signed media, executive producer credits, original props and set pieces, and more. (See reward section for all of the options).

story:
Short Summary

Joe King & Domenic DeSantis created Pickle Pals Productions back in 2017. Since then, they have created sketches, animated shorts & a parody album! Due to your support on our previous project, Joe the Angel, we've gotten to the point where we are now making the full pilot episode! We're back again with another project: Out of Ctrl. With your continued support, we hope to have this low-budget anti-sitcom about a dysfunctional Esports team ready to present to the networks too! All funds will be allocated to funding the location fees, craft services and travel expenses for the crew! Come join us in making this project a reality!

What We Need & What You Get

Making a 30 minute pilot is expensive! We need to cover travel, crafts, location fees, equipment, props & that's not even including the time & energy that goes into prepping all of it! Your donations can really help alleviate some of stress from our shoulders. Anything helps!

In return, check out our perks list! We'll give shoutouts, ad-space, thanks, early access & more!

A majority of the funds will go towards renting out the house we will be filming in. The rest will be allocated to craft services, travel fees and props! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone might not be in the position to be able to donate. That's okay! If you'd like to help us out anyways please share this Indiegogo on social media! We'd super appreciate it!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Greville Henwood and I am the Founder and Owner of GroovyKids™ Yoga. Since 2004, we've been teaching kids yoga all over the world and  have trained over 1,000 teachers to teach our method. 

If yoga was available to them, kids would do it and their entire school experience would gain more balance.

We are shooting a full season of Yoga classes and every time you buy one, we'll gift a school somewhere. Gift the school half the year or the full year of classes!

  • Kids love movement and yoga and studies show that the benefits are not limited to bodies but also their minds.
  •  It's non competitive and non judgmental
  • Yoga relieves stress and provides tools for kids to help themselves
  • Our classes have meditations too!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We will spend every cent on screen time.

  • Using state of the art equipment and top professionals behind camera, we'll deliver  classes unique and compelling to kids.

We've put together some unique perks to help you help us help the kids!

If we don't reach our funding goal of the entire season, we will make as many as we possibly can with what we raise. 

The Impact

The Dalai Lama said if we teach kids to meditate, within one generation we will change the world. We think he's right. Everyone knows that kids have more stress, more pressure than ever before, so we've created something that helps.

Kids can learn things in a moment that they hold within for a lifetime. Our Shows are for all levels, all sizes, all backgrounds and all abilities. We teach life skills. Self acceptance, self awareness, and understanding. 

In 2014 we made the pilot GroovyKids Yoga Show and it has sold in over 25 countries across the world. We've had letters from parents who said "..my kids don't speak English and they didn't understand a word, but they did everything and they laughed a lot!"

We've seen kids everywhere delight in a fun and accessible yoga class that works them through a complete range of motion. From the ages of 4-10, we took four kids, two of whom had never even done yoga before, and we shot a live class. The joy and enthusiasm the kids had has inspired other kids all over the world.

 

Risks & Challenges

As with any project, there are risks. 

What if the kids watch it and don't do anything?

In my 13 years of teaching kids yoga I have come to realize that some kids learn visually, some by reading, some by listening and in fact, even when a child is watching something, they are learning something. We have seen children watch our class a few times before joining in. So we're confident that by offering something compelling and zippy, the children will at some point join in of their own accord.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We would love your help! We know that not everyone can contribute!

But you can still help and support us!

All you have to do is share this campaign. Help us find people who want to help kids!
