If we don't reach our funding goal of the entire season, we will make as many as we possibly can with what we raise. 

The Impact
The Dalai Lama said if we teach kids to meditate, within one generation we will change the world. We think he's right. Everyone knows that kids have more stress, more pressure than ever before, so we've created something that helps.
Kids can learn things in a moment that they hold within for a lifetime. Our Shows are for all levels, all sizes, all backgrounds and all abilities. We teach life skills. Self acceptance, self awareness, and understanding. 
In 2014 we made the pilot GroovyKids Yoga Show and it has sold in over 25 countries across the world. We've had letters from parents who said "..my kids don't speak English and they didn't understand a word, but they did everything and they laughed a lot!"
We've seen kids everywhere delight in a fun and accessible yoga class that works them through a complete range of motion. From the ages of 4-10, we took four kids, two of whom had never even done yoga before, and we shot a live class. The joy and enthusiasm the kids had has inspired other kids all over the world.
 

Risks & Challenges
As with any project, there are risks. 
What if the kids watch it and don't do anything?
In my 13 years of teaching kids yoga I have come to realize that some kids learn visually, some by reading, some by listening and in fact, even when a child is watching something, they are learning something. We have seen children watch our class a few times before joining in. So we're confident that by offering something compelling and zippy, the children will at some point join in of their own accord.
 

Other Ways You Can Help
We would love your help! We know that not everyone can contribute!
But you can still help and support us!
All you have to do is share this campaign. Help us find people who want to help kids!

story:
COMMUNE 

Right now we are saturated with politicized drama and global tensions in the media. I want to create a TV show that focuses on the positive actions being taken around the world. COMMUNE’S diverse and stunning locations will integrate visual storytelling while introducing concepts for cultivating resources from its environments such as an Urban Laboratory in Arizona, a spiritual retreat center in California, hand built dwellings in New Mexico, an artist compound in the High Desert, a tree house community in Bali, an “International City” in India, a monastery in China and a permaculture farm in Costa Rica.

For each episode, our core team will visit one location, documenting its architectural, agricultural, domestic and communal spaces. Coverage of workshops and new build outs will be part of the shoot schedule.

We will film discussions at communal meetings and conduct individual interviews. We will capture the synergy of recreational gatherings, people working outside and the therapeutic processes of herbal medicines and ceremonies.

 

COMMUNE TEAM

Betty Nguyen - Director / Creator

Director and Host Betty Nguyen spent three months at Arcosanti, Arizona in 2016 where she came up with the idea for COMMUNE. “Your consciousness feels amplified when you reside in an intimate setting. I’d like to show the world how people are living, differently. We need a positive show right now. I want to be the next Anthony Bourdain - but instead of celebrating chefs and food, I’d like to promote sustainability.

Nguyen demonstrates a unique talent as a documentary filmmaker, industry production designer, seasoned writer, magazine editor, DJ and memorable personality. She has been tapped for several television gigs before, including MTV’s Real World in San Francisco (‘93), hosting both a network travel series and an interview talk show. Nguyen served as a director at MTV’s Think Tank for four years. Her documentary short film about Vietnam, “Bestiary of Nam,” was screened at the SF International Asian Film Festival, Hong Kong Film Festival and was part of Miranda July’s short film series.

Nguyen also has a deep passion for music spanning all genres: she directed music videos for artful, post-punk band, Chicks on Speed (‘01) and her first DJ gig was for the opening of the London Film Co-Op (‘00). Soon after, she toured with Aphex Twin throughout the Middle East. Most recently, she DJed at the Venice Beach Art Auction (‘17) with the Arabian Prince, a founding member of rap group NWA and secretly, one hell of a great stop motion animator.

She published First Person Magazine for nine years interviewing artists and writing travel pieces. She also hosted radio show “Burden of Dreams II” on cable radio. Nguyen has lived in New York, San Francisco, Tokyo, Paris and London and has shot on location in Asia and Europe. She currently resides in Ojai, California.

Yuko Inatsuki  - Director of Photography + Editor

Yuko Inatsuki is the director of photography and editor for the COMMUNE trailer.  As a professional cinematographer and editor, her documentary credits include "Mrs. Judo" (2013) a feature length that celebrates a woman honored with the highest black belt in Judo and "We Are All Radioactive", an episodic documentary about a group of surfers and fishermen rallying to rebuild their community after the March 2011 earthquake and tsunami while dealing with the fear of radiation. ​S​he is passionate about documentary films which enable​s​ her to ​meet new people and discover the unknown world​. ​COMMUNE give​s​ her​ the ​opportunit​y​ to broaden her perspectives and share her talent.

Bozho Lasich  - Sound Mixer

Bozho is the founder and chief Engineer at PST Studios, San Francisco and worked as the Mixing Engineer for the COMMUNE trailer. He has been in several bands since the 90's and earned his chops working at Faultine Studios. I'm so pleased to be working with his amazing ear and cool sensibilities. 

​Jay Silverstein​ - Advisor

Special Thanks - Heather Mathews, Mason and Cheryl Cooper, Griffin Davis

 

The Impact

Each episode will inspire a narrative about contemporary community building and our abilities to transcend the human condition. We will reveal the quality of daily interactions and their transformation towards harmony, stability and balance. This campaign will fund the full pilot episode (24 minutes) for "COMMUNE" shooting on location for 10 days. Our ideal location for the pilot is at Auroville, India "an experimental town" with 120,000 residents that is economically independent with a successful volunteer-driven reforestation project, a "Fabric Village" where  organic cotton is grown along with plant-based dyes to make clothing for worldwide distribution and international pavilions where "men and women of all countries are able to live in peace and progressive harmony above all creeds, all politics and all nationalities". The Dalai Llama has described Auroville saying, "We are deeply impressed by the spiritual aim behind the building of an international city... The importance of the effort to achieve human unity and international cooperation by the creation of such a city cannot be overemphasized; nor can we neglect the immense benefit to be acquired from it."

Each episode will share an insider's perspective and insight into a very different site's hand-built architecture, sustainable agriculture practices, independent economies, day-to-day culture and infrastructure including coverage of special traditions and holistic healing.

All contributions are vital towards the production value of the pilot episode. The pilot episode is critical to demonstrating the full potential for the series to hopefully find its way towards television broadcast and national distribution. Everyone who contributes to this campaign receives a link to the pilot episode once it is completed. 

 

BUDGET

We are planning a two week shoot. We need to buy a boom mic ($400) and hire sound operator (3k). I would love to pay our small crew for their time and talent in planning, production and post production; Director, ($5k), DP, ($4k) Editor (2k), Sound Mix (2k) for their time  to get you the best  story, images and sound quality. We need a travel budget (air, ground, food, lodging for core three person crew to fly to India ($7k), a fixer for foreign sites (2k). The Pilot's location will be based on the success level of this campaign.

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use all funds raised to create a pilot at an intentional community in the United States. 

 

Networks

Please share this campaign directly with friends, on your social media and with organizations you know support sustainable practices. It is absolutely critical to the success of this Pilot and TV series to get the word out to as many people as possible. I hope that you can email this link to friends and colleagues in your network and on your social media. COMMUNE will help broaden our views on what contemporary culture looks like and bring inspiration to people wanting to live a more connected and conscious life!

 

TRAILER

I'm psyched to share our trailer with you. Yuko and I spent 9 days in Slab City as part of the "Sun Forts" project led by Adam Zeek where several artists from Portland, New Orleans, Los Angeles, San Francisco and Joshua Tree built a shelter from scavenged materials together and gave it away. Slab City is an off-grid site founded in the '60's for veterans and is now an area an unincorporated city where one can live and build rent-free. It is located behind Salvation Mountain in Southern California where an estimated 60 people live. There is a hot spring that serves as a communal bath and every Friday night there is an open mic night so folks can gather together to build community.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there! We’re the co-writers/directors of THE APPLICANT, a short film which you can watch below. For those of you who don’t know us, we’re friends and collaborators who have worked together since our days at USC Film School, on everything from short films to music videos and commercials. THE APPLICANT is the next step in our journey towards telling powerful, thrilling and thought-provoking stories.

The short:

We had such a positive response to the short (thank you, everyone!)-- it got us wondering if there was more of a story to tell. Once we sat down, we found there to be endless possibilities to explore the world that our characters are living in. How did Eric start doing what he does? Is he the only one? Where does he go from here? We got excited as we began to develop the intricate and nuanced world Eric lives in-- a world of questionable actions and immense power.

As a series, THE APPLICANT is a story of justice and redemption in a world where nothing is what it seems. It’s one part Bourne Identity, one part House of Cards.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re looking to raise $8,000 towards the production. While we did fund The Applicant short entirely on our own, unfortunately, we cannot fund the series ourselves. The $8,000 will be going towards our talented crew, camera equipment, lights, locations, permits, food, insurance and other production costs. We’ll be shooting over five days in a variety of locations that open up the world far beyond what you see in the short, and we’re eager to put every dollar up on screen!

We are also honored that our incredibly talented and a joy to work with crew will be joining us again. Our Director of Photography, Ana Amortegui, whose gorgeous visuals have been seen on TV shows such as Veep and most recently, Gente-fied, a web-series produced by America Ferrera that just premiered at Sundance.

Ana's reel: 

At this stage, we’ve already done a ton of preliminary work on the series, from writing the scripts to location scouting to 3D pre-viz and shots lists. Once we lock in the funding, we’ll hit the ground running. Our plan is to shoot the second week of May and have the series up online by the end of June, so you won’t have to wait long to see the finished product!

Combined with our own money and generous individuals like yourself, we will be able to make this series what it should be. If you’re unable to help financially at this time, consider passing this campaign along to someone you know. That could prove to be incredibly helpful too!

We appreciate every dollar, and that’s why we’ve created a broad range of perks for every level of contribution. Whether you’re interested in a social media shout out, a Blu-Ray, art from the series, or a signed slate, we have all kinds of fun rewards for you!

Perspectives artwork:

CAST UPDATE!

We're excited to be adding Tamra Meskimen to the cast! She'll be bringing her talents to a very important and mysterious character!

Risks & Challenges

With filming there's always risks. There are so many variables that can cause trouble between weather, traffic issues, scheduling conflicts, equipment failures etc. that the best way to deal with these is to anticipate and plan ahead. We and our crew have encountered all of these challenges and more over the years, and are well prepared to face them.

The Impact

It’s never been more important for filmmakers to create their own material, and we wouldn’t be coming to you if this wasn’t our most ambitious project to date.

THE APPLICANT packs the intrigue and twists of a blockbuster movie into a short series, and will be a powerful demonstration of our storytelling ability that builds off of what we did with the short film.

And for us, this is the beginning of an incredible journey that doesn’t stop here. In fact, we already have Season 2 all planned out. We’re excited to dive into the characters and deeply relevant themes of this series, and this first season can become the springboard to a much bigger world.

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE SHARE SHARE SHARE!

Plus, share!  Tell your friends, tell your family, tell the world!

Follow us and stuff!

Our Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/theapplicantmovie/

Our Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/theapplicantmovie2016

The Applicant IMDB: http://www.imdb.com/title/tt5891444   - If you enjoyed the short, rate it there!

Thank you.

story:
The Idea is for Co-Hosts Deanna and James to visit allegedly haunted locations in the Huronia region. They get a tour from an expert of the location and learn of it’s historical and haunted past. After hearing all the stories, they then embark on their own investigation of the premises and try to find evidence from the other side.

Whether you’re a paranormal fanatic or just really like hats this is a campaign you can get behind! Growing up in Penetang, James was always learning of hauntings and history in the area. The idea came to him over 10 years ago but is just coming to fruition now. After teaming up with The Midland Film Company and a rejected pitch by Bell FibeTV1 of another series it became apparent that the “Ghost Show” that James had thought of so many years before was ready for the world to see. Haunted Huronia was exactly what the network was looking for and gave the green light for a pilot episode. The pilot was so well received that the show was given the goahead on 8 more episodes. Thing is we have a very limited, shoestring budget and the episodes are not cheap to make. We are seeking your help to fund these 8 episodes and have added some really fun perks for your contributions. Always intrigued by the paranormal this show is a true dream project for James and the crew. Please help us continue this passion project.

His partner in hunting and in life is actor/producer Deanna Palazzo.   With over 2 decades in the acting business and a love for history, she brings the balance to the show.  

To round out the lot we have the resident skeptic director,editor and DOP Nate Lacroix to keep the camera rolling and keep us in the building ;)

 

The Believer

James Dalzell is an actor, producer, improviser and rapper. When he is not pursuing his passions you can probably see him at the Penetanguishene Beer Store supplying the locals with the tasty beverage or dealing poker at Casino Rama. James was born and raised in Penetang but moved to Toronto in 2006 to attend The Toronto Film School`s Acting for Film, Television and Theatre program. After graduating in 2008 he hit the ground running. For the past 10 years he has been booking bit parts in film, television, commercials and was a regular in the Toronto comedy scene. He is thrilled to be back home in Penetang and working with some like minded and hard working talents. Always intrigued by the rich history and haunting stories of the area, it has been a dream of his to capture and share these stories with the world. Some notable credits include Howie Do It, Surviving Evil, Paranormal Survivor, Close Encounters, Motives and Murders and Web of Lies.

The On The Fencer

Deanna L. Palazzo is a Toronto born actor, producer and improviser. She is a graduate of the Second City Conservatory Program and also holds a BaH in English and Theatre Studies from The University of Guelph.  Just over 2 years ago, not long after she was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes, Deanna and Jamie packed their bags and started their second chapter of their lives in North Simcoe and they haven't looked back.  Teaming up with Nate Lacroix and Midland Film Company Inc. as well as their colleagues from the Award Winning Good Morning Apocalypse, they are continuing to prove that there are stories to be told all over the map! Though she continues to commute back to Toronto for auditions and gigs, Haunted Huronia has allowed her to continue to fall in love with the history of this incredible county.  She is now the mother of an incredible little guy who continues to inspire her daily!  Notable stage acting credits include: Mr. Everything (Huronia Players), Looking (Nominated for Best Supporting Actor ACT-CO) Milton Players, Marion Bridge (D&T Productions), Off the Hook (p(a)), Crime Scene (p(a)), Twisted Elegance (p(a) &Upstage Productions), The Dinner (Upstage Productions), Some Play (Emsdale Productions) and A Crack in the Ceiling (p(a)).  Notable tv/film credits include: This Mortal Coil (Half Price Indie Films), Evil Encounters (Cream Productions), Paranormal Survivor (Cream Productions) , The Beast  (Good Morning Apocalypse) and Giving You The Business (The Food Network).  She recently served as the host on a web series focused on Type 1 Diabetes & Pregnancy with the Type 1 Diabetes Think Tank.

The Skeptic

Nate Lacroix is a filmmaker and photographer from Midland, Ontario. Nate’s passion for filmmaking began in high school when a Communications Technology course allowed him the opportunity to produce his own short films and music videos. He took that passion to Sheridan College in Oakville, Ontario where he studied Media Arts and later worked for Blackwalk Productions in Toronto before returning to his hometown to start a family. After a number of years working for Renegade Digital, a video production company in Barrie, Nate decided to embark on his own and created Midland Film Club. Through Midland Film Club Nate has produced hundreds of short films in and around his community, including a music video starring Noah Cappe (“Bachelorette Canada,” “Carnival Eats,” “The Good Witch”) for “Born Losers,” a song by Canadian recording artist, Matthew Good. In 2013 Nate completed an award-winning feature-length documentary titled “Start Local,” about the importance of supporting local, that has been featured in numerous film festivals and is frequently broadcast on RogersTV.

Nate continues to live in Midland and is currently pursuing numerous film projects.

 

Who is Midland Film Company?

Midland Film Co. a small group of passionate filmmakers who are driven to create engaging films that resonate with their audiences. We’ve applied our talents to nearly every type of film, from corporate videos and marketing films, to quirky music videos, dramatic short films, and thought-provoking documentaries. Our story begins in 2007, when a young filmmaker, working as an editor at a corporate video production company in Barrie, decided it was time to pursue his dream of starting his own production company. He called it Kunu, a reference to a film he liked, and he began his journey. Slowly but surely he started becoming more known throughout the community. By 2012 he had begun connecting with others in the community who wanted to be involved in films and filmmaking. That’s when Kunu rebranded as Midland Film Club. The idea was to bring people together who wanted to create films, and support each other in creating them. To make films in our community, about our community, and celebrating our community. The culmination of which came in 2015 with the release of the feature length documentary, “Start Local.” The film gave us a deeper look at our community, showing what it means to be “local.” For the company, it was the catalyst for the final name change to Midland Film Company Inc., and a fresh look at what the company was all about. Since then several of our films have won awards from film festivals and national institutions including Toronto Beaches Film Festival, FilmRacing.com, and Economic Developers Association of Canada, among others.

The man behind Midland Film Company is Nate Lacroix, a filmmaker who was born and raised in Midland and Penetanguishene, went away to film school in Oakville, lived in Toronto for a couple of years, and returned home to start a video revolution.  He is joined by James Dalzell and Deanna Palazzo, a husband-wife team who are both actors, producers, and motivating leaders.  Together they all bring their passions for film and storytelling to the next level, and have produced a number of award-winning films together.

Now it’s time for us to tackle our next big project. Haunted Huronia.

 

What is Haunted Huronia?

Haunted Huronia is a show that dives into historic locations in the Huronia region and explores their haunted past. Hosts James Dalzell and Deanna Palazzo share interviews and tours with the location experts and investigate the premises themselves to see if they can find proof of any life on the other side.

The show is directed, filmed and edited by award-winning filmmaker, Nate Lacroix. Interestingly, Nate is skeptic of the group. Although he may not believe in ghosts (yet) he brings a unique balance to the show while still presenting an authentic ghost investigating experience.

Rounding out the team is our on-set hair stylist and make-up artist, Erika Lacroix, whose lifelong interest in the paranormal has turned out to be quite valuable on investigations. And another talented, young filmmaker by the name of Eamonn O'Connell, who, in addition to bringing his own technical prowess to the production team, offers us his unique perspective during investigations.

 

Ok so..

We need your help!  Producing our episodes requires funding in order for us to bring our viewers the best quality. You wanna see more...we wanna make more! By helping us reach our goal you will help us share our incredible communities with all of Canada!  With your contributions we will be able to cover our costs for insurance, labour, cost of our locations, transportation, equipment and more!  Our perks range from shout outs on our various social media platforms to VIP treatment at our events to appearances on one of our episodes to being labeled Executive Producer of an Episode! Can’t get much cooler than that!

Even if we are unable to reach our goal, our funds will help us recoup some of our costs from the episodes we have shot thus far so any contribution helps and will be so very appreciated

As mentioned above, MFC is an award winning production company so you can trust that the project you are supporting will be something you are proud of and will want to share!

We have already had so much fun on our journey with Haunted Huronia and we would love to share the ride with you!!!

Can’t contribute financially, NO PROBLEM! We would love for you to spread the word about our show through social media, word of mouth and tell your pals to check it out on Bell FibeTV1 OnDemand!

 

Don’t have Bell and wanna see more? Wanna show your friends what you are supporting? Join us on Devil’s Night in Penetanguishene Ontario as we have our LIVE Premiere of Episode 1 of Haunted Huronia where we feature the historic Penetanguishene Centennial Museum as well as some other exciting performances, screenings of our upcoming trailers and more!

Facebook @HauntedHuronia

Twitter @HauntedHuronia

Instagram @HauntedHuronia

 

***** LIMITED TIME*****

Wanna see what all the fuss is about? What you would be putting your cash, love and support behind?

Click here to watch EPISODE ONE!
story_txt: The Idea is for Co-Hosts Deanna and James to visit allegedly haunted locations in the Huronia region. They get a tour from an expert of the location and learn of it’s historical and haunted past. After hearing all the stories, they then embark on their own investigation of the premises and try to find evidence from the other side.Whether you’re a paranormal fanatic or just really like hats this is a campaign you can get behind! Growing up in Penetang, James was always learning of hauntings and history in the area. The idea came to him over 10 years ago but is just coming to fruition now. After teaming up with The Midland Film Company and a rejected pitch by Bell FibeTV1 of another series it became apparent that the “Ghost Show” that James had thought of so many years before was ready for the world to see. Haunted Huronia was exactly what the network was looking for and gave the green light for a pilot episode. The pilot was so well received that the show was given the goahead on 8 more episodes. Thing is we have a very limited, shoestring budget and the episodes are not cheap to make. We are seeking your help to fund these 8 episodes and have added some really fun perks for your contributions. Always intrigued by the paranormal this show is a true dream project for James and the crew. Please help us continue this passion project.His partner in hunting and in life is actor/producer Deanna Palazzo.   With over 2 decades in the acting business and a love for history, she brings the balance to the show.  To round out the lot we have the resident skeptic director,editor and DOP Nate Lacroix to keep the camera rolling and keep us in the building ;) The BelieverJames Dalzell is an actor, producer, improviser and rapper. When he is not pursuing his passions you can probably see him at the Penetanguishene Beer Store supplying the locals with the tasty beverage or dealing poker at Casino Rama. James was born and raised in Penetang but moved to Toronto in 2006 to attend The Toronto Film School`s Acting for Film, Television and Theatre program. After graduating in 2008 he hit the ground running. For the past 10 years he has been booking bit parts in film, television, commercials and was a regular in the Toronto comedy scene. He is thrilled to be back home in Penetang and working with some like minded and hard working talents. Always intrigued by the rich history and haunting stories of the area, it has been a dream of his to capture and share these stories with the world. Some notable credits include Howie Do It, Surviving Evil, Paranormal Survivor, Close Encounters, Motives and Murders and Web of Lies.The On The FencerDeanna L. Palazzo is a Toronto born actor, producer and improviser. She is a graduate of the Second City Conservatory Program and also holds a BaH in English and Theatre Studies from The University of Guelph.  Just over 2 years ago, not long after she was diagnosed with Type 1 Diabetes, Deanna and Jamie packed their bags and started their second chapter of their lives in North Simcoe and they haven't looked back.  Teaming up with Nate Lacroix and Midland Film Company Inc. as well as their colleagues from the Award Winning Good Morning Apocalypse, they are continuing to prove that there are stories to be told all over the map! Though she continues to commute back to Toronto for auditions and gigs, Haunted Huronia has allowed her to continue to fall in love with the history of this incredible county.  She is now the mother of an incredible little guy who continues to inspire her daily!  Notable stage acting credits include: Mr. Everything (Huronia Players), Looking (Nominated for Best Supporting Actor ACT-CO) Milton Players, Marion Bridge (D&T Productions), Off the Hook (p(a)), Crime Scene (p(a)), Twisted Elegance (p(a) &Upstage Productions), The Dinner (Upstage Productions), Some Play (Emsdale Productions) and A Crack in the Ceiling (p(a)).  Notable tv/film credits include: This Mortal Coil (Half Price Indie Films), Evil Encounters (Cream Productions), Paranormal Survivor (Cream Productions) , The Beast  (Good Morning Apocalypse) and Giving You The Business (The Food Network).  She recently served as the host on a web series focused on Type 1 Diabetes & Pregnancy with the Type 1 Diabetes Think Tank.The SkepticNate Lacroix is a filmmaker and photographer from Midland, Ontario. Nate’s passion for filmmaking began in high school when a Communications Technology course allowed him the opportunity to produce his own short films and music videos. He took that passion to Sheridan College in Oakville, Ontario where he studied Media Arts and later worked for Blackwalk Productions in Toronto before returning to his hometown to start a family. After a number of years working for Renegade Digital, a video production company in Barrie, Nate decided to embark on his own and created Midland Film Club. Through Midland Film Club Nate has produced hundreds of short films in and around his community, including a music video starring Noah Cappe (“Bachelorette Canada,” “Carnival Eats,” “The Good Witch”) for “Born Losers,” a song by Canadian recording artist, Matthew Good. In 2013 Nate completed an award-winning feature-length documentary titled “Start Local,” about the importance of supporting local, that has been featured in numerous film festivals and is frequently broadcast on RogersTV.Nate continues to live in Midland and is currently pursuing numerous film projects. Who is Midland Film Company?Midland Film Co. a small group of passionate filmmakers who are driven to create engaging films that resonate with their audiences. We’ve applied our talents to nearly every type of film, from corporate videos and marketing films, to quirky music videos, dramatic short films, and thought-provoking documentaries. Our story begins in 2007, when a young filmmaker, working as an editor at a corporate video production company in Barrie, decided it was time to pursue his dream of starting his own production company. He called it Kunu, a reference to a film he liked, and he began his journey. Slowly but surely he started becoming more known throughout the community. By 2012 he had begun connecting with others in the community who wanted to be involved in films and filmmaking. That’s when Kunu rebranded as Midland Film Club. The idea was to bring people together who wanted to create films, and support each other in creating them. To make films in our community, about our community, and celebrating our community. The culmination of which came in 2015 with the release of the feature length documentary, “Start Local.” The film gave us a deeper look at our community, showing what it means to be “local.” For the company, it was the catalyst for the final name change to Midland Film Company Inc., and a fresh look at what the company was all about. Since then several of our films have won awards from film festivals and national institutions including Toronto Beaches Film Festival, FilmRacing.com, and Economic Developers Association of Canada, among others.The man behind Midland Film Company is Nate Lacroix, a filmmaker who was born and raised in Midland and Penetanguishene, went away to film school in Oakville, lived in Toronto for a couple of years, and returned home to start a video revolution.  He is joined by James Dalzell and Deanna Palazzo, a husband-wife team who are both actors, producers, and motivating leaders.  Together they all bring their passions for film and storytelling to the next level, and have produced a number of award-winning films together.Now it’s time for us to tackle our next big project. Haunted Huronia. What is Haunted Huronia?Haunted Huronia is a show that dives into historic locations in the Huronia region and explores their haunted past. Hosts James Dalzell and Deanna Palazzo share interviews and tours with the location experts and investigate the premises themselves to see if they can find proof of any life on the other side.The show is directed, filmed and edited by award-winning filmmaker, Nate Lacroix. Interestingly, Nate is skeptic of the group. Although he may not believe in ghosts (yet) he brings a unique balance to the show while still presenting an authentic ghost investigating experience.Rounding out the team is our on-set hair stylist and make-up artist, Erika Lacroix, whose lifelong interest in the paranormal has turned out to be quite valuable on investigations. And another talented, young filmmaker by the name of Eamonn O'Connell, who, in addition to bringing his own technical prowess to the production team, offers us his unique perspective during investigations. Ok so..We need your help!  Producing our episodes requires funding in order for us to bring our viewers the best quality. You wanna see more...we wanna make more! By helping us reach our goal you will help us share our incredible communities with all of Canada!  With your contributions we will be able to cover our costs for insurance, labour, cost of our locations, transportation, equipment and more!  Our perks range from shout outs on our various social media platforms to VIP treatment at our events to appearances on one of our episodes to being labeled Executive Producer of an Episode! Can’t get much cooler than that!Even if we are unable to reach our goal, our funds will help us recoup some of our costs from the episodes we have shot thus far so any contribution helps and will be so very appreciatedAs mentioned above, MFC is an award winning production company so you can trust that the project you are supporting will be something you are proud of and will want to share!We have already had so much fun on our journey with Haunted Huronia and we would love to share the ride with you!!!Can’t contribute financially, NO PROBLEM! We would love for you to spread the word about our show through social media, word of mouth and tell your pals to check it out on Bell FibeTV1 OnDemand! Don’t have Bell and wanna see more? Wanna show your friends what you are supporting? Join us on Devil’s Night in Penetanguishene Ontario as we have our LIVE Premiere of Episode 1 of Haunted Huronia where we feature the historic Penetanguishene Centennial Museum as well as some other exciting performances, screenings of our upcoming trailers and more!Facebook @HauntedHuroniaTwitter @HauntedHuroniaInstagram @HauntedHuronia ***** LIMITED TIME*****Wanna see what all the fuss is about? story:
Our Pilot Landed to Applause


Check out our pilot episode right here!

 "I certainly expect a lot of funny and interesting stories to come out of this funny little series as it continues.​" - Hollywood North Magazine

We self-funded a 30-minute pilot as proof of concept for the show. It's a pilot that won awards for the cast and crew, at various festivals around North America. We used that pilot to market the show to networks, streaming video-on-demand sites, and even some individual production partners and a TV station. But these groups wanted to see more than our pilot, pitch documents, and a series bible with future script outlines. 

So, as a team, we realized: "We're visual artists, if those interested parties want more, let's show them with a web series." 

  • With a web series, we can not only better market our show, but continue to build a further audience base for the full 30-minute series.
  • A web series can be produced easily, especially as the sets, crew and cast already exist.
  • And have you seen our cast? Read about them below.
  • We're ready to do this, and we will. Everything's set to go - all that's missing is your support.
  • Our producers have created shows before, on budget and to streaming services, so have a full sense of where and how to place a web series. Really, read on.

We've Done Series Television Before, We've Had Success

Our production team has produced such shows as
Kid's Town


2nd Generation.

The Game Plan

We are in the process of producing 10 new, ten-minute episodes to follow up on the pilot, which itself will be split into two parts to provide for a 12 episode series.

Our budget for the pilot was $30,000, fully paid by the production company; our additional episodes will be produced for a budget of $175,000 (CDN).  The financing will come through a combination of production company investment, private third-party investment, tax credits, potential funding through the Independent Production Fund, and from people like you through this campaign.

Production will take place over 20 shooting days during June 2018 in Oakville, Ontario, Canada, predominantly at Film.Ca Cinemas, and at a number of other locations in the immediate area.

And, we realize that audiences don’t just show up on the first day, so funds are budgeted for paid social media advertising to target our core audience. This will include short videos, gifs, Instagram-stickers and photos from the show.

Additionally, we have social media accounts for our fictional entities Cinema Six and MegaFilmPlex on Twitter, as well as Facebook Business Pages.  Using these accounts and websites, we will create a narrative outside of the show itself to build their identities and generate consumer curiosity. MegaFilmPlex will market their superior corporate promotions, while Cinema Six will brand themselves as the better choice with plucky humor. Using new graphics and some video captured during filming, social media will grow the personalities of the theatres, as they constantly snipe back and forth - before, during, and after release of the series.

The Long Game

Producing the show is just one component of the process of developing a successful show. Finding an audience and the right platform from which to exhibit it is just as critical.  By producing a pilot, we already understand our audience, and confirm that there is a genuine interest in the show.  We took an unusual route to publicly release our pilot on several platforms including YouTube, Facebook & Amazon Prime, and amassed almost 50,000 views we have used to understand both our target audience, and what exhibition platforms are best for us.

The good news is that we already have a home for our series, Amazon Prime and Vimeo Video on Demand are ready to go when we are.  Both these platforms provide a revenue stream we can use to seed a second season.  In addition, we have an ongoing relationship with two major distributors/aggregators - Juice International and Film Hub - and through these companies we will be able to secure additional monetized platforms such as iTunes, Hoopla, Overdrive and  more.

               

We also have a unique angle on building an audience. Operators of independent cinemas are a tight-knit group of business people who share common issues and stories, as well as a common enemy in multiplex cinemas. We will be reaching out to these cinemas to leverage their audiences for our show through cross-promotions, screenings of our episodes before their feature presentations (like the serials of a bygone era), mailings and/or social media interactions to their audience base. This partnership will drive audiences to online platforms to watch the series, and interact with the online personalities of Cinema Six and MegaFilmPlex.

Support the Theatre, From Your Couch

Hey, not everyone has the money for cool perks right away, but you can still help:

  • Share our pilot video with your friends.
  • Boost our project on social media.
  • Send our Indiegogo link to people who might be able to help.
  • Promote artisanally-crafted television projects (we were told it was hip to call ourselves that). 

Share and mention this project across your social media platforms and, as we see your impact, we'll send a little something your way, too.

Meet the Cast of Coming Distractions


Our cast are all professional performers and members of the Toronto Branch of ACTRA (Alliance of Canadian Cinema, Television and Radio Artists)

FELICIA SIMONE

Role: Rebecca

Felicia Simone is an actress, singer and dancer. Born and raised in Edmonton Alberta, she attended an arts school where she studied theatre, dance and did competitive cheer-leading. Felicia now resides in Ontario where she continues to work and train. She has been a professional cheerleader for 5 years, and recently acquired her Pharmacy Technician license.

IMDB

DAVID HUBAND

Role: David Darvis

David Huband was born in Winnipeg, Manitoba, Canada. He is an actor and writer, known for Cinderella Man (2005), Cube Zero (2004) and Wrong Turn (2003).

IMDB

MATHEW EDMONDSON

Role: Jordan

Mathew Edmondson is an actor, known for Group Home (2016), 2nd Generation (2016) and Lost & Found Music Studios (2015).

IMDB

JUSTIN MADER

Role: Andrew

Justin Mader is an actor and writer, known for Room (2015), Death Race (2008) and The Unauthorized Full House Story (2015).

IMDB

SOFIE HOLLAND

Role: Sunny

Sofie Holland is an actress and producer, known for Reign (2013), Coming Distractions (2017) and 2nd Generation (2016).
IMDB

TORRI WEBSTER

Role: Haley

Torri Webster is an actress, known for Life with Boys (2011), The Town Christmas Forgot (2010) and Jesus Henry Christ (2011).
IMDB

Nathan McLeod

Role: Herbert

Nathan McLeod grew up  in small town Airdrie, Alberta.  At the age of 9 moving to Toronto gave him the opportunities he wanted to be able to start an acting career. Nathan booked over a dozen commercials, has been a series lead and special guest in several television shows and movies, starred in over 8 Musicals and is best known for his role as Gabe Foster in Life With Boys (2011-2013). 

IMDB

Berkley Silverman

Role: Isobel

Berkley Silverman is an actress, known for PAW Patrol (2013), The Detail (2018) and Coming Distractions (2017).

IMDB

David Webster

Role: Frank

David Webster is an actor, known for Extracurricular, Cardinal (2017) and Condor (2018).

IMDB

The Production Team

Jeff Knoll  - Producer and Co-Creator

 

Jeff Knoll is a Canadian producer of film and television/new media content. In addition to his work in production, Knoll is an elected member of his Town and Regional Municipal Councils and the CEO of a local 5-screen first run movie theatre. Jeff has been working in movie theatres and making films since he was 13. Now 52, Jeff acts as Executive Producer/Showrunner for his own productions most recently (Kid's Town in 2013 and Coming Distractions in 2017) as well as for other production companies (2nd Generation 2016, Walking on Sunshine 2016/7). Jeff is a member of the Canadian Media Producers Association (CMPA) and the Canadian Academy of Cinema & Television.

IMDB

  
 

Marc Reyer Grant - Writer and Co-Creator

 

Marc has been writing for as long as he could work a typewriter, in his adult life: as a documentarian for the Manitoba Indigenous Cultural Education Centre, stringer at the Winnipeg Sun, Senior Writer for Foster/Marks Advertising, Communications Director at CBC, and Creative Director for Ottawa’s Bytown Group. Marc now works in politics, while maintaining work in freelance marketing, ghost writing and scriptwriting. He also moonlights at a local movie theatre, despite the abuse.

IMDB 

Mikelle Virey - Director

Mikelle Virey was born in Ottawa, Canada, the eldest of two children. Mikelle graduated from the University of Toronto with a double-major in Theatre Performance and Classics and Sheridan College's Advanced Television and Film program.

After a few years acting in theatre and films, Mikelle decided to pursue his love for story even further and made the jump to directing. After graduating from Sheridan College he has directed several shorts and also the award winning web-series Kid's Town.  Recently, Mikelle has directed the upcoming teen drama "2nd Generation" and comedy pilot "Coming Distractions".

IMDB

story:
Who We Are

Elephant Dept. is an online sketch comedy channel that develops and distributes original short form content across YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, and Funny or Die. Established as a vehicle for the enhancement of the ensemble's careers, we currently feature a cast and crew of twenty that takes content from concept to completion in seven days for distribution across our media platforms. We started posting on January 8th, 2018 and, as of March 30th, our content has been viewed over 64,000 times across our platforms. In our first season, we have released sixty-three sketches (as of 03/30) and are on pace to reach our goal of one hundred by the end of USC's Spring Semester. We are currently operating with no budget and receiving no outside support.

The Team

Andrew Teplitz & David Philip Fishman

Andrew (Founder/Executive Producer) and David (Associate Producer) met on a USC Welcome Week tour in 2014 and are graduating together in May with Bachelors of Fine Arts in Acting.

The Writer's Room

(From left to right): Andrew Teplitz, Antonio Chicco, Lila Smith, David Fishman, Samantha Dammeyer, Maya Tellez, Sidne Phillips, Camron Jones, Marc Hills, Rachel Mathieu, Aubrey Rhodes, Christie Griffin, Jens Sweaney, Brandon Warfield  (Not pictured: Nelson Baquerizo, Sabrina Malekzadah, Kendall Green, Savannah Harrow)

Comprised mostly of BFA Actors and BA Theater majors in their senior year, our writers meet once a week to pitch new sketch ideas and workshop existing scripts. As scripts are written and revised, a small team works with writers individually to further develop their script until it is ready to produce.

Production

Pre-production for Season Two will begin on April 30th and will include a workshop phase, a live show, and a week for test footage. Production will occur between June and September on a weekly basis with a seven day hiatus at the end of July. We will release three pieces of content every week: two sketches and one episodic segment. All of our content will be prioritized for YouTube and will be between two to five minutes in length. By the end of the season we will release forty-eight pieces of content across our various distribution platforms with the opportunity to release more as the production schedule sees fit.

Budget

It is our hope to raise between $3500-$4000. Roughly 75% of our funds will go towards upgrading our equipment as we produce the show with personally owned cameras, sound, lighting, and editing software. The rest of our funding (~25%) will go towards marketing our content across social and traditional media as well as hosting fees for an Elephant Dept. website to better develop our online presence.

Impact

Season 1 has proved our ability to create strong content at a breakneck pace with zero outside support. Developing content for online formats is something we are extremely passionate about and any contribution to our campaign will allow us to further develop our skills and bring them to the next level. Our production family has grown so quickly in just a few short months and extending that reach to you would mean the world to us.

Other Ways You Can Help

Subscribe to our YouTube channel:
https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGzRwxpZwcbypL...

Like us on Facebook:
https://www.facebook.com/ElephantDept

Follow us on Instagram: 
https://www.instagram.com/elephantdept/
story_txt:
Who We Are
Elephant Dept. is an online sketch comedy channel that develops and distributes original short form content across YouTube, Facebook, Instagram, and Funny or Die. Established as a vehicle for the enhancement of the ensemble's careers, we currently feature a cast and crew of twenty that takes content from concept to completion in seven days for distribution across our media platforms. We started posting on January 8th, 2018 and, as of March 30th, our content has been viewed over 64,000 times across our platforms. In our first season, we have released sixty-three sketches (as of 03/30) and are on pace to reach our goal of one hundred by the end of USC's Spring Semester. We are currently operating with no budget and receiving no outside support.
The Team

Andrew Teplitz & David Philip Fishman
Andrew (Founder/Executive Producer) and David (Associate Producer) met on a USC Welcome Week tour in 2014 and are graduating together in May with Bachelors of Fine Arts in Acting.
The Writer's Room

(From left to right): Andrew Teplitz, Antonio Chicco, Lila Smith, David Fishman, Samantha Dammeyer, Maya Tellez, Sidne Phillips, Camron Jones, Marc Hills, Rachel Mathieu, Aubrey Rhodes, Christie Griffin, Jens Sweaney, Brandon Warfield  (Not pictured: Nelson Baquerizo, Sabrina Malekzadah, Kendall Green, Savannah Harrow)
Comprised mostly of BFA Actors and BA Theater majors in their senior year, our writers meet once a week to pitch new sketch ideas and workshop existing scripts. As scripts are written and revised, a small team works with writers individually to further develop their script until it is ready to produce.

Production
Pre-production for Season Two will begin on April 30th and will include a workshop phase, a live show, and a week for test footage. Production will occur between June and September on a weekly basis with a seven day hiatus at the end of July. We will release three pieces of content every week: two sketches and one episodic segment. All of our content will be prioritized for YouTube and will be between two to five minutes in length. By the end of the season we will release forty-eight pieces of content across our various distribution platforms with the opportunity to release more as the production schedule sees fit.
Budget

It is our hope to raise between $3500-$4000. Roughly 75% of our funds will go towards upgrading our equipment as we produce the show with personally owned cameras, sound, lighting, and editing software. The rest of our funding (~25%) will go towards marketing our content across social and traditional media as well as hosting fees for an Elephant Dept. website to better develop our online presence.
Impact
Season 1 has proved our ability to create strong content at a breakneck pace with zero outside support. Developing content for online formats is something we are extremely passionate about and any contribution to our campaign will allow us to further develop our skills and bring them to the next level. Our production family has grown so quickly in just a few short months and extending that reach to you would mean the world to us.

Other Ways You Can Help
Subscribe to our YouTube channel:https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGzRwxpZwcbypL...
Like us on Facebook:https://www.facebook.com/ElephantDept
Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/elephantdept/

story:
Meet the Creators: 

Husband and wife duo, Fred Evans and Jana` Chantel, created the script for Fault:Gamma two years ago. They first became inspired by the Fukushima nuclear meltdown. Along with that idea, they entered a script writing contest that wanted to focus on diversity with women in strong technology backgrounds. Thus creating Fault: Gamma.  

This project is very important because it not only shows diverse, strong women, but it also educates the way technology is used in everyday life. With the continues growth of technology and the lack of visual entertainment, we want to educate how technology can be utilize on a deeper level. So we wrote this show in the hopes of breaking down advanced technology in a way that everyone can understand.

What We Need & What You Get

To fully fund this project we will need $20,000. The money will go towards paying our cast and crew, equipment, VFX (visual effects), props, food, and more.

The pie chart below shows how much of the funds will go to certain areas.

The Perks

Your donations will not go unnoticed! We have some great perks for those who donate. Our perks includes:

  • Social Media Shout Out.
  • Special Thank You Credit.
  • Custom T-shirt.
  • A Signed Poster and Script.
  • A Day on Set.
  • A Role as an Extra.
  • Exclusive Digital Content.
  • Digital Soundtrack
  • Concept Art and Storyboards
  • Invite to Private Viewing.
  • Executive Producer Credit.

The Impact

Fault Gamma adds value to the education of technology. Whether it it is used as a tool, or weapon, the purpose is to teach you how technology can be used/manipulated, therefore you can keep that resource to help you in everyday life, or prevent an attack from the reality of hackers. 

Risks & Challenges

Some of the risk involved includes the lack of adequate props and equipment. Without the funds, we impose the challenge of not having the right polish for the film. Whether it’s affording the right lenses,  treatment for acoustics, or props for set designing and green-screen. These lack of items make our job tougher in post, and could lead to re-shoots, or ADR (automated dialog replacement) for voice-overs.

Although we are experienced with getting the best quality with no-to-little budget, being properly funded will help us avoid these obstacles

Meet Some of the Cast

 Jillian Craighead as Terri Graham. Jillian Diane Craighead was born and   raised in Detroit Michigan. She graduated from the Detroit School of Arts   with a major in Radio & Television. Jillian has taken one year of BFA Acting at   Michigan State University but has returned home to attend a conservatory   Acting School. She has landed roles in: The Girls Bathroom, A Raisin in the   Sun, Macbeth, The Time and even worked as a stand in for Comedy Central’s   Detroiters. Her most recent role was in a pilot episode for a brand new   Reality  TV show called Street Cred written by Sultan Sharrief. Currently Jillian is documenting her acting career on her YouTube Channel where she spreads acting advice for other inspiring actors.

 

Chris Ewing as Martin Vessor. Chris Ewing is a Michigan based actor, working in Film, TV, Commercial, Stage, Voice-over, and industrial work. His playable age range is 18-40 and is adept at accessing all areas of believable emotion. He has been married to his amazingly supportive wife - Katelyn - since 2006, and the pair have 3 wonderful kids together. Chris is a Journeyman level welder/fabricator and holds an Associate Degree in "Plant Maintenance Trades."

 

 Molly Gibson as Maria Hayes.

Born and raised in Metro Detroit, Molly Gibson has been acting for 10+ years, having begun in musical and competitive theater throughout grade school and high school, and then going on to earn two Associate degrees at Oakland Community College in Liberal Arts and General Studies, respectively. She has trained and still studies at The Actor's Loft in Royal Oak, Michigan, with Emmy-nominated instructors, and does private coaching with various local and LA-based actors and coaches. She recently performed as a Taylor Swift tribute artist at Canobie Lake Park this past fall and has also done stand-in work for Comedy Central's Detroiters. Her commercial credits include Ford Motor Company, Financial Plus Credit Union, and MLILY mattresses, to name a few. Some of her recent and upcoming film credits include, Demon Child, It's A Life Worth Living, and Liz.

Carol Towns as Julia Rockford. Carol Towns is a multifaceted actress, voice-over artist and model. She started her journey in 2009 when a church member asked her to host a reality TV show called The I  Do Wedding Show. From there she’s done stage plays such as: Ain’t Too Proud to Beg, Danger at my Door, and I Need a Man. She has also been in films such as The Ghost of Saint Aubin and Why do Men Cheat? She was a guest star on the Detroit local TV20 sitcom Because We're Men and landed a feature role on the nationally syndicated Television show Empire. Carol is currently cast to film a few shorts, a feature film and a TV series. She is a member of Alpha Kappa Alpha Sorority, Inc. She enjoys spending her free time with daughter, granddaughter, family, sorority sisters and her dog, a loving Coton de Tulear.

 

 Walter Fahoome as Alex Rockford. Walter Sonny Fahoome is ten   years  old and attends Summit Academy North Elementary. This is his   first year being a member of the National Elementary Honor Society. He   participates in are travel baseball, Saturday morning youth bowling   league, and golf. He lives with his parents on their 10-acre ranch where   he also helps tend to their two horse as well as our barn cats and house dogs. He was the master of ceremony for the stage play Jesus Hopped the A Train for three weeks. He also competed in his school’s talent and poetry competition.

 

Louis Martinez as Colin Whitman. Louis Martinez is a professional actor from Bronx, NY. Louis has landed roles in TV shows such as Law and Order, Orange is the New Black, Bull, and Madam Secretary. After taking a four-year break to get a degree in Theatre from Shaw University in North Carolina, Louis was part of an educational Theatre company called the Creative Arts Team that used Theatre as a method to address social issues. The work that Louis is most proud of is the film Exposed, where he worked along side Keanu Reeves and the Detroit based TV pilot called The Inner Circle.

 

 Samantha Lillian as Heather Douglas. Samantha Lillian is originally from   Goderich, Ontario, and currently resides in Windsor, Ontario. She started   singing before she could talk and was raised with a love for musicals and   fairytales. Samantha began her studies in the University of Windsor BFA   Acting program and switched into and graduated from BA(H) Drama in   Education & the Community in 2013. She pursued teaching since, but has   recently discovered that her true passion lies in the performing arts, and is   now aspiring to be a professional actress! She has been in multiple community theatre shows in Windsor and Goderich, including: Company with Kordazone Theatre, Beauty and the Beast with Windsor Light, Super Duper Ultra Girl with Rob Tymec, The Bolt House with Windsor Feminist Theatre, Jekyll & Hyde with Cardinal Music, and Anything Goes with Goderich Little Theatre. She has also played various Princesses with Weekend Royalty and the Magic Closet, and has starred in multiple student films at Wayne State University and University of Windsor.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? We understand. Help us by spreading the word!

  • Follow us on Instagram @thirtyfour26
  • "Like" our Facebook Page at Facebook.com/thirtyfour26
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Check out our website: thirtyfour26.com

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary

IFÉ means love in Yoruba. IFÉ is a short animated series that centers around stories on love and life’s journey told from the perspective of African elders. I care about this community because as a Nigerian, I have seen that our stories are often told by others who have a limited understanding of our true experiences. Using animation I am telling the stories of African immigrants whose journey apart and together came with challenges, joy, and growth. This project explores themes like marriage roles, commitment, and cultural identity while fusing it with animation music and motion.

We need to hear stories that increase global awareness for African Immigrants. This animated series highlights the journey of various immigrants who have navigated through and are committed to loving through it all.

 

The Impact

Not only will this project touch on the complexities and beauty of commitment to a person, but it will engage about cultural identity, immigration, women’s empowerment and masculinity. We aim to connect Africans in the diaspora, both those who moved at will and those taken by force.

IFÉ means love in Yoruba.

This story was born out of seeing a lack of representation of African stories in mainstream animated projects, and also wanting to promote the journey of African immigrants in America. It is our hope that this project will inspire.

Why me, why this?

  • I have created 2 short films that tell of various perspectives of black experiences in America
  • I have close ties to the community of interest
  • I have amazing Nigerian couples who have agreed to be open with their journey! you can imagine how hard that was! haha.
  • What better way to tell a documentary story than through animation, for all ages
  • We're putting together an amazing team for this project

 

 

The Breakdown

Studio time/Voice Recording - $400

Storyboarding- 400

Pre-production- 300

Animation- 9,000

Sound Design & Music Composition- $1,200

Editing- $1,000

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with the project is going to be managing the pipeline of the animation work. We are confident that with our partners on the animation end, we will be able to manage the workflow and collaborate to get this project done and released for the public in an efficient fashion. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You may not be able to contribute right now, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our link with people you know!
  • We would love to partner with creative freelancers who are interested in providing their services to be a part of the storytelling project. email us at ife.animated@gmail.com if you have an interest.

Join me on this storytelling journey. Thank you for your support.

story:
What is CROWDED?

“CROWDED” is a web series dramedy written and created by Cori Woods. This original web series follows four women that come from different lives, but all struggle with mental health. Ebony, Paige, Asha, and Trudy, each manage their mental disorders through silence and fear. These women are battling for their lives while balancing their personal, professional, and social lives.

+Nice. So why did you create CROWDED?

CROWDED was created because of the lack of discussion about black women and mental health. When there's a discussion about mental health and mental illnesses, black women are overlooked. There are a limited amount of articles, data, and media coverage  that brings awareness. Why is that? In the U.S, black women are viewed and labeled as “strong” and that limited tag programs people to think that black women can’t be fragile. This needs to change!

Black women suffer from anxiety disorders because they always have to work twice as hard to be taken seriously. The minute black women start honoring their feelings, they are considered weak. The important thing that black women need to realize is that they do not have to bottle their emotions. Black women have the right to express their despair just like everyone else. It’s okay not to be okay. CROWDED is a reflection of the director and her journey with mental health. Cori Woods was diagnosed with depression and anxiety in 2013. She eventually found the necessary resources to receive help. However, that’s not the case for others. Each of us handles mental health issues differently and that’s what the director wants to portray in CROWDED.

The Impact.

CROWDED will continue the conversation about mental health in black communities. According to the Health and Human Services Office of Minority Health, African Americans are 20% more likely to report serious psychological distress than the general population (1). Why? Because African Americans are more likely to experience grief, loss, and trauma due to homelessness, violence, discrimination, and racism.

CROWDED is more than a web series. It’s a tool to educate the general population about black women suffering from mental disorders. The goal is to start the conversation that can eventually lead to change. More authentic narratives. More black leads. More beauty and positivity in the city of Chicago.

1. U.S. Department of Health and Human Services Office of Minority Mental Health. (2016). Mental health and African Americans. Retrieved from http://minorityhealth.hhs.gov/omh/browse.aspx?l...

Right on! What is your vision and what can I do to help?

Crowded is inspired by Easy, the color composition of Moonlight, and the horror of The Shining. Cori Woods and her team desire to film CROWDED on a Sony Alpha 7S II camera with various Canon lenses. The production team is also raising funds for top-notch equipment to shoot underwater. With the best equipment, The CROWDED team will captivate the beauty of our actors in their rawest and purest selves.

Who are we?

Cori Woods is the writer, director, and producer of CROWDED, working in collaboration with Director of Photography Paige Hochstatter, with Associate Producers Brittany Harlin & Jaaron Boger. As a team of Chicago based artists, they have a interest in telling stories with a unconventional approach, and giving a voice to the voiceless. 

Biographies 

Cori Woods is an actor, writer, and dancer. Born and raised in Chicago, Cori has performed at the former Clockwise Theatre in Waukegan and multiple student shows at The Second City Training Center. She has trained at Columbia College Chicago, Acting Studio Chicago, and Green Shirt Studio. In 2015, she had a guest starring role on Chicago PD’s season 3 “Life is Fluid” episode. She’s currently a student in The Second City Conservatory program where she will be graduating in June 2019. Cori is a SAG/AFTRA member and is represented by Hayes Talent Agency.

Paige Hochstatter is a director of photography; she has shot over 20 short films, 5 music videos, and 1 web series. She’s worked with companies such as Women of the Now, and has had a short film, “Spin Cycle”, premiere at the Chicago Feminist Film Festival. Paige is drawn to shooting stories that call for a stylized approach.
 

Brittany Harlin is the founding artistic director of Chicago Urban Dance Collective, a 2017 recipient of the Chicago Dancemakers Forum Lab Artist Award, and the 2018 recipient of the Sybil Shearer fellowship. Her influences are Hip Hop and Modern Dance Pioneers. In addition to company work, her dancing and choreography has been featured at Ragdale Foundation, Links Hall, Elastic Arts, Aragon Ballroom, DRAMA Duo Music Productions, Black Ensemble Theatre, and Hip Hop International.  Brittany’s focus is Hip Hop, Modern, Funk Styles, Waacking, and House, combined with growing knowledge of somatics and kinesiology, all through the concert dance lens. Her goal is to bring dance education to a place of complete body awareness, spiritual expression, and connection. Brittany hopes to establish her practice in expressive therapy, creating opportunities, and inclusiveness.

Jaaron Drew Boger is a person naturally drawn to the intricacies of planning, preparation, and execution. With a career spanning the practices of video editing and cinematography; producing seems like the logical next step. Jaaron’s story begins in Camden, a city not unlike Chicago in terms of poverty, segregation of wealth and corruption. This South Jersey native with a flair for the dramatics, pursued theater production; and toured internationally to both Athens in Greece, and Istanbul in Turkey. Relocating to Chicago, Jaaron fully explores his passion of producing as a Freelance Filmmaker.

Retrieved from http://minorityhealth.hhs.gov/omh/browse.aspx?l...Right on! What is your vision and what can I do to help?Crowded is inspired by Easy, the color composition of Moonlight, and the horror of The Shining. Cori Woods and her team desire to film CROWDED on a Sony Alpha 7S II camera with various Canon lenses. The production team is also raising funds for top-notch equipment to shoot underwater. With the best equipment, The CROWDED team will captivate the beauty of our actors in their rawest and purest selves.Who are we?Cori Woods is the writer, director, and producer of CROWDED, working in collaboration with Director of Photography Paige Hochstatter, with Associate Producers Brittany Harlin & Jaaron Boger. As a team of Chicago based artists, they have a interest in telling stories with a unconventional approach, and giving a voice to the voiceless. Biographies Cori Woods is an actor, writer, and dancer. Born and raised in Chicago, Cori has performed at the former Clockwise Theatre in Waukegan and multiple student shows at The Second City Training Center. She has trained at Columbia College Chicago, Acting Studio Chicago, and Green Shirt Studio. In 2015, she had a guest starring role on Chicago PD’s season 3 “Life is Fluid” episode. She’s currently a student in The Second City Conservatory program where she will be graduating in June 2019. Cori is a SAG/AFTRA member and is represented by Hayes Talent Agency.Paige Hochstatter is a director of photography; she has shot over 20 short films, 5 music videos, and 1 web series. She’s worked with companies such as Women of the Now, and has had a short film, “Spin Cycle”, premiere at the Chicago Feminist Film Festival. Paige is drawn to shooting stories that call for a stylized approach. Brittany Harlin is the founding artistic director of Chicago Urban Dance Collective, a 2017 recipient of the Chicago Dancemakers Forum Lab Artist Award, and the 2018 recipient of the Sybil Shearer fellowship. Her influences are Hip Hop and Modern Dance Pioneers. In addition to company work, her dancing and choreography has been featured at Ragdale Foundation, Links Hall, Elastic Arts, Aragon Ballroom, DRAMA Duo Music Productions, Black Ensemble Theatre, and Hip Hop International.  Brittany’s focus is Hip Hop, Modern, Funk Styles, Waacking, and House, combined with growing knowledge of somatics and kinesiology, all through the concert dance lens. Her goal is to bring dance education to a place of complete body awareness, spiritual expression, and connection. Brittany hopes to establish her practice in expressive therapy, creating opportunities, and inclusiveness.Jaaron Drew Boger is a person naturally drawn to the intricacies of planning, preparation, and execution. With a career spanning the practices of video editing and cinematography; producing seems like the logical next step. Jaaron’s story begins in Camden, a city not unlike Chicago in terms of poverty, segregation of wealth and corruption. This South Jersey native with a flair for the dramatics, pursued theater production; and toured internationally to both Athens in Greece, and Istanbul in Turkey. Relocating to Chicago, Jaaron fully explores his passion of producing as a Freelance Filmmaker.

story:
WAVES is a drama series created, written, directed, and acted in by Shania Banton.  Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancé. Jean now returns a year later hoping to mend the relationship with her sister. However, she has a secret that will rip their relationship apart for good.

For season 2 of Waves The Series, we are opening the door to a mature Jean whose life has turned around for the better and a confused Nia who is now trying to figure out what she wants in life. 

Season 1 can be found on;

Kweli TV

Afroland TV

Brainwash Media

Youtube

The Story is not over...

Season 1 left everyone wanting, so we must deliver. This story is designed to give hope to the audience so that they know after every downfall the only way to go is up. 

Your Donation

By donating you are contributing to the budget we need to pay the Cast and Crew, feed everyone, and afford amazing locations we need, not to mention the marketing to ensure we push WAVES to the next level. 

Tell. A. Friend

Donations are awesome, but also spreading the word about our fundraiser for Season 2 of WAVES. 

Tweet it

Instagram it

Facebook it

Snapchat it

Please  share &  Tag us on ALL social media at @WavesTheSeries

story:
About "My Dad, Vernon"

Most dads work a normal 9-5 job, coach your soccer team, and maybe they golf in their free time. Not my dad. He lives in his car. By choice. When I first found out my dad would be living out of his car I had a lot of questions and concerns, naturally. So I decided to join him on the road for 10 days on a cross country road trip from NYC to Denver to try to understand how, and why he does this. My dad, the former military man, republican, even gun owner, was suddenly sleeping in the back of his car, meditating, and practicing reiki. He rid himself of his belongings, moved out of his nice studio in Denver and hit the road indefinitely 10 months ago. While on the road he showed me the quirky lifehacks he has created, and along the way I also learned about the moments from his past that I believe have led to this lifestyle. Join my dad and I on the road in this web series to find out how and why he lives in his car. 

What We Need & What You Get

I am aiming to raise $2,500. 

With the money I am able to raise I will use that towards editing, reshoots, animation, and marketing, all of which are vital in order to finish the series.

There are different prizes for different levels of donations, including producer credits and a one of a kind "Sleep in Your Car Kit".

The Impact

This is a story that needs to be told, and I need to tell it. It's my story, my dad's story, my families story. In many ways it's relatable to people from all walks of life; Americans who suffered great loss after the recession, the wave of people opting out of buying homes and working 9-5's to live in their vans, and pretty much anybody who at one time or another has felt the urge to leave everything behind and hit the road.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, another great way to support me and this project is by sharing! Getting the word out is an amazing way to help the series grow. Share this Indiegogo page, share the facebook page, the instagram, and tell your family and friends about it.

- Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/mydadvernon/

- Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/mydadvernon/?hl=en

- Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our campaign

story:
Short Summary

Since we started one year ago, Saving Ghosts has been on a mission to help lost spirits cross over and be different from the other paranormal researchers. With our growing community and support, we have been able to accomplish so much...

But now we need to improve and up our game.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Here's a breakdown of what we need to happen:

  • $500 goal to improve some of our equipment.
  • $1000 goal to improve equipment and travel to new places within driving distance.
  • $4,000 goal to improve equipment and go to NEW ORLEANS for featured shoots!

As a result, you will get a variety of personalized gifts from private sessions, to meet and greets (if applicable), and so many other things!

The Impact

We have been in this game for a while, I myself have been in the paranormal for over 20 years. The importance of what we do is massive for these reason:

  • Education on life after death.
  • Assisting those spirits that are stuck to find peace.
  • Find peace for the living with their loved ones that have crossed over, creating closure.

 

Risks & Challenges

Shows like this have several challenges. While we are currently streaming on Amazon, we would love to expand into other mediums. With our show not being Hollywood produced, we are viewed as being boring and slow. The way WE see it - we are REAL reality.

Our other challenge is growing the interest in what we do. We have well over 5,700 followers, however not all are active. We need to change that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Pass the word along! ANY help you can give - even if just sharing our page can do WONDERS! Use the Indiegogo share tools to help!
  • Continue to give us your feedback. Your tips help us do better for you - so PLEASE keep up the communication!

.
