story:
Short Summary

Doing a web series, like a film or anything else costs money… that goes without saying, but I did it anyway. =)   I've done short films and have won many awards and accolades, so now my newest challenge... a comedy web series! Why? Cuz who doesn’t need to laugh in today’s climate and let's just sprinkle in some social commentary because who doesn’t need to shake and nod their heads with a smile once in a while. (Non-Political)

I will have some actors you may have seen before on your favorite shows, but this is also about showcasing talented cast and crew yet to be fully discovered.  Having the audience falling in love and hate with the characters they portray is what makes writing and acting worthwhile… so, I need help financing this project to feed these wonderful people and for post-production, marketing, promotions, film festivals, etc.  

The Story is a fun look at one man’s journey through Hollywood with his friends as they age and realize adaptation is the key to surviving in this industry.  Life can get in the way some times, but it makes things more interesting in the quest to doing what you love.    

A diverse cast of characters enhance the story and I hope you will join us on our 14 episode journey… because it’s just the tip with season one.  =)

Much love and thank you for your support!

~Ruben Avitia.
Just the Tip – Web Series
Writer/Director/Producer/Actor
www.JustTheTipSeries.com

What We Need & What You Get

Breaking it down...

  • Simply put... we need $5,000.00 to finish our web series and for Post Production, Marketing, Promotional Merch, Hot meals, Crafty and other miscellaneous expenses that arise during Production and Post-Production.
  • This is a fundraising effort first and foremost, but we have some unique perks only found during this campaign as a thank you from the bottom of our indie filmmaker hearts for getting in on the ground floor! First Season!
  • All contributions will be used immediately, as our target date to finish production is January, 2019. I've always finished a project and this one is my biggest endeavor yet... 14 episodes = 85 pages. Pre-production is done... now it's time to make this baby a reality!

The Impact

Donating to our campaign is the only way we finish our project and you make all the difference with your contribution:

  • This project is valuable in that indie filmmaking is where unique stories are told. The best programs are original... and that's what this comedy is... from writing to cast to crew.
  • As a writer, director, actor, producer, I've had a successful track record with projects like my short films Ingles and Missed Call. Winning Awards and Accolades that have lead to Industry professionals looking forward to seeing my versatility and excited about what's next on my plate. This is it.
  • I've acted in commercials, film and Television Programs. I helped my son become a professional acting star and managed him successfully through contract negotiations, meaningful roles and made it fun for him by balancing his acting childhood with sports and other leisure activities to provide a balanced upbringing... a happy determined child, now teen. My success as a filmmaker for independent projects has helped people other than myself... and I find extreme satisfaction in that. Hearing people laugh or react to a scene is what drives me. I love to entertain... in all aspects of filmmaking... but it takes more than one person to make it happen. Everyone who puts time, effort and/or money into one of my projects... are the do'ers I love to be around and hope to share in the success with.
  • With Indie go-go site... they take 5% of all contributions and another 3% + .30 cents for credit card use. So, reaching our goal is actually a higher amount than what we're asking for, but every donation does takes us a step closer to finishing our project, so we'll focus on the positive... just being completely transparent. Thank you.

Other Ways You Can Help

All contributions matter, whether small or choosing a perk. It all counts! I understand that though some people really want to, they just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • You can get the word out and make some noise about your campaign. 
  • Share our campaign link and direct people on social media and word of mouth!
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! It make it really simple.

And that's all there is to it.

Whether your a first or long time supporter... I want to say Thank you! This is our community project... I hope you can help me reach our goal. Much love always! ~R.

story:
Our Story

The YouTube WresTling ShoW is a family run business teaming up with like minded friends around the community to create a product we are all proud of.

  • MattJones2587 and KateJones1121 started The Show in 2018
  • The fans gave us the confidence to continue for four seasons.
  • Together we can continue to create the coolest audience experience online!

Sounds great right?

- What You Can Expect -

Here We Go Folks:

  • We have outgrown our current set (house) and are currently looking to expand!
  • With the new space we will be introducing "The Wrestling Ring" A Legit Ring Fans!
  • Also, our production value is increasing which leads to higher production costs (wrestlers get thirsty).

The Impact

Your contribution will effect directly the dedication we all are allowed to deliver creating this awesome show for you:

Risks & Challenges

We have dedicated our entire livelihood to breathing life into the YouTube WresTling ShoW

  • We vow to represent the Show with the most respect at all times
  • We promise to deliver content in best interest of the fans 1st

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Sign up for our Patreon Page for Exclusive content at www.patreon.com/mattjonees2587
  • Share the INDIEGOGO!
  • Follow KateJones_1121 on instagram
  • Like, Share, Comment on our YouTube Videos

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Jessi Who?

Visit Our Website: https://jessiwhoseries.com/

“Simplicity never felt so complicated”

An original series….on YouTube.

Synopsis:

In pursuit of one day becoming the next great TV Show Host Comedian, Jessi takes the plunge and meets the City of Angels, and boy does it take her on a whirlwind. After multiple enjoyably awkward mishaps, Jessi must navigate through her insecurities, naivety and unfit tendencies as she finds herself on a road not only to self discovery but self recovery, because let’s face it - LA is not kind to the artistic mind.

Take a look at a few clips of Jessi being .... well, herself...

 

 

About the Show and our Hopes:

Jessi Who, yes that is her last name. Simple chick whose goal is to one day become a TV show host as big as Ellen Degeneres and make a difference in people’s lives by being funny, witty and of course, adored. She moves to LA where she believes she has to tackle literally every aspect of the entertainment business to get there, don’t we all? She sees her best friend, Aelys, get discovered almost instantly and land a recurring role on a Netflix Original Series. Jessi falls in the LA trap of having to “look” like everyone, cute, petite, Kardashian, - there’s only one problem, she is none of that. Jessi is tall, awkward, (I mean for fuck sake, even her name is spelled in an awkward way) she has dreads that constantly get her into debates, compares herself to her cutesy bestfriend who seems to have it all and yet she’s naive enough to believe that she DOES fit in. But that’s just it, she does fit in because she quickly realizes that LA is no glamour shot, it isn’t a place where you walk into a bar, all heads turn and you get discovered to be the next Angelina Jolie.

No - here we follow Jessi through the nitty gritty of LA living reality, being broke, finding side hustles to make ends meet, living in a studio, going to auditions left and right, looking for love and the most famous - trying to discover and find herself. Here’s the fun part - it’s done in such a relatable way, because believe it or not - We all go through it. This show is to bring laughter in the simplest of mishaps that seem bigger when we are the ones going through it. Jessi Who will take us on Jessi’s journey of self discovery and make us laugh throughout. My hopes for this show are simple, ready? Here it goes - Just, enjoy it! By the end, I hope the audience feels understood and a little better. Because hey, sometimes simplicity feels so complicated.

You'll get BEEP - BOOPS AND EPISODES

What does that mean exactly?

Jessi Who? Beep - Boops are short sketches that will appear before the episodes air. Each one will mention hints to later episodes, once the episodes drop - we will have little contests for our viewers, if they can connect the dots of which episodes were hinted in what specific BEEP - BOOP, they will win a prize.

 

 

We will ALWAYS make sure to give you some fun blooper reels AND behind the scenes content! 

 
 
 

 

Some of our Characters:

 
 
 
 
 

 

SO, what can you expect out of Jessi Who? Well, you can expect to smile and to fall in love with all of the on-screen Jessi Who? gang, as they each bring something unique to the table. From her best friend and established actress, Aelys with perfect “couple goals” girlfriend, Randi, to her unknowingly air-headed, insta-famous neighbors known as, the Jays. From words of encouragement that her bartender confidant, Roman, often lends, to her continuously awkward run – in’s with lady’s man, Wayne. Then there’s the uncomfortable meetings with her not – so supportive acting coach, Agnes, to her auntie Margarita, running from the law ... And let’s not forget Tilly, the owner of “The Happy Kid’s Klub” who quickly learns that maybe Jessi isn’t so great at volunteering with kids…oh and Emily? Who the heck is that!? 

Jessi Who? Series, assures that you will walk away feeling lighter and fully connected to at least one of these characters, so why not press play?
 

OUR GANG WILL ALWAYS INTERACT WITH THE VIEWERS! 

 

 

Series Creators:
Meet Meredith Guerra & Jessie Williams

The idea to create “Jessi Who?” Started about 5 years ago. Originally it was a SHORT FILM titled “Jessie” – as the days, weeks, months and years went on, we thought- why not create a small web series that will be a good place for people to escape the heaviness of the world today and enjoy a simple yet very relatable show and just have a good laugh.

Read more about the Jessi Who Series on the LA Tribunes Article here:

Jessi falls in the LA trap of having to “look” like everyone, cute, petite, Kardashian, - there’s only one problem, she is none of that. Jessi is tall, awkward, (I mean for fuck sake, even her name is spelled in an awkward way) she has dreads that constantly get her into debates, compares herself to her cutesy bestfriend who seems to have it all and yet she’s naive enough to believe that she DOES fit in. But that’s just it, she does fit in because she quickly realizes that LA is no glamour shot, it isn’t a place where you walk into a bar, all heads turn and you get discovered to be the next Angelina Jolie.No - here we follow Jessi through the nitty gritty of LA living reality, being broke, finding side hustles to make ends meet, living in a studio, going to auditions left and right, looking for love and the most famous - trying to discover and find herself. Here’s the fun part - it’s done in such a relatable way, because believe it or not - We all go through it. This show is to bring laughter in the simplest of mishaps that seem bigger when we are the ones going through it. Jessi Who will take us on Jessi’s journey of self discovery and make us laugh throughout. My hopes for this show are simple, ready? Here it goes - Just, enjoy it! By the end, I hope the audience feels understood and a little better. Because hey, sometimes simplicity feels so complicated.You'll get BEEP - BOOPS AND EPISODESWhat does that mean exactly?Jessi Who? Beep - Boops are short sketches that will appear before the episodes air. Each one will mention hints to later episodes, once the episodes drop - we will have little contests for our viewers, if they can connect the dots of which episodes were hinted in what specific BEEP - BOOP, they will win a prize.
 
 
We will ALWAYS make sure to give you some fun blooper reels AND behind the scenes content! 

  
 
 

Some of our Characters:



  
  
  


SO, what can you expect out of Jessi Who? Well, you can expect to smile and to fall in love with all of the on-screen Jessi Who? gang, as they each bring something unique to the table. From her best friend and established actress, Aelys with perfect “couple goals” girlfriend, Randi, to her unknowingly air-headed, insta-famous neighbors known as, the Jays. From words of encouragement that her bartender confidant, Roman, often lends, to her continuously awkward run – in’s with lady’s man, Wayne. Then there’s the uncomfortable meetings with her not – so supportive acting coach, Agnes, to her auntie Margarita, running from the law ... And let’s not forget Tilly, the owner of “The Happy Kid’s Klub” who quickly learns that maybe Jessi isn’t so great at volunteering with kids…oh and Emily? Who the heck is that!? Jessi Who? Series, assures that you will walk away feeling lighter and fully connected to at least one of these characters, so why not press play? OUR GANG WILL ALWAYS INTERACT WITH THE VIEWERS! 
 
 

Series Creators:Meet Meredith Guerra & Jessie Williams

The idea to create “Jessi Who?” Started about 5 years ago. Originally it was a SHORT FILM titled “Jessie” – as the days, weeks, months and years went on, we thought- why not create a small web series that will be a good place for people to escape the heaviness of the world today and enjoy a simple yet very relatable show and just have a good laugh.

Read more about the Jessi Who Series on the LA Tribunes Article here:

story:
Hello Family and Friends,

My name is Selena Fitzgerald,  the writer. I am studying screenwriting in California. I am writing to ask for your financial support. 

I am creating a web series called "Vampire Rejects" that will target young adults and vampire fans. The show follows as a naive teen girl who turns into a vampire on purpose, she must learn the basics and the rules of being a vampire at a not so prestigious school The House of Vampire Rejects.

I am currently focused on writing and producing the pilot for my web series. I need to raise $5,000 in order to produce and direct the film because there are a lot of financial obligations that need to be met. My obligations include getting equipment, feeding actors, getting props and wardrobes, and other miscellaneous expenses. Any contribution to make this happen would be greatly appreaciated. Please consider sharing this with your family and friends. 

Thank you!

My obligations include getting equipment, feeding actors, getting props and wardrobes, and other miscellaneous expenses. Any contribution to make this happen would be greatly appreaciated. Please consider sharing this with your family and friends. Thank you!

story:
The Real Witches of Salem

They may have occult powers but being a member of one of America’s oldest covens is more trouble than fire burn and caldron bubble. As above, so below, & ready to conquer -- watch these witches navigate the magickal and the 'normal'. Whether it be the corporate world, their wrinkles, or the Republic — it’s all going down in a flume of smoke.

 

Why have you written it?

It kind of  started with Trump's "grab them by the pussy" scandal (aka him bragging about sexually assaulting women and getting away with it because he's rich and famous). When this scandal broke I was outraged by the deplorable behaviour and disrespect shown by this man -- but I wasn't surprised. We've all seen it a million times -- rich & powerful men getting away with everything and anything.

Mostly though -- I was triggered and my own trauma boiled to the surface, Grizelda summoned herself into my life, and the coven was born... 

The project has evolved from there. 

Real Witches of Salem (RWOS) is a fun, glamorous, and intellectual reflection of our world where you will laugh, cry and wonder how the hell we ended up here — the answer obviously being ‘dark magick’ -- just kidding its actually corporate greed and toxic masculinity.  

What's the status?

After securing 7k in funding from a creative non-profit (Godberd) & our executive producers -- we filmed all 3 episodes from Season 1.

Now we just need another 6k to complete the season. 

Our ultimate goal is to get RWOS in front of TV production companies to expand and develop the series further. 

Who's in the Coven?

Lucie Fleming as Bella

Keren MD as Amber

Kate Robards as Lucille

Jamie Milay as Safi

Astrida Auza as Carol from Accounting

Talula Wilde as Grizelda (High Priestess) 

Okay but...Who's also in the Coven?

- Writer - Talula Wilde

- Director - Eli-Bella Wood 

- DOP - Julian Garofalo

- Producers - Talula Wilde & Eli-Bella Wood & Jasmina Lukanovich

- Executive Producers - Douglas Bensadoun & Gregg Chillin & Godberd

 

What do you need the money for?

  • Some during production costs we incurred
  • Editting
  • Coloring
  • Sound design
  • Soundtrack
  • SFX
  • Marketing 

 

Is there any other way I can help?

 Yes! If you aren't able to contribute financially but like the sound of the show, please do share our IndieGoGo page on social media and give us a follow on instagram & facebook @realwitchesofsalem

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

My name is Anna Hollingsworth or you know me as Samantha or the Purple Warrior on Ancient Warriors. I am also the co-creator of Ancient Warriors Legacies of Olympus. 

Ancient Warriors Legacies of Olympus is a project I am over the moon for and never thought this idea would get this far. It is a Greek God based team who are here to defend Earth and kick some Hades butt. All of the powers are based on a Greek God. 

We are using this amazing campaign for suits, comic book, cons, and stuff we just need to make this audiobook the best it can be. 

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

What we really need is:

- Going towards locations for filming 

- Helmets & Suits

- Props & Costumes

- Lodging 

Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!

Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

To fund all the suit making and comic book production to take place we would need around $500, but we will take whatever you can donate to help us make our show come to life! 

If we go over our amount we will be using the remaining money to fund our tables in cons and help some of our castmates go to certain cons to share.

With each perk, you will be able to receive something from us.  It could be from a sneak peek of the script and or recording/personal shoutout in credits/autographs from someone in cast and even merchandise!

Our goal will always grow and every little bit of money aids in our efforts so thank you for the support. Should we exceed our goal there may be more perks added!!!  

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

If you can't contribute to the project then you are encouraged to share our Indiegogo campaign with your friends, family and, on social media  

And that's all there is to it.

story:
About the Project:

I am a first-time screenwriter who just started my own independent production company, Steel Vibrations. Steel Vibrations focuses on untold and under told narratives in our communities; particularly those about women and minorities. Our company's top priority is creating content that reverberates throughout society!

 

This project will be directed by Sherita Bolden and produced by Frank Murillo.

 

Our cast and crew are talented and experienced professionals. Collectively, we have worked on the following productions:

 

Step Sisters  (Netflix)

Bricked  (BET)

Being  (TV One)

Raising Dion  (Netflix)

Bad Boys for Life  (Sony Pictures Entertainment)

Greenleaf  (OWN)

The Spy Who Dumped Me  (Lionsgate)

Nappily Ever After  (Netflix)

Madea’s Farewell Tour (Tyler Perry Studios)

We have also taken our talents to the Sundance Film Festival, Sundance Institute, and the Cannes Film Festival.

 

Why We Need Your Help:

This story has been a passion project for me for over two years.  However, the pandemic has taken a huge toll on the entertainment industry specifically theater and film, causing our funding to take a hit.

Given the talent and dedication to this project, we would love for our actors to be paid for the work they put in. We will also need to provide catering for cast and crew.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools.

 

We appreciate your support of this project, and of the arts!

story:
​About this Fundraiser

Hello! We're Gabby, Jess, and Jacqueline, students at Emerson College in Boston, MA, and the Executive Producers of I Still Haven't Found What I'm Looking For, a 100% student-produced romantic comedy web series following the disastrous nature of young romance. I Still Haven't Found has recently become independently produced, and we need your help in creating the fourth season of our show. With the help of your contributions, we will be able to continue giving students the opportunity to tell relatable stories, and create genuine connections with their audience!

What We Need

For the fourth season of I Still Haven't Found, we are looking to raise $1,000. This money will be used to support our film crews, including but not limited to craft services on long filming days, transportation to and from set, and production design costs (props, costumes, etc). 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to contribute financially, there are still ways you can help! You can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out about our campaign, or visit our social channels to show your support. 

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCMlUHcr5ozcCAC...

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/istillhaventfound_tv/

Website: https://www.istillhaventfound.com/

story:
LAST CALL Season One continues... 

Our first two episodes went LIVE on YouTube over the holidays! They were largely self-funded by its creator, Mike Dreyden and with generous donations from family, friends and fans like you. Thank you so much for your contributions.
 

One of our biggest accomplishment happened last October when we became an 'Official Selection' and invited to premiere at the 2016 Brooklyn Web Fest. In addition, we received FOUR award nominations. PREMIERE SERIES AWARD, EMERGING VOICES AWARD, MADE IN NY AWARD and AUDIENCE AWARD. We were blown away and honored. Thank you BWF!

This time around we really want to step it up in order to complete our next 10 episodes and reward the cast and crew with more than just "copy, credit and meals."  The Mike Dreyden Media / LAST CALL team is working tirelessly to bring our show to the screen and we would like to better show our appreciation. Here's how you can help...

It takes a decent amount of money for a production like ours. From renting equipment, paying for locations, transportation, licensing music, post production costs, basic operating expenses, and of course lunch. It all adds up. We certainly hope you can find it in your hearts and your pocket books to donate to our first season of "LAST CALL". 

GUEST STARS & CAMEOS

Actors Fiore J. Barbini aka Hugh Hunter, Jesse Jackman (Titan Media), Jamison Daniels (So You Wanna Be A Broadway Star), Tym Moss, Tatiana Grey (Serious Laundry, Acting Disorder), nightlife personalities Michael Formika, Chad LaClair, Matty Glitterati, Busted Fitzgerald and more!

THE CAST

Mike Dreyden, along with actors Michael Vaccaro (Child of the 70s) and Robert Maisonett (Latin Lives), Mair Heller, Bianca Leigh (Hurricane Bianca), Clifford Ray Berry (How To Make It Big), and John Dylan DeLaTorre (People You Know). And introducing Moe Bertran (House of Mayhem). Check out our 2015 campaign video to meet the cast, learn more about the show and help us bring you LAST CALL.

SUBSCRIBE AND FOLLOW US:

       

 

THERE'S ONLY ONE OF THESE!

 

BOTTLE SERVICE
Click to visit Equality Vodka web site!

 

WALK THE VIP RED CARPET

OUR KICK ASS TEAM!

Mike Dreyden: Creator, Writer, Director, Star

Robert Mercado: Director and Director of Photography

Jonathan Alvarez: Director of Photography

Ariel Mahler: Script Supervisor

Nicholas Valva and Boris Palacios: Sound Technician

Ana-Maria Bandean, Tiffany Carvalho, Habi Coulibaly,

Ariel Mahler, Marian Moussa, Bailey Renee, : PAs:

John Alfred Nelson, Makeup

Amron Hayes, Stylist

BTS: On location at Rags-a-Gogo

RISKS and CHALLENGES

Making a low budget series like LAST CALL (as compared to a lot of studio projects) brings many challenges. We learned this while shooting our first episode, from losing locations to having actors drop out to having equipment break down, you have to be able to roll with the punches. We learned a lot of new lessons too, as we continue to create our first season, including the fact that some Indiegogo pledges don't ultimately go through if they are declined by the backer's bank--so make sure to verify your payment method will go through if you're interested in one of our higher level rewards!

We don't have a studio behind us, only our tenacity, AND YOU, our FAMILY AND FRIENDS! Backing us means you have an hand in us creating a track record of producing a quality show on a shoestring budget. We love making the series and we are confident we can make a spectacular first season!
 

On location :: Rags-a-Gogo, NYC

A note about the perks: delivery dates are only estimates and are subject to change-- but don't worry, Mike Dreyden will keep you updated! Some rewards also contain multiple availability dates for digital vs. physical delivery.

The VIP Relaunch Party will be held in New York City. We cannot provide transportation or accommodations, but we can promise it'll be all kinds of AMAZING!

There may be additional paperwork required to fulfill some rewards, such as producing credits or appearances on camera. This is for both your protection and ours!

The BIGGEST CHALLENGE is making sure that enough people hear about the campaign so that we can make our goal!

WE KNOW WE CAN DO THIS WITH YOUR HELP! PLEASE BACK US AND SHARE THIS PAGE WITH ALL YOUR FRIENDS!

story:
Short Summary

Two detectives

An unwavering journalist

A quiet bridge at night

This is where our story begins

The purpose of this campaign is to raise funds to shoot the pilot episode of our show "Whoever they are" We plan to use the pilot episode to pitch the show to online distributors such as Amazon, while also submitting to newer streaming services looking for original content, such as Apple, YouTube Red, and Facebook. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $70,000.  That may seem like a large amount, but if you break it down, it is only 2800 donations of $25.  The bulk of the funds will go towards talent, crew, and production costs (locations, permits, feeding the cast and crew, etc) during a planned 5 day shooting schedule.

 

$27,000 – Cast and Crew

$1,500 – Food

$10,000 – Locations

$1,500 – Transportation

$5,000 – Props

$10,000 – Post

$15,000 – Miscellaneous and gear

We appreciate anyone who helps us out, so we have set up some rewards for all of you.  Please feel free to click over to the perks section and see what we are offering.  Besides this new show we wanted to give a little back to those who invested their faith in us. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate money to this project, but that is not the only way you can help us.  if you feel this project is something worth getting behind (and we hope you do) but it just isn't in the cards to donate, just spread the word.  Getting this out is the key.  The more people we reach the more likely we are to succeed.  Share this project on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Snapchat, Twitch, Youtube, text everyone in your phone, email the planet, talk about us with your friends, family, coworkers, classmates, or strangers (but be cautious) Drive down the road with your windows down telling anyone you drive past.  Just get the word out. 

Final Thoughts

We wish to thank those who have already contributed to the making of this project and we hope that with the additional help of those who find this of interest we will be able to bring to life the beginnings of a show many will enjoy.

Collectively we have over 35 years of experience and have produced a range of work, links to which can be found below.  Additionally, we have produced a teaser trailer, or rather a proof of concept video to showcase the tone and look of the show, a link to which can be found here:

https://youtu.be/WP8DHrPRHfY

We look forward to the adventure that this project promises to bring. Thank you.

Other links:

Heroin Awareness PSA - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Om36uE8E5fo

Human Trafficking PSA - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvxzn21UmhE

Secrets (short) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mcVkufayW3U

Demo Reel - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XFpfXp9wYhI&amp...

"Whoever they are" We plan to use the pilot episode to pitch the show to online distributors such as Amazon, while also submitting to newer streaming services looking for original content, such as Apple, YouTube Red, and Facebook. What We Need & What You GetWe are looking to raise $70,000.  That may seem like a large amount, but if you break it down, it is only 2800 donations of $25.  The bulk of the funds will go towards talent, crew, and production costs (locations, permits, feeding the cast and crew, etc) during a planned 5 day shooting schedule. $27,000 – Cast and Crew$1,500 – Food$10,000 – Locations$1,500 – Transportation$5,000 – Props$10,000 – Post$15,000 – Miscellaneous and gearWe appreciate anyone who helps us out, so we have set up some rewards for all of you.  Please feel free to click over to the perks section and see what we are offering.  Besides this new show we wanted to give a little back to those who invested their faith in us. Other Ways You Can HelpWe understand that not everyone can donate money to this project, but that is not the only way you can help us.  if you feel this project is something worth getting behind (and we hope you do) but it just isn't in the cards to donate, just spread the word.  Getting this out is the key.  The more people we reach the more likely we are to succeed.  Share this project on your Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Tumblr, Snapchat, Twitch, Youtube, text everyone in your phone, email the planet, talk about us with your friends, family, coworkers, classmates, or strangers (but be cautious) Drive down the road with your windows down telling anyone you drive past.  Just get the word out. Final ThoughtsWe wish to thank those who have already contributed to the making of this project and we hope that with the additional help of those who find this of interest we will be able to bring to life the beginnings of a show many will enjoy.Collectively we have over 35 years of experience and have produced a range of work, links to which can be found below.  Additionally, we have produced a teaser trailer, or rather a proof of concept video to showcase the tone and look of the show, a link to which can be found here:https://youtu.be/WP8DHrPRHfYWe look forward to the adventure that this project promises to bring. Thank you.Other links:Heroin Awareness PSA - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Om36uE8E5foHuman Trafficking PSA - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=hvxzn21UmhESecrets (short) - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mcVkufayW3UDemo Reel - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XFpfXp9wYhI&amp...

story:
It You Plant It, It Will Grow

When I first came up with the idea for this show in late 2015, I decided I wanted to "change the world through food." I had recently gone vegan at the time and noticed that there weren't any TV shows focusing on a plant-based and vegan lifestyle. At least, not in the form of a TV series. So, I developed the show concept and was lucky enough to find a great team to produce the show, and pitched it to some major networks.

In the vegan community, I was called a "trailblazer" because essentially, this hadn't been done before. Veganism had yet to go mainstream. That is, until my show debuted in July of 2016 on A&E's FYI channel across America to 70 million households!

Why This Show Is So Important

Many people still think that a vegan lacks nutrients and energy, but my show demonstrates that the opposite is true. It show us that we can get all the nutrients we need without eating animal products, and are physically and mentally stronger.  Moreover, by being vegan, we are helping to protect the future of our environment. In fact, a global shift towards a vegan or plant-based diet is vital to save the world from hunger, fuel poverty, and the worst impacts of climate change. A reduction in the demand for meat will mean less cruelty associated with the treatment of animals bred for the meat industry. 

On Plant-Based By Nafsika, we talk food, fashion, beauty, health and innovations. So you learn a little AND have fun doing it!

So Here's What I'm Asking

Although it was an amazing experience to work on this project last year, I essentially had to fund the first season myself. :(  And it was hard. Even though I was shown some love in the community, I was not getting the financial support I needed. Now, we are working on Season 2 and I am asking for your help. 

The money I hope to raise here will go directly to paying the production costs. But it's a win-win! Because I've put together some exciting perks for you to choose from.

I've planted the seed, but need your support so that I could keep it growing. If I surpass my goal, I will then start working on bringing my show to more networks globally.

Thank you for your support!

With Compassion,

Nafsika

story:
Short Summary

MISMANAGED is the story of Charlie, who finds himself the manager of the overnight shift at a theater when his parents spend his college fund on what they call a "lifetime cruise." It's not great timing for them to both have a mid-life crisis, and it leaves Charlie in a much different place than he thought he would be. He's left to his own devices, trying to figure out what to do with life, love, and leadership of a group of certifiably strange people. 

My name is Garrett Ray, and I wrote MISMANAGED. I spent the last 9 years of my life dedicating myself to acting, stand up comedy, writing, and in the last three years I've tackled every aspect of filmmaking that I could get my hands on. Previously, me and my team shot 5 short films in 3 months, premiering them at events in Texas and Oklahoma to raise money for The Chosen Tree (a non-profit organization that fights human trafficking in America).

About two years ago, I started to think about a job I had spent some time at before I graduated high school: working at a movie theater. It was only 9 months of my life, but in that time I was starting to transition into adulthood. Starting my own production company, Solar Flight Productions, I catapulted myself forward and left the theater where I was feeling stuck in my "real job."

After leaving I started to wonder, "What if I hadn't left? What would life be like?" That's how MISMANAGED was born. Over the next 13 months, I wrote, rewrote, fantasized, planned, plotted, and slowly started to ask people about their interest in the project. My crew, who has worked with me on multiple short films, all loved the idea. Their reaction was overwhelming! As soon as I knew I was onto something that was as good as I hoped it to be, I began to work in earnest.

This project is my way of trying to reach out and show young adults that life is crazy, yes, but there's purpose in it. It's also a push to get more clean comedy out into the wild and show that we can be funny without being vulgar. It's a passion shared by everyone on our team.

Your support helps us pursue that goal, but it does so much more than that. MISMANAGED is going to be shot with the help of local high school students who have a passion for film making. We're getting a group of students on board to have credited work for when they enter the work field after high school, and learn invaluable skills along the way. We're trying to give back to our community by training up those who are following in our footsteps.

Campaign Goals

Our goal for this campaign is $2,500. We need to raise this money to take care of the basic necessities on set:

  • Food for a large cast and crew over (5) five 12-hour-days of filming
  • Basic costuming (vests, pants, for theater uniforms and "Buzzer Hockey" gear, as well as some studded boots for Grand Avenue's resident cynic Farrah)
  • Stunt safety gear for throwing someone over the hood of a car
  • Coffee. All of our shoots are overnights, and we need people awake!
  • Props (which includes a real duck or a very convincing fake one)

Perks: Yeah, We've Got 'Em. You Could Too!

When you back our campaign, you get cool stuff, like:

  • Get your name in the credits!
  • See episodes early!
  • Have an executive producer credit in the opening title of the show!
  • Get a page from our scripts, signed by the cast!
  • Join us on set! 
  • See behind the scenes of our editing!
  • Get your name said in the show!
  • And more!

If we don't hit our full goal, the money will go to costuming and props first, then on down the list until our funds run out. We'll scrape together what food we can and really stretch those coffee beans.

The Impact

This is just the start for MISMANAGED. Your contribution goes toward starting something truly special. We aim to make this show a regular thing, releasing full seasons down the road. As we forge ahead, we can show that there's room for entertainment of a different sort: clever, clean, and made with excellence.

Solar Flight, as well as our partners like Jeff Tucker (Flying T Entertainment) and Randy Bell (2Pug Productions, Spartan Media) have proven that we can craft unique and entertaining content with breakneck speed due to our dogged determination and love of our work. All we need to push this project forward is a little bit of help to get people fed while they blaze the trail!

Risks & Challenges

This is an ambitious project, to be sure. Filming six 20-minute episodes in five days is going to be a huge challenge. Cast members are coming from all over the US to film in downtown Belton TX, and we're not going to get much of a second chance. We have to get it right the first time. 

That's why we're preparing every day for our shoots in August. Scheduling, picking the right equipment, and preparing our actors ahead of time to get on set and shoot with fewer takes and fewer complicated setups. Below you can find links to some behind-the-scenes features from our weekly youtube series, Boom Shot.

We're scheduling every scene, so we know exactly what we're shooting and when.

We've picked a camera system that gives us a filmic look and won't bog down our shoots with complicated setups and poor battery life.

Our Actors are getting ready for their close ups. And all their other shots.

These are just small glimpses into the work we're doing in pre-production. Everything is set up so that we have a plan, but can flex it if we need to in order to finish our shoots. 

Other Ways You Can Help

First of all, thank you for reading all this. It means a ton that you've stuck with this page this far! If you don't have money to contribute, there's still opportunities for you to help! 

  • Share our campaign on your social media and see if some of your friends might want to help as well!
  • Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to blast us out on Twitter, Facebook, and whatever else you want!
  • Have a spare duck? We could use one. (You can have it back after.)
  • Do you sew? Buying the material for our vests may be cheaper than buying them pre-made, and we could save a bit of coin that way. Even if we buy the vests, we may need some help getting them fitted to our talent.
  • Word of mouth is one of the best things you can do. Talk to your friends, your family, your goat! If that's your thing, anyway.

Thank you for taking the time to look at our campaign. Whether you're able to help us out or not, we all wish you the biggest of blessings and hope you enjoy MISMANAGED later this year!

story:
Who Are We?

Over the last 6 1/2 years, we've produced podcasts about JavaScript, Ruby, Angular, iOS, React Native, and Freelancing. It started with Ruby Rogues in 2011 and expanded to JavaScript Jabber and the Freelancers' Show in 2012.

Since then, we've added other shows and a new format where we talk to developers and past guests from the shows about what they're doing now and how they got into programming in the first place.

Our mission is to help software developers build better careers, relationships, lives, and skills. Many of our listeners have asked for a podcast about React similar to the other shows we provide.

Because we want to help you grow, we are putting together this podcast about React.

We typically support podcasts through sponsorship. As we ramp up, we'd love to have your support in putting the show together. 

We anticipate that a large number of our current listeners will cross over from JavaScript and Ruby into React.

Overall, though, we have a lot of ideas for upcoming shows and feel like this is a great way to figure out if people want the show enough to support it. And, if there's enough support to pay for the show's production for 6 months, we can produce it and line up sponsorships to continue it long-term.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking to gather enough funding to cover the production for about 30 shows. That's a little more than 6 months of shows.

The production and hosting costs around $100 per episode. So, the overall number we'd reach ideally is $3000 plus $500 to pay for the artwork and designs for the podcast.

This does not cover the time Charles and team spend finding guests, scheduling guests, supporting hosts, and working on the Devchat.tv website. We'll take care of it, though, and hopefully find sponsors to fund this relatively quickly.

We currently have interest from a few of our existing hosts in co-hosting this show. We're also working on putting together t-shirts, mugs, stickers, and other goodies to hand out. 

We'll also invite you to the Devchat.tv supporters' Slack room where we discuss the shows, technology, and careers with each other.

On the off-chance that we don't reach our goal, we'll pull together some of the top folks in React and up our game for React Dev Summit Feb 26-Mar 2.

The Impact

This is a terrific opportunity to help us create an awesome resource that will help people in the React and web development communities for years to come. Over the years, we've helped several people start and grow in their careers in programming with our advice, knowledge, and explanations by our hosts and guests on how to best apply the things they do best.

Risks & Challenges

Most of Charles' focus over the last year has been on general JavaScript and the Angular community.

However, he's reached out to several people in the React community and has gotten some quality referrals for both hosts and guests.

We also find that most people are open to appearing on a podcast and we feel that we can grow our network of React developers to include many folks who are solving interesting and difficult problems across the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute monetarily, we understand. Everyone's situation is different. We still welcome suggestions for topics and guests. Send your email to help@devchat.tv with suggestions under the subject line "React podcast suggestions" and we'll keep track of those.

You can also help spread the word about this campaign and the React Dev Summit coming up.

story:
Asher (CLICK TO WATCH THE PILOT)  is an original web-series about an exorcist who makes a living policing the paranormal of NYC and helping the Big Apple’s lost souls handle their demons.  She is joined by her best friend and fellow veteran Sam Vargas, her naive but likable spiritual client Cassie, and a young couple who unwittingly involve her in something sinister. 

The full length pilot is available now, and we are planning another 5 episodes, which is where you come in. But first...

Cara Brennan and Jack Payne are co-writers and creators of Asher,  with Cara starring and Jack directing. After collaborating on several passion projects together, they decided it was time to make something a little bigger; something that would allow them to tell the story most important to both of them: The Hero’s Story - the fight of good versus evil.

Both creators are passionate about creating art that reflects the individual’s struggle to live with love and faith in a scary and chaotic world.  They believe that discovering the power of the Inner Hero is a liberating imperative for every human being.

Cara hails from the Washington, DC area, and Jack from K.C., Missouri. They met at college in NYC in 2007, and have been friends since.

To create an original six episode series (episodes each running 20-23 minutes) that will be available to anyone, anywhere.

To submit the series to festivals for wider exposure.

To use Asher as the flagship of Lonely Cow Productions that enables us to continue to make original content for a global audience.

Pre-production for Asher lasted two months, during which time we wrote first drafts for the entire first season, and an outline for season 2.  We assembled a cast, crew, and equipment, while securing filming locations.

Filming of the pilot episode went efficiently, lasting full 5 days in total.

Post-production took about a month, with Jack taking on the bulk of editing responsibilities, such as picture lock, color correction, sound design, scoring, and special effects. Cara oversaw the editing process while developing the Indiegogo page, promotional materials, and organizing the live NYC premiere.

Asher was filmed on the Sony A6500 with a portrait and wide angle lens.

Lighting was done on two Yongnuo soft lights and lights that were available on location.

Sound was done on the Rode VideoMic Pro attached to the A6500.

Editing was completed on a 2011 Mac with Final Cut Pro X.

Because you want to see a thrilling detective story with ol’ fashioned gothic horror.

Because you like to see strong bad-ass women on TV.

Because you like to see heroes who are relatable and imperfect but still try their hardest.

Because real life is messy and sometimes our stories need to echo that.

Because you believe that art reflects and explores essential truths necessary for a healthy society.

To pay our actors, our crew, music usage, location rental, equipment rentals, festival fees, and craft services. If we meet our ultimate goals, Jack and Cara will be able to take a little time off from their day jobs to get the series out sooner.  The pilot was fully funded by the creators while they worked full time. With a bigger budget, we will be able to get the remaining 5 episodes out in less than a few months. Taking care of our cast and crew is our top priority; it’s their dedication of energy and time that makes shows like Asher possible and they deserve to be well paid.

As well as taking care of our cast and crew, we need to upgrade our tech.

We need:

-To acquire new lenses for the A6500 (which will give us more flexibility on set to cover a variety of visuals).

-Better sound equipment, including a cord and boom pole. We also need a separate mixing unit to plug in headphones into (so we can hear what is being recorded live while filming).

-Additional lights to create a more immersive mood.  

-A new computer with more efficient high resolution footage processing capabilities (our current computer has trouble running 4K footage without crashing the system), and new editing software.

-Gore, creature effects makeup, and practical S/FX (good quality effects will enable us to create more high concept sequences).

Here is the financial breakdown to complete Asher: Between paying our cast and crew and acquiring additional upgraded technology, each episode will cost roughly 5,000. 

-$2,000 - Is the minimum amount we need to buy new lenses, upgrade our audio equipment, pay our core cast, and to hire one additional crew member. This will give us the basic resources to film Episode 2.

-$5,000 - All of the above, plus we can secure additional filming locations, upgrade our special effects, upgrade our lighting equipment, and include a fully realized set piece action sequence (hiring a fight choreographer). We will be able to complete Episode 3.

-$7,500 - All of the above,  and we can upgrade our computer and editing equipment. We will be able to hire additional cast (extras) and one more crew members, as well one additional post-production technician.  These are the optimal resources needed to film Episodes 2 & 3. 

-$10,000 - All of the above and the resources to additionally film all of Episode 4.

-$15,000 - All of the above and the resources to additionally film all of Episode 5.

-$20,000 - All of the above and the resources to additionally film all of Episode 6 (the entire series, Episodes 2-6).

-$25,000 - Allows the resources to complete all filming by the end of year.

INVEST by selecting a donation tier to your right. We are working hard to bring you all fun and rewarding perks. Making this show will be a group effort, and we intend to pay that back with unique and exclusive investor gifts. If you want to donate and get a reward perk, CLICK on the perk that you want.

PROMOTE by copying any of the soon-to-come graphics to share on your social media page to get your friends (and their friends and their friends and…) as well as re-gramming from @AsherTheSeries. We will also be releasing teaser trailers and short video clips that you can share as they are rolled out.

FOLLOW us on Instagram HERE @AsherTheSeries. 

SIGN UP for our mailing list at our website (COMING SOON). You’ll get direct updates about the production whether you can donate or not (if you donate, you can opt to sign up for updates).

Anything you want; every cent counts. We started our Reward Tiers low enough to make it possible for everyone who can donate to feel they are part of the Asher experience and to get unique perks out of it. We do have our sights set high, as we believe in the quality of our story, cast and crew, and capabilities. If you like the show but cannot donate much or at all, consider helping by spreading the word using the resources above.

Meet our cast! 

Cara Brennan  is an actor, writer and competitive strength athlete.  She has competed in Strongwoman competitions around the country, and has a state record in stone lifting (which is exactly as cool as it sounds). Cara is passionate about exploring the relationships between the spiritual and the physical. Her past battles with substance abuse (smoking and alcohol) as well as depression and anxiety inform her work and compel her to tell stories that people in similar situations can find solidarity with.  

Cara's early adolescence brought on a love of sci-fi, horror, and fantasy adventure that has only grown with time. Genre shows and films that have influenced her include Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Angel, True Detective, Terminator 2,  Battlestar Galactica, Blade Runner, the Matrix, Aliens, the Others, Evil Dead 2, Deathproof, the Ring, and the Thing. Asher is a love letter and homage to all of her influences and childhood loves. 

 

Ayyy! I am super stoked about  all things Asher and look forward to ish getting real weird this season! IRL I am a crystal enthusiast and avid collector of minerals, I love to read books on zen and spirituality; I also love animals and naturally, I'm a hugger! Erryday I'm hustling hard as an Actor + Documentary Filmmaker + Writer. Charmed was my favorite series in the 90s and the Shining is my favorite horror film.

Recent works: Same Same Series, What Came After, Birds of Paradise. Currently filming: HERassment

I got Palo Santo in my bag, swag.

 

Sara is an American actress, singer and writer. She was born in Detroit, Michigan and currently resides in NYC. Always having been inspired by the occult and unconventional artists, Sara has gravitated towards similar themed projects. After graduating from The New York Conservatory for Dramatic Arts in 2010, she has not stopped working. Her most recent feature film credits include Stephen King's, THE DARK TOWER, Sonja O'Hara's, OVUM and Brad Raider's, KENSHO AT THE BEDFELLOW. Other credits include the NBC TV series DECEPTION, the award winning TV series DOOMSDAY, and the short film, WAVES FULL OF BLISS, which she starred in and produced. You can check out more of Sara's work on IMDB. For the record, she is not in a cult.  

Some of her favorite scary/paranormal movies include Return to Oz, The Exorcist, Hocus Pocus, The Addams Family, Poltergeist, The Craft, Close Encounters of the Third Kind, Signs, E.T., Casper, The Mummy.

This year marks the 10th anniversary of me moving to New York, during which I've performed, written, stood in blizzards for Greenpeace, conspired to murder cockroaches, eaten several thousand pizzas, and slept on the subway for more nights than I can remember, among many glamorous artistic efforts. 

The best horror takes what is familiar to us, and transforms it into the stuff of nightmares. Your coworkers become tentacle monsters in John Carpenter's The Thing, your girlfriend becomes a headless twirling ballerina in Evil Dead 2, your family dinner becomes a cannibal cabal in The Texas Chainsaw Massacre. It is my hope that Asher continues this grand tradition of familiar nightmares. Happy hunting.

And

 Leon is an action devotee and accomplished personal trainer as well as actor. He loves all things action, including lifting and combat sports. He's excited to bring the mysterious Vargas to life in Asher.
story_txt: Asher (CLICK TO WATCH THE PILOT)  is an original web-series about an exorcist who makes a living policing the paranormal of NYC and helping the Big Apple’s lost souls handle their demons.  She is joined by her best friend and fellow veteran Sam Vargas, her naive but likable spiritual client Cassie, and a young couple who unwittingly involve her in something sinister. The full length pilot is available now, and we are planning another 5 episodes, which is where you come in. But first...Cara Brennan and Jack Payne are co-writers and creators of Asher,  with Cara starring and Jack directing. After collaborating on several passion projects together, they decided it was time to make something a little bigger; something that would allow them to tell the story most important to both of them: The Hero’s Story - the fight of good versus evil.Both creators are passionate about creating art that reflects the individual’s struggle to live with love and faith in a scary and chaotic world.  They believe that discovering the power of the Inner Hero is a liberating imperative for every human being.Cara hails from the Washington, DC area, and Jack from K.C., Missouri. They met at college in NYC in 2007, and have been friends since.To create an original six episode series (episodes each running 20-23 minutes) that will be available to anyone, anywhere.To submit the series to festivals for wider exposure.To use Asher as the flagship of Lonely Cow Productions that enables us to continue to make original content for a global audience.Pre-production for Asher lasted two months, during which time we wrote first drafts for the entire first season, and an outline for season 2.  We assembled a cast, crew, and equipment, while securing filming locations.Filming of the pilot episode went efficiently, lasting full 5 days in total.Post-production took about a month, with Jack taking on the bulk of editing responsibilities, such as picture lock, color correction, sound design, scoring, and special effects. Cara oversaw the editing process while developing the Indiegogo page, promotional materials, and organizing the live NYC premiere.Asher was filmed on the Sony A6500 with a portrait and wide angle lens.Lighting was done on two Yongnuo soft lights and lights that were available on location.Sound was done on the Rode VideoMic Pro attached to the A6500.Editing was completed on a 2011 Mac with Final Cut Pro X.Because you want to see a thrilling detective story with ol’ fashioned gothic horror.Because you like to see strong bad-ass women on TV.Because you like to see heroes who are relatable and imperfect but still try their hardest.Because real life is messy and sometimes our stories need to echo that.Because you believe that art reflects and explores essential truths necessary for a healthy society.To pay our actors, our crew, music usage, location rental, equipment rentals, festival fees, and craft services. If we meet our ultimate goals, Jack and Cara will be able to take a little time off from their day jobs to get the series out sooner.  The pilot was fully funded by the creators while they worked full time. With a bigger budget, we will be able to get the remaining 5 episodes out in less than a few months. Taking care of our cast and crew is our top priority; it’s their dedication of energy and time that makes shows like Asher possible and they deserve to be well paid.As well as taking care of our cast and crew, we need to upgrade our tech.We need:-To acquire new lenses for the A6500 (which will give us more flexibility on set to cover a variety of visuals).-Better sound equipment, including a cord and boom pole. We also need a separate mixing unit to plug in headphones into (so we can hear what is being recorded live while filming).-Additional lights to create a more immersive mood.  -A new computer with more efficient high resolution footage processing capabilities (our current computer has trouble running 4K footage without crashing the system), and new editing software.-Gore, creature effects makeup, and practical S/FX (good quality effects will enable us to create more high concept sequences).Here is the financial breakdown to complete Asher: Between paying our cast and crew and acquiring additional upgraded technology, each episode will cost roughly 5,000. -$2,000 - Is the minimum amount we need to buy new lenses, upgrade our audio equipment, pay our core cast, and to hire one additional crew member. This will give us the basic resources to film Episode 2.-$5,000 - All of the above, plus we can secure additional filming locations, upgrade our special effects, upgrade our lighting equipment, and include a fully realized set piece action sequence (hiring a fight choreographer). We will be able to complete Episode 3.-$7,500 - All of the above,  and we can upgrade our computer and editing equipment. We will be able to hire additional cast (extras) and one more crew members, as well one additional post-production technician.  These are the optimal resources needed to film Episodes 2 & 3. -$10,000 - All of the above and the resources to additionally film all of Episode 4.-$15,000 - All of the above and the resources to additionally film all of Episode 5.-$20,000 - All of the above and the resources to additionally film all of Episode 6 (the entire series, Episodes 2-6).-$25,000 - Allows the resources to complete all filming by the end of year.INVEST by selecting a donation tier to your right. We are working hard to bring you all fun and rewarding perks. Making this show will be a group effort, and we intend to pay that back with unique and exclusive investor gifts. If you want to donate and get a reward perk, CLICK on the perk that you want.PROMOTE by copying any of the soon-to-come graphics to share on your social media page to get your friends (and their friends and their friends and…) as well as re-gramming from @AsherTheSeries. We will also be releasing teaser trailers and short video clips that you can share as they are rolled out.FOLLOW us on Instagram HERE @AsherTheSeries. SIGN UP for our mailing list at our website (COMING SOON). You’ll get direct updates about the production whether you can donate or not (if you donate, you can opt to sign up for updates).Anything you want; every cent counts. We started our Reward Tiers low enough to make it possible for everyone who can donate to feel they are part of the Asher experience and to get unique perks out of it. story:
US, THE SHOW & WHY

Let’s get straight to the point about what this show is about, and why we’re the people telling it. 

John Paul Harkins and Genevieve Thompson are two NYC based Actors who, for a long time, relied on the Sharing Economy model to survive in a city which has become unaffordable for artists. In their case, it was Uber and Airbnb. We’ve now created a show about the reality of what it’s like to live that model while trying not to lose sight of our dreams, which can at times, seem beyond our reach. The show follows the lives of 3 Actors:

- Jackie (played by Genevieve Thompson), who rents out the extra bedrooms in her (and sometimes other people's) apartment on Airbnb <in the show, "ShareBnB">

- Will (played by John Paul Harkins), who drives for Uber <in the show, "Ultra">

- Arie (played by Samantha Aneson), who delivers for Postmates <in the show, "Deliver-Ease">

"ETA", which stands for Estimated Time Arrival can be applied to a customer waiting for a pick-up, a host waiting for her guest, and a delivery waiting to be made. Most importantly, what is the ETA of our careers? Is there one?

 

The reality of our Today is that JP and I are not the only ones who’ve jumped on that Sharing Economy band wagon. We hope to create a show that artists and freelancers alike relate to. For those coming from a different vantage point, we hope to provide an authentic, time-relevant, and refreshingly honest depiction of life in our shoes. 

 

"In what is called collaborative consumption, the sharing economy or the peer economy, owners rent out something they are not using, such as a car, house or bicycle to a stranger using these peer-to-peer services. The company typically has an eBay-style rating or review system so people on both sides of the transaction can trust the other. With the popularity of these services, many people don't need to buy when they can rent from others. Above, Ron J. Williams, CEO of SnapGoods, a site for lending and borrowing high-end household items, such as cameras, kitchenware or musical instrument."

- Forbes

WHAT WE NEED

A little... a lot help from our friends (and others). Basically, we've shot 6 episodes, but now we need the funds to have them edited before we can pitch the show to the networks below. We have someone with professional TV-series editing experience who has agreed to give us a massive discount, but it will still cost us. Additionally, we would like to shoot the last 6 episodes of Season 1.

WHERE WE'RE HEADED

Vimeo/Youtube ----> HBO / SHOWTIME is obviously the goal.

 

ABOUT THE PERKS

In regards to The Perks, the amount you donate does not have to be exactly that number, but must be at least that number to claim the perks. Meaning - if you donate $45, you still get the "Thank you" Mention in the credits! If you donate a certain amount but do not wish to claim the perks, please write us! Otherwise, we will follow up with in you in regards to delivering the perks!

story:
Dating in LA is hard enough. For ALICIA, dating in LA is an even bigger struggle as she is part of one of the least desirable dating groups – black women. The few guys who are interested in her are usually white men who fetishize her blackness, or fuckboys – men who are only interested in one night stands. Despite a string of bad dating luck, Alicia refuses to give up hope. She’s determined to find the man of her dreams. Which is why she thinks her fate has finally changed when she matches with JORDAN on Tinder. In addition to being fine as hell, he’s smart, funny, and everything Alicia wants in a guy. Unfortunately, Jordan doesn’t see Alicia the same way. After their first date, Jordan “ghosts” Alicia. He stops answering Alicia’s calls, texts, and, worst of all, ignores her Facebook friend request. Not wanting to give up on love, Alicia employs every tactic in the book, from sending illicit thirst traps (the dick pic of 2017) through Snapchat, to liking several of Jordan’s photos on Instagram. Alicia’s best friend, MALLORIE (24), a traditional dating aficionado, wants Alicia to forget Jordan and jump back on the dating horse without going the route of dating apps and thirst traps. Alicia is determined to get Jordan back and have the true love she has always dreamed of, even if it means embarrassing herself along the way.

Over the course of ten episodes, we see Alicia go from hiring an Instagram dating coach, famous for his “Instagram Not to Instagram Thot” video series, to participating in a reality show entitled “Swipe Right on Love”, a game that brings dating apps to life, to forcing her friends to recreate their entire snap story at the club from the night before so Jordan can see how much fun she is. Most importantly, we see Alicia learn to not settle for the first guy who comes along as she meets ADRIAN, an Asian man, who, next to black women, are the least sought after demographic on dating sites.

Want to see more? Here is a look at our first episode:

If dating in the social media age is the series protagonist, then race relations in dating is the pivotal character.  One of the big inspirations behind the series is that black women and Asian men are the least sought after demographic on dating sites. I strongly believe this has a lot to do with how black women and Asian men are perceived in the media. While there are shows like Insecure and Chewing Gum, those are only two voices that are speaking about the black female experience. As a black woman from the south, who grew up in a predominately white neighborhood, I can say that my experiences with dating are starkly different from the ones portrayed on these shows. Not to say that shows like Insecure and Chewing Gum do not give an accurate representation of the black female experience, but there is room for more. As the series progresses, we see Alicia confront the racial stigmas that come with dating as a black woman.

Another thing that makes Dating Now unique is that it does not just focus on the black woman’s perspective. Alicia’s best friend, Mallorie, and her eventual love interest, Adrian, are both Asian. The series goes into a discussion on the obstacles this demographic faces as well. The overall goal of Dating Now is to poke fun at dating, while also opening up a discussion about our prejudices and minority representation in media.

Dating Now is a mix between Insecure, Man Seeking Woman and Chewing Gum, in that the show takes a surreal approach to dating and race. No one episode of the series is the same. Alicia’s journey begins with her getting advice from a mannequin on proper hand-job techniques and spirals from there. Later in the series, when Alicia meets her love interest, Adrian, we see their relationship play out in an extended Rom-Com trailer. In the final episode, when Alicia and Adrian are comfortable with their relationship, we see them deal with the stereotypes the outside world puts on a Blasian couple in a Horror, Thriller- inspired episode.

Tasha Henderson (Writer/Actor) Tasha Henderson was born in Dallas, Texas, the land of vicious smiles and backhanded compliments. Her writing style is a mix of southern charm with a dash of grit. After graduating from Oklahoma State University, with a B.A. in Film Studies, Henderson went on to earn her M.F.A in Screenwriting from Loyola Marymount University. Henderson co-wrote and produced complex[ion] woman, a play that explores the intricacies of Black womanhood and won the Encore Producer’s Award at the 2016 Hollywood Fringe Festival. She is currently an LMU Incubator Lab and Project Involve Fellow.

Brett Takeshita (Producer)  Brett Takeshita is a Los Angeles-based producer and director who received a B.A. in Film and Television Production, and a minor in Film, Television, and Media Studies from Loyola Marymount University. He has worked on over 100 web series, short films, commercials, and features, with most of them being comedies that appeal to adults who embrace their inner 13-year-old. Brett serves as a writer and producer of the mockumentary web series, Hard Medicine, which is executive produced by Jay Ellis (star of HBO's Insecure) and currently airing on Urban Movie Channel. He is thrilled to work alongside Tasha and bring the edgy, hilarious, and honest Dating Now to life.

Diana Lu (Actor) Diana Lu is a San Francisco native and as the first of her family to be born in America, she often finds herself reconciling the differences between being American and being Chinese. This desire to expose the Asian American experience and find a sense of belonging is what fuels her desires as an actress and writer.  She recently completed a Summer Theater Company at Royal Central School of Speech and Drama in London and you can catch her in comedies such as Brooklyn Nine-Nine or the fun daytime drama, The Bold and The Beautiful. 

 

While the first episode of the series has been shot, Dating Now is currently in pre-production on our remaining nine episodes. The remaining episodes range from eight to fifteen minutes in length. With equipment, locations, and paying the crew, each episode will cost around $1,900 to make. Your contribution will help fund, our crew, food, equipment, locations, props, and more.

You also get some cool perks if you donate. Perks include, a Facebook shout out, Tinder advice, a chance to be in the web series, and much much more!

Please donate and share our video! You can also follow us on Twitter, Instagram, Facebook, and Tinder for updates on the web series.

Thank you for your support! Can’t wait to share our hard work with you!

story:
About us

The world realized the importance of our bucket list and showed their support. The truth is, we don't deserve this bucket list any more than other people fighting cancer. From this point forward, our primary goal is to make Web Series and Full Documentaries allowing cancer patients to experience their bucket lists.

Bucket Lists aren't easy, but if we come together we can change the lives of patients across the world.

Here is a great summary of who we are from the Washington Post, and here is our Youtube channel. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • $15000 of this budget will go to creating a full-documentary about Lexi, a girl our age battling cancer. Here is her bucket list we will be crossing off with her:
  • (1) Meet Selena Gomez 
    (2) Go back to the beach 
    (3) Play with a pile of puppies 
    (4) Meet any Marvel Actor 
    (5) Go to a Duke Game in Cameron Indoor 
    (6) Meet a cheetah 
    (7) Swim with Dolphins 
    (8) Travel to Hawaii, my dream vacay 
    (9) Backstage P!ATD concert or Bastille concert 
    (10) Walk a fashion runway 
    (11) Zip-lining on a real zip-line 
    (12) Be on Ellen 
    (13) Do 50 random acts of kindness in one day 
    (14) Extra in a commercial, tv show or movie 
    (15) Meet Shane & Ryan from Buzzfeed Unsolved 
    (16) Parasailing 
    (17) Tour Giants stadium 
    (18) Ride a cable car in San Fran 
    (19) Pay for someone else’s meal dining out 
    (20) Visit Alcatraz 
    (21) Walk the Golden Gate Bridge
    (22) Go to a famous person's restauran
    (23) Visit the Redwood Forest
    (24) Visit Europe 
    (25) Watch all the marvel movies in order
  • If we do not reach our entire goal, a documentary will still come out, but we may not be able to cross off all the list items. Learn more about Lexi.

Risks & Challenges

Bucket lists aren't easy, we know that.

  • Some items on people's bucket lists require other people, like meeting Selena Gomez. There is a fair chance we won't be able to do that but we firmly believe we can come together as a community to make anything happen
  • Because of the situation people like Chris and Lexi are in, we are always uncertain of their ability to travel. If someone becomes hospital ridden the bucket list wouldn't be as adventurous but it would become more human, and we can adapt to that. 

Other Ways You Can Help

1. Follow us on Youtube. 

2. Allow us to make weekly videos and content forever on Patreon. 

3. Most importantly, share this link wherever you can.

story:
Why and What Is Green Garden?

In 2017, 63% of Americans thought it was time to federally legalize cannabis. Those in the remaining 37% tend to belong to an older generation whose peripheral exposure to cannabis use came from exaggerated personae like Snoop Dogg, Cheech & Chong, and the characters on Weeds. But there are people who need cannabis to treat real medical conditions such as epilepsy, autism, PTSD, anxiety, and cancer. Some of these patients are children.

Meet Aiden. Aiden has epilepsy. Aiden’s parents, Nina and Osiris, watched their child suffer 200 seizures PER DAY. They decided that that was enough. Aiden became a medical cannabis patient; his seizures have dropped to 10 per month. Imagine Aiden’s childhood had a silly thing like stigma not stood in the way of legitimate treatment for his condition.

Aiden is just one of many helped by the legalization of cannabis. How many years must those in states that still criminalize cannabis wait before progress is achieved at the federal level?

The Creators of 'Green Garden' say ENOUGH.

We will not wait for lawmakers to come around: we will educate and communicate. Television can be manipulated to spread false narratives, but it can also be harnessed to clarify misperceptions and gain new perspectives.

The Green Garden team -- Emmy-nominated Stephen Robert Morse of Observatory Films, Matt Cianfrani of Cianfrani Films, and Rita Vinnik of Talbot Street Productions -- came together to do for cannabis users, patients, and caregivers what The Ellen Show and Will & Grace did for the LGBTQ community.

'Green Garden' is a cannabis cooking series. The format, a blend of ABC's The View and VICE Media's Bong Appetit, will use discussion, cooking, and storytelling to engage Americans of every background.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

This is a brand new format and we know we need to get it JUST RIGHT from the beginning. We have the talent, the connections, and the passion to push this series into the world. All we’re short on is the cash to produce a polished pilot episode to pitch to a mainstream entertainment platforms. Our partner, Stephen Robert Morse of Observatory Films, has a consistent track record of doing this well.

The funds raised will go toward pre-production and development, writers, talent and crew, set, transportation (until the laws on the East Coast permit it, we’ll need to shoot in Los Angeles), post-production, and editing. EVERY DOLLAR HELPS: we hope to leverage what we raise as proof-of-concept for our idea.

We at Green Garden are mobilizing our networks to help us reach this game-changing goal. Are you in? Will you help us make this happen?

What's in it for you?

Check out all the AMAZING PERKS we packaged just for you on the right!   

IF WE DON’T REACH OUR GOAL: There is no scrapping this project: we are 100% committed and will be fundraising through other avenues as well. Every bit of funding counts towards bringing this project to life.

The Impact

In 2017 alone, over 70,000 people died from opioid use. Cannabis, a drug with no recorded overdoses in history, is being used in certain states to wean addicts off opioids. Yet 85% of the more than 643,000 people jailed from 2006 to 2010 were imprisoned for non-violent cannabis possession. Think about that. Research has shown that cannabis can shrink cancer cells but the federal government still groups cannabis with hard drugs like heroin. Furthermore, jobs created by the cannabis industry have a 445% growth rate. Many of us have heard how many billions of dollars this industry is projected to make by 2020, but these figures pale in comparison with the economic engine created if all 50 states had the freedom to regulate a recreational cannabis market.

For most people, the picture is clear: lives lost and dollars lost makes no sense in 2018! Green Garden will help normalize conversation, remove stigma, and change America. If your cookbook, vape pen, or studio visit aren’t gratification enough, you can sleep soundly knowing your contribution has helped build something that brings this country forward. Your backing helps hundreds of thousands of people live their lives in peace and good health. And by opening up new markets of receptive consumers, Green Garden helps your other cannabis investments flourish, too!

 

Risks & Challenges

The rewards that would come from the success of this project are immense: open markets, changed laws, and evolving perspectives. These benefits are community-wide.  But there are also many risks in both the entertainment and cannabis space. As a result, it’s important that we distribute the risks of this project across the community, too.  This is why we hope to raise most (if not all) of the funds we need through this Indiegogo campaign.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't swing a contribution right now! Do you know what’s free to you and means everything to us? You sharing our campaign with your network! (Just use the Indiegogo share links or go old school and  email the link to people some/all of the people you know.
