story:
Funding part 2 update video

Hey hi what's up it's me Adam Reines!! 

I made an Indiegogo! That's this. You're here right now reading it.

I'm 22, from New Jersey, I'm an actor, writer and barista (shocking.) So, here's a little background regarding this project. I started writing the pilot episode to this project in March of 2016. It was going well, until I put it on hiatus due to the fact that I was too depressed to write, let alone leave my bed on most days. I was that depressed when I started writing it as well, but it got worse. From 2014 to January 2017, I was on and off suicidal.

However, through hard, hard work in therapy and finding the right medication for me, I haven't had a genuine suicidal thought since January. I finished writing the pilot episode a month ago from posting this, and I am excited, eager, and hungry for this to get made. This story is a super important and valuable story to share with the world and I know that it will do nothing but good.

Dust is not about me. The main message of this story is to exercise empathy, it teaches you how to get over emotional roadblocks no matter how severe they are, and it teaches how to deal with your internal demons. All with a healthy dose of dark comedic relief. You'll feel uncomfortable as fuck, you'll cry, your heart will warm, and most importantly, you'll laugh.  

Why I'm asking for money

Right. So. Why should you donate your hard-earned cash to lil' ol' me. Here are some reasons (holy shit I'm so bad at this):

I have a full production team of professionals and people who work in the industry working on this with me. I would like to pay them. I have my director and two other crew members flying in from LA (I live in NJ) and I would like to pay for their food and hotel. As for the others, they are taking time off from their jobs to work on this with me for 6 days. I would also like to compensate them, as this means way much more to me than words can express and they'd be missing out on funds from work. 

We are shooting after-hours at a deli for two-three days for this shoot. I know the owner would also appreciate some compensation, as they'd be running the electricity for longer than they usually do, and we will be using the equipment in the kitchen, sucking up precious electricity. 

Paying for miscellaneous items; such as props. I have a good graphic designer friend of mine who will be making some posters and labels for props (she doesn't know this yet, actually, but hi Jacqui xoxo) and I would like to compensate her for that as well. Promotional stills, advertisements, editing, and everything post-production will be handled by friends of mine. These donations are more-so going to everyone else besides me. 

Any left over funds from this campaign would go towards shooting the rest of the episodes, which I will also try to fund through Indiegogo. Due to the fact that I'm not an established actor in the industry, it will be harder to shoot the rest of the episodes. Unless this gets picked up by a network. (I'm looking DIRECTLY at you, Netflix.) ((also Hulu)) (((also literally any network in the entire world ok))) If it doesn't get picked up, they will come out between relatively large gaps of time. I have two out of the six written, and the other four I have completely planned out plot-wise in my records. Aka I know exactly everything that happens in the series and exactly what will happen.

And lastly, it might make you feel good to help make someone's dream come true. This is my dream. Not fame. Not money. But being able to put together a piece of art that will actually benefit the public. To create something that will effect people's lives in a positive way. To get people thinking in a way they normally wouldn't. To make people feel. To make people laugh. 

Risks & Challenges

As I mentioned previously, this campaign is only for the pilot episode. Any leftover funds from this Indiegogo will be saved for shooting the other episodes. Like I said, as an unknown nobody in the acting world, it is very hard to shoot an entire miniseries solely off of one campaign, especially when your director lives 3,000 miles away. However, the rest will be made. That is the only challenge I am facing in terms of the whole project. In terms of the pilot, the only challenge is compensating everyone :) 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't swing donating to this campaign, that is a-okay. Believe me, I understand. I'm a broke-ass. Yesterday, all I ate was a bowl of cereal. I'm on my state's health insurance. 65% of my wardrobe consists of things I've had since senior year of high school.

But, you can help in a free kind of way!

Please share this Indiegogo. That's all I ask. Maybe write a lil post with it about how gr8 this seems/how gr8 I am and that's it. Or don't. Honestly do whatever you want. Go watch youtube. Actually, watch this video; It's hilarious: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xYc4DT18EJg

story:
The first night is a bomb. He forgets the material, gets heckled, veritably dies on stage. But Jack does a show the very next night. And the next night. And the next night. People actually laugh. And the game is on.

This is a show about the ups and downs of the comedy world from the perspective of an up and coming comic on a mission to complete 100 nights of stand up comedy. The show follows the full roller coaster: the bombs, the kills, the anguish, the high. It's all in there.

We go through each of the shows in as much detail as is necessary. The progression is broken up by episode-themed topics like "The Process" or "The Callback" ...or "the Rule of Three." Jack teaches you what he knows about comedy and talks to working comics to get their take on the subject of the day. He shares the lessons he learns on the road by reading the crowd and watching and talking to other comics, and interviewing venue owners to get their take on this strange business. And finally, you get to see the life a comedian lives... Being broke, struggling, and chasing the dream.

Here’s the sizzle reel for the show, so you can see what we’re doing here. Warning, Strangling Jack works blue so there is some potty mouth in the external videos:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9x87SI0Ljcs

 

Strangling Jack is an acclaimed impressionist, comedy writer, and film and stage actor. Jack just got off a four year residency as the star of Evil Dead the Musical in Las Vegas. He played the starring role, “Ash” and also took over as the director of the show. Before that he was the MVP for the World Famous Swinging Johnson Brothers, an improv comedy and sketch group which ran strong for 10 years. With the group, he's done hundreds of live shows and sketches. They even made a full length feature film, “Driving Bill Crazy.” He’s been a regular “voice guy” on radio shows and cartoons. He’s done everything in the comedy world, except really tackling stand up comedy. The time is now.

Here’s Strangling Jack’s old impression demo so you can see what you’re dealing with here. Warning, there are a couple of naughty words:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Skajt3TENFQ

 

And here’s a commercial for Evil Dead the Musical! So you can see what Jack’s been up to for the last half decade:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yiNhXY9cbEo


It’s often said (er, complained) that there are very few stand up comedy documentaries, and even fewer good ones. This is better than a documentary - it’s a documentary series! Also for some reason, stand up comedy documentaries usually have a sad or dreary feel to them. Not this one. It’s fun, fast paced, even informative. The truly unique part of the show is that we start from the beginning. We film every show, and we’re already over 30 shows in. You can watch every stand up show in it’s entirety and see Strangling Jack’s progress unfold as it happens long before the nights are discussed in the show.

Another cutting edge aspect of the show is that Strangling Jack already has a large following. Go ahead, Google Strangling Jack. He’s a renowned impressionist, a veteran comedy writer and a professional performer, so he’s a good person to follow on a crazy adventure like this. He can move quickly and give the audience an insider’s view into the world of comedy. He also likes to be interactive. He’ll often take challenges from fans online, and use them in his sets.

This show is happening no matter what. The talent doubles as the crew in many situations, so we can work very cheap. Much of the videography has already been done, and the show is already getting a buzz. This campaign just gives the show the opportunity to be the best it can be.

Another draw to the show is the awesome production team. There are currently four heavyweights involved with the show: the producer/editor, Chris Weidman, was a head editor for Slash and Creed, and has two full length motion pictures under his belt as well as hundreds of projects on his resume.

 The Director/videographer; Stephannie Takagawa has a degree in directing and has studied several international styles of directing including an internship with the Royal Shakespeare Company at the Globe Theater in England.

Our visual effects guru is Kevin Lyons, an After Effects master having created gorgeous motion artwork and titles for hundreds of commercials and films and is a protege of Andrew Kramer (one of the most famous visual effects artists in the world), and is currently working on Star Wars as JJ Abrams’ head of visual effects.

 

Finally, animation will be handled by NachoToonz, a company run by Jeff Campbell. Jeff has worked for Disney, Nickelodeon, and many of the top animation houses in the country. He is currently working with Dan Harmon of Rick and Morty fame.

This team might be the biggest selling point of the entire project.

This show is happening no matter what. You guys just get to decide how good it is. The show’s quality is currently hindered by monetary constraints. In order to be a working entertainer, you have to make some sacrifices. Ramen-a-plenty, getting robbed, moving to California. There’s also a lot of costs to making a production... and the crew is in the same shape as Jack. Our equipment is in serious disrepair. The editing computer is on its last leg. We also need gear, staff, travel (so we can come to your town!), and of course, time. Every moment spent raising money is less time shooting, writing, performing, and making a kick ass show.

There are actually 3 tiers of funding goals.

The official goal is tier #1 at $10,000. This gives us the equipment and staff to make a killer show. It’ll be 3 seasons of 11 minute episodes released online.

Tier #2 is $20,000. If we make it to this goal, this is our job. All of our time and energy is devoted to making the best show possible. Constant travel, celebrity interviews, better equipment, multicam shoots, and much more.

Tier #3 is $30,000.  If we make it to this goal, it’s no longer a web series. We’re now developing a 22-30 minute television series for cable or Netflix distribution. We get an expanded staff, international travel. In this format, one season will cover all 100 shows. We will also deliver a bonus web series that will show how we’re making the show and a more in depth look into Jack’s personal life, so you still get your web series. We wouldn’t want to deprive you of that.
 

Ah, the perks! Every crowd funding campaign has some delightful kitchy perks in exchange for your patronage and we’re no different! You can get the usuals like DVDs, posters, t-shirt, etc. But we also have some good high end enticement like Jack’s Jacket (aka "The Strangling Jacket"), and executive producer credits. All shipping will be calculated, except for the t-shirt, which has free shipping no matter where you are. We’re not making money by jacking up shipping fees. This isn’t E-bay. The SEC won’t allowed us to offer monetary returns through crowdfunding campaigns, but if you’re interested in more traditional investment opportunities, contact us privately.

You can donate using the options to the right. But if you’re broke like us, there’s other ways to help. You can share out of this campaign with everyone you’ve ever met. Your family, your friends, your enemies. Especially your enemies. Spam those bastards! If you know anyone in the media, give us a plug. If you know any tour bookers or club bookers that Jack might be good for, send them our way. Money from comedy gigs will also go to our end goal.

You can also sign up for our mailing list on stranglingjack.com to get updates on the project. You’ll also get the first shot at opportunities in upcoming projects like the 90 minute stand up special we’ll be filming in January.

Thank you all for staying with Jack all these years, helping us out with this campaign and helping us make a great show.
story_txt:
The first night is a bomb. He forgets the material, gets heckled, veritably dies on stage. But Jack does a show the very next night. And the next night. And the next night. People actually laugh. And the game is on.This is a show about the ups and downs of the comedy world from the perspective of an up and coming comic on a mission to complete 100 nights of stand up comedy. The show follows the full roller coaster: the bombs, the kills, the anguish, the high. It's all in there.We go through each of the shows in as much detail as is necessary. The progression is broken up by episode-themed topics like "The Process" or "The Callback" ...or "the Rule of Three." Jack teaches you what he knows about comedy and talks to working comics to get their take on the subject of the day. He shares the lessons he learns on the road by reading the crowd and watching and talking to other comics, and interviewing venue owners to get their take on this strange business. And finally, you get to see the life a comedian lives... Being broke, struggling, and chasing the dream.Here’s the sizzle reel for the show, so you can see what we’re doing here. Warning, Strangling Jack works blue so there is some potty mouth in the external videos:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9x87SI0Ljcs

 

Strangling Jack is an acclaimed impressionist, comedy writer, and film and stage actor. Jack just got off a four year residency as the star of Evil Dead the Musical in Las Vegas. He played the starring role, “Ash” and also took over as the director of the show. Before that he was the MVP for the World Famous Swinging Johnson Brothers, an improv comedy and sketch group which ran strong for 10 years. With the group, he's done hundreds of live shows and sketches. They even made a full length feature film, “Driving Bill Crazy.” He’s been a regular “voice guy” on radio shows and cartoons. He’s done everything in the comedy world, except really tackling stand up comedy. The time is now.Here’s Strangling Jack’s old impression demo so you can see what you’re dealing with here. Warning, there are a couple of naughty words:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Skajt3TENFQ And here’s a commercial for Evil Dead the Musical! So you can see what Jack’s been up to for the last half decade:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yiNhXY9cbEoIt’s often said (er, complained) that there are very few stand up comedy documentaries, and even fewer good ones. This is better than a documentary - it’s a documentary series! Also for some reason, stand up comedy documentaries usually have a sad or dreary feel to them. Not this one. It’s fun, fast paced, even informative. The truly unique part of the show is that we start from the beginning. We film every show, and we’re already over 30 shows in. You can watch every stand up show in it’s entirety and see Strangling Jack’s progress unfold as it happens long before the nights are discussed in the show.Another cutting edge aspect of the show is that Strangling Jack already has a large following. Go ahead, Google Strangling Jack. He’s a renowned impressionist, a veteran comedy writer and a professional performer, so he’s a good person to follow on a crazy adventure like this. He can move quickly and give the audience an insider’s view into the world of comedy. He also likes to be interactive. He’ll often take challenges from fans online, and use them in his sets.This show is happening no matter what. The talent doubles as the crew in many situations, so we can work very cheap. Much of the videography has already been done, and the show is already getting a buzz. This campaign just gives the show the opportunity to be the best it can be.Another draw to the show is the awesome production team. There are currently four heavyweights involved with the show: the producer/editor, Chris Weidman, was a head editor for Slash and Creed, and has two full length motion pictures under his belt as well as hundreds of projects on his resume. The Director/videographer; Stephannie Takagawa has a degree in directing and has studied several international styles of directing including an internship with the Royal Shakespeare Company at the Globe Theater in England.Our visual effects guru is Kevin Lyons, an After Effects master having created gorgeous motion artwork and titles for hundreds of commercials and films and is a protege of Andrew Kramer (one of the most famous visual effects artists in the world), and is currently working on Star Wars as JJ Abrams’ head of visual effects. Finally, animation will be handled by NachoToonz, a company run by Jeff Campbell. Jeff has worked for Disney, Nickelodeon, and many of the top animation houses in the country. He is currently working with Dan Harmon of Rick and Morty fame.This team might be the biggest selling point of the entire project.This show is happening no matter what. You guys just get to decide how good it is. The show’s quality is currently hindered by monetary constraints. In order to be a working entertainer, you have to make some sacrifices. Ramen-a-plenty, getting robbed, moving to California. There’s also a lot of costs to making a production... and the crew is in the same shape as Jack. Our equipment is in serious disrepair. The editing computer is on its last leg. We also need gear, staff, travel (so we can come to your town!), and of course, time. Every moment spent raising money is less time shooting, writing, performing, and making a kick ass show.There are actually 3 tiers of funding goals.The official goal is tier #1 at $10,000. This gives us the equipment and staff to make a killer show. It’ll be 3 seasons of 11 minute episodes released online.Tier #2 is $20,000. If we make it to this goal, this is our job. All of our time and energy is devoted to making the best show possible. Constant travel, celebrity interviews, better equipment, multicam shoots, and much more.Tier #3 is $30,000.  If we make it to this goal, it’s no longer a web series. We’re now developing a 22-30 minute television series for cable or Netflix distribution. We get an expanded staff, international travel. In this format, one season will cover all 100 shows. We will also deliver a bonus web series that will show how we’re making the show and a more in depth look into Jack’s personal life, so you still get your web series. We wouldn’t want to deprive you of that. Ah, the perks! Every crowd funding campaign has some delightful kitchy perks in exchange for your patronage and we’re no different! You can get the usuals like DVDs, posters, t-shirt, etc. But we also have some good high end enticement like Jack’s Jacket (aka "The Strangling Jacket"), and executive producer credits. All shipping will be calculated, except for the t-shirt, which has free shipping no matter where you are. We’re not making money by jacking up shipping fees. This isn’t E-bay. The SEC won’t allowed us to offer monetary returns through crowdfunding campaigns, but if you’re interested in more traditional investment opportunities, contact us privately.You can donate using the options to the right. But if you’re broke like us, there’s other ways to help. You can share out of this campaign with everyone you’ve ever met. Your family, your friends, your enemies. Especially your enemies. Spam those bastards! If you know anyone in the media, give us a plug. If you know any tour bookers or club bookers that Jack might be good for, send them our way. Money from comedy gigs will also go to our end goal.You can also sign up for our mailing list on stranglingjack.com to get updates on the project. You’ll also get the first shot at opportunities in upcoming projects like the 90 minute stand up special we’ll be filming in January.Thank you all for staying with Jack all these years, helping us out with this campaign and helping us make a great show.

story: 1

On Order and Away

Just think... SCRUBS but set in a country restaurant. A heart-warming comedy/drama that's bizarre... wacky! A break from reality.

  • Written and directed by RICHARD J. PERRY
  • Produced by Richard J. Perry and Simon Nader
  • Starring a cast of (as yet, but you can help change that) unknown British talent

RICHARD J. PERRY

Writer/Director

Previously, Richard has made three feature films, multiple music promos and commercials. He's worked for Marvel, Warner Brothers, Legendary Pictures and is now looking to tell this story. Your contribution will help enormously and, like all crowdfunding projects, we owe so much to those who contribute to seeing our dream become reality. You can see some of his work at www.perrypictures.co.uk

SIMON NADER

Producer

Simon is predominantly an actor and director best known for his work on award-winning miniseries Houdini, Silent Witness and The Terror. He played the leading role  in Richard's feature film Therapy and is a teacher and mentor to young people working in the entertainment industry. He is passionate about getting On Order and Away onto screens with your invaluable help as crowdfunders.

What We Need & What You Get

Here is a break down of incentives on offer to you for helping us so generously - we really care about giving something back to you if you go out of your way to help us!

  • We can create our pilot for £6000. This will cover location costs, equipment and catering, transport costs and paying our actors, which is important to us.

Rewards

  • £5 donation = Insta-Face-Tweet saying thanks!
  • £10 = the above + Thanks Credit (6th episode)
  • £20  = the above + Special Thanks Credit (every episode)
  • £50 = the above + Digital Print from Episode One, signed by cast and crew + Printed Mug with artwork from the show
  • £100 = the above + DVD of complete series signed by cast and crew + Ident Poster of TV show printed, signed by cast and crew
  • £500 = the above + Digital Copy of complete series + Printed T-shirt with artwork + Bound Scripts of all six episodes, Episode One to be signed by cast and crew

High Financial Investment Rewards

  • £1000 =  the above + Set Visit for an episode + Premiere Screening of episode one in the cinema + Credit - Thanks for the huge contribution
  • £5000 = the above + Featured Extra Role in the show + DVD/Digital File of all Behind The Scenes footage + Clapper Board signed by cast and crew

All rewards will be delivered once the entire series is completed or your generous donations would just go on buying you merchandise...  

The Impact

How your donation will help us:

  • We want the highest production values that we can achieve. Your donations will enable us to proceed in the most professionally relevant manner possible and ultimately make this Pilot Episode as appealing to networks as possible.
  • Paying our actors an upfront fee for their time on top of production costs will be possible.
  • Richard J. Perry has excellent relationships with potential buyers already, previously having sold other projects to prestigious companies such as Shoreline Entertainment. We are highly confident that his previous portfolio allied to a polished final product in the delivery of On Order and Away will result in a high chance of a full series commission.
  • This is very much the first step for us - your help at this time is invaluable to us for delivering a high quality product and ultimately developing a full, commissioned series.

Risks & Challenges

Unforseen factors can cause havoc with film and television shoots, such as weather issues, equipment failure and other creative variables! We feel that our target funding amount is responsible and realistic in order to fully achieve our goal of shooting a high quality pilot.

  • An experienced, professional crew will be hired to minimise unforeseen risks. We know what we are doing and have delivered on past projects.
  • Actors will have a three-stage casting process and will be working professionals.
  • Locations will be familiar, accessible and fully vetted.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, we appreciate your looking at us anyway, but you can help us without financial investment and we would be very grateful for the following:

  • Please share links to this page and tell anyone you think may be interested about us!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!
  • Social Media is everything today for getting the word out, but so is an old fashioned email or text to a friend or colleague :) 
  • FACEBOOK - https://www.facebook.com/onorderandaway
  • TWITTER - https://twitter.com/onorderandaway

Thank you so much if you are able to help, we cannot wait to get On Order and Away ordered... and away!

story: Lo scopo di questa campagna è supportare il canale e fare in modo che lo stesso possa, grazie ai vostri contributi, continuare a proporre il format tanto amato dei riassunti.

story:
WOMEN 2 WOMEN

This series is based around a close-knit circle of women who are all tied together by their past. These four girlfriends stay so close because they would be ashamed or embarrassed to admit the damage that their childhood has done to their adult life to anyone else. We watch their daily struggle to maintain their sanity, mind, and self-control after being sexually and physically abused.

The men in that are in love with them find themselves in a world wind of emotional ups and downs.

The cast is full of great actors such as Nicole Eggert our former Baywatch Beauty. Andrea Kelly(formerly married to singer R. Kelly), the Ex-Wife of Hollywood VH1 Reality star and the creator and writer Della Savoury.

The amazing talent doesn't stop there with the beautiful ladies. The male cast speaks for themselves: Tobias Truvillion(D-Major) from FOX series"EMPIRE", The new "James Bond " actor Adamo Palladino, the great Andre Pitre and Gregory Madalson. Our cast is full of accredited actors who are committed to their crafts. 

 

             PRODUCTION AND FILMING

 

DIRECTOR 

Leonardo “Lenny” Gonzalez, is well rounded in the aspect of filmmaking. He was the       director of Miami Snow, and has an extensive background in editing. He is also CEO of Rhino Studios. Rhino Studios provides production services at the highest standards of quality and creativity. Rhino Studios has the infrastructure and in-house capacity to provide complete solutions to a broad range of customers, including: major motion picture studios, television networks and cable companies, advertising agencies, brands, production companies, independent producers, distributors and content owners.

PRODUCER

Cherie Johnson, is an actress/writer/producer. After her role on the televisiositcom 'Punky Brewster,' Cherie co-starred in a popular 90's sitcom 'Family Matters' as the best friend of Laura Winslow. She also had recurring roles in 'The Parkers' and 'Days of Our Lives. More recently, Cherie has produced 12 indie films and 1 TV show. Including wrote, produced and starred in the movie 'I Do ... I Did!' on DVD & BET, along with a long list of other available and upcoming DVDs.

CREATOR & WRITER

Della Savoury, creator and television personality of  "Keeping It Real with Della” the entertainment shows which brought events, news, and interviews into your home. Keeping It Real with Della” aired to its 1.5 million household throughout South Florida. She has executive produce an independent film "Ladies Night Out", Indie Film “Last Call at Murray” directed by Linda Palmer and "My Name is Lamar" Currently she is working on an upcoming short film "Passage" and is the creator and writer for "Women 2 Women".

story:
Short Summary

HBCU: An Animated Series is a comedic cartoon from the mind of Howard University Alumni & Creative Storyteller, Jeremiah Jones. The series reimagines the HBCU experience and black culture through the world of animation.

The show follows a group of friends as they experience the nuances of student life at the fictional Garvey-DuBois University. Covering topics ranging from the freshman 15 to student protest, HBCU Animated  looks to introduce a new generation to the beauty, complexity, and importance of black colleges and universities.

WATCH OUR HBCU MINISODES

MINISODE ONE The Case of the Nylon Balloon

MINISODE TWO Get In How You Fit In

MINISODE THREE Do Not Disturb the Peace

MINISODE FOUR Jesus Is On The Fall Line

What We Need & What You Get

Our Indiegogo campaign is to fund the pilot for the series. With a campaign goal of $10,000, backers can donate any amount, and receive perks for tiered contribution levels.

Campaign Funds will be used to take the concept and idea of the HBCU minisodes, and develop them into a full length episode with higher quality design, animation, sound design, and effects. This will include, but not limited to:

-Improved Character Design/Animation

-Episode Studio Recordings

-Cast & Crew Travel and Stipends

-Promotional Materials

Through your donations at certain tiered levels, you will receive perks varying from sponsored merchandise packs to exclusive behind the scenes content.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money isn't the only way to help. If you aren't able to make a donation, please SHARE OUR CAMPAIGN with anyone who maybe interested.

Follow us on social media:

Instagram: @HBCUAnimated

Twitter: @HBCUAnimated

Facebook: HBCU: An Animated Series

story:
THE STORY

Concept: A rag-tag group of college dropouts struggle to prove that they can thrive in a town where college rules everything. 

Logline: Rhad, a college dropout and former nightclub employee trying to get back at his former boss - as well as his cheating girlfriend - convinces the employees at his new job (also dropouts) to turn their dying restaurant into a competing nightclub.



Synopsis: After RHAD finds his girlfriend, STACEY, hooking up with their boss, RANDALL, at the Czar Nightclub, Rhad quits his job and his girlfriend. His flamboyant roommate DONNIE then scores him a job interview at THE FORTUNE COOKIE RESTAURANT-- which to Rhad's surprise, is right across from the Czar. Rhad is then hired on the spot by LARRY, the bizarre, prank-pulling boss of The Fortune Cookie. Larry puts Rhad under the care of LIZ, the general manager and general narcissist. Hilarity is taken to extremes when ARTURO, the landlord with a dress shirt that struggles to hold back his potbelly, informs LARRY that he's being evicted unless back rent is paid. 

TV Show Engine: The central conflict of the series is the competition between the two businesses. "The Czar" is a well-established, well-funded and super-popular nightclub, that holds an iron grip on the town. While "The Fortune Cookie" is a struggling Chinese restaurant, run by dropouts, that's trying to become the most poppin' spot in town -- if they can even keep the lights on. It is essentially Rocky. . .But with nightclubs!

Tone: This is the millennial version of "Freaks and Geeks" and "Community."  If "The Breakfast Club" became a series this would be it. Like all three of these school-based comedies, "Dropouts" carries a witty and playful tone all while focusing on the competition between the two nightclubs and spearheaded by two exes at war. The battle awakens one small town's decade's old rivalry between the local college students versus the dropouts.

For those looking for more information on the story, characters, and overall show, check out this pitch deck that describes the show in more detail: Pitch Deck

WHY YOU SHOULD SUPPORT?

This brings us to the message of the show. Though our show is titled, “Dropouts”, this show DOES NOT  encourage students to drop out of college. Our show focuses on the idea of SECOND CHANCES and INCLUSIVITY!

Second Chances: The show follows a group of young adults stuck in limbo, within a college town that does not accept them. Some are still working their way back to college, while others can’t even go back home due to their own personal reasons. It’s a time in their lives where what they do next could determine the rest of their entire lives. These kids have to convince the world for a second chance, whether it’s going back to college, winning back a loved one or having a shot at a career they always dreamed of. 

Inclusivity: The show supports diversity on and off screen. Our cast and crew hail from different backgrounds. Working on this project, we have learned from each other, shared with one another, and exchanged across cultures. Most importantly, we've determined to keep it that way throughout the production of our show, so that we can open more opportunities for people from all walks of life in an industry that still needs progress in that sector. 

Bonus: Our show EMPOWERS WOMEN on and behind the screen. Aside from creating opportunities behind the scene, we have created a number of strong female characters in the lead roles. Take STACEY for example, though she is our antagonist, she is a strong, independent, business-minded woman, whose main focus is to create a career for herself by any means necessary. She singlehandedly makes our group of outcasts team up to go up against her. But they have no idea what’s about to hit them! All I can tell you right now is that you’ll hate Stacey and fall in love with her at the same time. 

             

#GOALS

Honestly, our goal is to entertain people, make'em laugh, and spread our message to as many people as possible. To do it efficiently, this means we will have to go mainstream... at some point.

Plan A: Depending on the amount of money we raise, we plan to independently shoot the entire first season, build an audience online, then pitch the show to studios and online streaming services like HBO, Showtime, Fox, Netflix etc, that we believe will be a great home for our project. This approach will not only help us create our show with more freedom but will also give us leverage when it’s time to involve big sharks. Much like how our dropouts will have to build their club from the ground up to compete and gain the attention of bigger organizations. As you already know, we can only achieve this goal with your support by donating and sharing the project with your family and friends! 

Plan B: Shoot the pilot episode of the show and use it as a proof of concept when pitching the show to studios and online streaming services. 

Timeline: We've begun the casting process, as well as attaching essential production crew members. Principal photography will begin in May 2019 for 5 days and we will have a final edit within 3 - 4 weeks. 

Fact is... we are in one of the most competitive industries in the world and having a great script is just not good enough to greenlight a television show. 

This is why we need all the support you can give to make this project happen!

Campaign Video Credits:

Val Victa- “LARRY”
Malie Mason - "STACEY"
Eric Hinwood - Director
Shane Collins - Director of Photography
Rhianna Israni- Assistant Camera Operator
Igor Kogan- Sound Engineer
Quincy Tucker- Sound Engineer Assistant
Leka Romao- Editor and Motion Graphics
Nick Sho Ito- Visual Effects and Titles
Faithima Wright- Wardrobe

Yoying Eng - Associate Producer
Khambi Hamis- Creator, Writer, Producer
Kareem A. Cox- Executive Producer, Producer

The Production Team

 

Kareem A. Cox, Executive Producer

Kareem is a highly skilled producer and Daytime Emmy® Award Nominee whose experiences have prepared him to excel at any position. He has worked as a key team member, producing at Fox, NBC and TLC, on well over 300 television episodes and, been screen credited on each. 
While working at NBCUniversal, he earned the prestigious GEM award for his professional contributions to the company. 

https://www.linkedin.com/in/kareemacox/

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3699781/?ref_=rvi_nm

Instagram.com/KfromBrooklyn

Khambi Hamis, Creator, Head Writer, Producer,

Born and raised in Tanzania, Khambi Hamis is a writer currently residing in Los Angeles. His career began at a young age in his home country, when he made a joke in class about pursuing a career in entertainment and got laughed at. That moment quickly fueled a lifetime goal. Years later, Khambi won a top prize at his high school talent show, where a play he wrote and acted in, gave insight and education on HIV/AIDS. The same year he achieved a certificate from U.N for his Humanitarian services. After graduating high school, Khambi took a big leap, leaving everything behind to relocate to upstate New York, where he enrolled at SUNY Plattsburgh. He later moved to Los Angeles where he interned at Aligned Entertainment. His most recent feature screenplay, “The Nerds Club” has caught the attention of a veteran literally agent at Creative Artists Agency. 

Yoying Eng, Associate Producer

Yoying is the director of Sonderlust Cinema, a global entertainment and media business company based in Beijing and Hollywood. She has a BFA from NYU Tisch in Theatre Arts and a BFA in Film from USC. Yoying has studied under Anne Desalvo(Lee Strasberg Institute), Gregory Berger-Sobeck(Yale MFA Dramatic Arts Program) and Tasha Smith & Jennifer Collins(Ivana Chubbuck Studios). Her viral video "Domestic Abuse Social Experiment", which she produced, received 28 million views to date.

Faithima Wright, Costume Designer

Faithima Wright is a Fashion Stylist, Non-Union Costumer and Costume Designer. She specializes in styling for television and film. She has designed costumes for independent short films and student films. She enjoys various forms of art in her spare time. Faithima draws inspiration for her work from the environment around her, through music, poetry, artwork, and through the beauty of people she meets. 

Flattsburgh University Digital OneCard

All of our rewards are awesome, but the coolest by far is our Flattsburgh University Digital OneCard. Most universities in the United States have a "OneCard" which allows its students to get discounts at participating local businesses. So... with your Flattsburgh University Digital OneCard you'll get amazing discounts and offers from the brands and local businesses we know you'll love. The card uses a points system where users redeem points for the reward/offer they'd like to receive. The best and easiest way to earn points is by using your OneCard to refer others. Best of all, you can download the card right to your phone so you always have it with you. We will continually work to improve the functionality and usability of the OneCard. Because we value every bit of support, no matter how much you contribute, you'll get your very own Flattsburgh University Digital One Card! 

Example Rewards:

Free Jamba Juice Smoothie: 20 points

15% off Nike.com purchase: 50 points

Soho House Day Pass: 500 points

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are rough and we understand that you may not be able to contribute at the moment. However, we can still use your help.

  • Share our campaign using the share tools
  • Share our social media posts
  • Tell your friends and family 
  • Tell random people on street

And that's all there is to it.

Be sure to follow us on Social Media at:
Facebook.com/DropoutsTVshow/
story_txt:
THE STORY 
Concept: A rag-tag group of college dropouts struggle to prove that they can thrive in a town where college rules everything. 
Logline: Rhad, a college dropout and former nightclub employee trying to get back at his former boss - as well as his cheating girlfriend - convinces the employees at his new job (also dropouts) to turn their dying restaurant into a competing nightclub.
Synopsis: After RHAD finds his girlfriend, STACEY, hooking up with their boss, RANDALL, at the Czar Nightclub, Rhad quits his job and his girlfriend. His flamboyant roommate DONNIE then scores him a job interview at THE FORTUNE COOKIE RESTAURANT-- which to Rhad's surprise, is right across from the Czar. Rhad is then hired on the spot by LARRY, the bizarre, prank-pulling boss of The Fortune Cookie. Larry puts Rhad under the care of LIZ, the general manager and general narcissist. Hilarity is taken to extremes when ARTURO, the landlord with a dress shirt that struggles to hold back his potbelly, informs LARRY that he's being evicted unless back rent is paid. 
TV Show Engine: The central conflict of the series is the competition between the two businesses. "The Czar" is a well-established, well-funded and super-popular nightclub, that holds an iron grip on the town. While "The Fortune Cookie" is a struggling Chinese restaurant, run by dropouts, that's trying to become the most poppin' spot in town -- if they can even keep the lights on. It is essentially Rocky. . .But with nightclubs!
Tone: This is the millennial version of "Freaks and Geeks" and "Community."  If "The Breakfast Club" became a series this would be it. Like all three of these school-based comedies, "Dropouts" carries a witty and playful tone all while focusing on the competition between the two nightclubs and spearheaded by two exes at war. The battle awakens one small town's decade's old rivalry between the local college students versus the dropouts.

For those looking for more information on the story, characters, and overall show, check out this pitch deck that describes the show in more detail: Pitch Deck
WHY YOU SHOULD SUPPORT?
This brings us to the message of the show. Though our show is titled, “Dropouts”, this show DOES NOT  encourage students to drop out of college. Our show focuses on the idea of SECOND CHANCES and INCLUSIVITY!
Second Chances: The show follows a group of young adults stuck in limbo, within a college town that does not accept them. Some are still working their way back to college, while others can’t even go back home due to their own personal reasons. It’s a time in their lives where what they do next could determine the rest of their entire lives. These kids have to convince the world for a second chance, whether it’s going back to college, winning back a loved one or having a shot at a career they always dreamed of. 
Inclusivity: The show supports diversity on and off screen. Our cast and crew hail from different backgrounds. Working on this project, we have learned from each other, shared with one another, and exchanged across cultures. Most importantly, we've determined to keep it that way throughout the production of our show, so that we can open more opportunities for people from all walks of life in an industry that still needs progress in that sector. 

Bonus: Our show EMPOWERS WOMEN on and behind the screen. Aside from creating opportunities behind the scene, we have created a number of strong female characters in the lead roles. Take STACEY for example, though she is our antagonist, she is a strong, independent, business-minded woman, whose main focus is to create a career for herself by any means necessary. She singlehandedly makes our group of outcasts team up to go up against her. But they have no idea what’s about to hit them! All I can tell you right now is that you’ll hate Stacey and fall in love with her at the same time. 
             

#GOALS
Honestly, our goal is to entertain people, make'em laugh, and spread our message to as many people as possible. To do it efficiently, this means we will have to go mainstream... at some point.
Plan A: Depending on the amount of money we raise, we plan to independently shoot the entire first season, build an audience online, then pitch the show to studios and online streaming services like HBO, Showtime, Fox, Netflix etc, that we believe will be a great home for our project. This approach will not only help us create our show with more freedom but will also give us leverage when it’s time to involve big sharks. Much like how our dropouts will have to build their club from the ground up to compete and gain the attention of bigger organizations. As you already know, we can only achieve this goal with your support by donating and sharing the project with your family and friends! 
Plan B: Shoot the pilot episode of the show and use it as a proof of concept when pitching the show to studios and online streaming services. 
Timeline: We've begun the casting process, as well as attaching essential production crew members. Principal photography will begin in May 2019 for 5 days and we will have a final edit within 3 - 4 weeks. 
Fact is... we are in one of the most competitive industries in the world and having a great script is just not good enough to greenlight a television show. 
This is why we need all the support you can give to make this project happen!


Campaign Video Credits:
Val Victa- “LARRY”Malie Mason - "STACEY"Eric Hinwood - DirectorShane Collins - Director of PhotographyRhianna Israni- Assistant Camera OperatorIgor Kogan- Sound EngineerQuincy Tucker- Sound Engineer AssistantLeka Romao- Editor and Motion GraphicsNick Sho Ito- Visual Effects and TitlesFaithima Wright- Wardrobe
Yoying Eng - Associate ProducerKhambi Hamis- Creator, Writer, ProducerKareem A. Cox- Executive Producer, Producer

story:
About Hugowood

Hugowood is a dramedy series set at the elite, fictional Austin, Texas Armadillo Television Academy and stars Hugo Santana, an aspiring writer with dreams of creating an uber gay space opera series. Only, Hugo must contend with his closeted Professor Darren Strain, who is involved in a secret love affair with Hugo’s crush and co-star, Isaac Rexha, and Isaac’s reality TV crazed-sisters, The Rexhas, Kardashian-wannabes who are dead set on keeping Hugo from their brother due to Hugo’s disability.

It’s Mean Girls meets 30 Rock brimming with pink fabulousness, so what’s not to like? Seriously?!

 

Why You Should Donate

When we discuss the diversity issue in Hollywood, we often ignore people living with disabilities. This isn’t one of those series about a family dealing with their child’s disability. It’s about a boy with a disability living his life for himself, who can carry his own series.

To make matters short, Hugowood is the series that would’ve done me a lot of good to have in my younger years. I’m hoping to provide that for someone else. Also, it’s gay and amazing. Not donating would be considered a triple-hate crime. You don’t want to get canceled, right?

Please donate if you can and share!

Your contributions will help us pay for production design, wardrobe, and special effects.

 

Meet the Team

Juan Carlos Gutierrez - Writer-Creator-Executive Producer

An avid fan of Mean Girls, gifs, and Ariana Grande, Juan Carlos Gutierrez was born and raised in Port Arthur, Texas. Since the age of nine, Juan had his heart set on writing novels until he discovered a love of television and never again touched a book -- just kidding, kinda. After writing a few comedy pilots at The University of Texas at Austin, Juan hitched it to Los Angeles to obtain an MFA in Writing & Producing for Television at Loyola Marymount University. Juan hopes to create shows and roles for all marginalized people and follow the likeness of writers like Silvio Horta and Jennie Snyder Urman. Hugowood is loosely based on his film school experience, LOOSELY.

 

Brandon Estrella - Director

Brandon Estrella was born and raised in Hilo, Hawaii. He moved to Seattle, WA to pursue a Bachelor's of Science in civil engineering from Seattle University. He spent some time exploring his inner butch by working on large bridge and transportation projects before changing course and following his passion for filmmaking, thank god. He is currently pursuing a Master of Fine Arts degree in Film and TV Production at Loyola Marymount University in Los Angeles. There, he’s finding his voice as a director, producer, and production designer - talk about a triple threat, and he’s passionate about creating opportunities and opening doors for those who typically do not have a seat at the table. He is also a founding member of The New Alchemists, an interdisciplinary theatre company dedicated to creating and showcasing diverse stories that inspire audiences to actively participate in their communities and to promote better solutions for an equitable future.

 

Chikodili Agwuna - Producer-Actor

Chikodili Agwuna was born in a Nigerian home, but actually just in a regular hospital in Washington, D.C., and therefore enjoys the hell out of her dual citizenship. After fully living that Big Ten life in undergrad at Penn State, she co-founded a publishing company, Chormeri Books, and started to tell the kind of stories she wished she’d heard growing up. In an effort to share such stories with the world, she decided to enter the world of film and television and moved to sunny LA to pursue an MFA in Writing for the Screen at Loyola Marymount University. There, she discovered a multitude of talents she had never thought to explore outside of writing and has even begun a burgeoning career in stand-up comedy. Her role as Zadie in Hugowood will be her first on-screen role and will open the door for her next on-screen performance in her very own Netflix comedy special (speaking it into existence, people).

story:
The Story

Situated in the amazing  Alpine region of Central Europe, where old castles and souls are abundant, we invite you to join us on our hilarious hunt of blood, sweat, and maybe tears. There is nothing more fascinating and ridiculous than vampires and sword fights in historical sets and lush forests. YOU get to see it all.

The Hunted Allgovia is part of the web series 'The Hunted'  (http://www.thehunted.tv/main_frameset.htm)  created by Robert Chapin. The series, action comedy,' sword swingin', vampire slayin'',  is one of the longest-running shows online.

We have it all planned, and we have done pre-production and even a few shots! Here is our talented, yet silly, team:

 

Our Team
 

Robert Chapin - Creator & Writer

 

Robert Chapin is one of the great Hollywood swordsmen and VFX artists. He is the creator of 'The Hunted ' web series, and the writer for 'The Hunted Allgovia'. Robert Chapin worked on movies like Army of Darkness and Hook, starred in Ring of Steel and did VFX work for countless blockbusters; from X-Men to STAR WARS.

 

Christian Eberle - Producer & Director, co-writer

Christian has a passion for movies since his earliest childhood. Sci-Fi and Fantasy are his favorite. Together with Bob Chapin he wrote the script for 'The Hunted: Allgovia'. 

 

Katja Vartiainen - Co-Producer, Costume & Prop designer, Art advisor, PR and Catering.

Katja Vartiainen - Katja is a painter, an illustrator, a comic book creator, and an enthusiast of nature, cats,  and everything visual.

 

Hartmut Engel - Actor

 

Hartmut lives his passion for acting and film making in his professional works for animation and VFX movies during the past 25 years. Crazy for fine arts of all kind, including musicianship, drawing, and acting on stage and in films..." 

 

Jeremias Freinbichler-Kallabis - Actor & Co-Producer

 Jerry: ''I am not a comedian: 'It's not my fault people laugh at my stories'.

 

Julia Heidrich - Actor

Julia is a 26 years old outdoor sports enthusiast, preferring especially the Alps. She has practiced martial arts for 10 years, and that brought her to her role in this film.


Jochen Cavegn- Actor

Born in 1971, near the Allgovian frontier, where the Eastern and Lower Allgovia kiss the plains of river Lech, Jochen flew from business administration to his beloved sports...and straight into the wings of a mad film team.

 

Anna-Maria Osterried - Actor

 

Anna-Maria is married to Marko Osterried with a 4-year old daughter. Anna-Maria is a photographer specialized in architectural, web & tabletop photography.

 

Marko Osterried "MacMarcÓ" - DP, Sound Operator, Drone Pilot, Foley Artist, Post-Production, CGI, Music

Marko produces corporate- and wedding videos, he's our drone-pilot, foley-artist, composer and he studied audio-engineering. He's the all-rounder, every film crew needs, and Anna-Maria's husband.

 

 

Budget Breakdown

 

The primary fees are for locations, equipment, and transportation. And the crew. Our goal covers the minimum basics. What we receive beyond the goal to pay the crew with more than few pennies, and we will activate stretch goals to help cover festival submission fees, as well post-production, sound, and VFX costs. 

Our IndieGoGo goal is €3700

Your support helps us cover the following for 2 weeks of principal photography.

Locations & rehearsal rooms:  €700

Transportation:   €500

Props & Costumes:  €200

Catering:  €300

Indiegogo Fees& Misc: €200

Crew - Fees for our DP, Actors, Sound Mixer, Post-production crew, and extras: €1800

Total: €3700

 

 

Schedule:

We have been doing mostly pre-production and rehearsing until now, but also a few shots. First scenes were shot on the 17th of March, 2019.  Most of the filming will take place in April/May/June 2019. Due to previous commitments made that wouldn't finally budge, we need to push the filming of the final scenes to August 2019.   Estimated release is December 2019 - we will keep you updated!

 

Challenges:

The weather. The Allgovian Spring weather is in never-ending fluctuation. Anything is possible - sun, snow, rain, clouds, storm winds, floods, and all at the same time. Summer brings great thunderstorms. We are shooting some scenes in the forest. Yes, we are.

 

Other ways you can help

If you can't donate- we get it! You can always help us by spreading the word on social media and by telling about it to your friends and family. The links are on the page! We have also a Ko-fi button at:

https://ko-fi.com/thehuntedallgovia
 

Deutsche Version: 

'The Hunted' ('Die Gejagten') ist eine seit vielen Jahren lauftende Webserie, entwickelt vom in Los Angeles lebenden Schauspieler, Stuntman und Visual-Effects-Künstler Robert Chapin. 

The Hunted: Allgovia ist der erste, deutsche Ableger dieser Serie und handelt von einem jungen Mann, der in einem kleinen, allgäuer Dorf lebt und keine Ahnung hat, dass Vampire existieren.

Doch eines Tages klopft das Abenteuer an seine Türe und nichts wird mehr sein, wie es war...

In der Welt von 'The Hunted' sind Vampire inzwischen immun gegen all die klassischen Dinge, die sie einst töten konnten. Sonnenlicht, Pflöcke, Weihwasser, Kreuze... all das hilft nicht mehr! Nur noch durch Enthauptung können Vampire getötet werden. Aus diesem Grund sind Schwerter eine wichtige Bewaffnung sowohl für Vampire als auch Vampirjäger. 

'The Hunted' ist gleichzeitig eine komödiantische Interpretation des beliebten Vampirmythos, der seit fast 100 Jahren durch Kino und Fernsehen geistert. 

Schwertkämpfe und Vampirjäger -- eine wilde Mischung aus 'Buffy' und 'Highlander' -

The Hunted: Allgovia beinhaltet alles. 

Produziert und gedreht wird der ca. 20-Minütige Kurzfilm, der gleichzeitig als Pilotfolge für eine potenzielle Serie dient, in und um Marktoberdorf herum. 

Für die deutsche Version werden die Schauspieler ihre eigenen Charaktäre auf deutsch, allgäuerisch, schwäbisch...und wer weiß was für Dialekten nachsynchronisieren. 

Hier der Link zum Trailer: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R989ulQ0CEo

 

Where the story continues:

We will post about monthly updates on Indiegogo after our campaign ends on

May 10, 2019 11:59pm PDT = German time = CEST (UTC +2)  Sat, 11 May 2019 8:59 am,

and then will have more stuff on our Facebook group:

https://www.facebook.com/groups/thehuntedallgovia

and  essentials at: http://beyond-limitations.com

What we receive beyond the goal to pay the crew with more than few pennies, and we will activate stretch goals to help cover festival submission fees, as well post-production, sound, and VFX costs. Our IndieGoGo goal is €3700Your support helps us cover the following for 2 weeks of principal photography.Locations & rehearsal rooms:  €700Transportation:   €500Props & Costumes:  €200Catering:  €300Indiegogo Fees& Misc: €200Crew - Fees for our DP, Actors, Sound Mixer, Post-production crew, and extras: €1800Total: €3700  Schedule:We have been doing mostly pre-production and rehearsing until now, but also a few shots. First scenes were shot on the 17th of March, 2019.  Most of the filming will take place in April/May/June 2019. Due to previous commitments made that wouldn't finally budge, we need to push the filming of the final scenes to August 2019.   Estimated release is December 2019 - we will keep you updated! Challenges:The weather. The Allgovian Spring weather is in never-ending fluctuation. Anything is possible - sun, snow, rain, clouds, storm winds, floods, and all at the same time. Summer brings great thunderstorms. We are shooting some scenes in the forest. Yes, we are. Other ways you can helpIf you can't donate- we get it! You can always help us by spreading the word on social media and by telling about it to your friends and family. The links are on the page! We have also a Ko-fi button at:https://ko-fi.com/thehuntedallgovia Deutsche Version: 'The Hunted' ('Die Gejagten') ist eine seit vielen Jahren lauftende Webserie, entwickelt vom in Los Angeles lebenden Schauspieler, Stuntman und Visual-Effects-Künstler Robert Chapin. The Hunted: Allgovia ist der erste, deutsche Ableger dieser Serie und handelt von einem jungen Mann, der in einem kleinen, allgäuer Dorf lebt und keine Ahnung hat, dass Vampire existieren.Doch eines Tages klopft das Abenteuer an seine Türe und nichts wird mehr sein, wie es war...In der Welt von 'The Hunted' sind Vampire inzwischen immun gegen all die klassischen Dinge, die sie einst töten konnten. Sonnenlicht, Pflöcke, Weihwasser, Kreuze... all das hilft nicht mehr! Nur noch durch Enthauptung können Vampire getötet werden. Aus diesem Grund sind Schwerter eine wichtige Bewaffnung sowohl für Vampire als auch Vampirjäger. 'The Hunted' ist gleichzeitig eine komödiantische Interpretation des beliebten Vampirmythos, der seit fast 100 Jahren durch Kino und Fernsehen geistert. Schwertkämpfe und Vampirjäger -- eine wilde Mischung aus 'Buffy' und 'Highlander' -The Hunted: Allgovia beinhaltet alles. Produziert und gedreht wird der ca. 20-Minütige Kurzfilm, der gleichzeitig als Pilotfolge für eine potenzielle Serie dient, in und um Marktoberdorf herum. Für die deutsche Version werden die Schauspieler ihre eigenen Charaktäre auf deutsch, allgäuerisch, schwäbisch...und wer weiß was für Dialekten nachsynchronisieren. Hier der Link zum Trailer: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R989ulQ0CEo Where the story continues:We will post about monthly updates on Indiegogo after our campaign ends onMay 10, 2019 11:59pm PDT = German time = CEST (UTC +2)  Sat, 11 May 2019 8:59 am,and then will have more stuff on our Facebook group:https://www.facebook.com/groups/thehuntedallgoviaand  essentials at: http://beyond-limitations.com

story:
**Please be sure to scroll through our videos above and meet our Courtyard Staff**
 

THE CONCEPT

FRONT OF HOUSE is a situational comedy inspired by the daily lives of the food service industry.  Everyone comes together to eat GOOD FOOD.   Whatever that may mean for you. From eccentric guests, to over-the-top staff... the unforgettable birthday experience... good or bad, EVERYONE has a little something to share about their own memories at their favorite restaurant. From serving to being served, Front of House will explore what it is like to navigate the service industry and its challenges.

 

WHO WE ARE

Emerging Productions was founded by actors and filmmakers trying to make their way through the industry.  While juggling day jobs, auditions, and projects alike, our group came together with a passion to create excellent content and share great stories. 

FRONT OF HOUSE is a bit of a passion project for all of us.  We all have worked, or currently work within the service industry. One day, we were discussing endless accounts of our own personal bizarre interactions, nightmare events, that ONE customer, non-stop problems, and the sometimes very generous and the frequent not-so-generous... circumstances.  This conversation grew into an idea and realization.  We realized the need to wrap these stories, told and untold, into a fun ADVENTURE where characters at different points in their lives come together and face their struggles head on.  

After all, a restaurant is a gathering place of people from all walks of life to take part in a synonymous fellowship: EAT... and/or complain~

With the script and cast ready, we are poised to film the pilot episode come this September. We are excited to present and share this project with you and would like to extend the opportunity for you to collaborate with us in bringing this fun story to life! 

 

HOW YOU CAN CONTRIBUTE!

We aim to raise a budget of $10,000 dollars in order to film this pilot episode. Our expenses will cover Equipment, Production Design, Post Production, and the care of our Cast and Crew.  The following graph reflects the allocation of our budget:

 

We will be filming on the remarkable ARRI ALEXA MINI to capture the best performances in fullness and beauty and are set to film the pilot episode in the charming Mariposa, California.  

Your contribution will be wisely managed and invested to take this proof-of-concept and develop it into a full series. We plan to approach major networks with intention of getting this concept picked up and ordered into a show with major backing. We can make this happen!  

 

WHY COLLABORATE WITH US?

Front of House is a concept that really draws on the SYNERGY and TRUTH of the shared experiences of EVERYONE. Furthermore, we want to be able to INSPIRE and ENCOURAGE the imagination and creativity of everyone who watches this show, especially the individuals who front the lines of the SERVICE industry. OPPORTUNITY is waiting around the corner for everyone. Just make sure to yell "CORNER!" while you're on your way to cease it.

 

THE TEAM

 

Administration

Monique grew up in beautiful Orange County until the age of 22 when she decided to make the move up to the traffic infested city we know as Los Angeles. She could not be happier with this decision to pursue her dreams of becoming a successful actor. She grew up on set as a child actor, but against all logical advice, decided to take a break to have the wonderful high school experience that everyone speaks so highly. She is back now and could not be more grateful or humbled to be included in such an amazing project that allows her to express her creativity and follow her passion.

Mengfei is originally from the Bay Area with a background in healthcare. She soon realized she wanted to pursue a career in the entertainment industry and quickly planted herself in Koreatown, Los Angeles. Now finding her way through the industry, Mengfei is excited to unite her love of acting, food, and Asian-American culture with the diverse team of Front of House.

Production



Micah is an actor, writer, and producer in Los Angeles. Born in Japan, Micah grew up as a military brat living in countries like Saudi Arabia and Germany. He spent seven years in the Army before moving to Los Angeles and pursuing acting.  

Roy has a strong sense of empathy towards diverse viewpoints, culture, and the experiences of humans that help him maintain relevant relationships between organizations and talent.  He has worked for CJ E&M (KCONUSA), facilitating talent relations and event logistics to help spread K-pop from NY to LA in their annual conventions. From running live-event sound to consulting on set designs, and managing budgets, he enjoys being able to contribute in many different aspects of production. Roy looks forward to breaking into many new exciting projects and collaborating with the talent to help them do what they do best.

Zach is an aspiring film director and screenwriter looking to create humorous and insightful content. Prior to working with Front of House, Zach helped with content direction and features programming at the Newport Beach Film Festival. When he's not writing you can catch him trying to lose the burrito weight from last night, reading a good book, or watching Saturday morning cartoons.

Alex has always been compassionate and devoted to his work as well as his team. He has had experience working a multitude of fields ranging from creative positions to non-profit work. With a creative eye and technological prowess, Alex is always eager to tackle the next big project to come his way. He is passionate about making meaningful connections with others and fostering a fun environment both in front of and behind the screen. During his time off, Alex enjoys a freshly brewed cup of coffee, video games, and spending time with his loved ones


Creative Development

 

Justice is an actor and creator who is passionate about creating and telling new stories. He enjoys developing new concepts and working on projects of all scales to bring new insight and inspiration. Justice continues to engage in projects that drive creativity and aspiration forward, and looks forward to working with like-minded individuals.

Daniel is the babyface of the Front of House group. At the age of 19, he decided to leave his small hometown of Mariposa, California, located right outside of Yosemite National Park, and move to LA to pursue his acting career. Much to the disappointment of his scientist parents Daniel decided to skip the whole college scene and dive straight into the “adult” life. Though that may have been a risky decision it seems to be working for the young lad. He now delivers dumplings for a living and takes classes at the local UCB on Sunset. If you can’t find him there he may be watching Rom Coms or reading up on philosophy in his NoHo apartment.

Ben Beucler is a talented writer having worked on successful projects on all mediums from boardgames, comics, short stories, audio series, and film scripts. He is excited to continue sharing his work and developing his craft to bring new and exciting adventures to fruition.


Artistic Development 
 

Adam was born in Calgary, Alberta Canada. Because of his mom, he not only naturally became a Canadian Citizen, but a US Citizen as well. In 2014 he moved to Los Angeles to attend film school at The Art Institute. Well, after lots of trials and the school closing down on him, he still managed to finish his B.Sc. in Digital Cinema and Video Production. He got to be a PA for a few A-List feature films, such as Danny Boyles "Yesturday", and "Ford VS Ferrari" Directed by James Mangold. For the past year Adam has been working on a select few projects as a Cinematographer, Director, and writer, all while being the Sale Agent for one of the oldest motion picture companies in Hollywood: Alan Gordon Enterprises.

 Josh likes vikings.

 

 

 

THE CAST
 

 

Aldo Hari - JERRY

Aldo Ricardo Hari was born in Indonesia on April 1, 1989. He majored in Drama at the University of California, Irvine. Besides acting, Aldo also enjoys coding, dancing, photography, videography, listening to music, loving the Lakers, geeking on WWE, and eating food. Aldo currently works as a web developer/software engineer while juggling work as an actor. He also volunteers at his church by making promotional videos with dope soundtracks. In his spare time, Aldo loves to watch the Lakers and WWE. When its not basketball season you can watch his food adventure with his girlfriend through his snapchat or instagram stories. Aldo is fluent in Indonesian and Javanese, understands such coding languages as JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, and has experience with video and photo editing software such as Adobe Premiere, Adobe Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator, and Adobe Indesign. This upcoming actor has so many skills to offer and is looking forward to upcoming projects.

Ashley Dakin - QUEENIE

Ashley Dakin has an MFA in acting and is a working actress in Los Angeles. She is from Michigan originally where she got her start in theatre. From there, she lived in Taiwan for three years as an actress and TV host for Overseas Radio and Television.  She returned to the States pursue her dreams and has appeared in multiple indie films and commercials for The General, Viva, the National Ad Council and others. 

Daniel Gilger - RILEY

Daniel Gilger is the babyface of the Front of House group. At the age of 19, he decided to leave his small hometown of Mariposa, California, located right outside of Yosemite National Park, and move to LA to pursue his acting career. Much to the disappointment of his scientist parents Daniel decided to skip the whole college scene and dive straight into the “adult” life. Though that may have been a risky decision it seems to be working for the young lad. He now delivers dumplings for a living and takes classes at the local UCB on Sunset. If you can’t find him there he may be watching Rom Coms or reading up on philosophy in his NoHo apartment.

David Kang - ANDY PARK

David Kang is a Korean American that was born and raised in the heart of Los Angeles. He started a new journey pursuing a career in acting back in 2015 after quitting his decade long job in real estate. Although he left that industry, he still claims to be a real estate guru. Not only is he a real estate guru, he is also a self-claimed foodie but who isn't these days. If he isn't working on his craft as an actor, you can find him doing Mukbang on his youtube channel so make sure to subscribe. Im sure he will like that a lot.

Evan Benham - STEVEN

My name is Evan  Benham. I’m originally from Colorado. Everyone thinks Colorado is so beautiful, but I’m not from the beautiful part. I’m from the flat, corn field area on your way to places nobody ever goes. I’ve been in Los Angeles for 4 years now trying to chase my dreams of mass approval and acceptance through fame. Aside from being an actor I am also a flight attendant, a male flight attendant— with a girlfriend (sorry fellas) . When I’m not in the sky I’m usually on the ground at the gym working out my insecurities with some weights or reading a book somewhere, trying to pretend I’m an intellectual. Love you mom!


Kim Acquarelli - DAISY

Kim Acquarelli has wanted to be on the big screen ever since she was a little girl. With a background in theater, she hopes she can translate that training to film. She feels so blessed to be a part of this project with such talented and inspiring artists, especially since most actors can relate to this hilarious material. Enjoy FOH!

Mengfei Li - CINDY

Mengfei is a Chinese-American actress from the Bay Area. With a background in healthcare, she took the leap to jumpstart her acting career in the culinary oasis that is Ktown, Los Angeles. When she’s not delivering dumplings at her day job, you can find Mengfei devouring AYCE KBBQ or frolicking up Runyon Canyon with her canine best friend, Uni Bear. She is exhilarated to unite her love of acting, food, and Asian-American culture with the diverse cast of Front of House.


Micah Linderman - HARRY

Micah is an actor, writer, and producer in Los Angeles. Born in Japan, Micah grew up as a military brat living in countries like Saudi Arabia and Germany. He spent seven years in the Army before moving to Los Angeles and pursuing acting.  

Monique Gates - SAM

I grew up in beautiful Orange County until the age of 22 when I decided to make the move up to the traffic infested city we know as Los Angeles. I could not be happier with this decision to pursue my dreams of becoming a successful actor. I grew up on set as a child actor, but against all logical advice, decided to take a break to have the wonderful high school experience that everyone speaks so highly of. I am back now and could not be more grateful or humbled to be included in such an amazing project that allows me to express my creativity and follow my passion.

Rameses Arceo - GUNTHER

I am a Mexican/American born and raised in LA.  Everything I do in life, I do with passion. My characters come to life through my commitment to make my choices and risks as personal as possible. My promise to you, is that you will receive 100% of me every time you see me on screen.

Tymon Jones - TIP$

Tymon, a Detroit native, showed his love for the arts at a young age while attending the Academy of Performing Arts East. His talents in comedy, learning instruments by ear and stage performances shined. After relocating to Los Angeles, Tymon spent several successful years excelling in sports, highly recruited in both Track and Field and Football. However, his real passion remained the stage. Within the first year, he's gotten an agent, gained mentorship from one of the top acting coaches in town, appeared in a a short along with a new Netflix series. Tymon is excited to continue to see what's coming up next as he fulfills his dreams. 

 

Gratuity and Tipping!

There are definitely other ways to collaborate than financially contributing to this project! 

First and foremost, please SHARE this page with family, friends, anyone who would be interested in this concept! 

Second, please FOLLOW us on instagram (link below) and keep the buzz up about this new, up and coming situational comedy, Front of House.

https://www.instagram.com/projectfoh/

 

Thank you and we hope to see you again soon!

 

 

 

Promotional Video Credits :

Director / Writer / Producer : Justice Song
Director / DP / Editor : Joshuah Song
Executive Producer : Micah Linderman
Associate Producers : Daniel Gilger, Mengfei Li, Monique Gates
1st AC : Alex Pettyjohn
Key Grip : Roy Kim
Location Manager : Patrick Hua

Aldo Hari - Jerry
Ashley Dakin - Queenie
Daniel Gilger - Riley
David Kim - Server #1
David Kang - Andy Park
Evan Benham - Steven
Kim Acquarelli - Daisy
Mengfei Li - Cindy
Micah Linderman - Harry
Monique Gates - Sam
Rameses Arceo - Gunther
Roy Kim - Busser #1 / Interviewer
Tymon Jones - TIP$
