Tymon is excited to continue to see what's coming up next as he fulfills his dreams.  Gratuity and Tipping!There are definitely other ways to collaborate than financially contributing to this project! First and foremost, please SHARE this page with family, friends, anyone who would be interested in this concept! Second, please FOLLOW us on instagram (link below) and keep the buzz up about this new, up and coming situational comedy, Front of House.https://www.instagram.com/projectfoh/ Thank you and we hope to see you again soon!   Promotional Video Credits :Director / Writer / Producer : Justice SongDirector / DP / Editor : Joshuah SongExecutive Producer : Micah LindermanAssociate Producers : Daniel Gilger, Mengfei Li, Monique Gates1st AC : Alex PettyjohnKey Grip : Roy KimLocation Manager : Patrick HuaAldo Hari - JerryAshley Dakin - QueenieDaniel Gilger - RileyDavid Kim - Server #1David Kang - Andy ParkEvan Benham - StevenKim Acquarelli - DaisyMengfei Li - CindyMicah Linderman - HarryMonique Gates - SamRameses Arceo - GuntherRoy Kim - Busser #1 / InterviewerTymon Jones - TIP$

story:
Stella is trying to get over Astrid. Really, she is. She just seems to keep getting back into bed with her, and anyone else she sleeps with just can’t seem to measure up.

Pillow Talk is a new web-series which follows a series of conversations with the people Stella has just been in bed with, in a comedic but emotional exploration of the worlds of relationships, casual sex, and millennial life (without any condescending meta-jokes about millennials). Stella, still recovering from her recent breakup, tries her hand at one-night stands, casual hookups with colleagues and the odd second date. But nobody, from the fuckboy to the middle-aged Frenchman, can take her mind off of Astrid, who is preoccupied with trying to find her first postgraduate job, and struggling to figure out what she too wants from her life.

This series touches on issues uniquely relevant to young people, such as employment insecurity, anxiety about the future, and the difficulty associated with finding one’s place in the world. It offers an honest and open portrayal of sexual relationships, hoping to destigmatise and educate.

There is a startling lack of diversity in the creative industries; only around 10% of creative roles are filled by BAME people; less than 40% by women, and although the representation of LGBTQ+ relationships is improving, there is still a long way to go. In the top-grossing 100 films of 2019, women accounted for 37% of major characters, and of those, 70% were white, 18% were black, and 6% were Latina. In creating a female-centric series, we aim to explore issues that are less frequently discussed; Pillow Talk follows Stella, a young, bisexual BAME woman, and the series is not just about, but created by, the minority groups the story represents, with a BAME screenwriter and LGBTQ+ crew members.

Pillow Talk is brought to you by a group of young, up-and-coming professionals in the film and music industries. We are committed to producing high-quality, relevant and accessible film for everyone, both in front of the screen and behind the lens.

We have already shot Episode 1! We had an incredible time on set, and we’re enjoying getting ready for the rest of the shoots. Here’s a sneak peek at what went on...

We already have our cast and crew secured for all the episodes, and we know that our concept works on screen; all we need now is financial support to make the rest of the series happen!

 

We’re hoping to raise £8,000 to shoot the rest of Series 1. 

This money will go towards:

  • Equipment! This is by far our largest cost. Although we are very fortunate to already have access to some equipment, our commitment to producing the highest quality material we can and the nature of the locations we are using means that our equipment costs are high!
  • Cast and crew welfare. After equipment, our largest expenditure will be on our cast and crew! This includes catering (both lunches and an unending supply of coffee and snacks!) and travel expenses to make sure that no member of the cast or crew is left out-of-pocket as a result of participating in the project.
  • Set. We’re lucky enough to not be facing location costs, but we need to create Stella’s bedroom! 
  • Costume.
  • Hair and makeup.
  • Insurance. Obviously, with such a large amount of equipment in use, making sure we have the right insurance is very important!
  • Contingency. This is calculated as 10% of our budget and is there to make sure that even if we do have a surprise expense it doesn’t have to come out of any of the cast or crew members’ pockets.

What if we exceed our goal?

Our budget estimates across the board have been very conservative, so any additional money we’re able to make will be directly invested into making the series even better than it could otherwise be! Our priorities will be:

  • More money going towards our set budget to create an even better visual experience.
  • Any remainder will go into our distribution budget, allowing us to submit the series to more festivals and improve our marketing to reach, and have an impact on, a larger audience.
  • More money going towards cast and crew welfare, including a larger catering budget.

By supporting diversity on-screen and behind the lens, and raising the sorts of issues that it does, we hope that Pillow Talk will play an important part in the conversations that have already begun on these topics. Any young person can sympathise with Astrid’s attempts to figure out what she wants from life, and Pillow Talk offers an opportunity for those who would otherwise not see themselves represented on screen to do so.

To help reach those audiences, we’re planning to host screenings of the episodes and make them available to the groups who might benefit most from them, including mixed heritage and LGBTQ+ societies. 

We are also committed to supporting the development of our crew members and actors. This is part of the reason why our equipment costs are so high; we want to give our crew members the opportunity to work with equipment that they would otherwise not have access to so that they are best placed to continue their professional careers.

Obviously, making TV is an expensive business, and there is always a risk that we will go beyond our budget, or that production delays will happen! However, we are lucky enough to be working with a very experienced team who will do our best to ensure that Pillow Talk is delivered on time and to the highest quality possible.

Producer - Emilia Clark 

I first met Emilia three years ago on a film shoot on England’s coldest hillside - we bonded over chocolate biscuits and a shared risk of hypothermia, and haven’t looked back since (we have moved indoors). Since then, Emilia has risen from ‘good producer’ to ‘exceptional producer’ - she’s the first and last word in budgeting and logistics, having single-handedly piloted multiple huge-scale theatre productions and operas through venues including the prestigious Oxford Playhouse. She’s at her happiest neck-deep in a meeting agenda, but never loses focus on the critical component of this business - telling a good story. Pillow Talk is a huge undertaking, but Emilia firmly believes in the heart of the series and the importance of its voice. I’m so excited to be working with her on this project - there’s no one I’d rather be working/binging biscuits with.

(Bio written by Calum Bradshaw)

Screenwriter - Josh Bourne

Josh brings a unique voice and incredible creative talent to Pillow Talk. He is particularly passionate about highlighting issues which are less frequently addressed in the media, and enjoys writing character-driven stories which combine moments of drama and comedy - one memorable moment was a sword fight using a vacuum and mop as weapons…! He wrote several short plays while at university which were put on to sell-out success and critical acclaim, and he is now pursuing his dream of writing for the screen. I was lucky enough to produce several of Josh’s plays over the past couple years, and I’m thrilled to be working with him again to bring this story to life!

(Bio written by Emilia Clark)

Director - Calum Bradshaw 

As he has mentioned, Calum and I first met on a film set halfway up a mountain three years ago, and since then I have been continuously amazed by his talent, his creative vision, and the incredible energy he brings to everything he does. Collaborating with him on this project so far has been a dream come true, and getting an insight into his creative process and approach to filmmaking has taught me so much! Having directed multiple productions both at university and beyond, Calum has honed his skills and is excited to be working on a larger scale on Pillow Talk to bring this story to life. I couldn’t be more grateful to be collaborating with him again, and I’m so excited to see what he and the team create, and to continue our commitment to chocolate biscuits…! 

(Bio written by Emilia Clark)

… and Charithra Chandran, who plays Stella!

Charithra is one of the most exciting up-and-coming actresses that I’ve had the pleasure to work with! Having acted successfully in several theatrical productions throughout her time at university, Charithra has exploded onto the film and TV scene. We’re so excited to be working with her on Pillow Talk!

(Bio written by Emilia Clark)

Not to mention...

We’re very lucky to be working with an incredible crew on Pillow Talk, some of whom you will have seen in the photos above! A particular shout-out goes to Alex, our DP - Calum and Alex have worked together on multiple projects before, and have developed a wonderful synergy and creative partnership. You’ll also see Clem, our gaffer, Daniela, our production designer, Dan, our AD, Monaya, our AC, Will, our sound recordist, Kyle, our script supervisor, Anna, our intimacy coordinator, and Fran, our graphic designer!

story:
Overview

Rithvic Kumar and Erica Smith are two college students who would NEVER give each other the time of day. Unless they were in a pandemic. Which... they are.
 

What is Using Protection?

“Using Protection” is a web series co-written by Valen-Marie Santos, Rishi Mahesh, and Madi Hart, and directed by Valen-Marie Santos. The series is scheduled to be shot April 30-2, May 7-9, and May 14-16, 2021. In “Using Protection,” two lost weirdos search for someone to connect to and something to believe in. 

How will my donation help?

“Using Protection” is a not-for-profit student web series with the help from crew members generously volunteering their time. The money raised from this Indiegogo page will directly contribute to production costs of the series, including but not limited to: camera equipment, production design, craft services, transportation, and festival submission expenses. We greatly value your donation and want to recognize you through the available perks. The entire team of “Using Protection” wants to make sure this captivating and ambitious project comes to life!

 

Meet the people behind Using Protection

Valen-Marie Santos: Director/Co-Writer 

Valen-Marie Santos is a fourth year theatre major at Northwestern with experience in directing, playwriting, and performing. She co-founded the POC-centered theatre group Radius, and is currently Senior Director of Griffin’s Tale Children’s Repertory Theatre. Valen-Marie is so excited to use her wide range of experiences in theatre to delve into a film project for the first time. “Using Protection” encapsulates so many ideas she is interested in exploring through art: vulnerability, awkward humor, and being a young person in a world that’s actively falling apart around you. 

 

Rishi Mahesh​: Co-Writer/Lead Actor

Rishi Mahesh is a senior theatre major who focuses on acting and writing comedy! He currently serves as head writer of Out 'Da Box, Northwestern's multicultural sketch and improv group, and publishes sketches and vlogs to the internet under the username @rishipuff. He's super excited to work on what will be one of the first pieces of media to represent how our generation has experienced the coronavirus pandemic, and hopes people find something they need in the web series.

 

Madi Hart: Co-Writer/Lead Actor

Madi Hart is so excited to work on “Using Protection” She is a senior theater major at Northwestern who has spent her four years doing improv, standup, satirical news, and film projects. This year she is head writer of “The Blackout,” Northwestern’s Premiere Late Night show, and is hoping to move to LA post-graduation to pursue acting and writing for TV. “Using Protection” came from a need to make something funny in these unprecedented/crazy/wild/etc. times, and she is excited to follow two characters who just honestly need a hug right now... something she finds very relatable! 

 

Kinsey Jasnoch: Producer

Kinsey Jasnoch is a senior Radio/TV/Film major at Northwestern, where she produces and has written for The Blackout, Northwestern’s premiere late night show, and serves as the community engagement co-chair for Studio 22, a film board on campus. She is so excited to be on the team for “Using Protection,” and can’t wait to produce a story about people on the verge of entering the real world, especially at a point when the real world is so messy. Post-grad, Kinsey hopes to continue writing and producing comedy, probably in New York, a city famous for doing those things. 

Arie Cu: Producer

Arie Cu is a Radio/Television/Film major at Northwestern who has some experience in comedy producing, mostly through The Blackout, Northwestern's very own late night comedy talk and sketch show. She also has some experience producing student short films, such as the 2019 short film Faced With so she is hoping to combine her experiences in comedy and producing films with “Using Protection” and produce her first web series. She is also incredibly excited to work with such creative and funny people such as Madi, Rishi, Valen, and Kinsey!

 

Why support our series?

“Using Protection” offers an entirely new and unique perspective on how the pandemic has affected the college student. We will explore several themes throughout the series, but the central and most important theme is friendship. More specifically, the friendship between two lost souls looking and craving connection with someone. We believe this is a universal theme that transcends just the characters presented in the story. As the series progresses, the two main characters, Erica and Rithvic develop a romantic connection, pushing our series to explore an unlikely romance between two very different personalities. We will see the quirks, struggles, and benefits of this romance for each character, while also exploring college life in the pandemic, from virtual classes to maintaining a social life. 

 

No money? No problem!

While the most direct way of helping us is through contributions, we understand that sometimes you aren’t in a position to donate. Food donations are crucial to the functionality of Northwestern film sets, so connections to local restaurants would be significantly valuable as well. If you are looking for other ways to contribute to the creation of this passion project, please share this Indiegogo page with all your friends and family. Seriously, please tell everyone. Yell it from the rooftops. Talk to your grandma. Let your dog know. We <3 your support!

story:
Have you ever watched Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey and felt horrified at the sweeping depictions and misrepresentations of Bible-believing Christians? Are you tired of seeing yet another unchallenged show that props up the delusional "scientific consensus"?  Have you seen the programs on Discovery or NOVA and were frustrated or even angry that they're passing off the theory of evolution as fact, and teaching our youth that there is no God? Are you watching the news today where kids are shooting each other in schools, and you know why it's happening but you don't know what you can do about it?

PLEASE JOIN US. We need your support to raise the funds to create a new online series called Quantum. It will be the first Bible-based series of its kind. Beginning in 2019, Cosmos and other propaganda pieces will be cross-examined. After all, the real cosmos is God's cosmos!

What is the plot in simple terms?

A time traveler must go back to the past, on a mission to send to the present a message about the future. 

Excited? Scroll down to learn more...

 

In 2013 you gave over $250,000 to our Indiegogo campaign to support Genesis 3D, and we delivered! We were faithful with your support and created an acclaimed feature film released nation-wide. A special 4D version will soon be showing at the Creation Museum in Kentucky. By the grace of God, a dream was transformed into a reality.

Now I'm asking for your help again. Quantum will be Sevenfold Films' first independent, breakout series. Quantum will be released online and on Blu-ray and DVD. It is hosted by Dr. Charles Jackson (from Genesis: Paradise Lost) and the new series will teach real science and real history from the only true perspective there is: the Biblical one! We'll use the latest technology to create visually stunning sequences (like Genesis, but even better), with an incredible story-line centered around time travel and a battle of Biblical magnitude. Quantum will be made for all audiences but is oriented towards high-school age and up, and will tackle many of the most controversial topics of today. Quantum isn't just relevant. It's showing up for battle in an ongoing war zone: the world-wide web. We need your support to help free those taken captive in the “culture wars”!

 

 

It’s easy to see that violence in our schools is spiraling out of control. Network television is broadcasting content that is growing increasingly immoral each year. The internet is filled with perverse websites and videos. Practices like abortion, which our society once criminalized, are now legal and embraced. More and more states are enabling a culture that is increasingly dependent upon and addicted to drugs. Even basic scientific and biological facts about gender are thrown out the window at universities.

How did we get here?

On one major exit from the road less traveled, we exchanged the truth of the Creator for the theory of evolution (Romans 1:18-32). This lie about origins and identity is a major force in the anti-God / anti-Bible movement sweeping the planet. It’s no surprise either, as the Apostle Peter prophesied that such delusions would be widespread as we get closer and closer to the final generation.

So what can we do?

Do we simply wait around until death, the rapture, judgement day? Do we stand by quietly and watch as the world reverts back to the days of Noah? Do we only concern ourselves with our local church, or tithing to a remote orphanage? No, Jesus clearly taught us that we should neglect neither the care of orphans and widows, nor the spreading of the gospel to the lost among us. It’s a sad fact that when a lie is packaged in amazing graphics, it is likely to be accepted. This is making it more difficult to share the truth of real science, real history and the Bible, because the Church is often unable to compete at the same production levels as the larger secular marketplace. YOU CAN HELP US CHANGE THAT.

Quantum stands ready to make bold advances by offering spectacular visuals, a compelling story-line parallel to the battle of the believer, and incredible lessons in genuine science and history that will destroy many of the lies that have brainwashed our undiscerning youth (2 Corinthians 10:3-5).

 

 

Ralph Strean, the director and producer of Quantum, also directed and produced the successful crowdfunder-backed production Genesis: Paradise Lost, which was crowdfunded right here on Indiegogo and released in theaters just last year. Tim Gwynn, a researcher and screenwriter of Sevenfold’s exceptional documentary, is hopeful that God will also provide funding for our new media venture (Quantum) through people like you. Please help us continue to blaze trails; to carry the gospel torch in defiance of the "consensus country club" media! Genesis: Paradise Lost was the first 3D Christian film ever produced and has recently been nominated for five different awards from the upcoming International Christian Film Festival: Best Documentary, Best Animation, Most Creative, Most Inspirational, and Best Director. We as believers are instructed to store up treasures in Heaven (where our real rewards are), but such affirmation helps demonstrate that your hard-earned dollars are in competent hands, for the glory of God!

 

 

All you need to do is select a perk from the menu to the right and contribute to our cause. If you can't find a perk that's just right for you, you can also enter a custom dollar amount at the top of the page by clicking "BACK IT." For easy reference, we also included the following quick-sheet:

 

 

 

Our favorite personality packing four science degrees, Dr. Charles Jackson is returning from the documentary feature Genesis: Paradise Lost  to host Quantum! Pictured below are Dr. Jackson and Director / Producer Ralph Strean of Genesis: Paradise Lost. Ralph and Dr. Jackson enjoyed collaborating on the film and are eager to team up again for this new media venture. Be sure to watch the featured video at the top of the page for an interview between the two, detailing the project.

A plan is also in the works for Dr. Jackson to host an after-show with each engaging episode, featuring special guests from various fields of study. The after-shows will further expound upon the topics from their respective episodes.

 

 

 

With a concept like time travel, it's no secret that Quantum must utilize a lot of digital effects. Unlike Genesis: Paradise Lost -- a film involving 3D stylized animation --Quantum will neither be stylized nor animated but will instead opt for photorealism. To achieve a photo-real look, "background plates" are shot from actual locations and then digital effects are later composited on top of them. The triceratops frame from the above teaser video is one such example. Take a look at the process:

As you can see, the final result is virtually indistinguishable from a set prop or animatronic dinosaur. It is with these techniques, your support, and ultimately by God’s grace that Quantum will be created.

 

 

 

Quantum will address a number of topics, woven throughout its story-line that spans each season. The following columns contain theoretical topics that have been proposed for season 1. If you don't see a topic that you think should be on the list, be patient as we'll be announcing votes on new topics soon.

 

 

Our goals for this campaign can be divided into a three-level structure. Level 1 - get the funds to begin the production of the series with the minimal number of episodes (3 at 30 minutes each, roughly feature-film length in total). Level 2 - reach our goal for funds to round out season one with a standard number of episodes (5 or 6 episodes at 30-45 minutes each). Level 3 - reach our optimal goal of 9 or 10 episodes with all the extras.

Here's an approximate summary of how those funds will be utilized, based on the $250K goal:

 

 

 

What about “Genesis Part 2”?

A message from the director:

Making, marketing, and distributing a quality, independent feature film is a long and painstaking process. It took us a total of eight years of hard work, personal sacrifices, a lot of patience, and a lot of money (to us anyway, far from Hollywood’s deep pockets). The end result is certainly rewarding and something I'd love to do again, but for now I want to take a break from moviemaking and prayerfully work on a series that can provide immediate benefits (especially in testimonials), and quicker results for supporters. Furthermore, GPL (Part 1) is still in the process of recouping its costs, so it may take a while before the GPL team can afford to jump into pre-production for Part 2. Quantum can continue to satisfy the eager eyes and ears of those waiting on Part 2. So as with GPL, if you put up the money, we’ll put in the professional work!

How much will this adhere to the Bible, will it be accurate?

Our number one goal is to treat God’s word with reverence, and thereby ensure that our creative liberties do not violate the clear teaching of Scripture. Although Quantum will have futuristic “science fiction” elements, the genre will lean more heavily towards “science fact,” if you will, with some fantastic elements that don't conflict with the Bible. 

When will I receive my perks?

Perks related to season 1 (pilot season) are distributed upon the completion of episode 1 (season 1) at the earliest. Other perks, such as behind-the-scenes access, will be available immediately upon their respective posts. We will be updating you after the campaign ends with a report on what to expect regarding release times for your perks.

Where will my online access (of episodes) be?

We will be working with an "aggregator" to push the series to as many online vendors as we can, such as iTunes, Amazon, Google Play, etc. However, certain vendors do not allow coupon codes to be applied. We're working on a solution to this issue so that you'll be able to access the episodes on your platform of preference. We can't make any promises concerning series availability on your specific platform, which means that you may have to create a new account somewhere else. Pray for God’s favor when we eventually negotiate with vendors, so that viewers like you can have options to choose from. More details to come.

What if I don't want my name in the credits on your website, or in the series?

To opt out of this perk, let us know in the comments section here or write us through our contact page at Sevenfold Films.

Can I use any name I want for my custom wallpaper perk?

Our default will be to use the name associated with your contribution. However, if you wish to request a change you can reach us through the Sevenfold Films contact page on our website, or leave a comment here. All custom names submitted to us must be appropriate, otherwise we'll use the name associated with your Indiegogo contribution.

What happens if you're above or below the goal when the campaign ends?

We have multiple contingencies for different levels of funding we may receive, whether it's above or below our minimum goal of $150,000. We will be sure to update you on where we are by the end of the campaign and inform you of our plan moving forward.

What do you mean by "Pilot Season"?

"Pilot Season" is a term used for the first season produced in a series. This preliminary test season is typically used to pitch the concept of the series to networks, investors, or in this case, the audience.

What if I contribute multiple times, will my perk level increase?

Thank you for contributing multiple times, you're a huge blessing to us! The only down side is that this makes tracking a bit difficult later if you're wanting us to merge and upgrade your perk amounts. Because of this compounding difficulty, we're only allowing perk upgrades for supporters who have given a total of $300 or more, AND only if requested. Thank you for understanding, this is tricky business!

What if I want to contribute an amount not associated with a perk?

Contributions that are not associated with a perk will be considered a donation. If you want a perk, be sure to select one. If you just want to give what God puts on your heart and you need nothing in return, THANK YOU and MAY GOD BLESS YOU!

Is this run by a non-profit organization?

No, unlike the previous crowdfunder for Genesis: Paradise Lost, the Quantum Series is being produced exclusively by Sevenfold Films, which is not a 501c3 organization. Sevenfold Films, LLC is simply a media ministry that would rather pay its share of Federal taxes than be burdened with all the regulations compliance, personnel, and extra time required just to maintain not-for-profit status. Please keep in mind that most successful crowdfunding campaigns are operated by for-profit entities. Whereas your contributions will NOT be tax-deductible, hopefully as believers we are all looking to Heaven for ultimate rewards that will last.

Is Quantum affiliated with Creation Today or Resurrection Pictures?

No, Quantum is being developed exclusively by Sevenfold Films. While Creation Today and Resurrection Pictures may possibly endorse the series, they are not involved in the production. 

How can I contact the director?

You can reach Ralph directly through the contact form on the Sevenfold Films website. You can also post comments here on Indiegogo, which are routinely read by our team. 

 

TO GOD BE THE GLORY!
story_txt:
Have you ever watched Cosmos: A Spacetime Odyssey and felt horrified at the sweeping depictions and misrepresentations of Bible-believing Christians? Are you tired of seeing yet another unchallenged show that props up the delusional "scientific consensus"?  Have you seen the programs on Discovery or NOVA and were frustrated or even angry that they're passing off the theory of evolution as fact, and teaching our youth that there is no God? Are you watching the news today where kids are shooting each other in schools, and you know why it's happening but you don't know what you can do about it?PLEASE JOIN US. We need your support to raise the funds to create a new online series called Quantum. It will be the first Bible-based series of its kind. Beginning in 2019, Cosmos and other propaganda pieces will be cross-examined. After all, the real cosmos is God's cosmos!What is the plot in simple terms?A time traveler must go back to the past, on a mission to send to the present a message about the future. Excited? Scroll down to learn more... In 2013 you gave over $250,000 to our Indiegogo campaign to support Genesis 3D, and we delivered! We were faithful with your support and created an acclaimed feature film released nation-wide. A special 4D version will soon be showing at the Creation Museum in Kentucky. By the grace of God, a dream was transformed into a reality.Now I'm asking for your help again. Quantum will be Sevenfold Films' first independent, breakout series. Quantum will be released online and on Blu-ray and DVD. It is hosted by Dr. Charles Jackson (from Genesis: Paradise Lost) and the new series will teach real science and real history from the only true perspective there is: the Biblical one! We'll use the latest technology to create visually stunning sequences (like Genesis, but even better), with an incredible story-line centered around time travel and a battle of Biblical magnitude. Quantum will be made for all audiences but is oriented towards high-school age and up, and will tackle many of the most controversial topics of today. Quantum isn't just relevant. It's showing up for battle in an ongoing war zone: the world-wide web. We need your support to help free those taken captive in the “culture wars”!  It’s easy to see that violence in our schools is spiraling out of control. Network television is broadcasting content that is growing increasingly immoral each year. The internet is filled with perverse websites and videos. Practices like abortion, which our society once criminalized, are now legal and embraced. More and more states are enabling a culture that is increasingly dependent upon and addicted to drugs. Even basic scientific and biological facts about gender are thrown out the window at universities.How did we get here?On one major exit from the road less traveled, we exchanged the truth of the Creator for the theory of evolution (Romans 1:18-32). This lie about origins and identity is a major force in the anti-God / anti-Bible movement sweeping the planet. It’s no surprise either, as the Apostle Peter prophesied that such delusions would be widespread as we get closer and closer to the final generation.So what can we do?Do we simply wait around until death, the rapture, judgement day? Do we stand by quietly and watch as the world reverts back to the days of Noah? Do we only concern ourselves with our local church, or tithing to a remote orphanage? No, Jesus clearly taught us that we should neglect neither the care of orphans and widows, nor the spreading of the gospel to the lost among us. It’s a sad fact that when a lie is packaged in amazing graphics, it is likely to be accepted. This is making it more difficult to share the truth of real science, real history and the Bible, because the Church is often unable to compete at the same production levels as the larger secular marketplace. YOU CAN HELP US CHANGE THAT.Quantum stands ready to make bold advances by offering spectacular visuals, a compelling story-line parallel to the battle of the believer, and incredible lessons in genuine science and history that will destroy many of the lies that have brainwashed our undiscerning youth (2 Corinthians 10:3-5).  Ralph Strean, the director and producer of Quantum, also directed and produced the successful crowdfunder-backed production Genesis: Paradise Lost, which was crowdfunded right here on Indiegogo and released in theaters just last year. Tim Gwynn, a researcher and screenwriter of Sevenfold’s exceptional documentary, is hopeful that God will also provide funding for our new media venture (Quantum) through people like you. Please help us continue to blaze trails; to carry the gospel torch in defiance of the "consensus country club" media! Genesis: Paradise Lost was the first 3D Christian film ever produced and has recently been nominated for five different awards from the upcoming International Christian Film Festival: Best Documentary, Best Animation, Most Creative, Most Inspirational, and Best Director. story:
Hello there,

We started ChillAdvisor.com this past fall as a way to share the most fun, adventurous and affordable things to do here in Orlando, FL. and people use it to look for anything to the best happy hour specials around town to the most thrilling adventures in the land.

A few months back we started making happy hour videos throughout Orlando to share with our friends the best items at each place, and the response we got was phenomenal.

We just ended season 1 a few weeks back, and during this 1st season we visited 9 different happy hours and made videos. We got close to 8,000 Facebook views, just sharing them with our friends. We are definitely ready expand! So now we are officially calling this happy hour production...

 

"The Happiest Hour"

'The Happiest Hour' Season 2  is going to run for 10 weeks, and we're going to be making 2 to 3 happy hour videos every week depending on the week.

Our goal is definitely to make at least 25 to 30 happy hour videos in those 10 weeks.

So what do we need?

We’re looking to raise $4500, and most of the funds will be used to get better audio, and video equipment.  For season one we were using super basic equipment, our phones, headphone mic and so on, and our biggest challenge was definitely the audio and the editing. (Breakdown below)

A part of it will be used for the actual happy hours as well as gas money for the crew (the people who help shoot the videos).

We will also be getting some marketing materials to spread the word, and we'll be using some of the money for the launch party as well.

What's in it for you?

As a giant thank you for your contributions we've come up with some awesome perks.

Here are a few of my favorites:

  • $5 you’ll get you a thank you from the bottom of our cups + shout out on social media.
  • $25  you'll get our 1st official chilladvisor “Stay Chill” t-shirt. (we'll  be posting a pic soon)
  • $25 "ChillAdvisor Party Kit" Includes - fresh mints, body spray, gum, water, Advil, energy drink, tooth brush, tooth paste, mouth wash, towel, condom . (12 items) 
  • $35 VIP Launch Party Ticket - Includes complementary drinks, "stay chill" rubber wristband,  "stay chill" t-shirt. (early bird $35 )
  • $10.000 I will wear a t-shirt with your name on it, in all my videos. Your call!

Perks for businesses also available.

I’m broke, are there any other ways to help?

Of course, if for whatever reason you don’t have $5 bucks laying around to contribute of course there are other ways you can help!

Please share this Indiegogo with everyone; your friends, your coworkers, your parents, your grandparents, your boss (even with the mail person).

Also please like our Facebook page, follow us on Instagram, and definitely subscribe to our YouTube channel. 

Anything you can do to help would be much appreciated. 

Just don’t keep "The Happiest Hour" a secret!

If we reach our goal...

If we get to our goal of $4500, which with your help, we'll be able to get there, no problem, a few things are going to happen:

  1. We will produce all 30 happy hour videos in those ten weeks.
  2. For every $10 you contributed, your name will be entered for a chance to win a $100 happy hour gift card to any restaurant listed on ChillAdvisor.com (i.e. if you contribute $30 your name will be entered 3 times) 
  3. I will irrevocably get a CHILLADVISOR TATTOO on my chest. (really happening) We'll even make a video of it. 

We will also be geared up for Season 3 which is going to have more than just happy hour videos...  

Why is "The Happiest Hour" important to us?

Our mission statement for ChillAdvisor is:

  “To make our cities happier places to be and hang out, by using entrepreneurship, creativity, and innovation to entertain and to connect people with the fun, adventurous and affordable things they love to do.”

As a young start-up, change is a part of the daily grind. The one thing that has not changed at all since inception, is our mission statement. We wholeheartedly believe that producing these happy hour videos is the best, and perhaps the only way, for us to ongoingly live up to our Mission.   

Cheers!

  ------------------------------------

$$ Breakdown

All funds raised through this campaign will be used for the following:

Video and editing equipment (45.15%)

  • Mac Book Pro $1,299
  • GoPro +A's $499
  • Basic Audio Equipment $119.99

Happy Hours (25%)

  • Happy Hours(30x) $700 - $1050 
  • Gas money for the crew $250 - $325
  • Gratuities $175- $262

Marketing materials and Launch Party (29.85%)

  • Campaign Perks & Giveaways $976*
  • Launch Party Spring 2017  $187*
  • Indiegogo Fees $180*

We will keep you posted as the campaign rolls on through weekly updates here and on our Facebook page.

* This amounts will change based on contributions.

Please reach out to us with any question!

story:
So whatcha got here? 

We present to you, Koko Blayze: Undead Killer!  Koko Blayze is a 16 year old girl who attends Dagon Academy. When she is bitten by a vampire, it awakens in her a latent ability to kick demonic ass. The story takes place in the fictional town of Stoker, MA, a Gothic, Salem-like setting teeming with hordes of the undead and demonic forces, the results of an ancient curse placed upon the town when it was settled. When settlers came upon the land, they ran off the native inhabitants in order to colonize. Seeking revenge they placed a curse upon the town that it be forever overrun with evil, in hopes that the town wouldn’t survive. A priest and several others of power put a protection spell around the town to keep evil as contained as possible. But the spell has been wearing thin over time and Koko's "rebirth" causes an anomaly, ripping a hole in it, allowing the dark forces entry. A semi-dark, semi-campy story with its share of blood, foul language, and demonic ass kicking. Koko Blayze: Undead Killer is unlike anything you've seen before: part live action web series, part comic book.

Koko Blayze is a love letter to the supernatural sci-fi teen horror genre, paying homage to some of our favorite ground breaking series and films. Part live action web series, part comic, Koko promises to give you a one of a kind multi dimensional experience. 

 

You keep calling it a series. That mean you have plans for more than one season?

Hell yeah! We have ideas for at least four seasons! But we'll only get there if the first season is a success!

 

How how long will it be? 

Each episode will be approximately 15 minutes in length, with the comic episodes being about 15 pages. The first season will be 10 "episodes": 8 live action, 2 comic. 

 

Where will it be available?

Ever hear of Patreon? Koko Blayze will be primarily showcased on there, as a subscription based series. Previews and the first few minutes of each episode will be shown on YouTube, Facebook, our website www.madzproductions.com. In order to watch/read the whole episode, the audience will need to pay for a subscription. Campaign contributors over $100 will be given FREE access!  Subscription gives you access to comics, live action episodes, behind the scenes with the cast, and seasonal limited edition Koko merch!

So how much do you need?

We have an amazing team, and we feel $15,000 will give us the start up we need to make "Koko Blayze" a truly incredible series. Any funds raised beyond this initial goal will go back into the series and will be used to make it even better!

Your donations will go toward:

  • Equipment rental
  • Paying cast and crew
  • Props and Special Effects (we can't make demons without prosthetics and liquid latex! Oh and don't forget the blood. We promise this will be quite a bloody affair!
  • Wardrobe
  • Merchandise 

We know our goals are lofty, but we feel our perks will make it worth your while. For your donations, you can receive rewards such as:

  • Digital copies of the series
  • Exclusive Koko Blayze trading cards
  • Signed posters, prints or scripts
  • Limited Edition shirts, hoodies and so much more!
     

Okay so what does the cast look like?

A little something like this, actually:
story_txt:
So whatcha got here? We present to you, Koko Blayze: Undead Killer!  Koko Blayze is a 16 year old girl who attends Dagon Academy. When she is bitten by a vampire, it awakens in her a latent ability to kick demonic ass. The story takes place in the fictional town of Stoker, MA, a Gothic, Salem-like setting teeming with hordes of the undead and demonic forces, the results of an ancient curse placed upon the town when it was settled. When settlers came upon the land, they ran off the native inhabitants in order to colonize. Seeking revenge they placed a curse upon the town that it be forever overrun with evil, in hopes that the town wouldn’t survive. A priest and several others of power put a protection spell around the town to keep evil as contained as possible. But the spell has been wearing thin over time and Koko's "rebirth" causes an anomaly, ripping a hole in it, allowing the dark forces entry. A semi-dark, semi-campy story with its share of blood, foul language, and demonic ass kicking. Koko Blayze: Undead Killer is unlike anything you've seen before: part live action web series, part comic book.Koko Blayze is a love letter to the supernatural sci-fi teen horror genre, paying homage to some of our favorite ground breaking series and films. Part live action web series, part comic, Koko promises to give you a one of a kind multi dimensional experience.  You keep calling it a series. That mean you have plans for more than one season?Hell yeah! We have ideas for at least four seasons! But we'll only get there if the first season is a success! How how long will it be? Each episode will be approximately 15 minutes in length, with the comic episodes being about 15 pages. The first season will be 10 "episodes": 8 live action, 2 comic.  Where will it be available?Ever hear of Patreon? Koko Blayze will be primarily showcased on there, as a subscription based series. Previews and the first few minutes of each episode will be shown on YouTube, Facebook, our website www.madzproductions.com. In order to watch/read the whole episode, the audience will need to pay for a subscription. Campaign contributors over $100 will be given FREE access!  Subscription gives you access to comics, live action episodes, behind the scenes with the cast, and seasonal limited edition Koko merch!So how much do you need?We have an amazing team, and we feel $15,000 will give us the start up we need to make "Koko Blayze" a truly incredible series. Any funds raised beyond this initial goal will go back into the series and will be used to make it even better!Your donations will go toward:
Equipment rental

story:
The Animation Hall Of Fame’s Journey Into IMAGIMATION Television Series is the ground breaking in-depth television series covering for the first time ever the extensive international history of this great entertainment art form.

Never in the history of animation has such an international television series of this scope and caliber ever been attempted. The Animation Hall Of Fame has been planning and researching this project for many years, and we are now in production and are asking for your additional help and generous support.

Each of the 10 - 30 minute episodes of this first season of the series is focused on many of the 140 historic international animation works, and the pioneers and artists that created them, from our Journey Into IMAGIMATION travelling exhibition.

The complete series will be shot in our Journey Into IMAGIMATION exhibit gallery with the original exhibits and artifacts that were created and used in making of great animation classics that we’ve grown to love. Additionally, we’ll be interviewing historians, preservationists, artists and documenting past and present animation studio locations on six continents and in numerous countries around the world. 

Animation Hall Of Fame CEO, Chairman, Co-founder, and historian Hal Miles brings 45 years of motion picture and television production experience to the project and will be overseeing all phases of the production including directing. Pre-production is well under way and all of the ten episodes of the first season have been scripted; and also the opening and closing titles, transition elements, and generic graphic elements are currently being produced. A veteran location production crew has been slated and are eagerly awaiting the start of the production. The complete project will be 4K digitally produced from start to finish. An original music score will highlight this groundbreaking production.

The host of the show has not been signed yet, but we are currently in talks with two extremely well known television veterans and hosts who are very interested. Once signed, we will officially make the announcement. The co-host of the show, who brings a magical educational quality, is the exceptionally multi-talented Tabitha Rooney.

Also, Co-founder Nancy Miles brings 40 years as an international animation historian to the project. Cheryl Briggs brings her extensive animation production and teaching experience to the project as well. Our indispensable Advisory Board Members will be contributing extensively also.

The timeline for completion of the first season once the live action elements are shot is approximately 20 weeks.

Our final distribution outlet is to broadcast the series on Netflix, Hulu, Amazon, or another over-the-top media services provider.

And of course for your financial support we have some terrific rewards for you. Everything from getting your name in the credits of the film, to a Blu-ray copy of the complete first season of the series, to Animation Hall of Fame limited edition lithographs, a custom built AHOF Praxinoscope, or even getting a little screen time yourself!

We offer 15 different reward levels for your generous contribution.

$5 or more:

Financial Contributor Screen Credit recognition on the end titles of each of the Season 1 episodes and the Journey Into IMAGIMATION Television Series Website.

Production Updates.

The Animation Hall Of Fame thanks you for supporting and helping to tell and preserve for generations to come the complete international history of the magical art form of Animation.

Possible Risk and Challenges:

Even though the Animation Hall Of Fame has been working and structuring this television series for many years, there are always going to be unforeseen obstacles to overcome. Which we will persevere successfully!

In regard to risks, our number one is the unexpected illness of an individual that we are scheduled to interview, while on location. Being able to reschedule and restructure our production schedule on a moment’s notice and being able to shoot other interviews or visit other locations have been calculated in and will solve this issue.

Another all too common risk is equipment glitches or failures. However with the advent of a digital production such as ours and having sufficient backup equipment we can avoid any down time based around these issues.

The number one challenge has always been and will continue to be time itself. But, by allowing an appropriate amount of time, plus calculating in an additional margin for whatever situation may occur, we can minimize and defeat these challenges making for a much smoother running and more cost effective production.

Once again having 45 years of pre-production, production, and post production experience allows me the option of tackling these situations head on. Effectively keeping the production on time and on budget, if not ahead of time and budget, and delivering the material we need for this great television series production.

international history of the magical art form of Animation. $10,000 or more:You will be a Special VIP Guest at an exclusive VIP Contributors Formal Reception, Dinner, and Premiere Screening of the pilot episode of the Journey Into IMAGIMATION Television Series.A custom built Animation Hall Of Fame Praxinoscope with 12 frames from either an animation or live action project that you’ve created.You will have your own 60 second on camera testimonial segment that will be included in one season 1 episode of the Journey Into IMAGIMATION Television Series.An Animation Hall Of Fame magical art form of Animation.Possible Risk and Challenges:Even though the Animation Hall Of Fame has been working and structuring this television series for many years, there are always going to be unforeseen obstacles to overcome. Which we will persevere successfully!In regard to risks, our number one is the unexpected illness of an individual that we are scheduled to interview, while on location. Being able to reschedule and restructure our production schedule on a moment’s notice and being able to shoot other interviews or visit other locations have been calculated in and will solve this issue.Another all too common risk is equipment glitches or failures. However with the advent of a digital production such as ours and having sufficient backup equipment we can avoid any down time based around these issues.The number one challenge has always been and will continue to be time itself. But, by allowing an appropriate amount of time, plus calculating in an additional margin for whatever situation may occur, we can minimize and defeat these challenges making for a much smoother running and more cost effective production.Once again having 45 years of pre-production, production, and post production experience allows me the option of tackling these situations head on. Effectively keeping the production on time and on budget, if not ahead of time and budget, and delivering the material we need for this great television series production.

story:
What if there were an app for finding dad friends? This story started with the idea that it would be easier for dads to make friends if they could swipe right or left on an app on their phone. From there, a 10-episode web series took shape.

Packed was written by Patrick Zeller and Jake Millgard, two actors with a combined 35 years of professional experience in theater, film and television. Theirs is a friendship forged in fire, both earning a masters degree, while parenting children under the age of 3 and driving for Lyft.

Your contribution will allow us to tap into our extensive professional network to fill in the gaps in our own expertise. We are asking for your help in raising $40,000 so we can bring on a producer, an editor, designers, stylists, lights, sound, transportation, performers, locations, equipment and more.

                                         

More about the team: 

Patrick is a writer, performer and producer with a BFA in Theater from Emerson College and an MFA in Dramatic Arts from The Old Globe and University of San Diego Shiley Graduate Theatre Program. He has booked national and regional spots including Chevy Malibu, Wendy's, Sam Adams and Sprint. Feature films include No Reservations with Catherine Zeta-Jones and directed by Scott Hicks; Indie Comedy, Virgin Alexander, (Grand Jury Prize Winner of the Las Vegas International Film Festival and the Washington DC Independent Film Festival. VA also took Best Direction at the LA Comedy Film Festival); and End of the Spear, the true story of five post war American missionaries making “first contact” with the infamous Waodani tribe of the Ecuadorian rain forest, (Winner of the Grand Prize for a Dramatic Feature at the Heartland Film Festival.) In 2018 he starred in Say Yes, with Alexandra Paul and Shari Belafonte. He also stars in Just One More Kiss, written and directed by Faleena Hopkins, due out in theatres in 2019.  Network television appearances include Law and Order, Kidnapped and The Young and the Restless. Patrick has also performed on stages in New York and around the country from Shakespeare & Company in Lenox, MA to The Old Globe Theatre in San Diego, CA. He enjoys work as a voice actor in a host of media including audio books, video games, and commercials. 

                                         

                                           

Jake has his BA in Theater from Western Washington University and his MFA in Dramatic Arts from The Old Globe/ USD Shiley graduate acting program. He has worked  at theaters all over the country including Actors Theatre of Louisville, The Mint, and The Old Globe in San Diego where he has appeared in over 10 productions. Also through The Globe, Jake works in local prisons using Shakespeare as a tool for rehabilitation through self reflection. On screen he has been seen on  networks such as MTV, The Onion and NBC as well as commercials, web series and independent films.  

 

Producer and co-creator Emily Zeller earned her Bachelors of Arts in Theater Studies from Emerson College. While attending Emerson's Los Angeles program, she interned in the writers' room for Malcolm In The Middle and  in the publicity office of Days of our Lives. She was a founding member and Associate Producer of the Present Tense Theatre Project in New York.

story:
Welcome! Start Here. Did You Watch the Video?

Hi! I'm Jamin Keene. Fabulous secrets were revealed to me the day I held aloft my* laptop in Washington, DC, and said, "I'm tired of chasing work as an actor. How can I do more?" The sparkles rained down, some random choir sang, and I transformed from a management consultant to what I am today - an actor, filmmaker, and passable karaoke singer in Los Angeles, California, who developed a web series based on a play that I wrote based on my experiences dating in DC. Add in two characters who portray my main character's best friends and we've got ourselves a series!

Before this series I wrote, produced, and directed a short film, which was released in March 2019, and also have produced a weekly vlog and podcast covering political and gay topics in a humorous format.

(*That third sentence at the top was from my second favorite cartoon growing up, the original She-Ra. If you didn't know that, it's okay. What's important is that I referenced a cartoon for girls, which lets you know just how authentically gay I am for such a time as this.)
 

Why is Vinegar Water important?

This series is important to me because it's important for black gay guys like me and others to have representation in entertainment with stories that we tell about ourselves and not letting others tell our stories for us. I first loved Noah's Arc for telling black gay stories. Then everything there stopped once the show ended. 

I loved Queer as Folk and Will & Grace, but that's not really "my" story. As I look online, I see web series based on the black gay experience, but I don't see ones that show characters who offer what Vinegar Water offers: gay men who embrace yet don't know who they are and struggle with their faith (not necessarily the church), struggle with sex as an addiction but pass it off as being sexually liberated, or have questionable dating choices when they should know better. All of that helping to grow them up into more mature adulthood.

These are funny stories full of outrageous plots and characters based on real life. Also, quiet as it's kept, I never saw anyone tackle gay interracial dating honestly, and there is plenty of opportunity to upset a lot of people with the truth of that, so why not do that, you know? I live for provocative content!
 

"What Would We Need for This Series?"

Bottom line: This will take money to produce a quality show and I'd love your support in making this show a reality! 

We need five things:

1. You.
2. Money.
3. Excitement.
4. Prayers for its success.
5. Prayers for money, your excitement, and its success.

You

  • You are needed because without you, this show cannot be brought to life. Why you? Not just your donations, but you are the key to sharing excitement about this show, sharing information for this fundraiser with people, and the best advertisement we could ask for: word of mouth. Also, you may get your name listed in the credits. Haven't you always wanted to see your name in lights? If not, add that to your life goals. It's never too late to achieve your goals! 

Money

  • It takes money to make anything in Hollywood and none of us working on the series has enough to make this happen, so we do need donations. The best we've done so far with the money we had is hold auditions, shoot the fundraiser promo video and get it cut (i.e. - edited) for the public. A full show takes more, even for a web series.

    While we're not The Crown on Netflix with a budget of $10 million per episode, we do have costs. For example, there are costs associated with permits for outdoor locations and studio time charged for indoor locations, and some people charge to use their homes. That can easily go into the $1000s. 

    Also, with talent and crew to make a quality-level show, it will take some doing to pay the right rates to get the right people for the job. Who are the people we need to pay to make a quality show?
    ​
    • Actors - the people who bring the series to life playing characters on screen
    • Line Producer - the person who scouts and finds locations
    • Director of Photography - the person who directs and sets the tone of the series with each shot
    • Editor - the person who assembles the episodes for an audience to see
    • Production Assistant - the person who assists on set with the production with everything from sound, design, lighting, coordinating schedules, coordinating actors, ordering food, and other duties
    • Makeup/Hair Artist - the person who helps the actors achieve the required look on camera 
    • Sound Person - the person who gets the sound right for the series on set
    • Gaffer/Grip - the person who designs lighting and sets the right light for scenes on set
    • Script Supervisor - the person who makes sure the actors are saying the right lines
    • Music - the music used in the web series has to be paid for to the artist or composer

Excitement

  • We need excitement for this. If you or someone you know identifies with the storyline or finds it interesting, TELL THEM TO CHECK THIS OUT! We take all support and believe this is a show that is timely, unique, and hopefully needed now. 

Prayers for Its Success

  • I believe in the power of prayer and am praying for the success of Vinegar Water. But first, I'm praying for the success of this fundraiser. If you can't donate, please share it with someone who can. If you pray, please join me in prayer for success for Vinegar Water to get produced and in front of the right people to build a fan base to take it all the way.

    If you can donate, share, and pray, that's the gay trifecta. You're now gay. Welcome to the family! I'm kidding. It's doesn't work like that. You have to pay a fee to the gay mafia to be gay nowadays and it's a whole thing I don't have time to get into right now. 

Prayers for Money, Your Excitement, and Its Success

  • This is my prayer for you all. Again, if this web series touches you in a way that you find endearing or you know someone who would like it, please share it with them.


What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal?

I will have to start stripping for wealthy business travelers (again). But really, if we don't reach our goal, we will go ahead with what we have, but the quality of the show will suffer, and I really want to present a polished show. The less money we have, the more challenges there will be with regard to locations, equipment, talent, and crew. While I believe I am qualified with the people I have interested in helping (they do need to get paid) to overcome these challenges, I would prefer that we did not have to face those challenges on top of the normal challenges. 

Therefore, I'd love you to give what you can to help us do that. If you cannot give financially, sharing this fundraiser (see the SHARE TOOLS on this page) with people who would be interested and those who would also give is appreciated. Your prayers for its success are appreciated too.

Whatever support you give, MAKE IT LOUD and MAKE IT COUNT! 

Thank you for your support in advance! 

Much love to all! 

- Jamin Keene & the Vinegar Water team

 

Promo Team:

Keontae: Jamin Keene, repped by The Brogan Agency
Amin: Kojo Oduro
Blake: L.C. Williams
Director: Jake Fullilove
Cameraman: Andrew Hall
Production Assistant/Sound: Dru Bedard
Editors: Anja Kurtajic and Jonathan Vaughan
​Executive Producer: Jamin Keene
Audition Reader: Philip McElroy
Graphic Design: Mikki Veal
Special thanks to Jeff Kawakami and Rex Tillerson for the location

story:
Welcome to Sommoners Tale

 

Hi! Thanks for visiting our fundraising page. We’re raising funds for an independent magical-realism television series called Sommoners Tale (spelling intentional!)

What is “magical-realism,” you might be wondering? Essentially we're combining 2 genres: it’s a show based in our modern world, while utilizing all the amazing features of the fantasy/magical genre:

Our series is about a bullied young man who turns to the world of magic and spellcasting to help him cope- but he unwittingly becomes entangled in an ancient battle between the Light and Dark. Turns out, he's a very special young man and his role could be the turning point for this battle. With the help of a magical guardian, another Mage ally, and an incredible Book, this troubled young man may just decide the fate of the entire world!

 

WHO WE ARE:

The creative team behind this project consists of Brandon Smelko- creator/writer/director/actor, and Tina Christner- creator/lead writer/assistant director. We are 2 very passionate creatives who have spent the last 9 months developing this fantastic story, writing the script, getting actors, finding locations, and even putting together costumes and a photoshoot for Sommoners Tale.

 

After all this hard work, we're ready to move into the shooting phase. Now we need YOUR help to turn this dream into reality. So… we need backers! People who want to be “patrons of the arts;” people who want to take an active role in their entertainment; people who want to help produce an extraordinary show.

 

More about Sommoners Tale:

We classify our show as “magical-realism.” This means that we're using our current modern world (realism) as our backdrop, while incorporating fantastical/magical elements. We've also drawn inspiration from the science-fiction genre, classic mythology, and current real events.  We seek to not only entertain with some cool action and an intricate storyline, we're also addressing contemporary topics and social issues at the forefront of modern life. Sommoners Tale uses the lens of fantasy/magic to tackle some major topics and problems. Nothing is off-limits to us. We want to spark discussion and explore life.  Otherwise “sensitive” topics receive the ‘fantasy’ treatment- not unlike Gene Roddenberry and his Star Trek themes.

Some of our key topics:

Gender roles

Stereotypes

Sexuality

Bullying

Climate change

Politics

Social environments

We want to explore this crazy world we all live in, and we want to share this journey with you in the form of this TV series, Sommoners Tale.

 

Some specifics about our particular production:

We're using local talent (cast and crew)

We're featuring LGBTQ actors

We're giving some really amazing talent a chance to shine

 

So, why do we need money?

Well, obviously this sort of thing is expensive. Embarking on this journey, we have come to find all these various elements required for indie filmmaking. And most of them cost money! Things we didn't even know about- things you might not know about, like:

Fight choreographer

Permits (locations)

Lighting rentals

Marketing/promo materials

Regular photography

A lawyer!

We've been truly blessed to have a lot of talented people donating their time and abilities to Sommoners Tale, but it would be fantastic if we could compensate these wonderful people for their efforts!

 

So, please, check out our perks and help us bring Sommoners Tale to life!

And check out our social media links for some awesome content and updates! Feel free to email us with any questions.

 

THANK YOU SO MUCH!!
